Nx5Mo7v957CKteZ7J0iVLg.text: We had a very disappointing dinner. We had been there previously and enjoyed our meal so we decided to bring our family this time.   The dishes were not as good as remembered and the waiter was not able to recommend any options. We had tuna cones, yellowtail, black rice, octopus, rib eye, beef meatballs, pork meatballs, chorizo, and the bread with sauce and cheese. We tried a variety of dishes but didn't like any of them.   We will not

_0vLKvfg2hYqHKcwKDs98g.text: We like the small plate concept, so we wanted to try out Julian Serrano's. Who is Julian Serrano anyway? We have never heard of him before, but you get the feeling that to have a restaurant named after you on the strip you must have done something special in the culinary world. Anyway, we never met or saw Julian while we were dining, he must have been tending another restaurant with his name on it, it's like the other strip famous or infamous chef's, I'm sure he was there in spirit.  Apparently we arrived at the shift change, and there was a delay in our/any server coming to our table. The manager passed us twice without noticing that we had not yet been attended to, and the three hostesses engrossed in conversation did not notice that no one had been to our table yet. So funny, we were dumped off at a table by the hostess, and her job was d-o-n-e, done!  Anyway, my husband got up and asked  the surprised hostess if she could find us a server, and in a few short minutes we were finally ordering. I just remember overfried calamari, cold meatballs, shrimp with sauce running down the side of the bowl, well, well, done slider with terrible French fries, and yellowtail wrapped around shredded sweet potato, with horseradish and micro cilantro. The waiter kept prodding us for a compliment on the yellowtail, it must have been a winner dish for him, but unfortunately not for us. No taste of horseradish, no citrus, no salt, just bland and unexciting.  We get lost in the appreciation of the strip chef themed restaurants that are built for the masses and use that chef's name as the draw to get you in. None have been a special experience for us, especially Julian Serrano.

CMfH70qz4HUPFOTbdiGa6Q.text: The food was good, however, the service was horrid. Seriously, I've received better service from diners. The waiter, while not overtly rude, was not particularly friendly. We asked him how many tapas we should order for three people. He recommended 7-10. We weren't too hungry, so we ordered 5, and only one alcoholic beverage. He wasn't happy. He said, "Well, that's a start," and left us with a menu in case we needed to order anything else, which we would have if he had come back to our table to acknowledge our presence. Not once while we were eating did he come back to check how we were doing, if the food was okay, if we wanted more drinks, or if we wanted to order more food - which we did. He didn't even remove the dirty plates. I understand that he wasn't going to make a large tip off of our table, but this service and his attitude were really beyond the pale. We were going to order dessert, but my nephew, who wanted to leave a $1 tip, didn't feel like we should spend any more money after being treated so rudely. I normally tip 18-25%. In this case, I probably should have left $1, but I left a 15% tip because we all have bad days, and perhaps this was his. Still, I won't be returning, nor will I recommend it to any business associates.

rfNa17Sr1Jb10ri83EhyOw.text: The food was very good, but the server(Adrian) was beyond awful.  He spoke to us like we had never been in an "upscale" establishment.  I highly recommend the food, but I hope you never have this person serve you.  Update: Just after I submitted this review I got a bone in my croquetas.

NicWy9ffXNiSr66_H4IMYg.text: We came here for lunch expecting the prix fixe lunch menu. Unfortunately, they only have it on the weekdays and non-holidays...  The white ceviche was kind of bland- there wasn't enough lime to counteract the seafoody flavor. I thought Bacchanal made the ceviche better. The creamy risotto with mushroom was pretty good- husband thought it was mediocre though. The rabo de toro, or oxtail and Iberian pork with mashed potatoes, was surprisingly tasty. The mixed paella takes around 40 minutes to cook and is HUGE! Contained lobster, mussels, Spanish chorizo, chicken, and saffron rice. I'm sure four people could have comfortably shared it, but we were able to eat everything! The service I thought was a hit or miss and although the food was good, nothing was mind blowing. I wouldn't come here again, especially since the price is pretty steep for what we received.

s0-WJ8UPAN6cm6O8K-jLkw.text: At Julian Serrano, my wife and I had the single best dining adventure that I've ever had in Las Vegas.  While it may not have been the culinary apogee (that distinction actually goes to Picasso which is of course Julian Serrano's other restaurant located in the Bellagio), the food here was nevertheless absolutely amazing and the service was absolutely the best I've had in Las Vegas.   While it was my Birthday lunch which might cloud my vision a little, our waiter and the whole staff truly made my meal here one I shall remember fondly until the end of my days.  My wife and I walked in last Friday at around noon.   While we had no reservation, the staff greeted us kindly nevertheless and sat us near a TV, as I was following the Villanova - George Mason NCAA basketball game.  Our waiter approached us immediately and suggested we try the sangria.  It being my Birthday, I happily obliged him and I had in fact 3 of them by the time the meal was done.   Let me tell you right now the drink was crisp and very tasty and left absolutely no headache later on (something Sangria is typically notorious for in that regard)  As far as food is concerned, we started out with the Spanish Charcuterie Platter, Fried Calamari, White Ceviche and Crispy Pancetta Iberica.   Of those 4 dishes, the Fried Calamari came out on top, followed by the White Ceviche.   The Charcuterie platter was delightful too, while I must say we were not blown away by the Pork Belly (Pancetta) dish.  We followed up these dishes with 3 more tapas:  Stuffed Piquillo Peppers, the spanish chicken croquetas, and the Flat Iron Steak.   The first 2 were absolutely divine.   The third one was just so-so.  By that point, both my wife and I were absolutely stuffed.   Still, the waiter would not relent on us getting dessert, especially after he heard my wife was a Pastry Chef and it was my Birthday.   We nevertheless declined dessert, being completely full at that point.   Still, the waiter brought us a Crema Catalana on the house.   Since the dish was there, we had to eat it and indeed it was one of the best Creme Brulees (my wife's expected, of course) that I've ever had.   The dessert is served with a pineapple sorbet which is so clean and beautiful that it tastes like you are biting into an icy wedge of Hawaiian Pineapple.  Simply amazing dining experience.   The moment we were out of the restaurant, I tweeted to all the people who were attending the same conference I was that if they had no dinner plans, they should absolutely check out Julian Serrano.   I don't know if they took my advice, but this is a great restaurant and I plan on coming back here many times!

obL5x52_5ZfL_2qLHpENVQ.text: We has such a nice lunch here on our last day.  We sat down almost immediately after they opened and it was pretty empty.  Our waiter was super attentive but never pushy.  I really wish we would have come by one day for the happy hour.  We had a really hard time deciding on what to get because so many things on the menu sounded good.  We had the white anchovy fillets, served on toast.  Not my favorite anchovies I have ever had, but super solid.  The fried calamari was very good calamari, but wasn't anything that unique.  The scallops were perfect, great texture, fresh with a good balance of flavor.  The grilled lamb chop was probably our favorite, tender and flavorful.  Would definitely go back and try more dishes.

5ptz1Z23o-SJrAj-MaMMZQ.text: I cannot say enough great things about this place.   The space was open, modern, vibrant and energetic.   The waitstaff was attentive, friendly, fun and accommodating.  The food was amazing, I dare to say some of the best tapas I have EVER had. The Spanish tortilla, the lobster gazpacho and the creme brulle arroz con leche were out of this world.   We had the pre theater tasting menu which was an amazing deal for the quality and generous portions that we received.   Thank you for making our night so much better with a perfect and beautiful dinner!

c18jrED6k_aaaZpvefPIiw.text: This was my second tapas place to visit in Las Vegas.   The food was ok, nothing really stood out other than the paella. It was a 40 minute wait, but worth it to try at least once!  The service was top notch, from the moment you walk thru the entrance to the wait staff, manager, everyone made you feel welcome.   The price, OH THE PRICE!   Only complaint I would say.  The entire menu is seriously over priced, even by Las Vegas Strip standards. It's the reason it will not be coming back. There are far better places to go for tapas on the Vegas strip for a better price & value. And important a better selection.  The atmosphere is great!  Plenty of light, open, not stuff. It has a bar area as well. The noise level is on the average. And the place is clean, they did a pretty good job clearing the table as you was done.    All in all, I thought this place was OK at best.  But there are much much better places to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate Paellas!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna &amp; Avocado Cones.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic chicken!

5kzY4dMc52AV-uU8LF_CbQ.text: I ate here on a slow Thursday evening with my girlfriend.  The restaurant has a beautiful and elegant interior, but it's open to one of the main Aria throughways, and that makes it feel kind of casual, like a swanky airport lounge.  We were seated right away, but at a table next to a serving station, so we had waiters loitering by us most of the time.  I hate that.  Our drinks, an Estrella and a white sangria, came right away.  Once we ordered, the plates came out in rapid succession.  I highly recommend the potatoes brava, tuna tiradito, spanish charcuterie platter and sauteed spinach.  I do not recommend the lobster croquetas (off-menu) or coca chorizo.  I also had a mixed bag of mixed olives.  We skipped dessert, opting instead to stroll over to Jean Philippe.  I can never fill up on tapas for some reason, but I left satisfied, and it was a good way to start the vacation.

-0eXk8HkcuiU857wgn39UA.text: A whole new take on tapas -- some mini- masterpieces here. Highly recommend the chicken croquettes,  beef and cheese.  The lobster and pineapple was a bit out of balance -- lobster overpowered by a tangy pineapple aspic .... chocolate souffle and apple blossoms excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yNPx5QFdD1GIEbi5fiDz2A.text: Dinner was fine. Service was the worst possible. They seated us in a tight area and the servers kept bumping our chairs. I requested the first server to walk around if possible and he kindly obliged. half hour later and a second waiter bumped me. I requested him to now walk around as well if possible. And he doesn't say anything. He comes back 2 minutes later and say excuse me and then nearly smack me in the head trying to get by again. I ask him to come over and he ignores me.  Then he starts getting loud and says I'm going to call the manager. Was really not sure what he was threatening me with. Manager comes over, realizes that we have already paid our bill, quickly apologizes and then walks away. The worst service ever in an unnecessarily pricey restaurant. Couldn't figure out how to do zero stars.

iIA2lfGQ54Um7rRiCfeQSQ.text: This is a viable option if you're looking for a sprightly meal before heading out on the town.   We had the beet salad, the roasted eggplant, the lobster skewers and the ahi tuna appetizer.  All are tasty though slightly over salted, small bite plates.   The decor is an indiscriminate mixture of style and colors that evoke Disney's Tomorrowland Terrace Restaurant circa 1977.

ZQMxjbKHYpY3SvM92D56XQ.text: Can't say I'm a huge fan. You pay tourist prices for what you can generally get at Firefly. Their menus are unique in comparison so I'm not knocking the output, but for the portions that you receive and the general atmosphere, it wasn't a huge step up to warrant the extra cash.

EcGCHqgXFDzJ53bkUVcKPw.text: Absolutely love this place, from the ambience to the delicious dishes! The pitchers of sangria along with tasty Brava potatoes and tuna cones are a must try!  Our server Yoshi took great care of us. I recommend this place to anyone that comes to vegas!

yeppfRgwTTX9rXqXf_NeXg.text: I was so excited to go to this restaurant, it was on my list of must tries!!! My date and I were first feeling a little cold with the ambiance.... A tapas restaurant should have more romantic places to sit... Way too open.... I felt like I was in a cafe... We ordered the gambas, it is a shrimp dish in a flavorful tomato sauce.... The sauce was amazing, the shrimp beyond rubbery.... Could only eat one piece... My date ate the rest.... We ordered the salmon with truffles.... Salmon is my favorite normally, but this piece was not at its freshest and it tasted fishy and the sauces that surrounded it was too bland to cover up the fishiness. My date ordered the Spanish charcuterie platter.... I did not try it, but he said it was good.... But not good enough to order another...   I then ordered the creamy risotto which had good flavor and big portion, the issue was it was inedible due to it being under cooked... The waiter noticed it was basically untouched and took it off the bill... The stuffed peppers were yummy.... Servers should be friendlier in an environment like that.... My date was the best part of the dinner.... The alcohol and wine we had before dinner and during dinner kept us in good spirits.... We ate the M&Ms we bought across the street for dessert....  tapas is usually my favorite and boy was I disappointed!

a6XiNsSNEm8UEa7IwZBYHQ.text: This was my second time dining at Julian Serrano. The first time was amazing and the second time around it was good but not amazing. The beef and pork spicy meat balls were delicious. You get two big balls. The other items we got were good but not memorable. Service and ambiance is nice.

usdinT1-n9o3nxCWtJcnRg.text: I don't give five stars out much; but when I do, the place has the goods.  Instructions: Go here.  Experience.  Eat.  Smile.  Repeat.  There is too much to write and I am afraid I will leave something out.  Just go here... It's really good.

K-t7NbJ8Tc-PlHI9QP7C0A.text: BEST DINING ECPERIENCE!!! The food and wine was exqisite and the service was over the top. This was our first time here an we had no idea what to order. The waiter was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu as well as the wine menu. We we're NOT dissapointed at all. Definitly recommending this restaurants to all of our friends!!

ByhhQmMnX92WD8jGDhwFcA.text: Went here with my boyfriend for a late night dinner and really enjoyed it.  The decor is really nice and the service was excellent.  My BF started with the lobster gazpacho and liked it but wished there was more lobster in it HAHA!  We also got the salmon with truffle, creamy risotto (YUM!), and stuffed dates (good, but not as good as the ones from Firefly).  Also had a glass of Pinot Noir which was good.  I wish I knew what it was called cus it was so smooth!  Would like to go back and try more....and get more creamy risotto and wine!

eePOBSoFaRFb3pvtHrBuHQ.text: This was my first time visiting the lovely Aria and eating here.  Decor is definitely nice and modern.  The restaurant itself was packed, mainly due a convention that was being held at the same time.  It's also very loud, so it can be difficult to converse.  Service was excellent (possibly because we ordered a LOT of food as well as a bottle of wine and alcohol).  We ordered over 20 items, including almost every dessert on the menu, some more than once to feed our large group.  I have no idea what the bill cost, but I'm sure it would have been over $50 pp.    The food itself was nothing special - I've had much better tapas here in LA at various places.  I'll only gloss over the highlights.  I read that the chicken croquettes were to die for, but I found them to be simply good but something that wouldn't generally stand out.  The stuffed dates wrapped in bacon were excellent (though I must point out that it's difficult to get this dish wrong), the creamy risotto was super delicious, the scallops were good, the pan manchego was tasty, the peppers were a favorite of others, and out of all the desserts, the Spanish creme brulee was the best (unfortunately I have no picture of it, but it was larger than most creme brulees).  Again, most of the other dishes were average and nothing to write home about.  Oh, and the Sangria is delicious and sweet - they add some liquor to it (rum I think but I'm not sure) so it doesn't have a strong wine taste to it.  There's definitely better restaurants on the strip, though this was my first experience in Vegas eating tapas.  I'd say the tapas run on the more expensive side (most are $8 - $16, some up to $30), and we had to order a lot to get full.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Piquillo Peppers
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Dates
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Croquetas

dnaf7x2eoO9sgu88iI0y4g.text: Had amazing service here on a Saturday night with our server, Will! We gave him a set price our group each wanted to spend and he chose the tapas for us. The selection was diverse and delicious, we enjoyed every single option he brought. Would definitely go back!

q5XPZOa6mEaCqe_98JbVeg.text: Excellent! Bar menu allows you to try so many things at an affordable price. Yellowtail, mussels, chicken croquettes, paella...delicious!

0eJf8Pe45OXSY5HbrOkQyA.text: Me and some girls from the wedding party came in for lunch and since I wanted to watch football, we sat at the bar. I try to read some of the other reviews prior to adding my own - we had no issues with service but I think that is often the case at the bar. I can't remember the girls name but she was a doll. Yes, she reminded us what tapas are / portion size and that items just come out when ready. I had to search around for a website with a menu because I cannot for the life of me recall what we ate other than pure goodness. I think this guy did a GREAT post with pics and the menu...you might wanna check this out before going. I didn't pick this place so I had no idea what to expect. I'm ok with that, but some people are NOT. kevineats.com/2009/12/ju... There were three of us and we ordered *white ceviche yum *scallop ceviche - good but I could have skipped *ahi tuna tempura - Yes! Good size piece of ahi. *tuna-raspberry skewer - looked pretty, tasted good *cheese platter - cheese is my FAVORITE food...but it was just cheese, skip if you need the room. Go for it, if you're nervous about new foods *stuffed piquillo peppers - heaven!! Red pepper with goat cheese? I could have seriously had minimum 4 orders of this item! *pan manchego - this was GREAT - really bad sounding description but the "fresh tomato sauce" was more chunky tomato than sauce and it was the perfect amount of wetness on the bread...like soggy but not gross soggy, perfect. Just get it...it's awesome *beef and cheese - good. We did have cocktails but since we were at the bar I saw they had a great selection of spirits. We did get two desserts the server recommended....I didn't think they were fabulous but the meal was so good I didn't mind. Skip dessert and get the gelato in Aria. We discussed going back, the meal was that good. It is definitely not cheap. It was worth it! Check this place out - sit at the bar!

S16MRyObmQ1erOdedsbX_w.text: I love tapas because I don't like decision making and I love having a little bit of everything. This place was good and I was brave (just try it, I told myself), but some things were more up my alley than others. Still, I knew where it wasn't something I liked, it was more about me than the quality of the food or presentation. Like our sushi experience at Kumi at Mandalay, we just asked them to bring out good stuff until we said enough. I would have loved a potato tasty (should have asked about patatas bravas) but they brought out some really tasty things. I don't even like goat cheese, but the Stuffed Dates were probably my favorite, as well as the the little ice cream cone-like tartare, cucumber and guacamole (Tuna Cone); Rabo De Toro (oxtail and mashed potato) was also pretty good. I'd definitely come back here and try out some other fun stuff. This is the type of meal I totally enjoy and Avia was a lot cleaner smelling than the other hotel/casinos anyway.

nVlm8mdopZLP4b3vZBkG5A.text: I had a great lunch here, enjoyed it all, the service, food, decor.  The food was served up very quickly, so order in waves to set the pace.  Suggestions made by the server were spot on, and he even offered not to charge us for one item were not sure of - though we enjoyed it as he promised we would.  Note that there are several menu's - we were so hungry and ready for the tapas that we missed the lunch menu. When we saw salads and sandwiches going by we investigated further, and behold, there was another menu on the table. We didn't notice it? I guess we were *that* hungry. A cardio workout followed by a 32 oz beer poolside can do that.

g2ocylEMQ7W9aUbZ99YWbQ.text: Great modern yet casual tapas restaurant.  Be sure to be seated in the back, as it is more private and plush.  The seating infront of the bar at the front of the restaurant feels like you are eating in the casino and you are on display to everyone walking by.  The cocktails are well conceived, though the pear ginger julip, which sounded great, was very sweet.  Serving it in a taller glass with more ice or adding a splash of club soda would make it perfect.  I later switched to the red sangria, which was much better and half the price.  I must have sampled a dozen tapas plates, most of them based on the waitor's recommendation (our waitor Stefan was great server and very accomodating), and almost all of them were very good.  The only let down was the beef filet which was a bit tough and over done and needed more seasoning.  My favorite plates were the crispy calamari, ceviche, chicken croquettas, lobster skewers with pineapple gelle, ahi skewers with raspberry gelle.  Be sure to end your dinner with dessert as they all sound very good.  I would definitely dine again here.

3lUmn4le2DpPenWU1l8WxA.text: Stopped by for a mid afternoon vacation cocktail and ended up ordering some tapas. Restaurant has a open feel and looks into the casino lobby (& not the gaming floor) which happens to be an attractive space.   Cocktails were flavorful & were exciting enough to qualify for a early happy hour.  We ended up ordering the chicken croquettes & bacon wrapped dates. The chicken croquettes were crunchy on the outside & filled with bechamel creaminess on the inside. The dates were sweet, salty,spicy & of very high quality. One of the bartenders recommended that we try the stuffed piquillo peppers. We were glad we did. Nice pepperiness complimented by the creamy slightly sour taste of goat cheese.   I would love to come back here next time I am in Vegas to experience more of this menu. I had not considered this restaurant due to the stuffy, dated look & feel of Picasso (Serrano's other restaurant) I am glad I ended up stopping by for a drink as this restaurant is fresh & definitely adding to the foodieness of the Vegas dining scene.

JjyNXLSSx-KgGQ5FP87tnw.text: While visiting Las Vegas and staying at nearby Vdara, we decided to have dinner here as it was listed as $$ which was important as we had already spent a lot of money.  The food was fantastic and in spite of the location being right near the casino, it was lively and had great decor.  As the food is "small plates", we had Kale Salad, Bravas Potatoes, Asparagus, Chicken Croquettes and Beef/Pork Sliders.  They asked if we wanted them spread out or all at once and we chose to have one at a time.  Each dish was perfectly sized for two people to share and we were stuffed by the time we were done, unfortunately leaving no room for dessert.

V5M-27rTh0UcOB1ao1OLGA.text: We cannot say enough about the food and service at Julian Serrano's.   We have been coming here for 10 years since they opened and have been treated like royalty every time we visit.   Pedro our waiter remembers us every time, even if it is a year between visits!   He is one of the best waiters in our vast foodie experience, and definitely the best waiter in Las Vegas!   We recommend the beef and cheese, ceviche, mushroom risotto and mushroom soup.   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pedro from Julian Serrano
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cnZoB5QRLAp7nWNN0lpRPA.text: Not so great. Disappointing for the price. I ordered two dishes that were highly recommended in Yelp and other sites: the stuffed dates and the tenderloin steak/ fois gras/white chocolate bread. They were good enough but nothing special. I have had better at much less expensive Spanish restaurants.  Plus, they were both excessively heavy/fatty and left me feeling full (in not such a good way) and just a little sick to my stomach from the richness. Plus, the ambience leaves much to be desired for an expensive meal: it is noisy, cramped and has more of a sports bar feel than a fine dining restaurant experience. Had a much much better dinner at Jean Georges steakhouse in Vegas the night before. ... oh, and as others have noted, the portions are very small, and the sangria tasted too sweet (like another review commented: like Kool Aid).

TfhC0XzRxOYBwJmQEnIqOQ.text: After reading all of the rave reviews, we felt like we had to include Julian Serrano Tapas on this New Year's vacation. Sadly we were disappointed. From check in, the wait staff was rushed and unfriendly. Our waitress never checked on us after the meals were served. Drinks were never refilled. Understandably, it is New Year's Eve, so maybe they were slammed?? Tapas should be small plates that burst with flavor. These plates were beautiful, but muted and under seasoned. There was no pop. In Vegas, there are so many fabulous restaurants to choose from. I want to be blown away by flavor and leave the restaurant with delicious memories.  We started with 3 plates and we were going to order more. After tasting the first three tapas, we changed our mind.  We ordered the Seared Scallop Skewer ($32), Carne Asada ($35), and the Tender (fillet) crab ($45). Out of the three, the scallops were the best. They were well seared and the romesco was tasty. The Carne Asada included an end piece that was well above our requested medium rare. Three of the 5 thin slices were very fatty and included large amounts of gristle. On such a small plate that highlights the beef, all the pieces should be perfect. Trim the end piece and the gristle away. The filet in the Tender Crab was well cooked, but under seasoned. The bread underneath was incredibly soggy and drenched with the sauce. The crab was bland and added nothing to the dish. All three of the dishes could have used a few extra pinches of salt.   We were underwhelmed and decided to end the meal early and join our friends at another restaurant. We will not be recommending this restaurant to our friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared scallops and Tender Crab
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada

9oyoyEmXjDbIYCoXIBsOAQ.text: Excellent tapas restaurant, great ambiance, menu and selection of tapas. Stuffed dates are a must as are the stuffed pequillo peppers, manchego, paella. The mushroom risotto was delicious. Great beverages from sangria to wine selection, service can be hit or miss, tonight was crowded so was ok. Save room for dessert, portions are 'tapas' style so pick at least 2-3 per person, but that's great because there is plenty of variety in this menu to try a lot!

oMT3ZqXA5oMVdgmq-waibQ.text: Julian Serrano at ARIA Shout out to our waiter Antonio! Our first time  here was 2 years ago.  We came back last Feb and celebrated a wonderful Valentine's Day! He not only gave us excellence then, but remembered us from our anniversary 2 years ago.    The pallea is amazing, made fresh and worth the 45 min cook time.  Also in love with the Montadito de rabo de toro..  My fav dish.  Atmosphere is lively and decor open and colorful.  I'll be going back again VERY soon

qmTBY7iIVs9FmBK4f_aoSg.text: This restaurant is excellent! The food is phenomenally! Excellent sangria and the cheeses - and meats are high quality! The bacon wrapped dates are perfect. Can't wait to go back. Excellent service as well. Wish I could give it more stars!!!

q9sXuCny0YQMaAJxXMq4Yg.text: Came to Julian Serrano's with a large group for a work lunch. Some items were really good, but the main dish / meat items lacked flavor. Calamari was like chewing gum. Octopus and potato was bland, had to add hot sauce to the pork to give it flavor. The soda was Flat, had them replace it twice and just gave up from there.   Our main waiter was great but everyone else who was helping him seemed put out if you asked for anything.   I have no idea what our meal cost but I'm pretty sure we dropped a couple grand, and it was a serious disappointment. Do yourself a favor and go to Javiar's in the Aria instead... they were amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UWVQa0_GdYq9dCNojaNcVg.text: While Julian Serrano is certainly not new to the dining scene, he definitely keeps evolving his menu enough that we thought that we would revisit this restaurant of his name sake and share with you what we love about this place. Located just off the lobby of the Aria Hotel, it is most times a very lively place. You can choose to sit in the dining room, at the bar or score one of the three coveted peninsulas at the end of the bar where you can watch everything come out of the kitchen service window. That's my suggestion! It's a pretty much come as you are casual restaurant, nice jeans will definitely do, with a large selection of tapas, good drinks and housemaid sangria that ferments overnight. The emphasis is in the tapas selection on the menu, which are meant to be shared, and you'll be sure to order plenty as these plates are typically small. There's an expansive early dining menu with the newly added Spanish huevos creations that make this place perfect for that weekend brunch. Julian Serranos also serves up what we think are the best paella dishes in town on the dinner menu, but don't despair if you are early dining because there are some excellent rice dishes on that menu for you to enjoy along with two of their paella selections to enjoy as well, making this the best Spanish dining in town.  Don't forget to leave room for some of the best Spanish desserts as well! "Sinfonia de Placa Pequena"

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet and apple salad
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus in the forefront and octopus dish

iZv8-9c7L7oglAIo4UsHOw.text: Expect to drop some coin in this place (sad they dropped happy hour awhile back). Service is excellent and I dare you to find a better red sangria. I don't know the name of the dishes, but will try to explain. Had a squid ink pasta with baby octopus, tomatoes and squash. Favorite dish in this outing. He had the bacon, eggs and potatoes. Eggs should have been less cooked and bacon could be more crisp, but good overall. Meat and cheese platter was OK. Desert was fantastic! Carmel, ice cream and candied macadamias!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and eggs with potatoes. Limp bacon and hard eggs.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good stuff!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rucYRRRS-wAYCnVYci4m2A.text: Top and amazing restaurant in Las Vegas! Tapas are really good, make you feel that you are having lunch in the marina of Barcelona! It's a real Spanish restaurant!  Price is decent, just remember that you are on the strip, so of course price are not like Madrid or Marbella...  Staff are super nice, well everything was just amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese plate....

qKYgXvtyPc6xuulGBfI8IA.text: Wow! What a great meal we had here. For two of us, we selected 5 tapas plates-the tuna cones, the mushroom risotto, the lobster salad, shrimp in garlic sauce and the manchego cheese toast. All were fantastic but the manchego cheese toast, lobster salad and the risotto were superior! Amazing how such simple dishes were so flavorful. The dessert was great-the torrija (I am probably spelling it wrong) was to die for. The setting is nice-inside the Aria hotel. Our food came fast, almost  too fast but our server was great. A lovely evening for sure

3Wg4Xnh88qRxzg056vlvsg.text: Simply mouth watering and amAzing taste! We came here because we wanted to try chef cuisines in Vegas! So this restaurant was close to our hotel and so we walked in and we were quickly seated! So we first ordered a potato with egg and chorizo--- omg the presentation wasn't that good, something that I could do and prepare at home but wow! The taste was amazing! It lacked plating but amazing taste! Then we ordered these croquettes which were as equally delicious! I highly recommend this place for people who love small but tasty plates!! It's also a nice date night place, the interiors are beautiful and well though of! Would come back here for more tapas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GnGRrwuJAl_NpQPAsEh_VQ.text: Way overpriced!  I'm not a big eater so tapas are normally just right for me but the portions here left me hungry.  Seriously, $23 for one scallop, $17 for asparagus?!  We chose four tapas to share, as recommended by our server. We chose the scallop, asparagus, chicken croquet and the short rib. The first three were good, nothing to get excited about but the meat in the last plate was definitely not short rib.  Those are slow braised and become tender enough to shred. Instead we got a few slices of chewy gristle, like cheap steak.  We sent it back and gave up.  The check WITH our discount was over $60 for three very tiny plates and no drinks, just water.   The service was good until we had to wait 20 minutes for the last plate to come out, ironically the one we sent back.   When in the Aria, go to Javiers instead.

ndWqjaek7WaTtwTKtLHMWw.text: One of the nicer restaurants in one of the best hotels on the strip (and smoke free!) but I still can't get over how people bring their small children to Las Vegas. As a result we had to quietly chuckle when the 1 year old at the table next us kept crying and her mother tried to quiet her with a bottle of milk.  Love the bright colors at Julian Serrano but we also had to laugh at the comically HUGE and HEAVY chairs at our table. A lady next to us complained that her chair was wobbly and it took two waiters to move it out of the way and steal one from our table. I'm sure workers comp will get some claims after they throw their back out.  The menu has dozens of options and is a bit tricky to navigate but our waiter was helpful with many excellent suggestions. We love to go after a good charcuterie board and this one did not disappoint. The 5-star rating is for a restaurant that finally gives enough bread to enjoy the entire charcuterie selection, drives me crazy when you pay $30+ dollars and they give you 5 thin slices of baguette.  Great service, nice atmosphere, perfect location and some very memorable tapas selections would make us return. Beware of the chairs though!

6jsV7X0mjNK0dzhZ0SakPA.text: Stopped in here for a quick lunch and what a surprise it was! The food was incredible and there wasn't anything that we ordered that wasn't top notch. My favorite had to be the pan manchego and the shrimp ceviche. The ceviche had a Leche de Tigre gelato on top which added a new dimension to the ceviche. Was only able to snag a few photos of some of the plates we got because the rest were devoured in seconds. The service was pretty well my only complaint was our waiter disappeared on us a few times. It looked like he was the only one for lunch and he was servicing quite a few tables besides ours.  Food was incredible won't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jdv_rLULd4-oaHhfd7sumQ.text: Julian Serrano Tapas was a nice dining experience. As I mentioned before I love tapas. It's nice to be able to try different dishes all at once. Upon walking in we were greeted by the nice host. They took our baby's stroller and seated us. The food was good and we had an amazing waiter by the name of Yoshi. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and could answer any questions. He also made some suggestions that turned out to be good.   What we ordered was as follows:  -ALBONDIGAS : beef meatballs, tomato, and sherry sauce. These meatballs were so good and full of flavor. These were some of the best meatballs I have tasted. They were tender and just delicious. The tomato and sherry sauce added a nice touch. They were also served with some diced potatoes.  -BEEF AND CHEESE: prime tenderloin, mushroom, honey, walnuts. This was one of the dishes that Yoshi suggested, and it was AMAZING! I normally do not and will not order steak when I go to a restaurant because I don't like steak. However, my husband wanted it and this was nothing short of awesome! The steak was cooked med (pink in the middle). It was sooo tender and flavor. The cheese sauce and walnuts added a nice flavor and crunch. All the ingredients went together well to make the perfect dish! Definitely try this!   -GAMBAS: sauteed shrimp, garlic, spicy tomato sauce , arbol chilis. This dish was ok. It wasn't bad but didn't really stand to compete with the top two. It was a nice dish and the sauce had a good flavor, but it just didn't pop as much. Overall, it was pretty good.  -VALENCIANA PAELLA: chicken, rabbit, spanish pork chorizo, vegetables, saffron. We ordered ours with no rabbit. We also ordered this before we ordered any tapas since it does take approx. 30-45 min to prepare. This paella wasn't anything special and did disappoint a little. This wasn't as good as other paella I have tried in the past. It was lacking in flavor and seasoning. The Chorizo was very good but other than that there isn't anything special to report about this dish. It was kind of bland and boring. The chicken was tender but lacked in flavor as well.   Overall, I am glad I got to try Julian Serrano. They have amazing tapas but lacked a little when it comes to the Paella. In my opinion their tapas taste way better than the Paella. If we had ordered the Paella alone, this would have been a totally different review. Definitely do not just order the Paella and no tapas. You will do yourself a disservice.

xB4G8k2DF9SPNVhpG_Zb4A.text: Delicious aged ham, mushroom risotto, and chicken.  The restaurant itself was a bit on the cold side so both my fiance and I wanted to eat quickly to head out. Dress warm! But otherwise, great food.

5QVVV5Q7bmLFncH1a51uEg.text: This was by far our favorite restaurant during our 5-day Vegas vacation. Our server, Pedro, was very friendly and made great recommendations. We split a pitcher of red sangria, which was delicious and actually tasted just like the sangria I had many times during my summer in Spain in college.  For food, we ordered the stuffed piquillo peppers, tortilla, chicken croquettes, tuna carpaccio, tuna cones, and stuffed dates. Everything was excellent. Nothing stood out as being weak, but the tuna dishes were my favorite because the tuna itself was so exceptional. For dessert, we split the pan de Calatrava, which was also great.   Tapas is always our go-to cuisine when we travel, and this place did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A True tapas feast!

-HFeZqve7aj8FwobECGvJg.text: This place is a must. The beef cheese walnut and honey dish is stupid good! Honestly everything was good except the calamari. The mush room soup is amazing! Overall, 4.5 stars, I gave it five because of Pedro and Will, dynamic! They truly made the experience a blast. Don't pass this pace bye, unique and fun!!

5J0bmnZBI6cQ-4eoLNgi5A.text: If I could give this restaurant more than 5 stars, I would. Spectacular atmosphere, incredible food and the best service there is. Ernie and Antonio were outstanding waiters. They were knowledgeable of the menu and helped us to decided how much to order.   We got the paella for the table which was most likely the best paella I've ever had, and I have been to Spain. We ordered it just with chicken and vegetables, as no one in our party eats pork or shellfish. It was so flavorful and perfect.   I would recommend getting a few tapas to share to start the meal, and then ordering more as you are still hungry or want to try more. We didn't make it to the dessert menu but I have heard great things.   Some highlights from the dinner:  mushroom soup (worth it to get individually), mushroom risotto,  beef and cheese,  Spanish tortilla (incredible!!!),  tuna cones (so tasty),  the manchego toast was delicious and made me feel like I was back in Spain.   This is a great place for a special dinner while exploring Vegas. You will want to tell everyone you know about Julian Serrano's!

FIkmqXEyGM6wWwXrZlxIyQ.text: Flavorful decent sized tapas. Nearly every dish is enjoyable except the shasito peppers which lacked flavor. Did not like the riojas /Albarino we had but do not recall names as did not order. Lively open space. Good for large groups. Avoid if looking for a romantic setting.

5N1uu3VU5gfb-vPBpmPN-Q.text: Don't know what to eat? Tapas is always a great option! Friendly service and a wide variety of foods to choose from, there's not a bad selection to be had! Gotta love the  acorn fed Iberico prosciutto. Delicate and delicious!!!!

JfclgKhD_Hv3WFjdkuliig.text: Came here for lunch and I ordered the tuna cones, yellowtail, chicken croquette, ox tail, meatballs, fries topped with egg, Spanish tortilla, and spinach. Everything we ordered was mediocre at best. For the price the food should taste a lot better. My favorite dish was the Tuna cones, the Tuna was fresh and the cones gave it a great crunch. The service was great and the ambiance was very nice. However, I would not come back again unless it's for happy hours.

Gf3x-i8WZqWxtdeP-SVgfg.text: This is another places to try if you're ever staying at the Aria. Tapas style is the way to go if you're just wanting to enjoy a nice evening with friends. The paella will take at least 40mins to get ready but sooo good and with the wait! Enough portion for 2+ ppl. They have a really great vegetarian and vegan menu. Great for those who want to be healthy. The dishes are shareable and full of flavors. I tried the Risotto and Japanese elephant both are delicious!

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy Risotto wild mushroom, aged manchego cheese

9KvsrCzEzTVkG9gqkTfU1w.text: My wife and I enjoyed our Friday night dinner at Julian Serrano Tapas!  The food was very delicious, and the service was hands-down one of the best!  Our server, Pedro Ortiz, greeted and treated us like VIP's! He pointed out the delicious selections from the menu, and specifically recommended the best items based on how he knew our nationality and cultural background!  The delicious recommendations were as follows: Cochinillo (a crispy roasted suckling pig's leg), Spanish Pata Negra Ham (Jamon Iberico), and Spanish Serrano Ham (Jamon Serrano). He also suggested adding truffles to enhance our dining experience, as well as provide a special (not on the menu) non-alcoholic beverage mix for my wife!  In addition to the recommendations, we also enjoyed their delicious Tuna Cones (Ahi Tuna Tartare), and the Albondigas (Beef Meatballs).  For dessert, we had the Pan De Calatrava (Bread Pudding), as well as the Torrija (Salted Caramel, Vanilla Bean Ice Cream, Candied Macadamia).  Our server, Pedro, served Brandy the old school way of placing the Brandy glass over a hot glass of water to steam the liquor!  Needless to say, we will be back at Julian Serrano Tapas the next time we go on vacation to Las Vegas.  Highly recommended!

lCZ3fQUB04N835uhUI-DtA.text: ***** 2.5 STARS *****  Julian Serrano has a lovely, spacious restaurant located inside of the Aria hotel. The restaurant is very open and the colors are vibrant. I came here ok a Wednesday for dinner and the place was only half full. We were seated right away since we did have a reservation time. Once seated we glanced over the menu and quickly ordered a couple red sangrias before we ordered our food.   // SERVICE //  Our waiter had an extensive knowledge of the menu which was great. He helped us decide on a couple different items to choose from since the menu can be overwhelming at first.   // FOOD //  Black rice: Fresh calamari, lobster, saffron, squid ink. This was my most favorite dish of the night. The seafood was fresh, the black rice had great flavor and the aioli that they put on the rice was delicious with a strong garlic flavor to it. 3.5/5  Atun de hijada: Tuna belly, lemon, tomato. I thought the tuna belly was very flavorful, but unfortunately the lemon mashed potatoes on the bottom did not compliment the fish at all. The potatoes were really sweet, and had almost like a custard texture. 2/5  Pepito de ternera: Beef ribeye cap, pretzel bread. I thought this was a unique dish. The bread was burnt on the outside so all you taste is burnt bread which was unpleasant. The beef however was extremely tender and cooked perfectly. I wish they just added a little more seasoning to the beef. 2.5/5  Rabo de toro: Oxtail, Iberian pork, mashed potatoes. I liked the presentation of this dish, but the flavors did not go well together. 2.5/5  Overall, I was pretty disappointed with the food at Julian Serrano. From my perspective, many of the dishes had flavorful components to it, but when you combine all of the different components, the flavors did not compliment each other. I will most likely not come back to Julian Serrano to dine again.

2fqFQ1V1GViUmATjvlg36Q.text: Nice presentation but food is just okay. Fancy place so bring your wallet. Service is good. Their sangria is great.   T would try their sangria but would pass on the food.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classy touch to have the initials on the plate

j-LdK4UiJPjm_KkPSu3cAA.text: We came here with high expectation but was really disappointed. The ambience was great but I think that the waiter just didn't recommend the best dishes for us. Everything we ordered on the menu with the waiter's suggestion was mediocre and didn't live up to my expectations. But the ambience and lighting of the place is quite nice.   Sauteed shishito pepper felt overcooked and a bit sweet. The oxtail was too dry. The lobster gazpacho was too thick. And the yellowtail tirado unnecessarily paired with sweet potato haystack (fried) which killed the flavor of yellowtail.   Everything was just a bit off - either a bit too rich, trying too hard with too much sauce, and not letting the ingredients shine as they should.  I heard much better reviews on Picasso by Serrano - maybe better to pay up to try a different restaurant by him.

1v2NGs3qLfRBWKzWyhQZzQ.text: I rarely write reviews but this is one place I wish everyone would avoid.  The food is utterly disgusting-terrible. And the prices--just immoral. For 3 pieces of cheese and three slices of cold cuts, they charge you $26.  That'd be fine if it was good--but no--very stale, flavorless, and makes me want to spit it out and walk out of the restaurant. Please avoid. Many fantastic options around the area.

92q9gxxWXECIPp7YwB8rcA.text: Food is great, service was decent the ambience was a little loud and too open.  Came here for lunch one day to take advantage of the prefix restaurant week lunch menu $30. The menu included a choice of 3 to 4 tapas items and the list is pretty comprehensive and contained many of their favorite items.   The restaurant is actually in the lobby of the aria Hotel and it's really kind of just an open area with no walls in closing the restaurant. So anyone walking through the lobby of the hotel can see you and depending on how many guests are checking in or out, it can get loud. It didn't feel like a restaurant at all, but rather a cafeteria. The service was also a little absent even though the restaurant wasn't busy.   The food however was very good and I would give the food alone 5 stars. I would have to say that the food here is better than it is over at Jaleo. Each dish was made with quality ingredients that you can taste, and nicely presented.  There is Wi-Fi inside the restaurant that you tag off of the lobby of the hotel, and the bathrooms are very clean.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q-3MZusac8aAIvXJfgOoCQ.text: How did I forget to write a review! I guess maybe it's because I was too busy stuffing my face! We came here for dinner as part of a bachelorette trip for a fancy dinner. And fancy dinner it was. We had a decent sized group and were sat towards the back, which was perfect. The waiter was friendly and attentive. Now for the food (from what I remember): Sangria- Pretty good, hard to mess up Chicken croquettes- the most favorite amongst the table Paella- really good. did not skim on the meats, great flavors Spanish tortilla- nothing special, skip it  there was one dish that had some sort of potato puree and it was crazy spicy.  I know I am totally missing stuff, but these are the memorable dishes.

fUpvAnTL6Y09zdmjT73t_w.text: I had Aria food and beverage credit that I needed to use before my stay ended.  We picked Julian Serrano out of all the restaurants Aria had to offer.  We were definitely not disappointed with our choice.      We came an hour prior to closing and were seated next to a huge bachelor's party.  Needless to say, they were very loud, and very drunk.  After what seemed like a very long time, our server finally approached us.  He was very apologetic though, stating that he was also taking care of the big party, and that they would leave shortly.    We decided on ordering the spanish tortilla, chicken croquetas, and the vegetable paella.  The spanish tortilla was unlike anything I have ever tasted.  It looked so simple, but tasted so delicious.  The croquetas were very satisfying.  It tasted like everything you would expect.    One the menu, there is a warning that the paella takes upwards of 30 minutes to cook.  This was no joke, because it really did take a long time to come out.  Everyone around us had already left except for one or two tables who were probably in the same boat as us.  The menu also states that it feeds two people.  That part is incorrect because we had so much leftover.  The dish was full of flavor, and worth trying.  There were a lot of ingredients that made the entree come together.    The only reason why not 5 stars is because the food is quite expensive.  The paella alone was $40.  The other reason was the slow service in the beginning.    Julian Serrano is one of those great quality restaurants that you expect in Vegas.  I would bring friends next time so that we will be able to try, and share more tapas.

Gv0L1Anut6Qcmrv17tQ-rg.text: Our staff had dinner here the other night and overall, everything we ordered was delicious. We walked over to this place from Vdara.   If you ever need to plan a company meal I'd highly recommend this place because it's one of the more affordable options. It was priced at around $100 per person.

Xf39sufZA2vXh01xkeRfLw.text: The Serrano Tender, foie gras, prime tenderloin and white chocolate bread, has got to be one of the top 5 best bites I have ever had.  When compared to the cost of a meal at some of the chef steak houses in town, Julian Serrano is actually a bargain.

Qxr81oYRo9tHVAqB1EvPgw.text: Nice place for an upscale dinner with great company.  We had the following:  Spanish tortilla - pretty good, but it was small! I wish there was more.  Japanese eggplant - This was pretty good.  Peppers - these are actual chili peppers, not bell peppers, so be forewarned, it doesn't say this on the menu! We had to send it back.  Queso fresco - not a fan of this, I don't like olives and it's cooked inside the bread. It needed more balsamic too, not enough.  Asparagus - huge pieces, cooked perfectly, like the grilled flavor.  Patatas bravas - typical like most other restaurants, but I have had better, not my favorite here. We didn't finish it.  Sangria - was pretty good.

2Iuf1VVOQnANbXvuHEHakA.text: Delicious!  Beautiful setting away from the hustle and bustle of strip-side or in-casino dining. Way at the back of Aria. Our table of six spent about $70 per person plus tip. Sangria was decent. Many choices even without venturing into paella (we didn't have time). Service was good, and as expected with tapas, things arrived randomly. We did end up with three of our dishes arriving at once after a long dry spell. A little better pacing would have been nice. The gazpacho is to die for.

5-3PHbM6oXck1lSXryGeMA.text: The Serrano Tender and Pinxzo de chorizos were delicious! The white chocolate bread and foie gras were the perfect compliment to the meaty Serrano tender steak. The sweetness from the honey and the savory potato puree balanced the slightly spicy and delicious chorizo.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

znvn8hWI5xyWL9FGuCwHDQ.text: This place is legit.  Authentic Spanish tapas this side of the pond.  Ever since my trip to Spain last year, I have been craving this food.  And Julian Serrano's has exceeded those desires!  Pan tomate is perfect with the right hint of garlic and a generous drizzling of olive oil.  The serrano jamon melts in your mouth, and patatas bravas bite back with a spicy tomato and oil flavor.    Add to this amazing experience with reasonable prices even in the setting of the Vegas strip (each tapas plate averages between $5-9), an open, comfortable setting, expansive bar, and hip music at the right level that you can still hear your fellow dining patrons, and Julian Serrano's comes out a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crema catalana
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spanish chicken croquetas
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar lunch tapas menu page 3

zwxre9KKjgpfI8qvdB07Sw.text: Love the grub here! Fries with sausage and egg and the whole pig!!! That skin is just moist and super crunchy, got to have it!!! You can also order 1/4 pig at a time too.

wSc-ZGu3122kOYEecbrHDg.text: Decided to try this place again after a very long time, a much better experience this time! Had to wait a bit for our table cause we were late for our reservation time, the restaurant was very crowded, even the bar was full, but they gave us a big table for the two of us, so it was worth the wait! We brought our own Veuve Cliquot champagne, they told us three times that they had a corkage fee, we wondered why they kept telling us, it was $35! Steep!   I still remember the menu, so big it's like a book. The items are very well categorized. Snacks, soups, salads, bread and egg tapas, poultry tapas, hot shellfish tapas, cold and hot seafood tapas, meat tapas, pork tapas and cheese & charcuterie. Also paellas and platos grande for two people, and family size choices of lamb, ribeye or whole roasted suckling pig.... Yikes! But, they also have vegetarian / vegan choices, so it's a restaurant for everybody!   Ordering was easy, told the server what we would have liked to eat, the server recommended some of the popular dishes for us. The portions have definitely increased since our last visit, everything was big! The flavors have gotten stronger, much stronger too, to the point some of the dishes were a little bit too salty for us. So they just can't find a balance point, but it's much better than tiny portions with no flavors if you ask me!   Tapas: Yellowtail & tuna cones, fisherman's soup, grilled tuna belly, vegan sauteed spinach, lobster with angel hair pasta, ribeye rare plus and spicy pork meatballs.   Loved tuna cones and lobster angel hair pasta, the lobster and grilled tuna belly were a bit too smoky for me, especially the lobster, but the pasta was amazingly flavorful, it was so good! Hubby loved the ribeye, so tender and rare enough for him. The spinach was too salty, as well as the soup. Spicy pork meatballs were flavorful and very spicy, hubby liked them a lot.   For desserts we had three flavors of sorbets and creme brulee, loved the mandarin orange sorbet, creme brulee was heavenly yummy!   Overall the food was so delicious, the presentations were so beautiful. I had a glass of white sangria, it was very refreshing and tasty. Service was friendly and fairly attentive considering how busy they were.   Think we will come back whenever we want tapas in Vegas, cause they have many seafood, vegetarian / vegan choices on the menu, that's a big YES for me!   Ps. They have good happy hour menu, definitely take advantage of that if you don't want to spend big bucks at this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbets and creme Brulee
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Meatballs
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

kA3Fm-YxmV0sHRkLt25-HQ.text: 3 stars for the food. 1 star for the service.   Food was not bad. Not as good as it was 2 years ago. Lamb chops were ordered medium arrived closer to well done.  Soups were served at room temperature.  food arrives all at once, and the waiters make no attempt to clear a spot on your table. They stand around expecting you to move food around and move dishes for them.  Plates used are also ridiculously large for tapas.  3 plates and your table is overwhelmed.  don't get me wrong everyone was courteous and friendly but I didn't come here to be smiled at and make friends.    Used to be a standout Vegas restaurant, now it's just another aging Vegas hasbeen.

NcNH0aY3si2m-bPEwqTMCg.text: We ate at the bar and had the smaller ( and less expensive) tapas.   This way we were able to try a lot:  Mushroom risotto Jalapeno poppers Eggplant Paella  Dates wrapped in bacon Salmon cake Bombs spicy meatball  It was all okay,  not  fantastic, they all needed a little punch of flavor.  Jeffrey the bartender was super attentive and let us sample sangria so we could order our favorite. Sangria was only $5  ....the tapas only $6   .....What a deal!  We were very hungry after walking 8 or so miles out at Red Rock (a loop thru awe inspiring canyons) and tired after Penn and Teller show last night.  Tonight it's Brittney Spears!

HDJiKegJorpA9CM9ANmSBA.text: Awesome red sangria!  We had the cheese platter, Tuna cones, yellow tail, and rib eye dish and they were all delicious!

6Y-GWWZIck-rkq2OUnMhOQ.text: Everything was wonderful and tasty. Tapas are the way to go. Must try everything, was to the T on every dish. Highly recommend this restaurant. The black rice was to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foi Gras with apple
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foi Gras pate
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese platter

Xi9lEYJpe0DgtQR9UQnChg.text: My husband and I ordered about 8 items from the menu, and every dish was on point. The cocktails were great, our server was knowledgable and friendly, and the rest of the staff were very pleasant. I was completely happy with our visit!

KIpDKOU3iTYTdHK_URGZaQ.text: I really enjoyed my experience here.  The mushroom soup was divine.   The queso fresco was surprising and delicious but as my server as I you have to like olives.  The stuffed dates are indeed like candies.  Very sweet in spite of the bacon.  Had a small portion of the tenderloin in the beef and cheese.  Well cooked and well seasoned but strangely on a plate so small it made it difficult to cut.   I also enjoyed the white sangria.   Delicious.   Sadly I was dining alone and the paella is only served in a portion for two or more.  A table near me seemed to be relishing theirs.  Good size servings of lobster tails in it.  The atmosphere and service also enjoyable.

kQlqtxVQrL4Wl7vP385Nsw.text: Amazing vegan selections and great service.   I originally thought of going to Javier's but after seeing the menu and what was being charged for tacos, I didn't want to be disappointed how I was at Chino Poblano.   So I've heard so much about Julian Serrano I thought I'd give it a try. I browse the menu and know I can take a few things out to make it vegan. I ask the hostess if I can make substitutions to accommodate a vegan lifestyle. They said no, but instead pull out an entire vegan and vegetarian menu. SCORE!!!   Everything looked so good! I honestly could've ordered the entire vegan menu but I couldn't justify spending more than $200 when I still need to grab groceries.   I ordered the paella which is a must to try, either vegan, vegetarian, pescatarian or meat eater. Let it be the first thing to be ordered. When the waiter comes over, just order the paella! No questions, just order it. Even without the meat and seafood, this is the best paella I've had in Las Vegas. It takes about 45 minutes to hit the table. The temperature was just perfect.  I also ordered the kale salad which was amazing as well. Very light and fresh. I then ordered grilled jumbo asparagus which came out perfect and went so well with the salad.  There was a non-alcoholic sangria I tried which was pretty good too. Not too sweet and not too from all the fruit. The orange garnish I could do without but still nicely done.   Sadly there were no vegan desserts or I assume there wasn't since I wasn't offered a dessert menu.   The service was good. I sat at the bar and it took a few minutes to have my order taken. No worries, they seemed busy.   Julian Serrano, great for vegans and non vegans.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan paella
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale salad with seasonal veggies.

b9qyPoPOhwNP-LsSyddyrw.text: I love their paella! And I am very happy with their food! The foie gras (in the middle of a mini apple) is just fantastic and it melt in you mouth! I will definitely come back!

NDCXnxWC8u0us9x2mzCVfg.text: We come to Vegas every year for Christmas, and we always eat at Julian Serrano as it had been consistently great. Tonight, however, was a major disappointment - not the great food & service we have come to expect.  Food: Picas (chicharrones, olives, almonds) - excellent  Foie gras with Apple - good but the foie was a little overcooked, and there was too much Caramelized apple, which made it too sweet Gazpacho - excellent Patatas Brava - spicy tomato sauce was sweet and not spicy at all, and the potatoes were soggy instead of crispy outside and fluffy inside. This is usually a fave of ours, but we sent it back. Octopus - well cooked, but not seasoned (no salt) Oxtail - too sweet Stuffed dates - too sweet (tasted like they used candied bacon) White Sangria - tasted like watered down white wine - no hint of brandy or fruit, despite pieces of apples and oranges in the pitcher  Service: Lackluster. We like to order a couple of tapas at a time, then order more as we go along. The waiter forgot several of our orders until prompted, didn't return to take our order when we indicated we wanted to order more, etc. Not horrible, but not the attentive service we have received here in the past.  In the past, we have spent 2 1/2 to 3 hours ordering many tapas and then dessert. Tonight we got so fed up that we stopped ordering and didn't even get dessert. We only spent 1 1/2 hrs there. All in all, a disappointing evening.

lQQiwOZqXR3DiYkD3FFFtQ.text: It was a Saturday night, my LV partner-in-crime and I were in the Aria Hotel, and decided to dine at Julian Serrano after reviewing the menu. Truth be told, since this resto name somewhat resembles mine (as people have mispronounced and called me by this name along with others- ask me about if you're interested), dining here was really a no-brainer. hah! With no reservations, we chanced it and apparently lady luck was on our side, as there was no wait. The warm colors of the restaurant looked so inviting. Here's a pic of the bar area, taken with my iPhone yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... From our table, here's a shot of the entire restaurant yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... Everything on the menu looked so delicious, so we ordered (and pics credit go to my girl, Li): - Beet Salad: Roasted and oh so beetalicious! yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... - Beef with Brie: Tender pieces, with brie, (one of my fav cheeses). Oh Mylanta, such a digalicious combo, and with walnuts on top, and the savory sauce was divine! yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... - Striped bass: Fresh fish, cooked to perfection. Delish! yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... - Creamy Risotto with Mushrooms and Manchego: Mouth watering deliciousness, and so rich, creamy, and cheesey goodness! yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... - Pan Manchego: Spanish Toast with roasted tomato and garlic paste with melted Manchego cheese. All I have to say is mas pan, mas pan! yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... -Chocolate Cake: Chocolate molten cake, which rivals my favorite chocolate souffle at Roy's Hawaiian restaurant. Combined with mango sorbet, and I was in dessert heaven with these two loves of mine. yelp.com/biz_photos/_w5h... While we feasted so well, our beverages were refreshing white sangria (para mi) and red sangria (para mi amiga), and later had very 'brave' coffee. We needed the caffeine jolt, as it was only the beginning of a very fun and memorable night out. Que bueno, Julian Serrano! Beautiful interior, efficient service, reasonable prices, and wonderful food. This is a great restaurant for a date, a small or big group of friends, and perfect for getting the night started off right in Sin City! Viva Las Vegas!!

IBu32Bn13Vka4GJix91i0Q.text: An absolutely excellent experience. Antonio was the perfect server and deserves to be at such an amazing restaurant. We did a chef recommended tasting menu, basically their choice. It was for our wedding and the food came out perfectly timed, the Sangria was incredible, the cocktails were all excellent, and the plates were delicious. Truly a memorable experience! Thanks for making our wedding dinner a success!

R5hg7XOVZfgbC8oCTbUEJw.text: My all time favorite in Julian Serrano is the black rice that is shimmered with squid ink. I have to visit here whenever I come to Vegas. Service is very attentive. We met the server called Jason twice. He is very patient to us and keep his smile always although he is busy. You gotta try this when you are in Vegas!!!!

It was deliciously prepared with sea bass, calamari, shrimp, and mussels, all in a tasty broth which we sopped up with crusty bread! Anthony was our server, and he was polite and attentive! A five star experience... we'll be back soon...

dqxoZQN6DkMwnLC9U6-Nvw.text: Stopped for lunch at the bar. The red sangria was excellent and the oxtail was amazing. Great restaurant and staff, definitely will be back.

L4600cwdMKJFlByecpILPQ.text: Ok, I will definitely come here again for my churros. It is definitely 5 stars for the churros. With other tapas in the menu: The Black Rice - 3 stars The Rabo de Toro -3 stars, I think it's too much deconstruction that its no longer simple spanish tapas, too foofoo.  The peppers with seasalt - 4 stars per BF. He loved it but suffered after finishing it all up. So, in total it will be 3.5 stars... Unfortunately, I still can't give a 4 stars because not all that we ordered were that great.

Wct3xvpnrwOgCywjgAOO-A.text: ***PROS*** * Walked right in with no reservation * Our server was friendly and informative * Delicious wine! * Delicious tapas! We had caramelized pork belly with pepper, raw fish with root chips, asparagus w/peanut-tomato sauce, steamed mussels, rib-eye steak cooked medium/rare w/peppers and mushrooms, and cheese-stuffed dates wrapped in bacon.   ***CONS*** * None! Eat here now!

S4WvY0MDo7lciQX-RRqB_w.text: Wow. Had dinner at the bar for happy hour and so glad we did. We ordered more than usual but because of the great prices why not:)). Unfortunately we ate it all too. Totally stuffed when we left. We will be back!

aLcjAt2B9Y_lpmj_4NbeGg.text: Like a bug to a light I was attracted to this place by the other Yelp reviewers and the fact it was in eye site from the lobby when I checked into the Aria.  I am happy to report even though the wait was an hour, the food and experience was worth every minute I had to spend drinking in the casino.  I hate it when restaurants make me consume adult beverages.  I may have had a medium Vegas buzz by the time we were seated but I know the Tuna Cones will go down in history as one of my all time favorite small plates.  You must have those little cones of heaven.  The white ceviche was a solid dish that I would have again and the pintxo de chorizos should not be missed.  However those paled in comparison to the mixed paella.  We got one to share after about 8 tapas for a table of 6. It is a big dish that is great for sharing.  Lastly have the espresso cocktail at the end of the meal...WOW!  The atmosphere is nothing to talk about and open to the lobby.  I didn't like that but the service made up for it.  My only other suggestion is to get there either early or after 9:30pm.  The place is packed.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This dish is a must!

hqyZgZ__WFQolOGqwDikEg.text: Yep it's True Good service  Delicious food n sangria!  Beautiful decor , I loved the tilework in the restrooms !  Sweet bread for dessert!   Downside  Cold hard churro  I will go back. Aria never disappoints !

9gSC6DSL4JqhvOd4FrcFnA.text: Ridiculous menu. EVERYTHING we ordered was so amazing and reasonably priced. The "Beef & Cheese" could be one of the best things I've ever eaten(order it med-rare). Our bartender was Premo and he was awesome. If you can't find a drink you like, he'll gladly come up with one for you.  \Get there early on the weekends or make reservations because they fill up quick. It's a pretty dressy atmosphere so your typical jeans and a t-shirt get up probably won't cut it.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make sure you sit at the bar and ask for Premo

7z1Cej_hJNp2JZJIMfZXkQ.text: Just had dinner here and I would say only 3 stars overall   1. Patata brava - excellent  2. Mediterranean chicken skewers - Chicken was undercooked and pink  3. Payaya - too sweet  4. Spanish pizza - toooo oily and the bread seemed like you are eating a butter pastry.  5. Sangria - awesome  6. Service - almost felt like I was in a casual cantina whose server wasn't interested in understanding or taking care of the customer.   Don't know what the hype is about.   Cascal in mountain view California has much better food, ambience and service.   Expected better and was disappointed.

PntDHGYCsGNXmUiQpFZO6A.text: Extremely overrated. The paella was good but everything else was terrible and expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese plate....sucked

ldwZdwm0gjPFTa3Qq0G-oQ.text: I came here just a few weeks ago with my best friend and her family, and we were stayed at Aria. When she said we were eating at a tapas restaurant, I wasn't that excited because I had never really tried anything like it, and it didn't sound appetizing.   Boy was I wrong! Although plates weren't main course-sized, the tastes weren't anything short of spectacular. We ordered so much food I thought they would never stop bringing out plates! Ahi tuna tempura, tuna-raspberry skewer, crispy pancetta iberica, tuna cones, fried calamari, salmon with truffle, creamy risotto....we ordered it all!   Everything was so delicious and fresh with flavor. The portions turned out to be just right so you could try a little bit of everything and I admit I got two plates of the risotto! The service was impeccable, with waiters left and right, always ready to re-fill your glasses, clear your plates and bring you more dishes. It is a little pricey and I won't mention what our bill total came to, but I definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone!!

miPPSoreA6d5WY1giWd4aQ.text: I come here every time I'm in Vegas.  The bar menu, available from 11:30-5:30 is a great way to sample their tapas and enjoy $5 sangria.  My favorites are the tuna cones, black rice, and yellowtail tiradito.  Always great service.  Plenty of vegetarian options as well.

DwHow3nsk9pkd4mzQfOHog.text: Had multiple foodgasms.  Having lived in Spain for a while, I have to say I've had better Tapas here than I did back in some places in Spain.  I got the croquettes, potatoes, white anchovy tapas, stuffed dates (OMFG), and then finished it off with Churros con chocolate (OMG x2)  Words cannot express the feelings I got when I was eating all of this food.  Too bad it's pricey and 2,000 miles away from my home, because I'd come back here every weekend.

ZfQbiGSIvCURQBJC6_ZJ_A.text: Delicious tapas, but the paella needed some work.  I came here last year with some girlfriends and we had a delicious dinner of a variety of tapas. Because of my past dining experience, I made another reservation for my birthday dinner this past weekend.   As I remembered, the tapas were delicious. We had the albondigas, ahi tempura, and the yellowtail with jalapeno. All were super flavorful and tasty. We also ordered the seafood paella and added shrimp. For a $60 dish, I expect to be blown away. But, the paella was really al dente - almost crunchy. The seafood was good, but not great. About half the mussels didn't open up either, so I was sure to discard them.   I would definitely go back again for tapas, but I'm steering clear of the paellas.

r4JZ2sb_xz1r0bEzLUGraA.text: Good restaurant to visit if in the CityCenter. The New York Steak and other meat tapas were very good, albeit small. Most of the salads were very good as well, especially the Queso Fresco. The Queso Fresco is like a Caprese salad, except wrapped up. The shrimp dishes were terrible, with only 2-3 pieces of shrimp. To make it worse, they were served in a puddle of bland sauce. There was so much sauce, you had to fish the shrimp out from the pool of sauce.  The restaurant atmosphere is very modern and stylish like the Crystals. The seating area is located at the entrance to the Aria from the Crystals, and because of this, can be prone to drafts of wind coming in, although this is not a problem unless it is cold outside. In addition, the restaurant itself is relatively small and a little cramped with all the tables they try to fit in. It would have been nicer if they spread the tables out a bit. Overall, dining at the Julian Serrano was a positive experience.

2KDxYuuy80WSTo6rldLiDA.text: Thanks to Chris the gm, and will and Pedro for such an amazing experience!! Loved the food!!

5UvqJFjDIZdyP57YtnWd1g.text: I really wish I could say it were better.... But I lived in Spain and the meal was a little flavorless compared to what I'm used to.... Most disappointed in the paella.....
