3eYaPk_emho3QiCf8bW2oA.text: Delicious and quite an adventure. Definitely a go to when in Vegas.

tb25d4xcPOVH8v3obmTseQ.text: Had dinner here with the wife and it was amazing. We ordered the following: Black rice, tuna cones, brava potatoes, stuffed piquillo peppers, rabo de toro, molten chocolate cake and the churros. Everything we ordered was very good. Would definitely be back the next time we're in town

BuY06IXqMAHkMixguksjuw.text: There is no argument that the food is delicious.   For the price, however, I would prefer to head over to Firefly and pay about a third the price.    Definitely worth it if you are willing to throw your money around and are looking for a pretty atmosphere to enjoy your tapas and sangria.  I'd be happy to enjoy another fabulous dinner here...on someone else's dime, that is.

LPvkH7c2etnI7KU3A0qaew.text: Looks like they got rid of the happy hour menu and have a bar menu in place instead.

TAEOc6aWTBq6g7LnntqG_Q.text: I absolutely love this place. Top-quality.   I will come back the next time I'm in Las Vegas for sure. Family service and great food.

zx4dEf6rrStryHPO4a8QNw.text: At those prices I would expect a AAA service. But service was more like a D Class restaurant. The food is good but not spectacular. This is a restaurant that is extremely overrated. Never going back.

d8gOeNjG54C0yftWEJ5Scw.text: Could not have imagined a better experience. Had prearranged a package that included unlimited sangria with one of the managers prior to our visit.  We let them choose the food.  So glad we did.  Food was amazing.  I couldn't believe the quantity and the quality of the food that kept coming out of the kitchen, including dessert. AND, our glasses were never empty. Service was exceptional, from the manager to the bussers.   I can't wait to go back

_AX-mK8Ta2qXD6cYnkUZOQ.text: I had the pleasure of dining at Julian Serrano 2 nights in a row during my recent trip to Vegas. We didn't have reservations either time but found quick and easy seating, with friendly and attentive service, at the bar.   Night 1 we stopped in for tapas and drinks. We ordered the mixed seafood ceviche (I could have eaten a bucket full of that stuff), the tuna-raspberry skewer (beautiful, tender, melt-in-your-mouth tuna), and the seared scallops (perfectly cooked). Everything was very fresh, very flavorful, and absolutely delicious. I also enjoyed the tasty red sangria.   Night 2 we were tired of paying Vegas food prices and decided that $45 paella for 2 sounded perfect. We started with a lovely Mediterranean bass. I almost licked the remaining tomato confit off the plate. Then came our "marinera" paella and, unfortunately, it was quite underwhelming. All of the individual ingredients were certainly fresh-tasting but the dish itself was under-seasoned and bland. Very disappointing.  I highly recommend Julian Serrano for the tapas and I hope to try a different "platos grande" another time.

4XyKcNPo4Z7huWkUtawuOg.text: We forgot to make dinner reservations for the night but we're surprised to get a seat quickly at Serrano's. We sat at a high top table that bordered the bar. We enjoyed the seat since we love watching the "behind the scenes" stuff like food prep and drink making. Our Server, Jason E, was knowledgeable and helped us pick out fantastic wines based on what we liked. He also helped in making recommendations and narrowing down our food choices from the extensive menu. In all we ordered: Pan Serrano, Lobster Fideua, Goat Cheese Salad, Roasted Sweet Apple and Foie Gras, imported Spanish Serrano Ham, Queso Fresco and Santiago's Cake. The Pan Serrano was so good that I wished it was full size and subsequently ordered the Seranno Ham. The only dish that fell a bit short was the Salad. There was only one small medallion of Goat Cheese. I wished there has been more. Beside that, everything else was amazing. Our daughter said the Lobster was the best she has had. My husband gave the same rave review for the Foie Gras.  But, a restaurant is more than it's food. The atmosphere at Serrano's felt classy but not stuffy and the seats no was quite comfortable. But is was Jason E, our server, that really helped make this meal great. He was listened to our tastes and made appropriate recommendations, was knowledgeable about the wine list, and was friendly and easy to use talk to.  I recommend Serrano's to anyone looking for great Tapas!

BJEQc0BLQ4tilZTu_ch7Ag.text: Absolutely delicious! I've been here many times, tried about half of the menu items and loved every one of them. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. This place is must on all my Vegas trips.

DJjOGxje4C5DtIDShU4Kaw.text: This is a wonderful and a competent restaurant with great food and a very competent staff. The best part is that one does not get "sticker shock" when handed the bill. We had a wonderful meal at a very reasonable price.

R8ABIYFC8GDuQGQqUcUvhg.text: Tapas! Yes, the hot food trend is front and center at Julian Serrano. And he does a magnificent job weaving ceviches, charcuterie and (of course) paella throughout your table.  There is so much to choose from on the menu that there's really no sense in describing it all. Just try a little of everything and enjoy! Thoroughly! Each bite is so full of flavor your pallet will never get bored.  The decor is ultra modern but casual like almost everything in Vegas and it's right off the main Aria lobby. Service was impeccable - not hovering but also there whenever you need it. Friendly, helpful and attentive.  Don't be fooled by the relatively low cost per plate. It adds up quickly to a hefty dinner tab. But, what doesn't cost a bundle in Vegas these days? Enjoy the magical culinary adventure that is Julian Serrano Tapas and worry about your bank account tomorrow!

lg7grN204kiXPQQ5zrNpkQ.text: steamed mussels - 5 stars!  The sauce was delicious but didn't taste guilty.  tuna cones - 4 stars! 1 is not going to seem like enough.  Presentation was lovely.  stuffed dates - meh.  I wouldn't order again.  The bacon was burnt.  montado serrano - meh.  Not bad, but seems like something you can probably make at home with the right ingredients.    I had 2 of the manzanas which were dangerously delicious.  Refreshing and not headache sweet.

BoFLLOC5v0CeQOeRfxSrUA.text: This is my new favorite restaurant in Vegas. Everything is wonderful and like most Tapas places, most dishes are sharable by 2 or three. The stuffed dates are out of this world. Skip the Paella. Get more plates.

OklhBbUbcrWNOB2Br5S8Ew.text: THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE EARLY EVENING DINNER TASTING MENU -- $39/PP  APPETIZER  - lobster gazpacho | traditional chilled spanish soup with lobster meat (upon receiving this order .. I thought this was going to be a rich dense soup but it is really light and a nice chill taste. highly recommend this dish as an appetizer)  - stuffed piquillo peppers | goat cheese | mushrooms  (one of my favorite tapas menu item to order. Nice spice and the goat cheese was cooked to perfection)  ENTREE  - fish | fresh seasonal selection (fish for the day was a salmon. I usually rarely order something I can make myself at home but the fish was cooked perfectly. nice slice and seasoned well. paired with baby carrots and seasonal vegetables. I would opt for the other items available if possible but still a nice entree)  - pork chop | sous vide pork chop | baby carrots | dry fruit | px demi (entree is HUGE! might take 3 people to finish this course. the dates and prunes were a great addition to the dish. sauce was amazingly flavorful. a definite try)  DESSERT  - molten chocolate cake | baked meringue | blood orange sorbet (best dessert available. blood orange sorbet was beautifully crafted. chocolate cake was so gorgeous)  - santiago's cake | almond cake | turron ice cream | caramelized nuts  (server recommended this cake over the the other option. Can't get Turron ice cream like this anywhere.  OVERALL Julian Serrano is known for his work over at Picasso at the Bellagio. His tapas inspired restaurant at the Aria is bit more casual than his offering at the other hotel. I definitely will be returning to try his popular tapas items. Highly recommend this restaurant to all of my peers visiting in Vegas.

jJlp1bni1WXl8sX9baE3PQ.text: Great happy hour and tasty tapas! Service was great as well and extensive selection of cocktails and wine. Would definitely come back when staying at Aria.

AR34la0fqpSeP3CArSqp8A.text: The Julian Serrano Tapas Restaurant carries the name of its executive chef, Julian Serrano, who has made a name for himself in Las Vegas as the celebrated chef at Picasso's at the Bellaggio for the past decade. Prior to that, he was the head chef at the world famous Masa's, in San Francisco.  Here in the Aria at City Center, the grandiose, massive and latest project of MGM Hotel Group, it adds a nice modern Euro feel to the ultra modern and art infused City Center complex, and adds a splash of mediterranean hot colors to the understated Japanese-like hotel color motif of the Aria hotel. It's like a saucy Flamenco dance hall in the middle of the hi-rise offices of corporate giants in the Shinegawa section of Tokyo. Or like the Guggenheim's museum in Bilbao, Spain amidst the rustbelt of the surrounding aging industrial factories that once were the heart of that city.   It was later on a Thursday when we came, and it was fairly unoccupied. Sat at the bar and was professionally waited on with a lot of attention, owing to the sparse crowd. The room is large and very open; there are dozens upon dozens of bar seats, the ideal tapas location, strung along one side of the restaurant. The ambiance is a classy-festive feel and decor, but very pro in service.   The specials were told, but they were all fairly heavy and hearty, and we were in a lighter mood, it being about 9:00pm. So we opted for 4 light dishes:  -Marinated Olive Medley ($3) about 5 different offerings including pearl onion -White Ceviche ($10) This was light, with just a touch of onions and tomatoes, served with a wafer and garnished with cilantro and radicchio - Escalivada ($8) - were roasted bell peppers and mushrooms in olive oil with a baguette toast slice - Avocado Cannelloni ($10) this was a light cannelloni wrapped not in noodle, but thin avocado slices topped with chopped nuts, and sided with a dollop of guacamole topped with watercress and a side splash of aioli  With a Gin and Tonic, the bill was $43.24 before tip, and satisfaction came with the refreshing flavors with the creative and traditional dishes from Julian Serrano at Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wanugee meal

BjElhNY29AKwLC2skjT6Fw.text: Good $$$ food, but tiny tiny portions. Listen to your waiter when he says you should order at least 3-4 tapas per person. We shared: Tuna tempura: 4/5  Angus beef: 3/5 came out medium when we ordered medium rare, nothing special Brava potatoes: 4/5 creamy and spiced sauce gave it a nice kick.  Mixed paella: 3/5 seafood flavor is overwhelming! Lobster pieces are sufficient if you aren't that hungry.

-T5DXqXfFu4QXYzp4GzSrw.text: Yum! Love this place and will definitely return! Everything was delicious and service was fast.  faves: white ceviche gambas spanish sliders

c_8XvDq1bxrEfH61tsFmlw.text: Excellent paella at a reasonable price considering this is a 5-Star mega hotel on the Strip (reasonable in comparison to other 5-star restaurants where the average cost would be $75.00 per person at a minimum).    We ordered the $50 Mixed Paella ahead of time - NOTE:  it takes about 40 minutes to prepare the paella, so it's best to order ahead by either charging it to your room or going there to pay ahead, if that is possible.  Had a couple of tapas at the beginning, highly recommend the Gambas in a delicious sauce.  The tuna cones were also good and unique, but the winner was the Paella.  The paella is huge portion easily enough for 3 people, freshly cooked and still hot in a large skillet/pan, and perfect if you are a paella aficionado - in between the 'wet, Cuban style' and the 'dry Spanish style' I've experienced in the past.  This one was perfect.  Wonderful ambience at the restaurant 'open-aired' in the Main Lobby allowing you to people watch if that is what you want to do.  If you want more privacy, you can request a table more 'inside' the restaurant.  Fabulous place to experience a dish that is not readily found anywhere, let alone on the Las Vegas Strip.  The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is that I would prefer the dish to be around $30 to $35, but again, look at the place and location and I get it.

Lkgo6BgZ-4sExO9vNalNYQ.text: I've been here a few times and every time the food is amazing.  Not a cheap place to eat; but the food is soooo good. I've never tried the Sangria (and neither have my dining companions) so I can't speak to that.  We ordered Octopus, White Ceviche, Steamed Mussels, Spanish Chicken Croquettes, and 3 other plates. We shared the Churros with spicy chocolate for dessert; I really don't like chocolate but I loved their spicy chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed Mussles w/ shallots &amp; brandy
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanish Chicken Croquettes

v5tGtA3pE8vESHPyqggA4g.text: I highly recommend this to place to other tapas lovers. We had a 50 dollar dinning credit for Aria and picked the best reviewed restaurant here. We spent well over that and it was worth it!   We began our meal with a their version of sangria made with Spumante, (usually red or white wine is used) but it I was excited as it had my favorite kind of champagne. Sweet, fruity and not overly dry. It was light and refreshing but contained very little fruit perhaps due to being served in a small champagne flutes. The tuna tar tare cones were amazing! The light and airy crunchy cones they came in provided for a wonder contrast with the tuna which melted in our mouths. The dates wrapped in bacon and stuffed with goat cheese, were phenomenal as were and the breaded manchego cheese pops. Whitefish ceviche was yum but we wished there were more taro chips to go with it. Yellowtail was just eh.   We finished up the meal with simple but delicious donut holes with butterscotch sauce and a very nice port wine. It was a perfect combination and end to a superb meal. Our server Donovan provided excellent service and was very attentive yet unobtrusive. He provided wonderful descriptions of items offered and he was very helpful with recommendations when we had questions on what was best to order.

A9nNamiENbWkn-ZuT9clRg.text: Cannot come to Las Vegas, and not come to my favorite restaurant of all time.  The tapas here will leave you speechless. Las Vegas has become one of the new food meccas in the world.  This place makes that list.  The food, presentation and quality ingredients will want you coming back for more.  They recommend usually 3-4 tapas per person, well sorry - I had 14 (not including dessert)   the must haves:   the fish ceviche the pulpo the gambas al ajillo the beef tartare - was phenomenal the manchego lollipops the meatballs the dates with manchego and tomato marmalade (I would like them better without the marmalade) but that's a personal choice.  The sangria (white, red, bubbly) was some of the best ever.  For dessert - the churros! OMG  you may  have had tapas many times, but not like this... even the ones mentioned above have a special treat, presentation or spin.  you will love. I want more please.

7OFBXtMQzJl2GetssVC5xw.text: Unfortunately, this was a huge disappointment. We were fans of this restaurant and have been at this place at least 6 times throughout our   Vegas vacations.  However, after last night we will never be back. Food was good, but service was the worse we ever experienced in Vegas. Our waiter never checked on us, never introduced himself, water was rarely refilled and I had to flag someone to clean our table from appetizers....At the end our waiter had  to do something else and never told us that someone else will be taken care of us....this should never happen at the restaurant of this class... again we were hugely disappointed and sadly  will never be back....

FMkiM-fojueGlgiNlqp_yg.text: A menu full (almost overwhelmingly so) of small dishes that will give you a great taste of Spain right on the Strip.  Tapas restaurants are always frustrating to me because I can never seem to order the right amount of food and as a result always seem to leave hungry. To make matters worse, the food always seems to be pretty pricey so I'm not only hungry, but my wallet is significantly lighter to boot. This place is no different. The prices on some of the items border on exorbitant, which wouldn't be so upsetting to me given it's prime Strip location, except for the fact that I didn't leave full.  OK, enough about the prices. The tapas were very well prepared and came out in a timely manner. Definitely order the ahi tuna tempura and a couple of beef dishes. My strategy with tapas is always to mix vegetable dishes, meat dishes, and fish dishes and I always get some sort of cheese. Even with all that, my buddies and I were still hungry so we ordered paella to supplement. The paella takes 35-45 minutes to prepare so be ready to wait. I tasted both seafood and meat paella and really preferred the flavor of the meat. Something about the seafood didn't taste quite right to me, but, everybody I was with preferred the seafood so I think it was just me.  This meal is best enjoyed with a pitcher of red sangria - watch out for the fruit at the bottom, it'll knock you out.

QtlivQZo9YfHUhpgKO6Zyw.text: Went here for a late night snack a few minutes before their last call. I ordered the  oxtail and some skinny fries. The oxtail was braised, juicy and tender served on a bed of mashed potatoes and rolled in crispy fried bread, it was delicious!! The skinny fries was delicious too. This place was definitely the highlight while I was staying at Aria.

geuuOiQ6yryMxEPDRy2oOw.text: I've been here many times on my own but never with a date.  So here's the review while on a date, which made the experience even better than dining solo!  My date and I had a reservation before seeing a show.  We were seated promptly and greeted by our server Juan who was very friendly.  I asked if there were any good "must have" orders for cocktails or food and he made recommendations.  The cocktail that I ordered was spicy and had a pepper on the edge of the glass...I'm Mexican and can take the "heat" but it wasn't only "hot" but also an infusion of tastes...no, not boozy (who wants that?!) just many fruity tastes mixed with spice.  I'm not a big fan of raw fish, but Juan recommended the yellowtail.  I was feeling adventurous so I ordered and tried it and OMG it was delicious!!  Those little sweet potato shreds and horseradish sauce just took it to a level of DELICIOUS.  We also ordered the steak tartar, ahi tuna cones and stuffed piquillo peppers (stuffed with goat cheese...perfectly done!)  If we'd had more time before going to see the Eagles concert, I'm sure we would've explored and ordered more.  Highly recommended!  Enjoy!!

s8GnbKfS_0FXWClznWFb1A.text: Overall great experience. The mixed seafood ceviche was amazing! I wish the portion was a bit larger. I would definitely come back! I also tried the paella which was also delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro dessert

WIpIjCie23BoPl-MqjWpzg.text: Very good food, nice service. Ambience a bit lacking.  The portions are on the small side, but presentations are nice, and not too expensive.  The oxtail and the black pork ribs are awesome, the tomato cheese plate was awesome.  The mediterranean bass and lobster was more average.

66zxcmlokiAFinxuzdDSOw.text: Although the ambiance was nice, the food and price were very disappointing. I ordered the ham croquettes and these were more like mozzarella sticks as far as texture. They were a bit runny on the inside and for 12.00 you get 4 tiny ones. I found it expensive. Next i had the risotto, this was a bit aldente in texture. It was not as creamy as a risotto should be. My husband ordered the fish soup and it was semi ok. I know it may sound crazy, but it was too fishy. It needed a balance like maybe a bit of cream. The only thing we ordered that might have saved the food was the choripan.  This was delicious and the chorizo was very tasty. I willnot be back to thos place as i feel is expensive for what you get.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F9oeOkm-iD5-N2Ib9xhQXA.text: The tuna cones are a favorite and so were the short ribs.  We liked the asparagus dish.  The lasy time we were here not a single one in my party cared for the Japanese eggplant dish which i remember being vinegary.  This time, it was great, prepared with sundried tomatoes.  The calamari was ok but not particularly noteable.  The baby spinach dish was awesome (reative too) and plenty to share.  The apple foie gras was incredible!  The spicy chorizo was the best ive ever had and the pork oxtail dish was really tasty.

eadfqX0X5QdCaIilzEW76Q.text: We stopped in for a quick bite to eat before getting ready for our show and we were so pleasantly surprised. The tapas were delicious and perfect sharing portions. Drinks were wonderful as well. I'd definitely recommend stopping in.

fKBTveKO6nNfiryNmxKqgg.text: You can't go wrong here. But our best plate was the White Anchovy Filets, the Yellowtail and the stuffed dates.  We had a great Spanish wine as well.  Pleasant service with good suggestions.

DssLJNWvcolCiBWLNWwrlw.text: Ate here with a half dozen people.  We probably ordered 25 dishes, maybe 30.  Nearly all were hits.  I'll say, this is a large menu and there is a lot to try.  So, we were adventurous and ordered out of our comfort zone on a lot of things.  But, the baby eel omelet was just a miss.  I don't recommend it and won't get it again.  And, baby eels look....exactly like you think they do.  I like how you order several dishes, they bring them as they are prepared, and you can then order again.  I think we had 3 or maybe 4 rounds of ordering.  The sangria is very good, as many yelpers note.  If you have enough of it, the bill can get away from you at this place.  Those small prices add up friends.  Be advised.

PHb_Q_xrFy6fLH48ZLmdzA.text: Came in on 12/28/14 for dinner after being intrigued by the Aria's illuminated advertisement on the strip.  We've had tapas all over before and knew what it was all about....but I'm sorry, this place was horrible. There was no Malbec by the glass available.  The chicken croquetas..my husband found a bone in his and had to spit it out.  We should have said something.  That turned his off for the remainder of the meal.  I thought some of the flavor combinations for the ribs and steak tapas were alright, but the temperatures were disappointing as well as the amount of fat chunks included. Paella isn't our thing, but we saw a bunch of tables nearby ordering it, maybe that would have been better.  Out of all of the amazing restaurants on the strip, we like to switch it up each night, and considering we were there for only 3 nights and this disappointment occurred, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. We left paying $117 for 2 people.  I'm not sure what upset us more.  The fact that we paid that amount for miserable tapas or the fact we were still hungry after leaving!

R_iVyfhsTrsFO-kuTKRqPQ.text: I went there for my bday dinner and I CANNOT tell you how good everything was! The Pan Manchego was insane!!! Just order it, you will not be sorry. My favorite was the beet and manchego tapas plate that came on skewers and tasted out of this world! I loved the presentation and was so surprised that the cheese was melted on the inside but the breading on the outside was perfectly cooked...incredible!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FPzWK4pqZVJwrrolJqntRg.text: I really liked Julian Serrano. I'm a lover of tapas restaurants and Spanish food in general.  It's best to come here with a group of people so you can get a little taste of everything.   Some of my favorites were the tuna cones and the white anchovies on toast.  We also got a huge skillet of paella. It was filled with lobster tails, scallops, shrimp, mussels etc.  Although the paella was very good, it was a little dry.   The service was great throughout the night. Overall, I would probably go again sometime.

vPe7cELvrsm_cqJ-SFT97A.text: Amazing service! I came and sat at the bar while on a work trip to Vegas.. I've been studying for a wine exam and decided to sit at the bar and drink some Spanish wine while I studied my chapter on Spain. The bartenders especially Jason were so gracious and let need try anything I wanted to taste to aid in my education. what a memorable and fantastic experience I loved it so much. Great restaurant great wine and great service a must try while in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempranillo tasting
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PX!

D98qG-BEpNgF_6fCVAJ-sg.text: It's hard to find good, authentic Spanish food outside Spain. It's just not prevalent outside the largest cities with some sort of expat Spanish population.  For those who've traveled to Spain, "tapas-style" dining in the US is frustrating because something gets lost in translation with the taste and presentation. Not to mention that it's more expensive here.  Julian Serrano is not for the budget conscious. It is a celebrity-chef restaurant in a glitzy Vegas casino. But, the food is good, authentic, and has several options for all palates. I've been to Jaleo (Jose Andres' restaurant in DC), and this is on par.  Had the Paella Valenciana and a couple of tapas: Croquetas de pollo and pimientos de pardon. Peppers were hotter than what you'd normally get and the croquettes were delightful. Paella was on point as well: from the rice to the saffron, on down to the pan.  Good selection of Spanish wines too. Nice spot just off the lobby in the Aria for some prime people watching.

SY0BpVo9PXViAmpIgbbX0w.text: Meh...  This meal was nothing to write home about.  Presentation was great, but the food just okay at best.  The value was good, only because we ate at 5:15, so it was happy hour.  I could not possibly recommend paying full price at this place, with so many other outstanding places around...  The Aria is an outstandingly beautiful place, and the restaurant shares that beauty.  It is a great place to watch people, and the bathrooms are even better...  don't miss them!  You can sit in the restaurant and watch people checking in or walking by in-between the Crystals mall and the Aria casino floor, which provides some of the best people watching on the strip.  You can also enjoy the fantastic display of kites on the ceiling in the Aria lobby.  A great spot to grab a happy hour cocktail for sure...  But, pass on the meal.  We tried one of everything on the Happy Hour menu, and the only solid dishes were the Spicy Meatballs, and the Raspberry Tuna. All the other dishes were below average in taste.  The Serrano ham plate and Charcutere plate were also enjoyed, but the portions of these full priced dishes were small, and the meat quality mediocre.  The only good part were the toasted bread served with them.  The Calamari was extremely greasy, and did not impress.  The Tomato Bread was soggy and gross.  The Sangria was not good at all either.  Skip it.  Really.  Beyond the bathrooms, the highlight of the meal was the Carahillo after dinner drink, which is fantastic if you like an ice coffee.  Yum.  Get one.  I also recommend you pass on dessert...  we had the Flan, and Orange Creme Brulee.  The Flan was more like a fluffy, bubbly omlet, Bad.  And Brulee just okay.  The service was also poor.  Ordered peppermint schnapps and got peach.  Ordered one decaf coffee and got 4 orders of regular.  Nearly all the dishes came at the same time, so there was not room on the table. Had to do a happy dance to get the attention of the manager, and once he saw the generally unattentive server headed over, he turned around and never visited...  basically, for a high end place like this, lousy service and obviously poor training.  Really poorly managed place with mediocre food.  Good place for a happy hour drink.  Otherwise, pass.

aHPMrvHCE2qvkgqTKCO-IA.text: Loved it! It is not easy to find True Spanish food in the US, but these are by far the best tapas I have ever had outside of Spain. We tried 9 different tapas. Our favorite were the black rice, the ham croquetas, Spanish tortilla and the rabo de toro. Highly recommended for groups or even with kids!

pGEH3Ow7nauPz1NdaOKgSw.text: Because we LOVE Spanish style tapas we made point to visit this place during their happy hour today and we were very impressed. The service was good and the food delicious. Between the two of us we had:  - Fried Calamari - Pan Serrano - Potatoes Bravas - Chicken Croquettes  - Iberico Sliders - Chorizo with mashed potatoes  Since it wasn't busy the food came out REALLY fast.  Everything was piping hot and we were done within an hour.   I had a martini and a couple of glasses of Red Sangria and the bill was still only $75. We would definitely come back again even if we didn't hit the happy hour prices.

gi53o48e_-CYXgwIv1KAZw.text: My husband loves tapas so we were excited to find this place. Their new bar menu allows you to try many of their tapas for a great price. The sangria is good but my house wine was amazing. Already looking for where I can get a bottle. Jeffrey, our bartender/server was AWESOME! He liked that my husband and I were foodies and engaged us in conversation which made us enjoy our meal even more. Highly recommend coming on a Saturday mid day - not busy and you get great food and attention. For food - the yellowtail "tiradito", atun de Coons, and dates were our favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mhtf9E7pBYTubeYSZTAAuQ.text: Great experience here.  I was a little expensive for my budget, but I knew that going into it.  I struggled between 4-stars and 5-stars just because of the cost, but since there were no surprises on the cost I decided on a 5-star rating.  The hostess was not that friendly, but the waiter was fantastic.  We ordered the bacon wrapped dates, and the paella mixto, sangria, and a cocktail and another tapa that I can not recall.  Everything was excellent tasting and the whole experience was great.  Too bad that we were too stuffed to try the churros con chocolate.  They looked great. Total bill was $105 for the two of us.

mMiI24oBVhiIo-DX_Lpyfg.text: Great food and service. Would recommend to anyone looking for some delicious tapas. Great drinks and wine selection as well.

dhg2RltYHWpXMl4NsRdQIg.text: We love tapa bars. It is a bit on the pricey side. $182 for 2. Here is what we ordered  Mushroom soup: amazing. It is like French onion soup w mushrooms  Kale salad: disgusting. The stripe beets were nasty. Bland, no sweetness. Tasted more like radish.   Stuff dates: amazing. Perfect blend of sweet, savory, and creamy  Sweet tomato marmalade: amazing. The tomato cake was perfect.   Small pork chop: amazing. Loved the potato w the chop  Short rib: average. The sauce is amazing but the rib was not tender today. Overcooked  Chicken skewer: amazing w the beet hummus and apricot.   Yellowtail tiratito: amazing. Good sushi w crispy sweet potato.   Albondigas meatball: amazing. It's homemade meatball. Of course delish

Wtniu6LpDl1bgaqFRMLJiA.text: I was really looking forward to dine at JS, unfortunately my dining experience didn't match my expectations. Service seemed generic, not attentive. I had done my research about the place so I had an idea what to expect, we didn't get any suggestions from waiter,not even an explanation of the menu. Our waiter switch mid service with no explanation too. I ordered the white sangria( sparkling), the flavors didn't wow me,perhaps it wouldn't been better to order the red, this one tastes watered down. We also ordered empanada mayorquina , this was the flavorful , but the top was burnt , so the pine nuts on top were pretty much black, the waiter most have seen my face because he came back and asked if everything was ok, when I told him about the burnt crust and burnt Pine nuts he said he would tell the chef but no offer to replace or even take it  off our check was made. I wouldn't serve something burnt to my family or friends so to get a dish like that in a high rated restaurant is quite a disappointment. The shrimp ceviche was really good, my favorite dish of everything we ordered, very fresh flavors with just the right amount of heat. The paella took the promised 45 minutes and although it was tasty and not mushy I didn't get much of a saffron taste in it and there's no socarrat( lightly toasted rice in the bottom ), good but not the best I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt empanada, The Black on top are pine nuts, not golden brown but burnt!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed paella
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x47xKf8P7Gt6BGwU7bIAWg.text: Came for Restaurant Week with my sister from another mister (and mama too),  Angela H.   We did the lunch menu for $30.12   Lobster Gazpacho; Traditional Chilled Spanish Soup with Lobster Meat- There was a sphere in my spoon and it was a cream "truffle" with some broth in it. The texture of it bursting with broth was texturally exciting. The soup itself was very refreshing and bright, good and very fresh chunks of lobster.  Salmon with Truffle; Truffle Bechamel, Portobello Mushroom - the salmon was perfectly cooked, the bechamel was aces. Salmon is a very common fish so normally I'm a bit "meh" about most preparations but this was pleasant.   Santiago's Cake; Almond Cake, Turron Ice Cream, Candied almonds - I am a almond freak and this was a decent cake. I wish there was more of the burnt leche tasting turron ice cream. The crumb candied almonds mixed in with it was good.   I of course try everything Angie is eating and all pretty good. Stuffed Piquillo had a surprising hearty flavor from the mushrooms, steak with eggplant and mushroom demi glace was tender, churros was ok, but its rich bitter dark chocolate dip was great.   Service was good. I think our server was coming up a lot because he is trying to get his flirt on. Haha.   Good impressions of Julian Serrano. I looked at the regular menu and lots of goodies and really, the prices aren't too crazy, competitive with other tapas places, even off strip. I would consider coming here for some tasty snacks whenever family stays at CityCenter.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Gazpacho

uKr-LzlVrVCuc0qPbzl5IA.text: Excellent food with a decent wine selection. Black rice and empanadillos are good. Ox tail in reduced wine sauce is spectacular. Service is great.   This is a good place for a low key dinner between bouts of buffets and fine dining.

4cR0vYCchM5KirTkgK3vOw.text: I'm surprised how many 5 star reviews this place got. There were things I liked but overall, this place lacked consistency.  This restaurant is in the Aria hotel and has a half glass perimeter so you don't feel like you're going to a restaurant like other places where there is an entrance and a full restaurant. This didn't help the acoustics either, super loud in here! I thought the servers were attentive and helpful but found it a but strange they wore name tags. Didn't feel that's a high class touch but at least it made me remember our servers name.  We had two different type of croquettes and they were light and crispy and fluffy on the inside. The salad mixta was dissapointing like salad out of a bag, but with no real flavor. The osso bucco had a good depth of flavor. We also had the seafood paella. I thought it was tasty but others at the table found the rice undercooked and crunchy. The sangria was excellent and when I asked for a glass of red wine, the server recommended an excellent choice.   For dessert, there was a salted caramel cake and a delicious chocolate lava cake. If I were to go back, I'd go for the sangria and the desserts. I

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken croquettes! Yummy but the filling was a bit to whipped.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious sangria! Get a pitcher.

6fu9VTTLF0k588ME_5ymsA.text: The black rice w calamari, lobster, saffron, and squid ink was amazing. Might be the best thing I ate while in Vegas. Would come back just for that. Seriously, just get it.   Of note, I'm not sure why but the bar menu has some of the same items as the regular menu but the prices are a little cheaper at the bar. Maybe the size of the plate is smaller?

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EutKtVfxNWP1dtr8RM9P4A.text: I happened to find this restaurant on yelp and it was a success!!  We were deciding on where to eat for dinner that had good food and wine but didn't want to leave too full.  The tapas and paellas are amazing and we would go back here again.  The Apple foie gras, potatoes and bacon wrapped dates are the only three dishes we would not order again.  Sadly these were disappointing.  Overpriced and just not good.   However, The German Riesling paired with the rest of our meal was fabulous!  It was around $100 per person not including tip and tax.  The suckling pig was cooked to perfection and it is strongly recommended!  Service was just OK and nothing special.  Our servers professionalism was equivalent to how we would be served at Denny's.  Don't expect any high class service.  Located near the lobby of Aria Hotel, the parking is $10.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gwHXFavWVpl-Dkn_OzXCIw.text: Had an awesome time at this exquisite place. Our server Yoshi and Miguel were amazing and I cannot thank them enough for all the great food that they recommended for us. It there was a 10 star I will give that to them and to the chef Rafael. We had our friend's birthday and they even surprised us with a small I will say cake or dessert. At all all the service was excellent I will definitely came back again when I'm in Vegas with my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella was great!!

jS4JGVqNV2Hx5QEFVWca7g.text: My kids love this place and had to revisit. Tapas menu is fun and paella is a must try.  Wish I ordered a larger portion of paella.  We each had two spoonful.  Paella is served in a very thin layer.  Excellent dish.   Wine list is exceptional.  I believe there were 5 different vintages for screaming eagle on the list.   Only in Vegas. (I didn't get to order one.  Probably never will on my dime).  This is a fun restaurant which feels very airy and even somewhat casual.

v_BeCUPt6CpvjTfrTcTLKg.text: We were in Vegas for 2 nights and made a point of eating here and we were not disappointed.  Jason was our waiter and he gave us THE BEST SERVICE we have ever had in any restaurant we have dined at in Las Vegas!!!!!  We were so impressed by his service, that we asked to see a manager on our way out so we could tell him how awesome Jason is. We were not surprised to learn that he was employee of the year last year.  My husband and I shared a salad, risotto, padron peppers and olives - all were delicious.

BpdjTyffksNcnd45_mkc3w.text: A fantastic place for small plates!! Everything was fantastic!! Loved the sausages, foie gras , chorizo, rib eye, dates and DESSERT!!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8kGquPiQig5eycjWrgsHpw.text: Horrible service.  We sat at the table for 15 minutes with no water, no waiter, no wine list from 6:15-6:30. Someone, I believe his name was Juan, finally came by  at 6:31 and asked us if we needed anything and I said "we've been sitting here for 15 minutes with no water, no server, and no wine list." The guy directly said "I don't think you've been sitting here for 15 minutes"   Well, if you'd noticed us maybe you you would've realized we've been here for 15 minutes! An apology and asking us what we would need would be great.   The ambience is also in the middle of the hotel lobby, where you're subjected to continual passerby's looking at you eat like you're an animal in the zoo up for feeding time.   Avoid at all costs. So many more better restaurants around Las Vegas.

kKrESG3ngZzXge6BKPHbPw.text: Not a good choice for vegans. We went after reading favorable reviews on here of their vegan options and menu.  There were really only two vegan dishes on their 'vegan' menu.    The waiter said they could do one of the salads as vegan as well.  It came out with cheese, lol. Server did not seem to understand vegan dietary restrictions and it was difficult to make modifications to dishes.  Mushroom dishes (soup & risotto) could not be made dairy free.   Moreover, it was difficult to make a filling vegan meal out of the available options.    The olives appetizer was marinated in vinegar.  Not a good representation of the delicious olives served in Spain.  Girlfriend didn't care for the asparagus & felt it was not well made.  We were split on the peppers.  One of us like them, the other did not.  Tomato bread was good.  Papas Bravas are fried in same oil as seafood.  Vegans should look to other establishments until the menu options expand.  Gordon Ramsey Burger actually had better options/food and was more accommodating.

M5_UaQeCkCaMvRggdkJUFA.text: Very disappointed in our visit here. We've come before and had a great meal and service so we brought some friends a few nights ago and we were so embarrassed that this is the place we took them.  Our server was TERRIBLE. He took forever to even come to our table. When he did, he just stared at us. I had to ask him after waiting forever for him if he was our server. He said yes and continued to stand there. He didn't explain for menu or features or suggest cocktails. After we ordered other people ran our food to us, but he never checked in us. There were other people pre-bussing tables and bringing us water at least. Since he never came back we could not order more cocktails or tell him that one of our plates never came out. Finally we had someone else bring him to us to let him know we were missing a plate. He left. No explanation. We basically waited for him to put it in and then they brought it but by this time we were ready to go.  We complained to the Manager who offered us some free dessert but we passed. He did comp the only 2 cocktails we could order.  As for the food, my previous experience was better.  Half of the items were delicious. Cheviche was delicious. Skip meatballs, octopus, and black rice...  We won't likely go back. For that much money, we expect better.

tqbGr5lsXWzGcojRRullyA.text: El jamon serrano and melon, who knew the pairing of savory and sweet just the right combination. The melon is cut and prepared so delicately,  it's practically see through.  Yet it's still honeydew green and sweet. So perfect.   I keep coming back to Jaleo the menu changes with the season,  so it never gets old.  Try the octopus,  the scallops,  and the Salmon.  Hey I love seafood when I'm not eating Jamon Serrano.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamón serrano y melon

1cCCHfR5Uk75G-O7jTTddA.text: I stayed at aria this time so decided to explore the restaurants around. There was a Thai restaurant right downstairs from my room, but my friend wanted something different, and we ended up here. I think the restaurant is just like all restaurants in Vegas hotel, service and food are good. However, when I say good, I mean there is nothing to pick on unless you are one of those super picky annoying and harsh person. The food is ok in my opinion. I have had better tapas restaurants before. The food definitely didn't worth the price. but we are dining at a hotel, so it wasn't surprising. I ordered a seafood paella, it was pretty decent. The tender beef was good as well. I will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SC9hS1y1RawtbAFR8958DQ.text: If you want to pay $80 for a small snack this is definitely the place for you (I understand the Tapas concept btw). The ceviche is some fusion bullshit. Fail.

RNPzKCsAwBU6YFY2g_9ALA.text: Another awesome experience at Tapas after an awful experience at China Poblano. Yoshi is the best!

icvWSB-Z3lJJdHg3OKVPiA.text: Update: So I went back and gave it another chance. The service from Pedro was top notch (one of the best servers I've ever had, and that's saying a lot). He has been there since they opened so I put my order in his hands.   He started me with the Pan tamate and it was a perfect combo of bread and topping with butter. Then he brought the cheese plate that was good. The chicken croquettes with aioli were phenomenal (I've had these almost every time). Then was the Carne asata with Demi glazed mashed potato and the Peppers provided a perfect contrast. I liked them so much he brought the Piquillo peppers with goat cheese and mushroom that were great as well. He finished me with the bread pudding that was spectacular.   Awesome service Pedro and well worth giving this another chance!!  Old review: I've been here multiple times and realized I never wrote a review. Tonight we had the Spanish chicken croquetas (we order every time we come - they are awesome), stuffed peppers, tuna cones, pintxo chistorra (another favorite, with a bite of kick to it), rabo del toro, padron peppers, yellowtail taradito (a little spicy with jalapeno).   We had a kid named Who it was his first night and he literally knew nothing about the menu and forgot to put a few tapas plates in, but thankfully another server did. I think the training should be improved though.   Everything was good until our last item took over 25 minutes so I cancelled it. I was pretty disappointed that the manager or server did nothing about it except say sorry.

7QzMirIeKNxvOYCO-DlmqQ.text: Very very nice stuff from the entrance we feel extremely welcomed, very relaxed environment Decor is funky lux and modern Try the mushroom soup Also surprisingly a lot of families come with kids so just come enjoy this great restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y0sceDyxgD8j-ABo3xQXgQ.text: I have dined here several times and have always loved the food and service. Last nights dinner was delicious, but one star knocked off for bad service.   We waited 11 minutes (I counted lol) for Pedro to greet our table and hand us drink menus. Throughout the night, he seemed very frantic and I would see him clearing tables while dropping food on the floor. He also spilled some of our sangria on the floor in his hurried state. I also dislike when servers hand you the check during dessert and he did just that once our dessert arrived. We felt rushed.   Food was delicious as always! The Spanish chicken croquetas were amazing with the garlic aioli. The shrimp ceviche is a must every time I dine as well as their stuffed dates with tomato sauce which is melt in your mouth good. The New York steak with mushrooms and potato puree along with the chorizo dish with potato puree were my absolute favorites. So flavorful. We got a few other things such as the meatballs and another chorizo dish and they were all fantastic. The churro dessert came with a somewhat spicy chocolate dipping sauce and it was sooo good! Also, their torrija dessert which was some kind of bread pudding with ice cream was really good as well.   I will definitely come back as I've always loved this restaurant. Hopefully the bad service was just a one time thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Torrija and churros
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York steak with mushrooms and potato purée
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AA4dsbpuY8Jkyjo3y3jYeA.text: Eh. Too pricey- food not great. All the servers look pretty miserable. Wouldn't go again

as4x7odVZiVygvH9l2Qk1g.text: Ate here with my husband on February 3.  We ordered the Iberico ham ($39), the pepito de ternera (steak sandwich in pretzel bread - $18), gambas (shrimp in a spicy tomato sauce) - $12), and the cochinillo (roast pig portion - $60).  Service was fine, but the restaurant is VERY loud, making it difficult to have a conversation with the person sitting across from you at the table.    As for the food:  the Iberico ham was good, but not amazing.  It tasted best when eaten with the bread and tomato sauce together.  The pepito de ternera and gambas were both amazing.  The cochinillo - this was a disappointment.  We had come here specifically for this.  I have no idea what portion of the pig we got, but it had numerous tiny bones in it that we had to cut around, almost like a rack of ribs, except there was no meat.  We got maybe 10 bites of good meat out of it after having to cut around these bones.  Not worth $60, and we are not people who have a problem dropping good amounts of money on food.  Would we return?  Not sure - there are so many other good places to eat in Vegas that I'm not sure this place warrants a return trip, sadly.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamon iberico.  Good but not sure if it&#39;s $39 good.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cochinillo.  Very disappointing.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gambas - shrimp in spicy tomato sauce.  Too spicy for me but husband loved it

7PqnDl8POVE_R1_Lf6QUDg.text: The experience was so forgettable that I want to write a review to remind myself I have eaten here but at the same time don't know what to write.  In brief, their mixed paella and sauteed gambas were 2 best dishes of the night. Both were pleasantly tasty. Foie gras was decent, and the eggplant was a disaster. Sparkling sangria was refreshing and delicious.  Oh talking about sangria, we had 3 people. One of us doesn't drink but the waiter kept pushing for us to get a pitcher instead of just 2 glasses. She finally said fine I'll drink a little and we got a pitcher. Guess what? Half the pitcher was wasted. The waiter needs to know the difference between recommending and pressuring.  3 stars because the waiter makes his effort to be nice and accommodating. Great ambience and so-so food.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That mashed potato looks like... well you know what I mean.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed paella. Pretty good!

tDLWnFVbSRV8BtZcunOwVA.text: While staying at the Aria Sky Suites, we wanted something that would allow us to try a variety of dishes without having a blow out in our waistbands!  Since we didn't have reservations, we opted to sit at the bar, which is honestly my favorite place to sit anyway when dining.  I started with a delightful glass of Cabernet.  The Mr wanted to get the "Beef & Cheese", which is tenderloin & mushroom.  This was so good that we ordered a second one!    I also ordered the shrimp ceviche, which was a generous portion (that I ate all by myself .. doh), loaded with shrimp and avocados.  Yummy!  We were definitely pleased with the food and the experience overall!

LUl9RsZn5bhDjCKbJAzaFg.text: It's really 3.5 stars for me.  Compared to another higher end restaurant in aria that we ate at the night before, this one leaves something to be desired.   The ambiance is noisy and busy and it's hard to hold a conversation with your companion.   The tapas are okay. We had lots of tapas in Spain and loved them. Here the tsoas are okay but none that we tried were really great for us. Maybe it's our selection.  Service was good and friendly.  Not bad by any means but in terms of experience for the money I expected more.  Overall, for the price I'd look for something else next time.

I59JHIE2nBGrdD1ZZ2NncA.text: Update: I keep thinking about this dining experience even after 4 months and many restaurants later. This should indicate how good it was. Our superb Canadian waiter was highly knowledgeable of their wines (some *actually* unique ones that you won't find easily anywhere) and I still remember his excellent timing and frequency of these chats. I have to say, this was one of my very best dining experiences, ever.

_p4B1eB0-mg7DgRwh7MZ-A.text: The pitcher sangria was good. The food was bad. We ordered 4 dishes. All were fake food. Chef boyardee if you will. We we were just in Barcelona and had great food. This place was a huge disappointment. We should have known it was bad when when we asked about reservations and the hostess looked surprised. The place was empty on a Saturday night!!! New chef needed!!!

EtvBFUxejBNjJQyPqKwL0g.text: Stopped here for some tapas before a concert. We ordered stuffed dates, peppers, ribs, and a flat bread. The tapas were extra small and very expensive. The peppers were expensive but delicious. The ribs had too little meat and too much fat. The flat bread was good. The dates were ok. The service was subpar. It took forever to get someone to take our order and water glass was definitely empty. For such a high priced place, you would think the service would be better. With all of the other restaurants, I would try something else.

2AKm4tz-97IdxsA5hnPZJg.text: Ever since the first time I stayed at Aria, I'd always been curious about the nicer restaurants they had to offer. Maybe it was my being skeptical, but, as tasty as their food seemed to be, I could never tell if spots like Julian Serrano were actually good or if it all was just based on looks. All of those reviews certainly suggested the former, but we decided to check them out for ourselves for our trip's "nice" dinner. Of course, it didn't hurt that they happened to have immediate reservations on Opentable...ha! Looking around, the restaurant has a slick, modern decor that fits Aria well. It's also easy to forget that the restaurant is right off the casino floor, despite how open and airy it is. More importantly, you don't get the smell of cigarette smoke either, so points for that. As for the menu, it offers a wide range of options - paella, ceviches, seafood, large meat plates, and a number of traditional tapas dishes and house specialties. However, as you can imagine, prices aren't exactly cheap... -- OCTOPUS A LA GALLEGA with Potatoes and Spanish Paprika...$17 (yelp.com/biz_photos/juli...) By far, my favorite dish of the night! While I've had better versions of this in the past, this was great! The octopus was perfectly cooked, the potatoes were tender, and the sauce had a wonderful mix of flavors to it. -- GAMBAS - Sauteed Shrimp, Garlic, Spicy Tomato Sauce, Arbol Chilis...$18 (yelp.com/biz_photos/juli...) Decent, but not exactly amazing. Mostly, I just didn't care much for the sauce (not a fan of tomato sauces, though the spices were nice). That said, I did like how the shrimp were fresh, plump, and sweet. -- SPANISH CHICKEN CROQUETTAS - Chicken, Bechamel, Aioli...$15 (yelp.com/biz_photos/juli...) Very, very...okay. The croquettas were moist and not super greasy, but they didn't have a ton of flavor on their own. Although not exactly bland, it could've used a bit more seasoning. Thank goodness for the aioli. -- MIXTA PAELLA - Lobster, Mussels, Shrimp, Chicken, Spanish Pork Chorizo, Vegetables, Saffron...$60 (yelp.com/biz_photos/juli...) This looked fantastic (and loaded!) on the pan, but the taste of it couldn't match up. While the seafood and sausage were great, the chicken was dry, the rice was uneven (some undercooked bits), and it was heavy on the saffron. -- COCHINILLO - AAA Pig Farm Portioned Crispy Roasted Suckling Pig with Seasonal Vegetables...$53 (yelp.com/biz_photos/juli...) LOVED the crispy skin and how juicy the pork was. However, as tasty as those parts were, the portions without skin and/or seasoning on it tasted, for better worse, like just pork. Not a bad thing, but I expected more. -- CHURROS - Fried Spanish Pastries with Spicy Hot Chocolate...$8 (yelp.com/biz_photos/juli...) Great, in terms of flavor - the churros were sweet, but not overly so, and I LOVED the hot chocolate and its bit of spice. As for the texture, this was rather dry; rather than "tear" pieces of, they broke off as if it were brittle. -- PAN DE CALATRAVA - Spanish Bread Pudding with Cinnamon and Orange...$8 (yelp.com/biz_photos/juli...) A couple of my friends preferred the churros, but I actually liked this one better. The bread pudding wasn't super dense and it sopped up the caramel quite nicely. What's more, I loved the hit of orange in every bite! As with our food, service was similarly uneven. While our server more than got the job done, she also had a very dour demeanor. By no means unfriendly, but not exactly welcoming either. I guess we just expected more of both the food and service, given their prices (though our desserts were fair). Nothing failed, but we just weren't overwhelmed. I'm still glad to have tried Julian Serrano though; I'll just have to keep my expectations more modest if/when I try another one of Aria's restaurants, like Sage!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan de Calatrava - Spanish Bread Pudding with Cinnamon and Orange
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros with Spicy Hot Chocolate Sauce
