Cz0wLnyWRs5GN2QBH2fc_w.text: Aloha, Las Vegas baby!  Awesome food choices in LV!  Julian Serrano Tapas is a Spanish themed restaurant with great share plates.  Good price, around $100- PP with drinks, decent.  We had a very large group of 25, & food came out nice & hot, I like it when restaurants can accommodate any size crowd & be proficient at it, nice.  Fun, fun night!  A great restaurant for your needs.  Mahalo

H6CMxeNdZuE-YVd35Tws1Q.text: Loved this place. Didn't look crowded from the outside but there were actually a ton of people in the restaurant.   Similar to Jaleo in the COSMO, this swanky hotel needed a tapas place. Food came out fast! I'd pick this over its next door neighbor. Papas braces were awesome! Really enjoyed Spanish omelette as well.

dEt_o9k3ewGbjZgskwbpmQ.text: We came in with a big group and our experience was outstanding! Pedro was our Waiter and we left the ordering in his hands. Which was a great idea!!! One of the couples said the food was identical to Barcelona!! We will definitely be back and will most definitely ask for Pedro to be our server!! Great job!!

M3uBWpe19J7REqUBmM588w.text: Cool place with very delicious food but plates are very small since I guess it's tapas style. I got the mushroom soup for about $12 and was actually the best mushroom soup I've ever had. I got the asparagus but it felt like baby asparagus because they were so skinny .. lol.. I actually couldn't really eat it with the fork since they were so skinny so I kind of just used my hands. Service was good.

uog05e5c0d4iDs3GzgUq5A.text: I came to Julian Serrano Tapas with colleagues for dinner a few weeks back. Our group was large, about 16 people, but we were able to make a reservation for one of the long, large group tables.  We started by ordering drinks, which as a group I'm sure is quite a few to make at one time, but still took at least 10 minutes to get back to us.   Our service experience started out with the server being a little concerned about our size and the way in which we would order. Asking for one single order for the table. This was a little confusing as the location has quite a few large tables and seemingly must deal with large groups quite frequently. As a result of this concern, one of my colleagues went to each guest to take their order and then we submitted a written piece of paper with our order at one time. When food was delivered to the table, some servers sat at one end of the table with the assumption we would pass down, while others tried to track down who requested. At one point, we did have to order more food. It just wasn't a great experience.   I'd recommend that patrons group up and put in separate plates orders or the whole table gets multiple of each.  The food I did try was pretty good - the tuna carpaccio, tuna cones, brava potatoes and asparagus. That said, we were in the restaurant for almost three hours during which time we only we're served two drinks and the small plates.

VxxsTtNv2sh378uj3J2kWw.text: Surprisingly delicious! The menu had so many options and each tapa was very different. We loved this place!  Highly recommend the Ox tail...crispy outside, warm tender meat on the inside.

0E2WYHkyDBJTLfMi4A2FBw.text: We were excited to try tapas in Vegas. The food was decent, but there is an INSANE bread charge. We paid $30 for the table ($5 per person). We received one TINY roll each!!! I'm guess the charge was for the olive oil that was "200 years old" (which tasted no better than Bertolli).  When we asked for more bread to sop up the sauces from our tapas they said NO! We didn't want any more oil, just bread. It was RIDICULOUS!!! We would have ordered more tapas had we known.

ghqqGzSRVblcsguGJSiE0w.text: DISSAPOINTED :(  Over cooked, burnt, dry Paella. A shameful  waste of perfectly good material.  Dry cubes of chicken, Overcooked dry shrimps and calamari, dry Lobster tail, even the fatty sausages were dried out .  The rice was also a dry mush. Could not taste any Saffron at all. I think they left the Safron out.  Picture of the burnt Paella attached and incorporated herein. Please take notice of the black charred ring around the edges of the pan evidencing the burnt over cooked dish.  Just a poor execution on Jullian Serranos famous Paella.  Perhaps in a well managed restaurant they would not serve a defective dish. Perhaps the sous Chef would make another dish  if the one in the oven was burnt. Perhaps the server would not serve a burnt dish.  Then I looked over to the table next to my table who also had ordered a Paella, and noticed their Paella was burnt too. Jonathan B. stood 20 feet from my table for most of my meal.  No one asked me if I liked my meal.  If it was not for the 50 minutes it took to prepare the Paella I would have sent it back. It just was not worth waiting a 2nd 50 minutes for them to remake the lousy dish.  When it's bad, sometimes just pay, and politely brush it off. Just will not go back to Jullian Serrano

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OVER COOKED, burnt, dry PAELLA mush. Take noticed of the Charred edges arround the pan...

65AnrKPXsBgdoXSqsEJu5A.text: I went here at 7pm on a Thursday night (of Memorial Day weekend) and was pleasantly surprised that we were able to get in right away! The interior is beautifully decorated and they had TVs so we could watch NBA Conference Championship.   We started our meal with the tuna cones, crab black rice, and octopus a la gallega. The tuna cones were amazing - crunchy wonton cone filled with tuna and guacamole. The crab black rice was creamy and flavorful. I would recommend these two dishes! You will not regret getting these. I thought the octopus a la gallega was pretty boring - the beautiful orange/yellow sauce had no flavor and the potatoes were really bland. I'd skip this dish.   Then we ordered the mixed paella. This dish took over an hour to make so I wish we had ordered it at the beginning of our meal. I think our server should have just said at the beginning on the meal that if we wanted paella he'd put our order in right away so there wasn't such a long wait between our courses. Nevertheless, the wait was well worth it! The paella was amazing - so good that I found myself scraping every bit of rice off the bottom of the pan! I especially loved the lobster and the chorizo. I was not impressed by the mussels - they were smaller than any mussel I've ever seen! I'd still recommend this dish because the flavors were awesome!  Go to this restaurant & you will not regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful interior
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus a la gallega - I would skip this, the sauce and potatoes had no flavor!

cylYZVqtu8FfPF7KP4IAjw.text: The service was great. Our waiter was very nice & friendly, he gave us some of his favorite options & we liked it.  The portions are tiny I'm not going to lie but they were delicious.

5Tqw8aS4jBI-NSxNx3ljkw.text: Let's get this out of the way: Mostly hype. Which honestly is quite disappointing given the location and chef behind the endeavor.  AVOID Vegetable Paella: I was trying to be charitable and give a 6, but my dining companion, who'd spent over a year in Spain, jumped in and flatly called "4". He then went on to mansplain the art of Paella and why it is so difficult to get right, just before sliding in that this version was more like a decent (brand-not-to-be-mentioned) boxed rice dish. But whatever, this is supposed to be a signature dish at a top-flight establishment at a top-flight resort in Vegas. Disappointed.  FINE Patatas Bravas: I found them a little dry and lacking any real "Bravas", dining companion liked them more. (Restaurant Rec) Stuffed Piquillo Peppers: Love all the ingredients separately, but they didn't go together particularly well in this case. The peppers seemed too limp to be paired with a soft cheese, but the taste was decent. (Restaurant Rec)  GOOD Mushroom Risotto: Much better rice dish than the Paella, great consistency and a ton of flavor. Asparagus: Classic grilled flavor and perfect preparation. (Restaurant Rec) Pan Manchego: So simple, so good.   SERVICE Server looked flummoxed by the notion of asking him (and by extension the chef) for recs on best vegetarian tapas. At a top-flight place like this, the recs should flow with ease (see my Casa Mono NYC review for what happens when recs go right). I think he became a little concerned when it was clear we were just trying to get the check and bounce, becoming more and more attentive and accommodating in tone. Not your fault, my man! We did need to rush off but were also pretty disappointed in the Paella. Solid service, no complaints.   VERDICT  Trendy joint and all those trappings - not an empty seat. Maybe the meat things are better, but average at best, overall, on the veg offerings. Can't screw up your Paella. Too many excellent dining options in Aria (let alone Vegas) for me to return to JS.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patatas Bravas + Stuffed Piquillo Peppers (ok)
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable Paella (not good)

vddmdL9rjKUD1h4NweUn1g.text: A Spanish restaurant at Aria, located right at their lobby.  Had lunch here and fell in love with their seafood paella.  With 4 girls, we ordered few dishes to share plus a 2 persons portion paella.  The paella had lots of seafoods, including lobster, crab, shrimp and mussels.  The rice was cook perfectly with enough meaty bites as well.  Their braised oxtail in red wine served with mashed potato is another dish I enjoyed much.  It was simmered to the perfect tenderness and very delicious.  I love everything I ordered and happy that I decided to give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood paella
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed calamari

6uEuFcj9sk1AEJQ_nMjK9Q.text: Chef Julian,  I really wanted to like your restuarant. It is a beautiful setting with a lovely decor, but the food didn't give me that "wow" moment.... Yes, I tried the paella, the squid ink paella in particular, which is one of the signature dishes according to our waiter.  I would have given this restaurant a 4 star review if the service was actually attentive. One of the managers of the restaurant seemed to be stressing out the waiters and waitresses alot, which perhaps had direct impact on the quality of the staffs' job performance.   If I ever go back to this restuarant, (keyword IF), it would be just to get drinks and appetizers and that would be it.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The paella was just ok....... The appetizers were better..

4DXjXiIavWQqVcaq3wdQKQ.text: Met my cousins who arrived into town late for the last stop of our Aria food crawl. The Pineapple Smash cocktail is super refreshing and delightful, if you are a pineapple fan. We were pretty full from our other stops so we only tried the pan con tomate and the paella Valenciana. Pan con tomate is one of my favorite Spanish tapas, and this one does not disappoint...fresh tomatoes rubbed on crispy garlic-scented bread with a drizzle of Spanish olive oil. The paella...I had problems with it. The chicken was hideously overcooked and there was little to no soccarat in the pan. But the cousins were hungry and they didn't mind. Also ordered the tuna cones (which they loved) and the asparagus a la plancha (gotta have something fresh and green). I've been to both Julian Serrano and Jaleo and I think I'm more of a Jaleo fan...also you lose me when I don't get soccarat. We walked in at 10PM and the kitchen closes at 10:30PM, so that may have had something to do with it.

rm9SCMEGQ8IkTmu0rf0rjQ.text: Julian serrano is a great spot at the heart of the strip. After eating here mutiple times I can say I love this restaurant. The food is innovative and beautiful. I love the mix of modern and rustic Spanish cuisine. The huevos Estrellados is amazing and simple as can be. The piquillo peppers are great. The octopus is phenomenal. My only complaint is that some of my favorite items have left the menu and that it has become quite expensive while seeming simpler. Overall if you're in las vegas and eating on the strip julian serrano is a great option.

fIjH1ZKfL93VSbKX7yQciw.text: Highly anticipated (by me), rather disappointed in execution.  I need to stop falling for the chicken croquettes! They are NOT the same as what you get in Spain.  Bland and not cheezy.  They were identical to the ones I had at Bazaar in LA.  The best dish was their risotto with mushrooms and manchego.  The calamari dish (small whole squid) was juicy and tender.  The deconstructed seafood stew, lobster skewers with pinapple and the coco chorizo were all severely disappointing - really unmemorable, boring items.

QMI1xo4pUBjEtmuENm7XfA.text: Good for a small bite but also for a normal dinner. Good option to try different flavors as the plates are small... Good for sharing also... Nice Spanish wine

Kntdggbonq90gH7sYXsCgg.text: Had the opportunity to dine this evening solo at bar.  The staff was inviting and made me feel quite comfortable.  Savored the Creamy Risotto with wild mushrooms as aged Manchego.  Perfectly cooked (and I can't say that for a lot of the Risotto I have had while dining out).  This is a Tapas style restaurant so plates are small and delightful.

_EVmlLqxYSyfQO7F5_fuNA.text: Came here for an early dinner for six of us and was able to catch the end of happy hour. We ended up just ordering 2 of every tapa on the happy hour menu so that each person got to try one of each. Didn't even really bother to look at the menu as I think all of us were too lazy to pick out what we didn't want :P We also got a paella along with 4 pitchers of sangria (part of the happy hour menu) which may have been overly ambitious :D 2 pitchers of red and 2 pitchers of white. We were struggling to finish all the alcohol. For the most part, everything was excellent, I just wasn't too big of a fan of the stuffed date (not too into sweets in general). I don't remember all the food we got but some of the items included: potatoes bravas, meatballs, chicken croquettes, calamari, and chorizo. With the happy hour prices, our bill actually came out to less than what we were anticipating which made it a pretty good value for a fancier meal with copious amounts of alcohol.

34oWSgx2aYi2p9a-hhKnzg.text: Overpriced tapas in extremely small portions in my opinion. But if you want to indulge in a few bites of Spanish food before heading out to the Vegas clubs, this place will do.  Try the world famous ham~ it was definitely the most delicious item on the menu, and we tried just about everything on it.

VTC7p_HjIDzXnWZ7ipU3-g.text: We got the beef w iberico pork and caramelized onion slider and it was excellent. I got the mushroom soup which was just OK and a friend got a seafood soup which she said was good. We also got the Mixed Paella which came with half a lobster. It was very good but I think next time I'll get the Paella Valenciana. A bit pricey but if you're staying at the Aria, what the hey.... I would go back for lunch.

uyK0CUT2S6F00DSbbvqQsw.text: Fun lil tappas place. Good atmosphere. Different areas for intimate dining, group dining or entertaining view from the bar. Server was informative without being pushy. Portions fill you up just enough.

TyhL2SUWKFtz2lTsB6VU5Q.text: Get the stuffed dates and foie gras!!! Stuffed dates have pancetta with its wholesome self crisped around it. The gin cocktail with pureed apples and thyme, perfect. Short ribs a bit tough, lime sweet potatoes were delicious. Seabass was executed nicely... great flavors, perfectly crispy skin. Make sure you ask for your temperature on the sliders, ours came it well. Manager was great and gracious enough to attend time with us and explain everything. Our server on the other hand, not attentive. He did not have suggestions, didn't know the menu, spoke way to quiet, and stood around across the room most of the night. Nice kid but not up to par to serve at a complex strip restaurant.  Bussers and management were at our table 98 %. I would come back hopefully service is better.  Prices are a bit high but i knew and expected that. 3 1/2 stars.

Z2OBSyHs0MAjLK0NNS5qpg.text: Absolutely amazing.  A girlfriend and I went here for dinner and were very impressed.  We ordered the mushroom risotto, spicy potatoes, oxtail, and colorado lamb.  The oxtail was to die for, I could have ordered seven.  The sangria had that slight hint of strawberry and cinnamon and was absolutely delicious.  We regretfully did not order the paella, but the couple next to us did and it looked stunning.  I will absolutely come back here every time I'm in vegas.

o52i3nGyM9QQvGhVrXPBqw.text: Beautiful and modern decor. I love the dark wood everywhere that fits well with the entire Aria look and feel. The food and presentation was great. I love tapas because you get a small portion and many plates.   The most memorable dishes was the flat iron steak, chicken and mushrooms and the churro with spicy chocolate. YUM!  Our waiter was extremely accommodating and comped our dessert. The manager even offered to have my girls and I to come back and have a round of drinks comped. Sold! =D

AgR5JKmW3mlaDGTVfSOXwg.text: I have MULTIPLE reasons why this place deserves waaay less than 5 stars.    I wanted to check out the new City Center, so on our way out of Vegas we head over- holy moly, this place is huge!  As we're walking around and trying desperately to find a place to eat, I spot Julian Serrano.  Tapas?  Yum!  So we try it out... (one of my many bad decisions in Vegas...)  It was around 12-1ish (lunchtime), and there weren't too many people seated, but they gave us a table front and center of the entrance.  Not a problem, but that table was rockier than a mountainside!  I told the hostess about the problem, and she quickly alerted the manager, and he came to fix it... with paper... while we were just sitting there.  After a minute or so to no avail, I exasperatingly asked if we could just be moved.  Geez, no brainer, people!!!!!!  NEXT PROBLEM!  Our waitress was slower than molasses.  Took forever to order, forever to get our drinks, her attention, etc... it was a nightmare (maybe her first stint at waitressing? Her shaky hands couldn't even fill our waters without spillage all over the table)!    Since the area was open space, and it's right next to the entrance/exit to the mall (or maybe the A/C was on waaay too high), but it was FREEZING, which quickly rendered our food cold.  I was a Marisa-sicle and just wanted to get the heck out of there.  Only brightside was that the food was good, but def not worth all of the issues.  By the time I finally found our waitress and asked for our bill (and waited foreverrrrrrr for her to get it to us), we find that she billed us incorrectly.  FOREVER minutes later, her manager finally hands us our corrected bill.  By the end of our lunch I was completely unhappy and cold.  SADFACE.

Z49QC-2PdOjI_OOMHIAyEA.text: This review is way overdue but better late than never. My husband and I went to Vegas on our honeymoon back in November and went to have tapas here. This place had amazing food. Yes they were expensive about $10-$15 a plate but Julian Serrano is the chef so I don't know what people expect and they are small portions but that is what tapas are. Tapas are not meant to be full meals, they are Spanish appetizers. If you are the type who looks for more bang for your buck or does not like to splurge then this would not be the restaurant for you. If it takes alot for you to get full then prepare to spend some money. The prices are clearly marked and the staff does inform you of the portion sizes beforehand so you can always walk if it is not what you want to spend your money on. There are no tricks or surprises. It would be nice to see more reviews about the food then people getting mad about the high prices of the tapas as if someone held a gun to their head and forced them to choose to eat there.Sorry about the rant. now back to the review:   We had the 2 orders of the croquetas, potatas bravas, churros with chocolate chili sauce, and the flan. Everything was so pretty I almost did not want to eat it. They were amazing and they filled us up also! If you are looking for authentic Spanish tapas, a laid back atmosphere, and upscale customer service all in the same place then I strongly suggest you visit here. The food is worth every penny and I will be back when I go to Vegas. His staff is very polite and we never went one second without not being attended to and the staff made sure we had everything we needed at all times.

-Dp0LTnBECAlkND20R5wbw.text: My favorite part of the meal was the Agua de Serrano, an awesome alcoholic drink that I am still craving. The ambience was alright for a big restaurant on the strip; it's not billing itself as fine dining, and the restaurant reflects exactly what it is--a place to get a quick bite before you head off and do other things.  The portions were HUGE for tapas. I guess that they've had too many tourists who don't know that tapas are meant to be small plates. I am not complaining, but I have just never seen such large portions at a tapas place. The patatas bravas were good, though I again found that they must have been bowing to an uneducated public by calling them by the Americanized "brava potatoes." I liked the pan tomate well enough. The dish that was a huge miss for me, however, was the vegetable paella. Not only was it just not good, but it actually tasted kind of meaty. When I asked the manager, he said that that was the saffron and that saffron just tastes meaty. I cook with saffron a lot, and that's just not True. Besides which, vegetarians don't like the taste of meat, so they really should have gone with a better flavor profile. Apart from the bites of the dish that tasted meaty, however, it was flavorless. Just not a good dish.  Still, I thought that the manager was respectful of my comments and listened to my concerns. I also saw him be particularly gracious with a crazy woman who seemed like she was just out for a free meal, so props to him on remaining courteous in a difficult situation.   So all in all, I give the drinks and service 5 stars but the ambience and the food get 3 stars.

Drl46XDtL0WxOYWFQqSc6Q.text: An amazing for vegetarians to eat. All of the bread tapas and the veggie paella are perfect and flavorful. The sangria is also excellent. I'll definitely be going back. The service was also very good.

jJjZY0TwgateSdt6yBIAPA.text: This place is so gorgeous and great location.  We went for a girls weekend before our show.  Made a reservation ahead of time and our table was ready right when we arrived.  Food is absolutely amazing!!  The paella says it serves two, but it easily served 5 of us, especially when you are noshing on all the various tapas before it arrives.

CxSyQ0mkIkmhP1i8FILdMw.text: Aww. Gotta bump you down JS. Somewhat of a letdown for a handful of out of town guests who had enjoyed their time at Firefly. Mussels were tiny, wasn't feeling the foamy presentation of the pork belly dish (hello Goyemon!) and tried a few other dishes which were fine. Still, service and white wine sangria is still on point just don't think I'm coming back for a while.

O-sCJXTpYegdE6qEVVWCDQ.text: Atmosphere was very nice but food was just okay.  We did enjoy the Vegetable paella and felt it was worth the 45 min wait.  The food was very pricey but this is Vegas!

GkNYQRHP5NDFTIDM7tjg2w.text: Excellent food. Clean and modern restaurant. Friendly staff and the tapas are amazing and 5start quality.

3Do8rW_MTtD2fZCApCAUpA.text: I tried about 5 or 6 different tapas and they were all amazing! Small in size but BIG in taste. It worked out perfectly for the occasion. It was my first restaurant of this type and it was a great experience.

MOEK-Z1mQ1ft1rwsGXhIDQ.text: We came here for dinner, and I had high hopes because of the menu and the Yelp reviews. There's a lot to choose from on the large menu, from traditional tapas to more fusiony dishes. Vegetarians and vegans have some good options as well.  The good: fried seems the way to go here. Fried crispy gambas (shrimp) each on a skewer with a pepper was a standout dish. Also enjoyed the empanada and croquetas. The sauce for the brava potatoes was delicious, but the potatoes were too soft.   The not-so-good: Tortilla was a huge disappointment. I love this dish in Spain, but for $10, all you get here is a tiny piece of bland omelet. Definitely skip it. The gambas in garlic sauce didn't taste fresh at all.   The restaurant was very busy, and service was okay -- sometimes very attentive and sometimes we'd have to work to flag down our server.

vN2RBDIa9zCHr2JXEv71kA.text: Having no expectation of this place and a pretty bad experience with Spanish cuisine, I must say I was amazed at how Julian Serrano has proved me wrong and makes me want to return to try more tapas.  For two people, we split an order of paella (takes 40 mins to make, enough for 2 according to their menu, enough for 4 if you are ordering some tapas). We started off the meal with the sliders, ceviche, and chicken croquetas. We might have ordered a dish too many as we were waiting for our paella, but oh well! I loved their croquetas. Crispy outer layer with a creamy, juicy chicken filling. It's like a bite sized pot pie! Although the dish is quite petite, it can be quite heavy. The ceviche I ordered contained white fish, octopus, scallops served with these chips reminded me of some root (I'm guessing its a lotus chip. ) it's a good light and appetizing small dish. The chips balances out the not too overwhelming lime juice. The tentacles weren't tough to chew, not overdone.   We had the mixed paella with Spanish chorizo, lobster,  mussels, chicken, artichokes, peas. Some of the other paella sounded tastier but I couldn't decide between chorizo and lobster so why not both? It's a fragrant dish served fresh on its hot plate, with the steam with juicy chicken and fresh seafood seeping out of the saffron rice. The dish isn't extremely dry, overlooked, or salty. It has been way too long since I've had paella like this.  I couldn't finish half my paella since I do want to make some room for desserts. We split the molten chocolate cake with blood orange sorbet. After tasting some crappy fake blood orange flavored sugary ice with food coloring, I'm glad to have some real blood orange sorbet that is on point! It's a must for me to have some tarty flavors in case the chocolate gets too sweet and overwhelming. The chocolate cake itself is actually semisweet. Good on its own, great with the sorbet. That warm and cold mixture just gets you when you're indoors at somewhere with super high AC but you're still in the desert. The cake is not dense at all, very airy textured, just enough to hold the warm chocolate filing in the center.  Definitely worth my dollars. Can't wait to come back and try more tapas!

dYlLfkQVR-mKlKcJuZE-8w.text: Definitely 5 star. I arrived for happy hour and ordered the Spanish tortilla. This is the ONLY place I have ever been to that has it. This place is located inside of the Aria resort and was pretty much empty which surprised me. But hey. I ordered a red sangria as well. The tortilla was fantastic. They are small plates, so there really isn't too big of a serving, but for the $4 happy hour price it was definitely worth it. The sangria was amazing! It was $5 on happy hour. Not sure if I would go for any other time as it is $$$ but definitely a place I would go to for happy hour for the tortilla and sangria.

kKv7ho6AQdg45CZv3YE-3Q.text: By far my favorite tapas restaurant! Took a girls trip to Vegas with 8 girls and we all loved it!! Everything was top notch! Each item we tried was amazing! Everything from their sangria to dessert is recommended. I don't think you can go wrong with any selection. We wanted to try everything so we even went back the following day; which is unheard of in Vegas. If you enjoy tapas, then this should be your first stop in Vegas!!!

NLAcMgLez7Swj0Lne5IZZQ.text: I really wanted to like this place since I've stayed at Aria a few times. Some of the dishes were pretty tasty. But the service was mediocre.  Most of the food came out lukewarm and we all felt rushed with the service from the timing of how the food was sent out and how the runners dropped off food and busters collecting dishes.  It was definitely not a good experience and not sure I would be back. There are so many other places to eat in Vegas.

_fi3LCzWmKfncHIRWVbQ6g.text: This place was in the top restaurants I have ever been to in Vegas.  I highly recommend their food.  I was blown away by this place.  We had multiple tapas including the Creme fresh brioche, gazpacho, beet salad, and more.  Then we had the lobster paella which was incredible.  The desserts were amazing too.  This place is 5 stars and I highly recommend it. Also the service here is exceptional.  This is just a perfectly run place.

flw34jWmkElnZhwFct_9jQ.text: 5 stars for Happy Hour!  Great selection of apps from $4-$7 and the portions were more than I expected for Tapas.  The sangria was fantastic and only $5.  Happy Hour is Sunday-Thursday 4-5:30pm

llUayfBghC5VfH7DQKxiag.text: I hate writing bad revives but the service here is just terrible, beyond. It's my third time here so it's not a fluke with getting the wrong server or what not. The food is AMAZING and that's the only reason I gave it three chances. Each time the service has just been negligent and in caring. The last time we made a reservation ended up sitting at the bar because they didn't have a table which is fine but the service at the bar was just as bad as the tables. If you love great food and don't care about service, which unfortunately I do, then try it out

tGvgTbvC2HwJD97IEuJUNQ.text: Nearly every dish I tried at Julian Serrano impressed me - the portions are small (as are all tapas) but all delicious! The only thing that I didn't like was the seating arrangements and the seats themselves. The chairs are not very comfortable, and seats were placed very close together and it was a hassle trying to enter/exit the restaurant, zigzagging through the chairs.   What we ordered: 1. White Ceviche $14 - This was my first time trying ceviche, and quite frankly, it was very tasty, but for the price, I didn't think it was worth it. The white fish went well with the lime - all ingredients tasted very fresh and served as a good appetizer.   2. White Anchovy Fillet $12 - I don't like anchovies so I didn't personally try this, but my friend claims that this was the most amazing dish served here.   3. Brava Potatoes $10 - I LOVED this dish. I normally don't like potatoes unless they're served in the form of french fries, but the Brava Potatoes blew me away. I'd say this dish is a must-order at Julian Serrano.   4. "Bomba" $12.50 - A mixture of veal and pork tenderloin, this spicy meatball leaves your mouth burning for awhile after devouring it and I loved it!   5. Beef & Cheese $17.50 - the tenderloin used was larger than the bread on the bottom. The beef could have been more tender, and it's a little overpriced for what you get.   Service was decent - servers didn't go out of their way to please customers, but our waiter didn't mind doing separate bills for our group of seven. Aria is a beautiful Vegas resort, so I would definitely come back and visit Julian Serrano!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomba
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SAX-aS7T8XfStGG--xtQ8g.text: Recommend ordering only the fish dishes. The white Ceviche and yellow tail was great.  All the beef dishes missed on the savory.  If you do order beef--- ask for a steak knife especially for the short rib.    The chicken croquetta was my favorite. The cheese l platter also missed as the goat cheese were were lame.   Sangria was good, but you should ask them to make sure to put pieces of fruit  from the mix.... It made difference on the second glass.   Service was great at they let you I'd put 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna cone... A fav at the table

BTfncc94J5GNdARwuTJxhg.text: Whenever we are in Vegas we have an obligatory meal here. The tapas menu has enough variety to keep everyone happy and they do a great job on all types of food.  The Oso Bucco was a recent stand out; it absolutely melted in your mouth. Also the grilled peppers with orange glaze were fabulous, a great amount of heat and sweet. The cocktails we had (something pine-apply) were also divine.  Our service experience has always been more than satisfactory. I would absolutely recommend a stop here!

3Nungiu2h5pIshWgIPLBaQ.text: Excellent tapas. The oxtail was our favorite. Also had the yellowtail tiradito, lobster fideua, and the stuffed piquillo peppers. All amazing. We sat and the bar and Premo was our primary server. He had excellent recommendations, was very friendly, and gave awesome service.

-dPKrTdEV2aZL1jeFoVY1w.text: Many years ago, I spent the summer in Segovia, Spain and to my delight learned about tapas. With every glass of beer or wine came a small single serving of some delectable tidbit. So I was happy to eat at a gormet tapas bar/restaurant in hopes of bringing back memories of my summer of 1978. Unfortunately, the tapas were only OK. I think the chef over-thought the concept of tapas. It's a simple food. The tapas served by Julian Serrano are complex. It's hit and miss. Some great-some not so great. (I won't bore your with the details of every tapa we ordered-quite a few.) Here's a basic report card for the restaurant.  1. Food - B-. 2. Wait Staff - A. The service was excellent and the waiter recommended an excellent wine for dinner. 3. Ambiance - B+. The owners spent lavishly for the decor. One drawback was that this restaurant is essentially in the lobby of the Arias. There was a chilly draft at our table. 4. Price - Reasonable for a quality restaurant on the Strip. (Strip restaurants are notoriously expensive, but I don't mind. It keeps out all the trailer trash riff-raff that is everywhere on the Strip!  Bottom Line: Give it a try. You may like this style tapas better than me.

eboOuvoZ1ZGX-u2BvsWijQ.text: There are not many type of dishes you can choose from , but the food are truly high quality. Personally, I love their fried calamari and New York prime steak. We also ordered two of their main dishes, which was great traditional Spain type!! If you cannot stand a bit raw rice, then it might not for you. Overall, great restaurant for food! Their service does not as great though, 1 Star off for that... Our waiter can hardly speak and understand English, and kinda rude and impatient (got our order wrong the first time) it might be just the waiter that we happened might.

K5HiCXGJK0KiHhDRiS2u-Q.text: Julian Serrano is amazing! I would give this 10 stars if that was an option!   Initially, I didn't even want to go here..... because my first impression was that it was going to be tiny servings with a fancy bow & big $$$ tag, that would leave me still hungry for more. Boy, was I wrong! Every dish ordered was prepared and cooked to perfection. Bursts of flavor, fabulous presentation, reasonable portions, and just overall a wonderful experience for the tastebuds. Love the decor & ambiance too.   Below are a few comments on the dishes I will be crawling back for :) And please note: I did not try all of the below in one sitting. The list includes dishes tried on 3 different sittings :)   MUST HAVES!  - Tuna Cones - this was my favorite dish! I wanted another order! But btw, i think it's only available at dinner. I didn't see it available on their lunch menu :(  - Stuffed Piquillo Peppers - so delish! especially if you like goat cheese & mushrooms. Was my second favorite dish!  - Ahi Tuna Tempura - maybe because I love both Ahi Tuna & Tempura, but I thought this was just scrumptious - Tuna Raspberry Skewers - a nice twist of flavors.  - White Ceviche - this ceviche was divine! My only complaint was it was a bit heavy on the lime, but then again I'm just not a lime fan ;)  - Spanish Chicken Croquetas - kinda like fried mozzarella stick, but with chicken & creamy bechamel sauce! I really liked this. Note: I luv creamy/cheesy stuff.   - Grilled Lamp Chops - very tasty & tender  GOOD!, but nothing to scream about:  - Wild Mushroom Soup - again, it was really GOOD! but I would prefer getting a second order of something above if given a choice :)  - Lobster Salad  - Lobster Saffron - Beef & Cheese - Padron Peppers - i felt like it was a bit too salty (this coming from someone who LOVES salt!) Also, it's probably more ideal as a sampler dish for a large party. For my table of 2, I felt like I had enough after a few bites, and felt padron pepper'd out by the time we finished the plate :op - Brava Potatoes - don't get me wrong, it was delicious. but as it's a pretty filling dish, i just felt that these were not out of this world, and I'd rather fill up on one of the many other tapas choices they have to offer  Overall, it was so delicious. Can't wait to head back here soon!! :oD
