ipz5iKHG90B0DQQq-keBmw.text: OX TAIL! Good service, great food. VERY small tapas plates.   Don't expect to get what you pay for 1-2 bites per plate, order 3-4 dishes for person.

_s4YdcAIT7AtcJR3FQ2ZPQ.text: Great food with great vegetarian options  Portion sizes are small but you can easily get full off ordering several dishes!  The salads are great and so is the risotto!

-n0AQuyaFQSynYOD89dzeg.text: Have been here a number of times over the last several years and it was one of our favorite restaurants.  This go around it was average.  They seem to have changed some of the way they make some of their menu items and they are not as good as I remember them.  The albondigas tastes like Chef Boyardee and the torrijas were not as good as in the past.  Everything was just average.  Really disappointed.  Service was also slow.

ppf6gNvYSPh5zZ5hALoHmg.text: This is a great place for tapas. The service here is excellent. The ambience is laid back but chic. Each dish is carefully crafted and the flavors phenomenal. My favorite dish was the paella. We got a less traditional version with shrimp, calamari and squid ink topped with aioli. The appearance might be off-putting to some at first but it was very flavorful. I will definitely be visiting again the next time I'm in Vegas.

x6MwT5OiMhTEXCgAmVhfDg.text: Came here during a lunch break with some office mates. I had the shrimp ceviche and tomato bruschetta as an appetizer. I also tried the lobster salad, which wasn't my favorite. I asked for the dressing on the side and the dollops of cauliflower on the side which went okay with the lobster.   Overall, it's an amazing ambiance, but the food is standard. Nothing too amazing. I would come back if I tried more of the hearty side, if I ended eating here again.

w78UBEfDewzQF72OLtKq3A.text: 45 minutes to wait for the Paella? Do not be impatient because it's all worth it. This means they are not playing with the ingredients and preparation.  PAELLA NEGRA. This was unforgettable. The pieces of squid and shrimps were super fresh with the saffron rice rissoto. How I love squid ink with anything and so this dish was a winner.    CEVICHE WITH TARO CHIPS. Anything with taro,I'd die. I never knew it could be a perfect combo,it was so refreshing .  I enjoyed the food with my Sangria.  BTW,the visit was unplanned and the people around me appeared to be very satisfied.   Overall,it is a must -try restaurant when in Aria.

0JW4ELQP4CnLQy5NZt0x_w.text: The atmosphere was very loud but the food was worth the screaming across the table to my husband! We ordered quite a few dishes like we always do & most didn't even get a picture as we enjoyed them so quickly.  No pics for the spicy tuna cones, steak & mashed potatoes, and Moscato sangria.  All were delish!  Couldn't finish the paella so took it togo & was still good cold at 1:45am

Service was excellent, the quality of the food was on point, and the ambiance of the restaurant is festive. I personally recommend the carne asada. Surprisingly, I thought I would not get full from the tapas we had ordered but it was quite filling.

CddJ8gWwGUhQvAyfdqmD6A.text: Ruined my wife's 40th birthday the worst restaurant service I've had in my life the wait staff appeared to be medicated or on illegal substances   weak drinks food not served properly or explained   If I was Julian Serrano' I would not want my name on that restaurant

9JqOsISEUdrAST-NXzrNUg.text: We had a very pleasant and well paced dinner with several small cycles of orders. Starting with a little charcuterie and bruschetta that really kicked of the rest of the small plates. The Meat and Cheese I had was just the right size for me after bariatric surgery and really hit the spot. Too bad though, I would have loved to try more. Everyone at my table had so many great small plates and by their reactions, they were in foodie heaven. On my next visit to Vegas we will definitely visit again. The service was great, personable and made excellent recommendations with charming candor that fit our personalities. Also, on a healthy eating note... if you have had bariatric surgery and have to eat small with high protein, then this would be the little treat for you.

fb5S0Wz5h1HikdBlLjE8OQ.text: First visit 2 years ago was amazing. went again yesterday and the waiters were too pushy /salesy. And food quality had dipped. Went from 5 to 2 stars in my mind. Disappointed taking my wife a couple close friends on my recommendation....

vXkdN8-sXbzo_9vVSnmYvA.text: Fun, good food and pricey Julian Serrano Tapas is an experience on the Strip you might miss if you aren't headed for Aria Hotel. Our kids stayed there, and raved about the tapas, so we opted for our last LV lunch there and were not disappointed. We enjoyed the bacon-wrapped dates with goat cheese and apples, the oxtail, the andouille sausages, and the apple salad. All were very tasty. We have had tapas in Spain and in Northhapmton, MA, and frankly, the best was the Northhampton, which sadly isn't serving tapas anymore. This was second place, even to Spain, but way more expensive. Many small plates come in threes, so adding $4 for a 4th is a good option. Expect to spend around $25-$30 per person with no drinks. But, it is a good experience, good social atmosphere for eating and fellowship, and if you're into tapas, this is one of the good ones. tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

Oxr25Pj66-O6DZRCOUtlZQ.text: Really good tapas are def small. The server suggested 2-3 dishes per person. But I always think servers recommend more than enough. However we did have to almost order 3 dishes per person.   We ordered: -flat calamari x2 (super good) -chicken croquettas (rly creamy)  -bronzino (not bad) -ribs (Avg) -tuna cones (the fish was a little odd but there's guac at the bottom!) -beef & cheese (super good)  Note if u want paella don't come super hungry, it takes 45-60 min to make in the kitchen.   My mom thought the dishes were a little salty. But I didn't have a prob with it. Service was avg.

fAcXqL4opUhATxsOAt8lkw.text: Come hungry... leave angry !  This is how I felt after dining here!   We were staying at the Sky suites at the Aria, and we saw this place a few times while walking by.   The colours were bright and cheerful -it's an open air type place. It seemed friendly and we were looking forward to a fun time.   I love tapas, and yes while I know it means "small plates" I seriously wasn't expecting the portions to be SO small !   We asked the server what she liked, and she recommended the bread with cheese. Which was exactly that -   We also ordered 2 other items - I can't recall exactly what they were, but it was something that was no more then 2 bites, and the other was some paper thin meat that cost almost 30$   Total for this meal ( which would be more like an appetizer ) was just around 100$ with 2 drinks.   I don't have a problem with the price IF the amount of food left us satisfied. But we left feeling hungry and utterly ripped off.

yGeRbEzfRCz4IosP8S1J7Q.text: Julian Serrano Tapas is a Spanish tapas restaurant that offers small plates and paellas in ARIA.   For drinks, we wanted a pitcher of sangria but wasn't sure which one so they provided us samples of each. After sampling them, we decided getting a Pitcher of Muscat Sangria, which consisted muscat wine, apples, peaches, grapes, and golden raisins. It was light, sweet, and refreshing but strong at the bottom.  Since we wanted to eat light, we shared four tapas and a large paella. The Fried Calamari consisted of lightly breaded calamari rings and tentacles topped with jalapeno and bell peppers and served with spicy tomato sauce and herb garnished garlic aioli. The Pan Manchego consisted of country baguette topped with diced fresh tomato and a slice of aged manchego cheese. The Spanish Chicken Croquettes consisted of panko breaded croquettes filled with shredded chicken and bechamel and served with lemon-pepper alioli. The Lobster Salad consisted of country baguette topped with avocado, tomatoes, corn, and lobster and served with baby greens salad. The Mixta Paella consisted of saffron flavored long grain rice cooked with lobster, mussels, shrimp, chicken, spanish pork chorizo, and vegetables.  By the end of our meal, we were too full to have dessert.

IOcOi9h4lgP6Fx1pFdtGsQ.text: Researched a ton of restaurants along the Strip as we wanted a delicious dining experience.  3 spots at Aria sounded interesting so our first night in Vegas we ventured over and checked out their menus.  Julian Serrano stood out - our mouths were salivating just reading the menu so we made a reservation for the next night. Shrimp Ceviche was incredible, Chicken Croquettes were delicious, Lamb was good, loved the Churro for dessert especially when I opted to order ice cream to dip them in!  Will definitely return and try the paella - looked yummy!  Our server Ernest was amazing - very attentive.

Yh8xFn_cS4ZilgFw5izXkA.text: New Years Eve.  What a performance by the stomping & beautiful salsa dancers.  Sorry I don't know what the specific dance was, but the area to the left, as you walk in was made into a dance floor.  Julian had special performers bringing in the NYE, beautiful pink & red balloons everywhere & square boxed ornaments hanging on the artsy trees.  I wish it was like this everyday!   My best friend, mom & dad thought they had Paella as the hostess told me when I made reservations, but they had a 'Special New Years Menu.'  All was good cause Brian, the BEST manager was there & Antonio was our server who recommended a new dish to me.. the Huevos Soria.  Or the Huevos to die for lol.  I never tasted the creamy spinach listed in it, but that was fine cause I never tasted anything like this before and want this tapas to forever stay on the menu.    The perfect yolk of the free-range jidori egg poured out on top of a thinly made pancake or crepe, french toast-tasting layer.  Under that was this spicy kind of red pepper & Spanish Soria Truffle, sandwiched together w/ another bottom layer of the thin pancake.  I can't even describe it's amazingness lol.  I was full after that & a sangria.  But honestly could eat this everyday.    I cannot begin to express how amazing Julian Serrano is & the crew he picks to represent him & his love of food.  At both Lago as well, the attention to detail & perfection is impeccable.  Another reason Vegas is the best city is because of how these amazing chefs, servers, bartenders & all people come together to cater to locals, tourist & represent our city as a whole.  Thank you!  Love you for that!

TK2qMPfVtUUFy59oT_zuYA.text: Had dinner here October 16. Had four different dishes including Paella Valenciana (chicken and chorizo), a dish of mixed vegetables in a creamy sauce, Sea Bass, and a Lamb chop. The first two were quite forgettable and expensive. The last two were excellent. I did comment to our waiter, Jimmy, that the vegetable dish was truly awful and that the chicken in the paella was way over cooked. Without even hesitating he removed the vegetable dish from our bill and comp'd us one glass of wine. The atmosphere in this restaurant is lively and Jimmy was an excellent and enthusiastic waiter. The food dishes appear to be hit and miss.

RqNAqbMMNP8Qj4dQgh2KbQ.text: Love the tapas.  The chicken crumpets were crispy n delicious.  The tuna tartare on a cone was amazing  The bacon wrapped dates with goat cheese is standard like all tapas restaurant.  Traditional paella was delicious.  I usually prefer seafood paella but today I had the traditional chicken and sausage.  Delicious

q47isS9JvTTMXfZF7ZGsGw.text: We recently went here on a double date, and were underwhelmed.  The food was fine, but there were few standouts. We sampled a lot, including the Lobster Salad, Ensalada Mixta, Creamy Rissoto, Stuffed Piquillo Peppers, Brava Potatoes, Pan de Hongo, Grilled Ribeye Steak, and beverages. Of the tapas, our favorite was the Pan de Hongo, but it's hard to screw up bread, mushrooms, and cheese. I liked the Brava Potatoes, but others thought it was heavy on the sauce. Everything else was fine, at the appropriate temperature, and served as stated on the menu. Again, adequate, but nothing that totally wowed us or justified the price.  For the most part, the wait staff was polite and attentive, and understanding when the other 2 in our party arrived later than the time on our reservation. The restaurant was clean. The huge seats at the tables in the back were comfortable. No major complaints about the service or facility. However, there was one weird thing that happened.  Strangely, when the boyfriend ordered the Lobster Salad and asked for it with no corn, he was told they couldn't do it because it was "pre-made like that." Thinking it was mixed in with the other ingredients we accepted it and ordered the salad "as is." However, when it arrived, the corn was plainly sprinkled on top of the salad. So, either the chef and staff were unwillingly to make a simple accommodation for a diner, or everything is pre-made and plated in advance and just pulled from a refrigerator. Either way, I'd expect more from a "classy" restaurant in a "hip" casino.   My boyfriend and I agree that though everything was "okay," the restaurant suffered from a major case of "trying too hard." We likely won't be back.

GilWhrR5x7O_VFRH_ijd1w.text: The tasty things were the trips risotto, rib cap with pretzel bread, squid ink rice and oxtail. The empanada was 1 slice of meat pie- the crust was soggy and tasted like crap. The apple foie gras was mush on mush, it needed a crunchy component for texture. Overall was average food experience, left disappointed.

Q2KV0CHm4akg6-03rREhRA.text: Whimsical, beautiful plating. Interesting flavor combinations. STRONG sangria.   I loved Julian Serrano at Aria, and I would absolutely come back.

mMi9DuImk2tDWROVYoJDxg.text: We had an early show so I used the Bellagio self-parking garage and took the tram to Aria where we took advantage of the daily happy hour that runs from 11:30AM to 5:30PM at Julian Serrano's. Julian was not available so we ordered glasses of 3 day red sangria from the bartender - excellent, the sangria, the bartender was just okay.  On the first round of tapas we ordered cheese coca (small flatbread with goat cheese, spinach and pine nuts) and a beet salad (striped beets, kale, goat cheese, croutons and beet vinaigrette). The second round included another round of red sangria and a bomba (a veal and pork tenderloin spicy meatball with spicy rocoto sauce) plus paella magro y verduras (pork and vegetables). Each dish demonstrated the chef's commitment to sourcing and a deft hand though the paella, made in a large batch each day, proved to be a disappointment.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bar

JV-qZChDfrovnWXTPgTeEQ.text: Come for the happy hour until 5:30pm! Great sampling of tapas and red sangria! Mmmmmmmmmm delish!  Sat at the bar and ordered the stuffed dates, veg flatbread and the tuna tartare in cones.  So savory and just enough to fill us until a late dinner.   You have your pick of white, sparkling or red sangria, so why not try all 3? At $5 a glass it's a steal and a full pour!  If you're lucky you'll get Premo the bartender. Very welcoming and cool guy.   We would love to go back and try some other dishes too. But the casino calls!!

FDcgOTB3h7BbxvVcTS9NKw.text: The risotto organic mushroom is fantastic! The seared scallops skewer is AMAZING. I love the apricot next to the scallop. It really in riches the flavor. The beef and cheese has great flavor. The ambiance is very nice and is perfect for date night. I would definitely eat here again.

STXsNFuJivqDRTuNTaemtQ.text: Where do I begin? Julian Serrano starts with the greeting , accommodating behavior, top notch sommelier, then segues into spectacular menu.  Thank you for a fantastic meal and experience.

4-iw53mfLQvBKbAhCXr3KA.text: The mixt paella was so bad.  There was no crusty rice and the paella was luke warm!  I ordered the octopus & calamari tapas and it was over done & dried! I came here in Jan/17 and the food was great that I would come again.  Now, I would never come back.  The waitress never came back and asked if the food was good or not.

diR_1me91n5Xaw4LJpderA.text: Come for the tapas, but order the Mixed Paella We've been to Julian Serrano Tapas at Aria Las Vegas many times. It just gets better and better! Jason took care of us. His service, insight and hospitality were exemplary. Plan your menu carefully. Remember that it's tapas and OK to order more. Our latest dining experience was olives and almonds with drinks, then simple mixed green salad, followed up with the mixed paella - PERFECTION.

tUjdYrCBnzIg3hjMpBAczg.text: Had eaten here twice before, good and bad. Intrigued by the apricot scallop combination, I ordered that and was delighted. Later made it at home. The Branzino Donnestria was also excellent when I began combining it with the potato/tomato it came with. Sangria was perfect with the apricot dish, but a cava would have been better with the fish. Later that evening, I had a totally forgettable meal at Picasso, Julian's main restaurant, or perhaps it once was. My life is enriched by the apricot-scallop tapa.

5I2fRNgpgmG94CQirs9UBg.text: Rolled up to Julian Serrano for a bachelorette party here with 13 other girls and it was the CRAZIEST dining experience I have ever participated in!  The reviews on Yelp raved about the paella, but we were short on time and couldn't afford the extra 30 minutes...so we were trying to figure out the best selections for a group our size especially given our time crunch.  We finally decided on the pre-fixe menu and the GM came over with his own recommendation. He said he'd do something special for us similar to the pre-fixe menu...he just said "Trust me".  Holy eff.  We gave the go ahead and it wasn't long before our heads were whirling with a flurry of arms and dishes swarming around the table. He literally had us try everything on the menu and plates and plates were whizzing by. I looked around the table and all the girls were eyes-forward, head-down just eating as quickly as humanly possible. We had sliders, kabobs, skewers, ahi, meatballs, etc etc and it was incredible.  The entire waitstaff was incredibly nice (most were incredibly good looking too), and the food kept coming at a comfortable level, where it was fast, efficient.. but not stressful! lol..  They also hooked it up with a sampling of all their desserts...and oh snaps, we were so SOO happy with the line-up. mmMmMmmm..  everything together cost a bit more than the pre-fixe especially cuz we had drinks (Sangria!!) and cocktails...totally about $80-85 per person. SO. Worth. it!

m3AuJrqTW_olTK9BhBEI8w.text: A Las Vegas staple for us, Julian Serrano never fails to please.  This is our fourth time visiting and it was better than the first. A bit small, so reserve early. Not stuffy, so wear your jeans and get ready for a flavor explosion. Great service, although even with a reservation you might have to wait a few minutes to be seated, but be patient!  Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gCK4ypLASXdiGGN7_B7ChA.text: One of our favorite restaurant in Vegas. This is a must visit for us everything we are in town. Had the Peta Negra and was fantastic. The Succulent Pork was great as well. When in Vegas, this is a must.  BEST tapas.  Only con of this place is that one of the lady at the desk (greeter) isn't very friendly.  She is pretty nonchalant. But the food and our waiter (Ernesto) makes up for her poor service.

pewBaGIwRazaXesyD51iYA.text: Went back again this past weekend (twice)... What can I say, this place is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, hands down my number one choice...   Everything I tasted was so good, I had some of my favorites that I already know like the mushroom risotto and the oxtail ... But I tried a few things I haven't had before - foie gras (just wow... I wished it would be healthy lol cuz I would eat it all day) salmon with truffle sauce , steak with cheese , almond cake, bunuelos.... And ordered the risotto twice in one order (that's how perfectly cooked that risotto is)... And paired it with a great bottle of 2010 Etude Pinot ...   Just wanted to update my previous review to highlight this restaurant as much as I can... There's hasn't been a dish I didn't like and like I always say, when it comes to fine dinning I'm a hard man to please ...   Thanks Julian Serrano for another great meal, you will see me every time I'm in town.

0K500zy8dKopWu4501i94A.text: Ate here three times while at a conference and the food was excellent. The only disappointment was tonight when I ordered the jamon Iberrico de bellota "pata Negra". While the flavor and quality was good, they served the it in slices all clumped together on a piece of paper and it was difficult to get individual slices of jamon to eat. it seemed they had been pre sliced it hours ago to save time and stacked on top of each other . This jamon needs to be sliced preferably by hand and served neatly on a plate considering they charged $39 for maybe 1 ounce.

vRxNhKxMZrYIV3udKb9cxw.text: From atmosphere to food to service- from drinks to tapas- Julian Serrano is a must when even close to the Aria Casino. If you are a fan of Spanish tapas, you will be as close to heaven as you will ever be. We are huge fans of tapas, the smaller portions and the many flavors that will explode on your taste buds. So many varieties and all of the tapas were beautifully presented on great, long rectangular plates that facilitated the three of us getting to all that was available. Favorites included the Spanish tortilla de patata, the octopus, the scallops, the ceviche was so delicious. We tried everything we thought we would like including the lamb, and then because we had a great rapport  with our waiter, we let him pick some of his favorites for us to try.  We had reservations for 9pm and ate easily for at least 2 and a half hours, as a matter of fact, we actually closed the restaurant down and were never made to feel that we were a bother. It was a birthday celebration, and they brought the most beautiful plate complete with candle! (see pictures) Rarely will you find a restaurant that gets all of it right- but at Julian Serrano all of the stars aligned for us to give us a perfect meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cake!! complete with candle

0agooyd4f_sFEbFUCtWh-Q.text: More like 3.75 stars really, but I'm rounding down cause of the prices. But I guess it is Vegas. I mean the food was delicious, but the prices were steep. I love tapas and Spanish food. But $45 for their seafood marinara... Steep!! It was yummy and there was a lot of seafood in it, but still. Most tapas dishes ranged in the prices between $10-18. And the dishes were pretty small too. The goat cheese stuffed dates, really yummy but $12.50 for three pieces. The braised short rib, one rib for $16.   And the desserts were alright. At $8 a dish I was expecting heaven in mouth. The desserts were definitely unique - pistachio tart, almond cake with almond ice cream. But it didn't have that "you're totally worth paying for" quality.   If I were to write a review based on the deliciousness of the food, Julian Serrano would get 4 stars. However, my review is based on the overall dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat cheese stuffed dates - so sweet tasting :)
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna!!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short ribs

d0nuIyP3yLXsVfO4E3mdPQ.text: *Thumbs up* This was my first tapas dining experience in Vegas, and I enjoyed just about every dish ordered. Highlights were the raspberry tuna skewer, yellowtail crudo, octopus, lobster saffron, and the rabo del toro (oxtail).  *Thumbs down* Like anything in Vegas, especially on the Strip within a high-end hotel, it's expensive. You don't get initial sticker shock like with a $100 wagyu from a steakhouse, but the $10-15 per tapas dish quickly adds up in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9VkiYCQeZgX3CEzMT5xcEg.text: Oh, yum. Everything I had was really tasty! Tapas are usually expensive, so I didn't see this place being that much more expensive than others, but for a few extra dollars you get a lot of flavor. They have a lot of "new" kinds of tapas that are a fusion of other ethnic foods but you also have the traditional spanish tapas such as mussels, gazpacho, and the like.   What did we get? Asparagus Spinach Chicken croquetas (Don't get this. not worth the money)  Spanish tortilla Mussels White ceviche Yellow tail dish (it was 3 raw slices of yellow tail that was wrapped around this sauce filled with what they said was "sweet potato haystack"...JUST GET IT.)  Gazpacho w/ lobster (MY absolute favorite, had this ball that broke open in your mouth that had this super savory broth in it)  Paella valenciana (for 2)  Oh, and a glass or red wine sangria and a pitcher of sparkling white sangria  Man oh man. Bill turned out to be 212 dollars or so. Not too terrible for a tapas place.  What dishes were the stars in my opinion?   1. Gazpacho- it was one of the BEST i've ever had. Lobster pieces were BIG too, and that weird sphere thing was tasty! Hard to share, since it's soup, though. BTW it's kinda cute that the waiter warns you that it's a cold soup. I guess people have made that mistake before, but don't get put off by it- it's SUPER refreshing!   2. White ceviche- ohh...so orgasmically delicious. I wish they would put more taro chips on there with the ceviche...and I wish they would have a separate plating of the chips and ceviche so the chips won't get soggy.   3. YELLOWTAIL ...it's pricy.. 3 pieces for 16 bucks so it was basically almost a 6 dollar bite you're paying for (plus tax and tip)  ...but it was so worth it. We didn't know it was only 3 pieces or else we wouldn't have gotten it, but if you're a baller...get this dish. it's extravagant, delicious and PERFECT. The best 6 dollars you'll put in yo mouth.   4. I personally loved the spinach. It might not be worth it to some, but it was cooked great with pine nuts, raisins and apple pieces all lightly sauteed. it was perfect.   Things that weren't so great:   1. Mussels: I've had better mussels at other places. These mussels were small, and kind of sad. They all came out luke warm, too. Not that much broth in there either. My favorite mussels are from Cha Cha Cha's in San Francisco. These...just didn't keep up.  2. Croquetas. bleh. I was expecting something else. some other girls in my table liked it but I wasn't impressed especially with the price.  3. Worst was the tortilla. I really, REALLY wanted to like this. They gave you one small slice of an already made portion- I get that part. But I've had and had made spanish tortilla before and I get why it wasn't made to order.  The reason why I didn't say it was that good was because it was way too salty. Across the table, every single person in our party said it was salty...and it was. The texture, the flavor was all really, really nice... it was just the excess salt in the dish that made it not quite as tasty.  Overall, a really nice experience. The paella was good and the portion for 2 people is enough for tapas for 4 or 5 or even more. For 4 girls, we got 2 tapas each and a paella to share and I think that's more than enough. We were stuffed beyond belief. (The waiter said 2-3 tapas per person..but i think you can get away with 1-2..and share a paella)   The sparkling sangria and the red sangria were both excellent. I'd love to come here again..but I'm ballin' on a budget so if I go to another expensive restaurant it's gonna be at a new one so I can try 'em all.

3u3noXtTx5wVdg9OTITmRg.text: A month later and I'm still MEH on this place. The drinks aren't anything spectacular, the food is okay and the service is friendly enough. Not the best the Aria has to offer, but good enough in a pinch. My primary complaint is that the tapas aren't really shareable for parties of 3+. The seasoning seemed to be off on the food as well.

YlLxukEhmsg9-RUAbSGwIg.text: Bar staff was very friendly! We had few vegetarian tapas, everything was good, they also have a nice selection of wines by the glass.. Tommy was very professional, patient and provided us with excellent service!! Lalo and Juancho also provided great service, and even though the place was so busy, they all took time to answer our questions :) thank you guys!!

-qI73CsVPHxmJmbJ2-eiLA.text: So we came here for happy hour and sat at the bar. There were roughly 3 waiter who were helping us which confused us... First the service was extremely slow. It took awhile before we were asked what we wanted to order.  The couple next to us were also irritated with the lack of attention from the waiters. On the good side, the food was amazing... Try the following  Spanish tortilla - rate 4/5 Steamed mussels - rate 5/5 Chicken croquet as - rate 5/5  Desserts to try: Molten chocolate cake and Santiago cake  Would come here again to try other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q7Dr1FkA3KrZUpqGMrsD5w.text: We stumbled in here during a business trip for a quick lunch and were blown away by the flavors of the tapas served here.  Our team shared the following tapas: Lobster Salad Ahi tuna tempura White ceviche Tuna carpaccio White anchovy fillets Traditional Spanish chicken croquetas Fresh calamari a la plancha Creamy risotto  The tapas that hit me as the best have to be the ceviche, calamari, and the tuna carpaccio.  The calamari was fork tender and perfectly accented by the acid, the carmelized onions added the needed sweetness to round out the dish.  The execution of the carpacio left me wanting to order another order, but I had to sustain.  The carpaccio is sliced thin and placed over pine nuts that gave the dish a perfect, and when I say perfect I mean crunch.  The vinaigrette was refreshing while not being too overpowering of the fish.  The restaurant is beautiful, and the fun vibe of Tapas makes it a great experience.  A must check out if your in Vegas and anywhere near the Aria Hotel.  Price is on the high side, but quality, service, and most of all flavor get the high marks for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled squid.

JtHmGoNWSPmBaU5QAn0gFg.text: Fantastic dinner and service last night.  The food (tapas style) was perfectly cooked.  I ordered the crochettes, dates, tuna cones and pork cubes and they were all fantastic.  Dinner for two with a glass of wine each will run you about $100 which is not bad for a nice casino like the Aria.  It matches any Spanish restaurant that you would visit in Madrid and the staff is very friendly.

4pa-zKkiIHpEobqEBHDWBQ.text: Great service and food! Our waiter gave really solid suggestions. Fun dining experience.

d_35UGozERKC6sZQZliHkA.text: My wife and I had a fabulous time here last night. The Tapas were outstanding. We had the following: - SPANISH CHICKEN CROQUETTES - BEEF & CHEESE - IMPORTED SPANISH SERRANO HAM - LOBSTER FIDEUA - ARTISANAL SAUSAGE SKEWER We wanted to get the SEAFOOD ZARZUELA but we were stuffed.   We did have the dessert though - the bread pudding and tiramisu. Outstanding.   The vibe is totally contemporary and cool. Loved the bathrooms. The tile work is spectacular.   Our server Antonio Martinez was great!  His recommendations were spot on and he was great with the service.   Great, great experience!!

LzMsLJ_q-PSNFY0FuBnEfg.text: I am a huge fan of small bites, instead of a large entree.  I love having a taste of everything.  This restaurant fulfills that requirement in a great way.  There are so many to choose from.  We had trouble deciding what to get but here are the ones we chose and if we liked them or not.  (note: their menu changes from time to time)   Coca Foie Gras - LOVED this dish.  "coca" is a flat Spanish bread that is delicious, it is crunchy and softens with the sauce on top.  This bread was topped with beets and foie gras.  Everything was cooked perfectly and the flavors melded together like a perfect bite.  Spanish Tortilla - Think of this like a frittata with potatoes in it.  This was delicious and it was the first thing to disappear off of our table.  This is worthy of ordering as a side dish to your other tapas.  Serrano Tender - Prime tenderloin on top of the coca bread and then topped with foie gras.  This missed the mark for us.  The meat wasn't that tender and there was not a lot of flavor to it.  I would pass on this next time.  Octopus a la Gallega - These were coin sized pieces of tender octopus served on top of a half dollar sized formed potato, the sauce is heavy on the Spanish paprika and I found it a little bitter at the end.  Not one of our favorites, would probably not order this again.  Brava Potatoes - spicy potatoes - this is one of my go to tapas whenever I visit a Spanish restaurant.  I can usually gauge the level of excellence by this simple dish.  These were some of the best I have ever had.  The potatoes were perfectly prepared and the sauce was divine.  This is a must have.  Even if you are just sitting at the bar for some Sangria, you have to order this.    Mixed Paella - NOTE, if you want Paella or any of the larger entrees you MUST order them immediately.  They can take up to one hour to be ready.  So do not delay.  Having said that, the wait is worth it.  This Paella was delicious, with smoky undertones and the best rice I've had in a restaurant.  By the way, I am not a fan of rice, that's my husband's go to dish and yet I ate this too, it was that good.  This restaurant is in the main lobby of the Aria, it is loud, there is a lot of activity around you and it's worth coming in for a bite.  The staff went above and beyond and the drinks were good.  You can eat as little or as much as you want here, but this is not a quick place to eat.  Make sure you have time and sit down and RELAX.

_Ydtpq7lPs1zdyymz4azWw.text: As a Vegas local, we very rarely opt to go to the Strip area except when friends were visiting and this was no exception. A very sweet and dear couple we've known for a long time finally ventured to Vegas to visit us. Sadly their experience here wasn't the best between the constant barrage of timeshare folks accosting them each time they walked through their hotel to the coldness of the staffing.  So we wanted them to have a great meal on their final night in a beautiful setting that was relaxed but also something they couldn't get back home.   Julian Serrano was perfect.  We started with cocktails - several in the lobby bar at the Aria then proceeded to dinner.  Tapas:   The bacon wrapped dates were delicious morsels of happiness in a wine reduction sauce. Brava potatoes were small cubes of golden brown goodness with a spicy alioi for dipping.  Empanadas were puffed to perfection and filled with a creamy cheese Tiny cuban sandwiches - were like mini-grilled cheese and ham.   We shared a paella - one with chicken, rabbit & chorizo. - and a small seafood one as a side dish as 2 of us are allergic to the seafood.   Sangia & Cerveza flowed - and we topped the delicious meal off with cafe and dessert - a selection of cheese and bread.   Total bill was just over 300.00 for dinner and drinks for 4.   Seating:  Great tables and the chairs were very comfortable - wide enough for ample bums to sit for an extended period and leg room for the 2 tall guys with us. The atmosphere is open, bright and airy. The tables are just far apart enough so that you don't feel like you are rubbing elbows with your neighbor.  This is worth noting because of the cost of the square footage in high end hotels on the strip is pricey and most of the better establishments still have very close seating.   Service: impeccable. Our waiter - at our request for a small paella for the seafood, was more than accommodating. it came out filled with what looked like more seafood than rice. at the end of the meal, he bought out complimentary churros still piping hot.    Pricing: Ok I admit it, i had some $$ on my M-life that took care of a large portion of the meal..one of the advantages of actually living in Vegas. Still the actual $300 it cost us out of pocket wasn't a lot for the amount of food / drinks we consumed.   If you want something different with great service coupled with delicious food, this is a great spot to go.   Side note: We ended up back in the bar - and closed it down. Our waiter from the restaurant had the bartender send us over drinks - I mean who am i to refuse???

YnyVr3ht9w6fzTE2J2gXww.text: Jeffrey, the bartender, was a nice guy.  Jesus, the bar back/assistant bartender seemed like he going to do well... likable.  But this review is more about the food than the staff.  We went here two or three years ago and were blown away by every dish.  This year, not so much.  It seemed like some great Julian Serrano ideas that weren't really clicking.  The Jamon Iberico Croquettes were just kind of mushy.  The flatbread was good but not crazy good.  The Black Rice with calamari was nice.  Yellowtail Tiradito, excellent.  It's crazy how quickly the food comes out... make you feel comfortable not ordering everything at once... easing into the meal and not guessing at how much to order.  But this was at the pre-christmas lull.  This was kind of a three star experience but I'm averaging with our first go round.

G_04J9Wh3-tOmQhaigAYVQ.text: I LOVE everything about this place. Every time I come to Vegas I have to eat here. Tapas are magnificent! Perfect size... You have two and it's like having an entree. The decoration is fun and vibrant, the service is exceptional, the wine list is awesome and the food is delicious. Try the tuna cones and the filet mignon tapas, you won't regret!

P9gpy_B9YDdnVD4GO1NFZA.text: Came here for Valentine's Day and everything came out just perfect for my taste buds. Definitely coming back and I can't wait!

9JxUcmho5xd0lhl3jOFi_Q.text: I come for the cochinillo, skewered lamb and chicken foie gras. Corkage is $50. Great service by Pedro!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab black rice was super rich and good
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cochinillo was amazingly tender
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dates were too sweet for me

0-T5CNVQjNjoaWmEA-Pujg.text: Overhyped, It was wayyyyy overpriced. Yes I do understand it is tapas style, but for the price it was definitely not worth it. We ordered several tapas ( it wasn't that great so I do not remember the names).   Lastly, we orders the churros and I was soooooo disappointed. Every time I dipped the churros in the chocolate it would fall apart. It was definitely a big disappointment because I loveeee dessert after dinner. Next time we will be using our comps somewhere else in Aria.

SkFvN8DEuJpmrfajcD4Krg.text: A must try when you're at the Aria.....  A really nice restaurant located right in the lobby area of the Aria hotel.  While waiting for our group to arrive, the bar served some really potent cocktails.  Really nice bar area...  For dinner we just went to town on the tapas style menu.  I can't remember everything we ordered, but croquettes, octopus and branzino were great!  Lamb chops were ridiculously good.  Skirt steak was phenomenal.  Can't say much about the price as a friend of our flipped the bill.  Eat here....you can't go wrong!

PzvSDVnVNCQmi66qIGC1Rw.text: Used to be our favorite tapas place... This time the experience was a complete fail. A lot has changed since last year. Bar menu is gone. New menu is weird. Service was inattentive, bread or drinks (not water) were never offered,  when we started to order it turned out that calamari were not available  (for like a month we were told), but the items were still on the menu. The waiter talked to us like we owed him something,  made me feel absolutely uncomfortable and wanting me to get up and leave. Chicken crockets were overfried and oily, yellowtail was just blah...

YXWdbeUSFMRsmBIiTnuu9A.text: Julian Serrano is now one of my new favorite restaurants in Vegas.  We started the evening with a pitcher of Sangria.  It was definitely the strongest Sangria I've ever had, but it made the Cirque du Soleil show after dinner much more entertaining =)  Between two people, five tapas were enough.    First, we ordered the rabo de toro, which was oxtail and pork served over mashed potatoes.  This was SOOOOO good, and already got us excited for what was coming.  Next, we had the black rice consisting of squid and lobster meat in a nice squid ink/saffron sauce that left the most amazing taste in our mouths.  Needless to say, this was our favorite dish of the night, and makes me incredibly hungry just thinking about it!   The next three items were very good, but hard to compare with the black rice.  We had the grilled rib eye steak, which was actually pretty dry even though we ordered it medium rare.  It was a very thin piece of meat, so I understand that it is easy to overcook.  I would've given Julian Serrano 5 stars but for this overly dry meat.  We also ordered the steamed mussels and mixed seafood ceviche.  Both were very good, but again, hard to satisfy us after the amazing black rice.  All in all, I would DEFINITELY come back and try their other dishes.  We didn't order the paella last time because it takes 45-60 minutes to prepare.  Just give yourself extra time if you're planning to watch a show after.

0jRRS2Jp0E_A8WllzVLD6g.text: Wow just discovered paella heaven!  If you're adventurous try the paella negro.  A little taste of Barcelona in Vegas baby!!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8BhtoU0T0CgLp4pWTn1xxQ.text: My wife were looking for something different to eat late at night. This place has a great atmosphere with excellent service and most important of all excellent drinks and food. My wife and I ordered the white sangria for her and red sangria for me. The white sangria had pieces of pear with a hint of sweetness. The red sangria had a cinnamon note with red apple pieces. Both were tasty. The best thing I ate was the steak topped with foie gras and chocolate sauce. We had 7 tapas style dishes and enjoyed every single one. The bacon wrapped dates are also a must try. I highly recommend this place.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cvdg5exNdNPx2tRjiiPviQ.text: Delicious food! Service was pretty good, only complaint is that they forgot two of our tapas and they had to be reminded. Some items on the menu are pretty boring and definitely not worth the money but they have seem great unique items. I could eat the pate parfait and black rice all day!

cSpqOEanZe1THUv_FLNrxg.text: Great food, great service - need I say more? :-) The lobster gazpacho had a very well rounded taste. The heirloom tomatoes salad was delicious, even though it is not really a tomato season (Christmas :)
