Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black pork shoulder

RPl-3aYA-vsubQqQa20TUg.text: This a good restaurant, but overpriced for what you get. There are better tapas restaurants in Vegas...you're better off dropping coin there.

mzyxh4e8pckqeqayJyaGUQ.text: Fabulous tapas restaurant inside the Aria. Couldnt decide on which dishes to try so opted for the lobster salad and the large seafood entree, the mariscada. Loved loved loved it. Tried a bit of the huevos estrellados and almost collapsed. The fried potatoes and chorizo combination was amazing. Cant wait to dine here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster salad

OG0K6giFUgS9cyBIFDLUaA.text: I was very pleased by this place.  I came here with a friend for dinner, and we wanted to eat, but not stuff ourselves, and have a nice mix of flavors, but he was also on a low-carb diet.  It provided some great options for us.  The egg yolk ravioli were a lovely texture, creamy and crisp at the same time. Unctuous in the best possible way.  Really, these were for me, not the low carb person. The sauteed padron peppers were wonderful.  Mild with a little snap to the skin, and great salt on them. From the world of seafood, we got the gambas, the white ceviche, and the white anchovy filets.  The white anchovy was my favorite of these...if you haven't had Spanish anchovies, you should try them at least once... this isn't the over salted fish, but a rich, creamy flavor, with a touch of pickle.  The lamb chop was good, but I think the favorite of the night was the black pig pintxo.  That was a thin slice of heaven, and I'd have that again, despite the price.  All in all, it was what I wanted, though a touch on the pricey side, and I'll be back, especially if I want to eat light and have variety.

ufIp6W3o9ZC4vHatY5Vo0w.text: I love this place and go here every time I'm in Vegas.  It does get pricey but their tapas are intricate and delicious.  My favorite is the seafood Gazpacho that comes with a little ball filled with some gazpacho and bursts in your mouth when you bite it.  I also love their white asparagus dish, the lamp chops, and of course their manchego cheese sandwich with egg.  I can't wait to go back!

M772fFuHb8e1otVov1fqCw.text: The food was delicious, especially the chicken  skewers. Really good red sangria.  Service started out great but then they forgot about us halfway through  the meal.  Didn't  bring our last tapa until we asked about it. We wanted to order another drink and dessert but when nobody  checked back with us for 15 minutes we asked the hostess for the check and had dessert at another restaurant.

7i4o4aMrl10dUlyAOinuxw.text: Who doesn't love bite sized food? :) I have this theory that miniature versions of food always taste slightly better than their full sized parents (e.g., Minature Resse's Peanut Butter Cups).  Didn't someone say, "big things come in small packages?" :) Well, Julian Serrano might have, because he definitely took that phrase to heart and drove it home with his menu at his tapas (snacks, appetizers, finger foods) joint at the ARIA hotel.  I had been itching to check out the new City Center on the strip for quite some time.  I finally got a chance to make it out there and found myself ready for lunch.  To my dismay the majority of the restaurants I was interested in  weren't open until dinner.  So, after walking around and round I stumbled across Julian Serrano on my way out towards the shops.  Jackpot! It was open, there wasn't a line and it looked pretty :)   I didn't actually realize it was a tapas joint until we were seated.  The overall feel of the place already gets you excited! From the overly helpful staff equipped with various accents from different countries, to the beautiful artistic layout  and decor of the entire room.  Even though the restaurant is inside the actual Aria they used the space perfectly with almost no walls utilizing the high ceilings to give you that open airy feeling that just makes you look up and exhale with a smile.  The furniture is very modern and the lighting was shining perfectly dim (you know that lighting that let's you still see your food and makes your face look flawless...so FYI perfect date spot: quaint portions of really high quality good food, in a expensive looking place with great lighting that makes you look good...girls will love it, trust me)!  Now for the food...everything I tasted was pretty well...tasty and the plating was simple and clean.  I was fourtnate enough to order a lot and got a pretty good tasting of the menu.  My ORDER:  WILD MUSHROOM SOUP!!! WAS TO DIE FOR! I mean if I could I'd have it everyday...carry it in a camelbak I wear everywhere.  TUNA - RASPBERRY SKEWER...a must try just because the combination and presentation was pretty intriguing and the tuna was good quality.  WHITE CEVICHE...yummy with a good spicy kick.  STEAMED MUSSELS...just okay.  I love mussels so I've had my fair share but good amount for the price.  GRILLED ANGUS FLAT IRON STEAK...just okay too because I love steak so I'm picky when it comes to steak.  BEEF & CHEESE!!! MY TIE WITH 1ST FAVORITE (MUSHROOM SOUP)! So simple but packed with great flavor and texture.  I can't wait to go back and try some more great bites!  My only gripe was that I tried to order a seafood dish and pan manchego but they were all out.  I thought this was definitely poor management and a bad oversight to under order ingredients for a busy weekend.  But other than that...AWESOME!

X0ZR5VEvP0cZ57Z-QnKbww.text: They always find a way to get your money back in Vegas. This was how I gave them back my meager winnings and then some.   The waiter was nice and friendly, however, the food was bleh. Turns out tapas just meant "small portion." I was fine with that and begun to order everything that sounded tempting. If I remember correctly I had the seared ahi with some raspberry paste, lobster with micro pineapple, shrimp and fish ceviche, some steak, some ridiculous black forest ham that was double the price of the regular ham and a pitcher of Sangria. Honestly, the only thing I liked was the sangria and ceviche. Everything else was bleh or mediocre. The tuna and lobster was the absolute worst especially if you're a sushi lover.    2 stars for delicious sangria that got me nicely buzzed so I didn't mind paying 200 bucks for such a mediocre meal.

WDZFyYHyMFgR3nRUed3oDw.text: After walking around the new Aria Hotel and shops at the Crystals, Julian Serrano provided a fancy afternoon snack. The WHITE SANGRIA was delicious, as  was the CHEESE PLATTER and MIXED SEAFOOD CEVICHE.   Overall, this is nice restaurant is a nice hotel - nothing more, nothing less. We didn't stay for dinner, but I looked through the menu of mostly simple traditional Spanish tapas. This place is missing pizazz and needs more WOW-factor to make my Vegas hit list.

IIfuIUpaTf6Fyylf8OmkHg.text: The worst experience of my life at a restaurant !!!!!  Not only they took for ever to bring us food, the tapas were cold and all tasted the same. The paella never arrived, but the worst was when one of the waiters, banged my dad's head pretty hard and didn't even care to make sure he was ok!,,,the manager with a stupid smile on his face didn't do any better. Over all my worst ever specially with their over priced food!!!!

4EAhN-PfXIciFyh-MJVJJA.text: On a Thursday night at 7:15 pm, this restaurant was packed, but without a reservation, we were able to get seated immediately.  Julian Serrano's Picasso is one of our favorite Las Vegas dining treats, and we expected his signature tapas restaurant to live up to his reputation.  Unfortunately, we didn't have that same experience. First off, let me say that in a way comparing Julian Serrano to Picasso is like comparing apples and oranges . . . two totally different types of food, different dining styles, etc., but one would expect that the quality and service for each respective restaurant would be of the same caliber. This was certainly not the case.  Fortunately, we had a lovely couple seated at the table next to us who were very familiar with the tapas style. The own a Mexican restaurant in Texas. They were almost finished with their meal when we were seated, so we were able to ask them about their choices. According to them, they ordered half the menu just to taste everything!  We started with the Yellowtail "Tiradito" (sliced yellowtail with sweet potato haystacks, horseradish cream and ponzu sauce. It was a hit . . . We followed that with the Black Pig Pintxo (Iberian pork shoulder meat with caramelized onion). It was divine! As our main course we ordered the Mixed Paella which serves at least two -- mistake!  Our waiter had emphasized to "order the paella with your appetizers because it takes 40 minutes to prepare".  Imagine our surprise wWhen he brought it to the table BEFORE our appetizers; his excuse was that they had a large party and had already prepared enough in advance. I asked them to take it back so that we could eat our food in the order in which it was intended. When the paella did arrive, it must have been the same one he brought out 30 minutes prior. The rice was dry, the lobster chewy, the mussels over cooked . . . the only tasty thing among the ingredients was the Spanish pork chorizo that brought a little flavor to the dish. Seriously a miss!  Hubby ordered the pistachio dessert and said it was heavenly . . . so maybe consider coming her for dessert and coffee instead.  One five star element was the Drunken Cherry cocktail I ordered. It was one of the best cocktails I have ever had -- Effen Cherry vodka, acai, pomegranite and lime with a garnish of Spanish cherries soaked in brandy. Our waiter redeemed himself when he asked if he could bring me dessert, and I said, I'd love a few more of those cherries . . . and he brought a plateful!   I wouldn't say we had a bad experience here, just not as good as we expected.  Funny how the last two restaurants I've reviewed are sister restaurants of two of our Bellagio faves, and the Bellagio outlets are far superior!

dQjCKuBNFELRc41ivnOFXA.text: Let me start by saying I don't like tapas places.  I like the variety but always feel the portion size to price ratio leaves me hungry at the end of the meal.  Overall this is the best tapas place I have visited.  We tried many dishes and 2 paellas.   The oxtail and spicy meatballs, beef cap were great.   I didn't love the stuffed dates, but most people raved about them. The paella with rabbit was really good.  The squid ink paella was so-so.

toINPwlxNq4joze-OfCVaw.text: I've been here several times and they never disappoint. The tapas and creative combinations are delicious. A must try when you visit Las Vegas.

lHkz10ALhf0IdNv_JyiGIQ.text: I came here in a larger group for a birthday dinner and a positively amazing experience. We opted for a tasting course menu, where we able to taste several different plates. The staff was very attentive and the service was quick! My personal favorite item on the menu was the stuffed dates, delicious!! Everyone in my group loved our dinner experience and would recommend it to anyone! I hope to go back to Vegas soon and eat there again!

DSzRZ4jHJhTbq3Y4rG16Ow.text: Incredible food, incredible service. This was the best dining experience I had in Las Vegas. Food was sophisticated from a preparation and flavor perspective. We felt like we got  tremendous value.  Staff were courteous and professional.  As a reference, my worst dining experience was Bouchon.

nni1hc2fHkKl6YIEXwYHaA.text: We love tapas, we are obsessed with finding great tapas because you can taste many different dishes at one time. We are here today and we were disappointed. Most of the tapas we ate were amazing; the octopus, wild mushroom soup were outstanding. The oxtail was dry bummer, but the most disappointing thing was the main dish The paella; the rice was undercooked, the seafood was overcooked and it was overall dry. This is one of their signature dishes and it was jus not up to standards :(

eTShq76aBFmO-m7aI9Fcvg.text: First time at the Aria hotel and decided to come here for dinner. Snazzy place with a nice bar and a couple flat screens TVs to watch any sports games.   Tried the flat iron steak, lobster/pineapple appetizer and marinera paella. The steak was amazing, the lobster dish was interesting (pineapple to lobster ratio was too much) and the paella was okay. The menu says that the paella takes 30-35 minutes to make and ours took way longer than that.. I was thinking that this had to be the bombest paella ever, but it wasn't. It was good, but not great. It had lots of seafood in it and flavor but it was a bit soggy and I got some grains of rice that were a bit underdone.   I've had better tapas for the amount of money spent, so if you can, venture off somewhere that will give you your moneys worth.

3qjPTXpW2yRWboUWcIzk3A.text: Meh.  This was a culinary let down.  I'm a fan of Tapas and here is what I thought.  Pretty expensive for what you get and really nothing that special.  Nice staff and atmosphere - hip, fun Stuffed dates - fry oil past it's prime ? Lamb Chop - Very Fatty, half raw. Lobster Salad - really good. Olives - they're olives. White anchovy - very salty Potato/Onion Gratin - so salty it was stupid  So, not so amazing.  I think Serrano of Picasso fame is a great chef, but Serrano was just average Tapas.

-4gSWRCRY3iqsnsqllEpQQ.text: We had the ahi tuna and raspberry skewers and thought they were amazing!  Not many people seem to be a fan, but I loved the unique combination of flavors.  We also ordered the gazpacho because I'm obsessed with it, and this dish did not disappoint!  The best part was this parmasean cheese ball with yumminess inside!  We were trying to share it, so I cut it in half which made it difficult to eat but did not detract from the yummy sauce inside.  We had a couple other non-memorable things but we were still not full.  My boyfriend luckily asked the waiter what he would recommend.  The mussles.  Oh.  Em.  Gee.  The best $9 I didn't spend!  I swear the pot  they brought out with the mussles in a most scrumptious sauce was bottomless.  We must have each had at least 15 mussles.  What a deal!    The decor is bright and whimsical and I want to tile my future kitchen in those same exact colors!

oD3DDe-VQz6xRBuSXqYb8g.text: What a great meal. My favorite was the tuna cones. The whitefish ceviche was excellent as well. I am not a local but if I was I would come back to try more dishes.

FCfk_oJbEQkotAVokzrasA.text: im a little apprehensive on giving this place 4 stars - it should be more like 3.6* because of the hair i found in my spanish tortilla (which was quickly resolved) but the food is simple and delicious  the service is quick and friendly we ordered the seafood fried rice, sandwich with a hole in the middle, steak and brie open face, mariscada, sauteed baby spinach, gambas, huevos estrellado, tuna raspberry skewer all were very well seasoned

mdQFyxnAG-4zdo1m-bPvpA.text: Overrated and moderately overpriced.  Paella is okay but nothing special - somewhat bland and more soupy than it should be.  The tapas are definitely fully-priced for what you get, and again, the ones we had were just okay.  The manchego was $10, memory serving, for two small slices of bread topped with two very thin slices of cheese; my friend made a comment about this.  The croquettes were okay but again, all in all, this place is not really worth recommending and especially not when there are plenty of other alternatives in Las Vegas.  So it's not bad, and the service was very good, but I'm Spanish and took my friends there to have some authentic food and we all left moderately disappointed.

uyGuRGdFVTxqNaKs4LGEQQ.text: Delicious food, great atmosphere. It was just loud, we had a hard time hearing one another. Small portions!!!!!

6LAWaXA9qOKhaoa-igQg8A.text: I went to JS at City Center with great expectations. But alas, the food did not match the lovely hip decor, great colors, and even JS on the plates. When I order serrano ham, I expect it to be paper thin-like see through-delicate and light like lace, cut from a beautiful ham mounted in a prominent plac, like  at a great tapas bar in Spain. It was thick and cluncky, too bad. The Gambas description was wonderful, but far too few herbs and garlic to be a credible dish. The white anchovies were good, but served on enormous boat-like toast pieces- two small anchovy filets total--come on. The waitress recommended an avocado-wrapped cigar like roll with smoked salmon and other things inside--interesting only. That's enough. This restaurant should be kickin, should be packed and lively with people. Doubt I'll return anytime soon.

KhZfDjSAfo75Bxm9PF_M7g.text: We got in to Aria late and decided to have a light dinner.  Everything was great, service, food, decor.  Husband and I had 5 dishes between us and everyone was great.  Our waiter helpful and friendly and the support staff equally so.

XU_Z_fYWLdoat9t-Mpfr-A.text: I have eaten here probably 5 times, and the food has been really good every time, and so has the service. Don't let the fact that it is in the lobby slow you down... once you're inside it doesn't really feel like a lobby restaurant. I really like the broad menu... and the paellas are GREAT!

PNhuEo5F4e6KBBsJ_Ko9sQ.text: Julian Serrano Tapas is an excellent restaurant inside Aria. The staff is extremely friendly and the food is delicious. The menu is filled with classic Spanish fare. Our party truly enjoyed the Valenciana tapas as well as the ahi tuna tempura.

Cj55M-_7ZobSeWGHy2s7_A.text: Question:  Is tapas Spanish for diarrhea?  Terrible experience.  Charged for bar nuts and seeded olives.  Awful servicer, recommended shittiest items (assuming) on the menu.  Chef ran out of all seasoning and herbs other than salt.  Charged for extra order of bone-in ceviche which was not requested.  Misery of experience long lasting.  Save yourself discomfort and dine at Sage, directly across the hall.

6NX2EDq-3gVBDUUXTWH7Vw.text: Our late lunch at Julian Serrano was great.  We had a nice waitress made great tapas recommendations.  The red sangria was yummy.  All of the tapas were great but my favs were fresh calamari a la plancha, albondigas, white ceviche, and pintxo de chorizos.  Pricey, like all nice Vegas restaurants, but I would still come back.

OCtMN1XjA2b5dCrl0u6-MA.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary in Las Vegas and wanted to take our friends out for a special dinner (we love tapas!), and we were not disappointed with the tapas or the restaurant. When making reservations, I requested a table away from the entrance (it opens up to the hotel floor, and I wanted to have a little more privacy and intimacy). We were seated at the very back of the restaurant, and our waiter was very good. As soon as we were seated, I ordered two paella dishes (Mixed and Valenciana)--I am allergic to shrimp so we opted out of the Marinera), since they take 45 minutes or so from the time you place the order. I asked that as we ordered the tapas, they come out slowly. I did not want to feel rushed. There were nine of us, and I also asked that as we order dishes, they are set up so that enough of us could sample each dish (meaning that if I order sliders, perhaps bring out two or three of the dishes--not just one dish with two sliders). Looking back, I realize this wasn't communicated very well. We ordered twelve tapas (vegetarian, meats, seafood, new style), and everyone was pleased with all of them. My only wish was that they weren't coming out so fast and that there were more on the plate to try, but the red sangria was fabulous and that kept coming! The paella was served tableside to us since the dishes were so large for the table. The lobster and mussels were excellent, but again, not enough to go around or it was that half the table was served the lobster, and the other half had none. We ended up cutting things up and redistributing plates so all could try things, but again, I wish there had been more seafood in the dish. Also, the paella seemed very wet to me. It wasn't one of my favorite paellas that I have tried (others at the table raved about it though). The cost of the tapas and paella along with the rush of serving them is what gives this restaurant a "very good" rating. It is expensive, but so is all of Las Vegas! I wouldn't not go to Julian Serrano for tapas but since I have already been, I will just try another tapas restaurant when visiting Las Vegas.

X63ib37wtMwbCw1pavyL2Q.text: Ordered three plates: (1) yellowtail "tiradito" - very good (loved the fried string sweet potatoes with it. The portion was very small (only three pieces), (2) white ceviche - decent, but had better, (3) Heirloom tomato salad with mozzarella ice cream- tasty.  Overall, the food is good, but portion is very small and it's pricey. I know it's a tapas place, but I've had bigger portions at other tapas place.

k3oYg6kusnDt3Q6FSGWgMw.text: I absolutely love the happy hour here.  They have a very nice selection of half price tapas and sangrias which makes it easy to try a number of different things without spending too much.  Love the chicken croquettes and the stuffed piquillo peppers but especially the bacon wrapped figs.  The convenient location right off the casino floor makes it a must do for us every time we visit the Aria.

s1wpfEJLgPCkjjJv98893Q.text: I was reluctant to believe the reviewer who reported food poisoning, and so we eagerly ate at Julian Serrano. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner -- the food was great and so was the service. Then I got sick the next day. And 3 days later, I'm still not able to enjoy eating. As good as that may be for my waistline, it's a pretty serious indictment of the food storage and prep at this restaurant. The food may be wonderful, but if it makes me sick, I'll never visit again.

U7drMUCjkYUOB8eISbHtVg.text: good stuff ;) Suckling pig, jamon bellota, good selection of wine, good service... Satisfied :)

F9kcYbc1XhEtYfhq3UFlmA.text: I believe this is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, for now. In a 3 day stay, I ate here everyday, for dinner one night and lunch the other two. The food was delectable and I wanted to eat more and more. If you go, make sure to try the scallops and the lobster-bisque soup; both are very excellent. The service could be a tad more attentive, but were still friendly and prompt. The decor is fabulous, a very warm yet modern approach to Spanish ambiance. The constant stream of people going by is a little distracting (since it is a "open-air" restaurant), but the delicious food and drinks makes up for it. This is a new restaurant not to miss. The Breakdown- Food-10/10  Decor-9/10 Service-8/10 Price-A tad pricey for frugal diners, but worth it Overall Experience-9/10

EX9VKxxub-x9KgREyKnT2w.text: Absolutely.  Fantastic.  Appetizers.   My wife and I decided to do a food crawl through Las Vegas the night we got in (a la Betheney, for all you BGM fans).  We stopped at Julian Serrano first and completely destroyed our concept of a food crawl.  My pregnant wife was tired from flying in that day and walking around and wasn't too stoked at the 30 min wait for a table.  The wonderful manager brought a comfy chair out from the back office for her to sit in and personally secured and escorted us to a table as soon as space was available.  Awesome!  The menu is massive, and covers a range of traditional and modern interpretations of tapas.  It's pricey, but you are paying for ambience, the name, and the location.  The food is good, the service is good, and we kept ordering small plates becuase we didn't want to go anywhere else!

_JNMDHZBFeud0cMSGgXlfg.text: Went here with yelper Evan T so this review might seem redundant, but seriously WTF? Yes, this place had been open for a mere week before we choose it as our dining destination, but if your gonna open up in Vegas, you better have your shit together. There are tons of casinos/hotels/restaurants doing things the right way, just copy and paste. JS failed to do that. Three hungry dudes and tapas should have been a perfect match right? Wrong. The food was extremely forgettable, with the worst item being the one recommended to us by our server, the overcooked lobster with canned pineapple skewer. As unmemorable as the food was, the service is not something I will forget. I am convinced we either never saw our waiter or he wasnt working that night, as the gentleman who we kept having to flag down was gracious enough to take our orders but had to keep reminding us that he was not our waiter.  20 minutes after being presented with dessert menus someone returned to ask us what we would like. "20 minutes ago we wanted dessert, now we just want the check." Perhaps this place will work out the kinks over time, but ill let you figure that out since plan never to return.

maAmNX5Dw6mXovewEZ7cCw.text: really 50/50  some of the small plates rocked like a mofo - ceviche, stuffed piquillo peppers, stuffed dates, seared scallop  some were just odd , boring or bad (pan machego and the tuna with molecular raspberry, for example)  the service at the bar was not great - the bartender apologized for being busy (but at the time of delivering the check) which rang hollow.  we did have to fight for drinks, and the pacing was awful (i.e. all 7 or 8 dishes appeared at once and we were fumbling to eat everything  good option if you are staying here - but don't come out of your way for it.

7Ss-xRnhWSFyXAPh0NCP_A.text: It was okay. Not the best, not the worst.  I was expecting something nicer.  I found that most of the tapas were too salty.

gtVWYMCMJildZcBJox7b9Q.text: I hate to be a downer but this is potentially one of the most overrated places in Vegas.  It's packed so you have to wait a while which is fine. And I know tapas, but this tapas isn't anything to brag about.  Smaller than small plate portions for outrageous prices and slow - slow - slow service.  Our server would bring out 1 plate and bring another plate 15 to 20 minutes later; mind you, all plates were ordered at the same time.  it would have been nice taking more than 2 bites every quarter hour.  And honestly the food was not as flavorful as I would have liked; very under-seasoned.  Convenient factor is the only thing going for this place.  Honestly I wouldn't bother.

i9-H-M3bZ5-wyFLeJf5XQQ.text: We stayed at the Aria for 4 nights and ended up here for lunch twice. The happy hour menu (11:30am - 5:30pm) offers 3 types of sangria (red, white, bubbly) for $5 and a good selection of tapas for $6-$9. They also offer items from the regular menu, but since paella takes 45 to 60 mins, we didn't end up trying. A few stand out dishes:  Black rice - this is the best dish of the house. Black rice is creamy, with that distinct mild sweet seafood taste that you only get from squid ink. The calamari on top is grilled to perfection. Even my husband who doesn't usually like squid ink loved this dish! We ordered it both times we were here. Spanish chicken croquettes - crunch on the outside, savory and creamy on the inside. Good pick for hangover. Gambas - it's hard to go wrong with sauteed garlic shrimp. Tuna cones - tuna tartare in a cute little cone. I do wish they mixed the avocado dip with the tuna a little bit more. The dip was all at the bottom of the cone so it made the last bite a bit lacking (in tuna). Pintxo de chorizos - I didn't expect much from this dish but was really pleasantly surprised by how light the chorizos' texture was  Other dishes we tried: Brava potatoes - a bit too tomato saucy for my taste. It was practically drowning in sauce. Yellowtail "tiradito" - the filo dough provided an interesting contrast in texture, flavor was a bit lacking though. Beets salad - the mix of cooked and fresh beet in the salad was rather refreshing. It's a pretty big plate for tapas size. Sauteed padron peppers - the orange zest and glaze in this dish kinda ruined it for me. It was meant to brighten the dish but just didn't compliment the dish at all. Would it been perfect if it was just grilled and salted. Sometimes less is more.  Overall, this is definitely a fun and tasty spot of lunch. Would love to go back the next time we are in Vegas and try more dishes!

r8hItw5HK-CojXvwf-0jig.text: Great place to try in Vegas if you're into tapas or if you want to try for the first time.  Recommend to order light to begin with, as the tapas (usually two pieces) do stretch further than you'd think and you can always order more.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l4t1QVV5oMyl01I7M7OBXw.text: So get my money on time, if they not money, decline I just can't worry 'bout no haters, gotta stay on my grind Now tell me, who that, who that? That do that, do that? Put that paper over all, I thought you knew that at...JULIAN SERRANO! - Iggy Azalea (fancy)  I would normally never intentionally wait 40 mins for a paella in Vegas (where time is money). Since it was Labor Day weekend, we had more time and because I've walked by this place so many times, we finally decided to try this place for a late lunch. Most of the tapas were strong in flavor, including the steak, but the seafood paella stole the show. The lobster, clams, mussels, and shrimp all blended in together and its a dish we would never be able to replicate correctly at home so bravo! Dessert was also yummy.  I'd recommend a paella and 2-3 tapas a person and you're good to go for a pleasant dining experience!

bAd_-cPcZNsVfhFgNC0XLw.text: We were in Las Vegas for my friend's bachelorette party, and we decided to have one of the dinners here. I must say - the food did not disappoint. It's a cute little restaurant, with no walls - so it's open to the hotel lobby and walkway.   Food:  -Spanish Tortilla - Would pass on this next time  -Queso Fresco - would order again  -Coca vegetarian - indifferent  -creamy risotta - so delicious :)  -Papas serranas - eh; would pass on this next time  -Brava potatoes - yum yum yum!!!!  -Asparagus a la plancha - yum! I love asparagus :)  -Cheese platter - delicious, variety of cheeses! Very good :)   Overall, everyone was very satisfied with all the food. Well left full, but not over-stuffed. The food was light, unique and flavorful! Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas!

gV-yHAwPUvN1eA2G_umadQ.text: So disappointed in my glass of red Sangria tonight, delicious but naked, with no fruit adornment, just one measley raspberry floating.  What happened to the beautiful Apple slices? The Sangria I remembered from a few years back was beautifully presented in a larger glass.  The octopus was the tiniest portion ever but moist & perfectly cooked, potatoes accompanied it & were a bit boring but again, perfectly cooked.  3 stars for this visit, will visit again soon.

j5s9ce9PHFkhHCnBwlulqw.text: I'm not usually a big fan of tapas. I feel like it usually ends up being super expensive and I never feel satisfied.  However, at Julian Serrano, I'm glad I was able to sample a variety of dishes and I was pleased with everything we got.  Our party of 4 got 9 tapas:  -Paella: I forget which one, but it had pork ribs in it -Spicy Bomba -Grilled Calamari -Ribeye -Serrano Ham -Lobster Salad -Shrimp Ceviche -Chorizo -I forget the last one.  I was pleasantly full after the paella came at the end.  The menu said it takes 45-60 min to prepare, but if they're not busy, it's more like 30 min.  Service could've been better.

3QfUJRHnvzrKPylTFezkPA.text: Soooo, beautiful restaurant.  Otherwise, meh...  We ordered two dishes as a snack before a show - the Apple Fois Gras and Stuffed Dates.  The duck was good, but tiny - like the size of a dollar coin on the entire $18 plate.  The dates were good but you get 3 for $11.  It was depressing, but great portions if you're anorexic.  I've had high quality tapas, like The Iberian Pig in Decatur, GA, but this was not a good price for the moderate quality.

TKaKE5fQuuh2dilJQUs4Rw.text: So disappointing. Food was below average. Glasses were dirty and servers seemed overworked and over it.

FK44wjOhNvVqJuhZxVOsWw.text: My third time here and it's just as good the first time ... Oh Julian, you make me crave like a crack whore wanting another hit cause Shit I'm still thinking about it the next morning. The rush of flavors and texture mix together on those small over priced plates .... Oooooooh, getting goose bumps thinking about how you slave away in the kitchen making Magic.   That last thought sounds a little Gay but who needs girls when I have your Tapas ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good ....
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HJcJbhEw0G1JUg_fMgzufw.text: This place was great! It's an open restaurant in the Aria hotel. It's not overly formal.   We went the tapas route for dinner. We got the Spanish tortilla, salmon with truffle, mushroom risotto, fried calamari, ahi cones, brava potatoes, white ceviche, cheese platter, and the veggie paella. The paella takes 40-60 minutes so if you know you want it order it when you sit down. We got the two person paella and it was plenty for four of us given the amount of food we ordered.   My favorite dishes? I LOVED the mushroom risotto. I would order that as a main meal if they had it. The salmon, ceviche, ahi cones, and potatoes were also really good. I should have ordered some hot sauce for the paella. It needed a little pick me up, but was still good.   For dessert we got the churros and flan. The churros were not overdone. They were nice and soft. The flan was great! It had a little bit of a floral undertone to it. I liked it a lot.

y15OZlHjCBdTDVBMy-V2bA.text: An undecided group of coworkers, a date, a business meeting, casual meal, or just any occasion, this place is variety without going to a place like the cheesecake factory.  The atmosphere is trendy, the food is fusion with some authentic mixed in.  The presentation is all on par for a pleasant upscale experience.  My favorite, the Apple Foie Gras.  Downside...not an enclosed restaurant.  Faces the casino.  I understand why..visibility=publicity.  DT

9Jb3ApKehUZ0Pw7EzSUsog.text: We started with the lobster salad and oxtail for starters. Next we ordered the mixta paella. The appetizers were extraordinary!!!!  The paella was the best we ever had. It was cooked and served in a cast iron pan The flavors were unique and so delicious !! We can't wait to come back.

lLbM4woHr0Fovo78CMsHNA.text: I was a bit disappointed with this first try of Seranno's tapas restaurant in Aria although the food was very good.  It was the service that was somewhat off.  I decided before I went to try the signature tasting menu--four courses with choices in each section.    First course was a choice of a salad or Castilian soup.  I ordered the soup.  My server came back in a short time to tell me they no longer have that soup, and she showed me a menu from which I could choose from three different dishes.  I opted for the Lobster gazpacho.  The server then said, "You know that's cold, don't you?"  Do I look that much like a rube? (that's rhetorical!)  The gazpacho was excellent.  Great tomato flavor and there were several pieces of tasty lobster.  Course two was the creamy risotto with wild mushrooms and manchego cheese.  The risotto was very flavorful and very enjoyable!  For the third course, I chose the Crispy chicken breast roulada with sauteed potatoes, pork chorizo, and roasted red pepper.  Very tasty!  Finally, I was allowed to order anything off their dessert menu rather than choose from the two choices on the tasting menu.  I chose the molten chocolate cake, with orange jelly and blood orange sorbet.  I didn't taste any orange jelly.  The sorbet was sitting on top of some chopped mango.  The cake and the sorbet were very tasty.  It's nice they allow you to choose any dessert because they're all the same price.  As for the service, aside from the question about gazpacho mentioned above, I was enjoying the risotto and was not yet finished with it when the server brought the chicken roulada and placed it along side the risotto.  It's not like the place was crowded and they were moving the guests out quickly.  Shouldn't a server check before they bring out a dish like this?  My iced tea was not refilled until it was time to order dessert.  It should have been much sooner.  I wonder why a tapas place like this bothers with a tasting menu.   The dinner was good but it wasn't something that caused me to think that I had to return to this restaurant.  There are too many other places.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The molten chocolate oozing out.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Molten chocolate cake.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken breast roulada.

zGtqlbfwtF31UZcUvcBNjA.text: Marinera and Pintxo De Chorizos!! Minus one star for the Salmon with truffle...as much as the name and description sound amazing, I would not order this again. The salmon was cooked a bit too much that it was dry. I couldn't taste the truffle either. However, the Marinera paella and Pintxo De Chorizo is very good!! The paella is more than enough for two people. The broth/sauce was very flavorful and you can really taste the seafood. The rice was cooked perfectly. Not mushy at all and not too hard. The Pintxo De Chorizo was amazing. I'm not a big fan of sweet dishes (aside from dessert) but the honey is not overpowering and compliments the potato & chorizo very well.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marinera
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pintxo de chorizos
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with truffle

Rwtegwpn7FE1awck70EbIQ.text: We decided to eat here last minute. We were a party of four and were seated immediately. The restaurant is open to the Aria so it's quite loud. The seating is tight. I would say the ambiance is left lacking because of that.   This is a tapas restaurant (we love tapas). Basically you order several small plates and share the items around the table. They also have entrees if you don't like that, but that kind of takes the point out of going to tapas.   What we tasted: *White Ceviche, fresh white fish, red onion, rocoto pepper, cilantro, lime juice: I thought this was good, not super flavorful, but fresh tasting.  *Stuffed Piquillo Peppers, goat cheese, mushrooms: We all liked these quite a bit.  *Stuffed Dates,medjol dates, goat cheese, crispy pancetta, tomato marmalade: these little guys were delicious.  *Beef And Cheese,prime tenderloin, cheese, honey, walnuts: this was our favorite. We actual ordered a second order of this.  *Pan Manchego,toasted bread, fresh garlic tomato sauce, one-year-old manchego cheese: as good as it sounds.   We enjoyed a delicious bottle of Pinot noir suggested to us by the sommelier that visited our table. I would say he was the best part of our meal. He knew the wine list and was extremely knowledgable about wine itself. We love wine and greatly appreciated his expertise.   As a whole I would not rate this as the best tapas restaurant we have visited. The menu did not appeal to me greatly, however I was able to find items I enjoyed. The atmosphere is a wee bit too loud for me. I don't think we choose to eat here again, but am not disappointed we tried it.

YnGPliSK9GE5HQwklATdyw.text: Came in for a quick bite after a long day at the office and was pleasantly surprised. This was my first foray into the Spanish tapas in Vegas and it was very positive.  I started off with the red sangria and that helped kick off my experience (very good btw). I first ordered the jamon croquetas. Nothing to write home about but good. I then had the spicy bomb which was delicious. Portion size was excellent and rocoto flavors and presentation was superb and not too hot. I capped off my meal with the gambas which were amazing. The brava sauce was so good I had to consume it all and gambas were large and tasted very fresh, by far my favorite dish. I will definitely be coming back the next time in Vegas. Review is a 4.5 star since I expected more out of the jamon croquetas.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Gambas!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy bomb

NHW-kaynOFfrTxIrPgqndw.text: My apologies for getting around to this review after 3 trips to Julien Serrano. The first time we went was awesome. The highlights were the octopus and the yellowtail tiradito tapas. Both outstanding dishes with bold flavors and great attention to detail. These dishes are not easy to prepare at all.  Unfortunately the second time we visited was not as good. There was a lack of detail to the preparation, which was surprising given how detail oriented Chef Serrano is. Especially after seeing his guest judge role on top chef. After an email to management I come to find out that their executive chef took some liberties to the dishes and was recently no longer part of the staff.  Fast forward recently, my wife and I went back after management guaranteed a much better experience. First off, Manager Min absolutely took care of us for the day. He apologized for the prior experience and got us our favorite dishes. The octopus and yellowtail were up to par. Unfortunately the creamy risotto was not "creamy" enough and a bit too al dente. We did try the tuna cones which were delicious and playful. Min comped our dessert and we tried the churros with the spicy hot chocolate. That dessert was worth going back for again. The spicy hot chocolate is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros with spicy hot chocolate
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Cones
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus over potatoes with Spanish paprika

Mx7L5ChmyQVtWCxk2yGobA.text: A great place for late night tapas. Come grab a quick bite. Desserts are great. Our Waiter PEDRO WAS AMAZING so attentive and acommedating. Our best Waiter in our 1 week stay in Las Vegas.

-2h9iIEuTADL5KFCQpUpDA.text: What a wonder; my daughter and I love tapas.  There were no disappointments here; every aspect was top notch and reasonable for Vegas.  Highly recommend the Potatoes Bravas, Chicken Croquettes, and both sausage dishes.  Would go back in a heartbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best meals I have ever had in Vegas!

N-HdgeSaf9nwbovwHtkiBw.text: Was in Vegas for a work conference at Aria. Made reservations for 15 here a month or so in advanced. They called ahead to confirm and had everything ready when we got there. It's really convenient if you are staying at the Aria, Cosmo or any casino nearby. Had a couple drinks at the bar while waiting for the whole party - bartenders were friendly and attentive.  Now...for the dinner. We got the Chef's tasting for all of us along with some wine and cocktails. Ummm BEST decision ever - the food was amazing. There were around 6-7 sharable dishes and 3 types of desserts at the end. I have to say that EVERYTHING was amazing. Some of my particular favorites were the scallops, short rib, risotto and oxtail. For dessert, the Churros and almond cake were...amazing.   I really think this is one of the best restaurants I've tried. The food is super flavorful and inventive. I literally closed my eyes and said "MMMM" several times during the meal. It's a great dining experience for a group - I love variety and sharing plates...makes it a great group experience. Will DEFINITELY go back when I'm Vegas. I am drooling just thinking about it.

IpT39qLNeDCP0DVHp_GNBw.text: The food was ok but the customer service was awful we had to wait 40 minutes to get tea because the server forgot.  it was our anniversary and the server never showed up to ask how we were doing not recommend it at all expensive with super bad service

oxiz0_9dxDZFhEPZDjhW5g.text: I brought a large group of non-English speakers with no previous exposure to Spanish cuisine. Giving out waiter limited instructions (no pork :( and bring about 40 small plates).  Despite the crime of not ordering pork at a Spanish resteraunt, we had a fantastic dining experience. The food came in perfectly paced and paired batches. Every dish was delicious. The recommended wine was similarly delightful.

TiMUmDnsIpIlu1UjPm4MAQ.text: Julian Serrano's in the Aria adopts a winning combination. Great service, great food and amazing cocktails.  The Patatas Bravas were a definite stand out, chugged down with a couple of glasses of Sangria.  Just managed to beat the rush as we didn't have a reservation, but got noticeably busier from 8pm onwards. Bar staff were incredibly attentive, an all round pleasant experience.

prw9tSI5JIbbb5puT2Fmxg.text: Had a wonderful meal with my husband. Our wait staff made sure we had time to get to our show on time.  They were gracious and I enjoyed my first absinthe experience.

EyBLErdhxOE_9p3xX-ZXmQ.text: Came here Saturday night for my sisters bachelorette party. The service was excellent, food was yummy and the whole experience was top notch. We sampled all sorts of yummy stuff - my favorite was the mixed seafood ceviche and the lamb special. The prices were not too outrageous considering the location and when a dish we ordered arrived super late after we had already finished eating the server graciously took it off our bill. I would highly recommend this place, you can't go wrong, it was delicious and super fun inside.

VP4e2jZlvwBXGsAb0cA_dw.text: Many reviews have been written about this restaurant already so I'll just say that the service was excellent and comment on the dishes we tried:  Stuffed peppers: excellent Salmon with truffle: excellent Gambas; Horrible Chicken croquettes: good but not great Serrano ham on tomato bread: outstanding  Steak with Brie: good but not great  I would definitely go back though.

mtfYssCPJJz0pcaaEsUWOA.text: I really wanted to like this place.  I've stayed at Aria a few times and always pass by this restaurant, but this time... I decided to give it a try.  I read the warnings from other Yelpers about the tapas being small and expensive.  We weren't that hungry, so we had dinner here.  What can I say... not my thing.  Way too fufu.  We ordered the brava potatoes, gambas, short rib, rabo te toro (oxtail), and lobster saffron.  She had a white sangria and I went with the red.  Everything (including the sangria) was bland.   The potatoes... I've had better from Ore-Ida.  A little crispy, but hardly any sauce... so it was a bowl of potatoes with virtually no seasoning.  The gambas (shrimp) were ok.  The short rib dish had the most flavor, but there just wasn't enough of it.  The oxtail was wrapped in iberico and... I couldn't get past the texture.  Way too chewy.  Finally, the lobster dish was so small (and unremarkable) that... we quickly asked for the bill.  We left hungry.  The only other time that's happened to me... Melting Pot.  Oh well... at least I tried it.

oDuHlr7QJL3_KSyJ9NUHrQ.text: Modern,chic decor and friendly wait staff. Completely tapas style menu and extensive cocktail ,wine & apertif selection. Black pork pintxo is a Iberian pork shoulder with carmelized onion on toast, bruschetta style but was rare, with bright pink through middle. Gamey to the taste buds. Then the mixed paella consisted of lobster,mussels,a very tasty Smokey chorizo, chicken & saffron rice....arborio rice wasnt cooked throughly & light salt gave understated flavor. Black rice with squid ink was surprisingly delicious & squid was tender & flavored to perfection. Gambas a la plancha was impressive whole prawns with garlic & lemon, essence of shrimp all the way through. Octopus served atop thick sliced blanched potatoes with paprika was disappointing at best. Flan for dessert n fried donut balls were mediocre. Overall didn't live up to the hype of chef Serrano.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black pork poncho?
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black rice with lobster,squid ink

eSSoNougrNXf6kwq6EIT4Q.text: We choose this place based on all the  4-5 star reviews from Yelp.  I am only giving it 3 stars based on what we ate.  I do believe we DID order the wrong things and didnt really get a good taste of the restaurant.    We ordered 5 tapas plates: Lobster Pineapple Sticks (just ok, nothing special)  Ahi Tuna Tempura (great!!! Delicious) Fried Calamari (gross!!! Lacking flavor in the calamari and the aioli) Egg Ravioli (looks good but not what I expected) Seared Scallops (perfectly done and well seasoned.  Delicious!)   I'm a big fan of food and I love to try new places.  I was excited to try Julian Serrano but I'm afraid this place doesn't live up to the great expectations.  I did expect more but i have to agree with what another fellow Yelper said, she also gives it a "solid 3 stars."  I left disappointed and still hungry!!!  Be forewarned, the portions are SMALL!!!

5Ud05YkrNAcflIWi1Tof7w.text: Love this place. MANY items to choose from. We opted for tapas instead of large dishes but next time we'll be trying a paella (be aware it takes 40 minutes to prepare if you order one). we had: -croquettas (probably the best thing we had. just delicious sweetness. They have a happy hour where you can buy them for $4 instead of $10) -gambas (basically shrimp in a spicy sauce....the one dish i could have gone without. The shrimp seemed overcooked and dry....and that's even with the sauce) -calamari (my wife had this and loved it. I'm not a huge calamari guy so i passed. She's very picky about calamari and thought it was a solid dish) -bombas (pork and beef meatball. Be aware these are SPICY. Delicious though. And the sauces? please. I still have dreams about it) -pistachio tart dessert (omg....this was so much better than we expected it to be. you MUST try it. it's not even like a tart. It's more like a very thin cake. Just incredible. I could have eaten 4 more.  Definitely worth a try. There were maybe 10 other things we wanted to try. It would be a perfect place to try with a big group because you could try almost everything on the menu.

m1BmpkWH0QPZOAQ54xmrmA.text: Holy mother of all things sacred...  This was excellent.  We arrived for an 8:00pm reservation, but couldn't be seated until after 8:30.  While that wasn't too cool, there were eight of us, so you have to be patient.  We were headed to NY-NY for a show at 10:00 so we had to be quick.  I have to admit I was nervous about making our show.  We told the waiter and he said, "let me just start bringing dishes".  We trusted him and he didn't let us down.    We had an amazing selection of worldly flavors.  From the appetizers to mains, then desserts, i didnt have anything that I wouldn't order again.  My favorite had to be the lamb chops, no wait the beef and brie, no wait - who knows, it was all so good.    While it was a bit pricey, I think you have to expect to pay for good food and good service, especially in Vegas.

6yoBznCC9dOAN93r6ajXJg.text: 3.5 stars   This place would be getting less than 3 stars if I actually paid to eat here.  Servings are really small for some of the dishes and price is not cheap.  But since I didn't have to foot the bill, I could just enjoy the food without worrying about cost.  Everything we had was pretty decent.  Some standouts though included:  Black pig pintxo Tuna cones Huevos estrellados - this was amazing. Huge serving of fries + chorizo + egg on top - it's the perfect drunk food! Salmon with truffle  The service was spotty.  Our party ordered risotto and an order of tuna cones that never arrived.  Our server also recommended 2-3 dishes per person, but I think we ended up needing around 4 dishes/person to get full.  Dining ambiance:  pretty terrible.  It was later in the evening (around 8pm), and the place was packed.  Noise level was out of control.  It was hard to even hear the person sitting next to you.  Shouting at your dining companions never makes for a fun time.  I'd come back if, again, I didn't have to pay.. hehe.  The main draw of this place is that it's right on ground level by the front door... so it's convenient.  Also, you can probably get in during primetime without making reservations.  But taking cost into consideration, there are much better places to eat in Vegas.

fU3hUgi14qwVswek_Ow4_w.text: Amazing service. Food was out right away. Everything was so delicious. Restaurant is gorgeous. Get 2-3 items per person as everything is small plates. Will be back here for sure!

qt7Y_QugF71IwAqqSvYGJw.text: I had a very good experience at this place.  The tapas selection at this place made me feel like I was having a big meal, but overall, did not overstuff me!  There was 3 of us, and they recommend for each person to get 2 to 3 tapas per person.    Huevos Estrellados (So Good! Perfectly fried eggs on top of chorizo and crispy fries!) Pan Tomate (Pretty Standard, good tomato flavor and crisp bread) Fried Calamari (Thick cut calamari, not thin and crispy) Traditional Spanish Chicken Croquetas (Bechamel Sauce = Too Die) Stuffed Dates (Sweet and Savory!) Ahi Tuna Tempura ( Cooked just right, wasabi foam, a great touch) Churros(Just get them, eat them all and drink the rest of the dipping chocolate!)  Pedro our server was really nice and helpful too!  I would ask for him if he is available.

tT7Q3CfZjHoI6HCGhYi3Ug.text: Even though this is a beautiful venue with nice service, the food is supremely overrated. I am in full support of splurging for good food but there wasn't anything special about the food to warrant the cost. I had the ceviche, mussels, and paella. Each of the dishes were disappointingly bland despite the fact that they were described similarly to how the dishes are prepared in authentic Spanish restaurants. The only thing I found to be surprisingly unique was the sangria. Unfortunately, that's all my tummy walked away feeling satisfied with. Also, keep in mind that this is a tapas restaurant so the portions are tiny (smaller than typical tapas servings). If you insist on eating here for the beautiful experience/ ambience, be sure to order accordingly.

IAkUIdRnNQIQzfYga1Z0Rw.text: Had dinner here at the bar. Fantastic decor with a very airy open bar.  Went back 2 year later with girlfriends for a late lunch. This place rocks. The food is tasty, the drinks are innovative and the ambiance is energetic.

Nwm4u_T62SYyFNoEb50DHw.text: Can't beat the location.  Prime people watching place. Our meal was great. Man, the Espana's really love the quality of their sauces.  I really liked the different cheese platter menu too.  Overall, a great place with different type of Espana food.  Good for groups. Can make this a light fare if you are planning to party later.

1TR-FwIQv8dug1N1koZtcQ.text: I went for the first time in a year yesterday and wasn't impressed like I was in the past. I recommend over 25% of my Hotel Guest to Julian Serrano. The service dropped Dramatically, and the food was coming out cold on a Very slow day. 6 Tapas @ 100.00 wasn't worth it because the service just seemed Lazy and Boring. They say fresh but it didnt seem that fresh. And  I don't know if I will be back here again, and I don't know If I will recommend my guest there any more.

R_DCR3xiPHuwcsggGbAs4g.text: We stayed at Aria, so this restaurant was very convenient for us.  We ate here twice during our stay.  The first time for happy hour, and the second for dinner.  For happy hour, we ordered from the happy hour menu.  Everything we ordered was good, but nothing out of the ordinary.  Our second visit was for dinner.  The service was slow, and all of the food was over-cooked.  We loved the hotel, but will not go back to this restaurant.

ub04t-Gf31qPRFjdLEVb9A.text: Small tapas plates are good but pricey. I enjoyed the white fish ceviche, it was very good and just about right with the citrus. The seafood combo paella was not good, it was too salty and the lobster was bland and mushy as well. never going to order it again, not for $50. The huevos ranchero i believe was very good too. the small plates ranges from $5-$13. yum yum.

xgWGOqW2DqNgfRKFPenc6A.text: I fell in love with their egg ravioli. It's a warm little pastry puff with a runny egg yolk inside.  It's heavenly.  While I was enjoying this dish it took me solid 10 seconds to realize... how in the world is this possible?  I guess that's one of the mysteries in life.  The potatoes and chorizo on the side of a main dish were also very delicious.  The other tapas dishes were good, pretty much what you would expect.  Everyday we would pass by Julian Serrano in the hotel lobby and want to get the egg ravioli to-go.

W2-qRKhT5f_iJ2baFVDaaw.text: Julian Serrano was good but maybe I was overly hyped about the restaurant.  I guess I expected something out of this world but it was ok.  I've had very good tapas in Manhattan beach, San Francisco, and elsewhere and Julian Serrano is about the same.  It was good.  Also their sangria tastes watered down.  One of the few times I didn't finish my drink and I usually never let alcohol go to waste.  But the atmosphere and our waiter rocked so we had a good time.

FITaBaL3jD0BbsNViZY4Eg.text: We only sat at the bar and had a couple plates before going to see a show, but I was really pleased with the experience.  The bartender was very friendly and attentive.  He was very knowledgeable about tequila. The white sangria was delicious and fruity without being overly sweet.  The pan con manchego was absolutely perfect - great country bread, just the right amount of garlic and tomato, and very high quality manchego and olive oil. It was very satisfying.    The bartender recommended the wrinkled potatoes, which were deliciously salty boiled new potatoes with a delightful spicy dipping sauce.  The sauce was very flavourful and had the right amount of kick.  Prices were very reasonable and portions were adequate, given that its a tapas place.  Please run around $6-$8 for the lighter fare, and paella closer to $15 (I think) . Tons of great veggie options, which is rare in Vegas.  I'll definitely go back for a full meal in the future.

cTgTtdw_O-C7VO3oNzGRvg.text: Denver, CO 8/11/2011 This is the worst place we have EVER eaten!!!!  We were party of 9,since waiter was getting 18% tips automatically, he wasn't attentive at all, we had to call him several times just to get water and wine. Food came late and it was cold and saltly..yuck.. If ARIA wants to keep their good reputation, they have to review this restaurant's staff, management and services..

ukicTzMpRvTN5eoTNHZaZA.text: this is a solid choice in a town of over-hyped and sometimes over-priced eateries. the venue is spacious and comfortable with an open kitchen for your viewing pleasure. i love the organized menu that has a section for each type of tapa (soups/salads, nouveau style, seafood, meats, vegetarian) and a separate selection of paellas. i recommend:  *fresh calamari a la plancha - the citrusy, salty evoo pairs well with the sweetness of the caramelized onions  *albondigas - tender, flavorful pork/beef meatballs with a light tomato sauce. eat this with a spoon  *beef and cheese - another nice sweet/salty combo. the honey really kicks this dish up a notch  *grilled lamb chop - a bit pricey for 1 chop ($16) but it's perfectly seasoned and cooked  both housemade sangrias are excellent. the white is refreshing and light...a good starter. the red is bold and delicious. the service was spot-on...timing of the dishes, attentiveness and friendliness. it's always a good time when i visit.

0x3GkMKapDIb8a-Oj73QkQ.text: The best thing about this restaurant is the service. However, the food was nothing special.  For the prices, the food should definitely be special.  If you are looking for unique food, you might be impressed.  The menu encourages a sort of dim sum style dining.  If you pick a few different things from the menu, your group can try a few different menu items.  The food was just okay.  I do  not believe it was good enough to charge the prices they charge.  I don't think I will dine there again.  No one in our group was impressed.

qstxL5hKLVL0vA50a7yMCg.text: Very creative and delicious food.  I've been too many tapas places and they are rarely up to par (especially if you've been so Spain and understand what Spanish cuisine is supposed to taste like).  We ordered 4 tapas and each one hit it out of the park.  Our favourite, interestingly, was pan con tomate, which is so basic, but Julian Serrano's pan con tomate will blow your taste buds.  The other dishes -- ahi tuna codes, beef with figs and manchego and mushroom risotto -- were also stellar and very interesting takes on traditional Spanish cuisine.

BXnS5moD9lZ5B_3ta7Zusw.text: GREAT lunch at Julian Serrano..me and my fiancee's last meal before leaving LV. Every single thing we put into our gaping maws we loved......lobster gazpacho, goat cheese-stuffed piquillo peppers, fried potatos with chorizo and fried eggs, seafood-saffron rice, bread with tomato and machego cheese, tuna/raspberry skewers, lobster/pineapple skewers....I definetily want to come back for dinner when they have a more extensive menu. The pitcher of sangria we got was $$$$ at 44 bucks, but it was huuuuugge. Service was very good and our server made good recommendations.

0g6M9BC05oRfFT-aW8JQWw.text: The place is beautiful. Depending on time of day and crowd, there is energy here. The waiters are excellent. The food...not that good! Perhaps they were having an off day, but everything was a little too delicately flavored for me. The Brava Potatoes are comparable to the Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes at Taco Bell (congratulations Taco Bell, I guess). And the mixed paella was a oil drenched rice with overcooked crab and lobster.

Izn9H4HceVWV1xKd-F0DKQ.text: OMG!  By far, the best lunch on the strip.  I had the white fish ceviche.  WOW!    And the sandwhiches which are Spanish themed, are great.  Think, i had a burger at the ESPN Zone and it was $14.  I go to Julians, and it's less.  And SO MUCH MORE CLASS!  The Gazpacho is excellent.  Comes with every lunch.  ENJOY!

K6EAuppaVSsJjKShZB2hKQ.text: We were excited to try Julian Serrano because of their ceviche and array of tapa menus! I ordered the mixed seafood ceviche- it was meh okay.  Nothing special.  Also the steamed the mussels that were pretty good.  The other girls ordered the spare ribs and mushroom risotto - nothing specatuclar :-(

NBqsgfWkVvmf_rf-xkUPMg.text: Julian Serrano for lunch was perfect. It's in the beautiful Aria hotel and the decor is very chic. The menu definitely has a Spanish flair--and the chef is very well acclaimed. We had the lobster pineapple skewers for an app, and then i had the saffron rice for an entree. Although both were delicious, I don't think they were entirely memorable. The saffron rice was a little too al dente for my taste--but the combination of flavors from the sausage, rabbit, and chicken made it worthwhile. The prices were definitely affordable.

T1Wt6iN5CcHO9Aje5aF10g.text: Just about everything in the Aria is fantastic, and Julian Serrano is no exception. I am not crazy about tapas, but I have an appreciation for unique combination of flavors and textures. The best part of my dining experience was the great selection of wine and spirits.

K09IV3vuKd1lCUWmM7iZ3Q.text: Best place I've eaten in Vegas so far. Great food and great service. Everything we had was tasty, but highlights were the Tuna/raspberry and the duck confit. The rice pudding dessert was a must have. Best part of the meal. The service was attentive, but relaxed. As a woman paying the bill when dining with two men, I appreciated that the server actually looked at the name on the credit card and handed it back to me for signatures. The only drawback to this place is that it is very loud, with a dance music backdrop, so if you aren't up for that ambiance you should consider going elsewhere.

5-mt2RzI1v41m95J8mecww.text: a bit disorganized at the check-in due to design of reception area. once seated very interesting menu. great combinations among the tapas dishes. well presented and fantastic flavors. wait staff very timely and polite. Atmosphere was lively but too loud. would have given 5 but for the chaos at front desk and stingy wine pour.

TBMmQK3MzHmkzC3jYb5p0Q.text: My wife loves this type of food so she wanted to take me out to try it.  It did not meet our expectations.  We left still wanting more food and thought it was over priced for what it was.  Most of the food is pre-made.  We ordered 3 items and they all came out in around 5 minutes.  I asked how they got all of it done so quickly and they said they had the food pre-made for what we got.  Nice decor and great service.  We were in and out in about 30 minutes so it was quicker than we were wanting.  I will probably not come back.

w4fGRuWyCK2TS3f0HFVPBQ.text: The potatoes were off the chart. If you are into tapas then this place will rock your world. A few of the dishes weren't our favorite but 3-4 were really good with great flavors!

Tc511yME8axDPq2J6woxkg.text: I am in love with this place!!  Not only do tapas and sangria melt my heart but this place was amazing.  Every small plate we had was delicious and the sangria was intensely good.  Some of my favorites were the meat plate, cheese plate, french fries with the chorizo and egg, and the spinach.  Each plate was soo good and the service was great.  I will be making this a Vegas favorite for all my trips back!

ZDQ0WpUUpZJwPLI9dUbUwg.text: I loved this place. Definitely my favorite meal of my Vegas trip. I was expecting super small servings based on other reviews, but I thought they were all on par with the tapas I've had around the Bay Area. My husband and I went with another couple and we must have ordered about 10 dishes between all of us, plus a couple of desserts. There was too much stuff to break it all down. My favorite of the night was a dish with eggs and chorizo over frites. It was awesome. Would definitely eat here again. Loved it.

ZSs6gAah2Qz3ExsR0jGSCg.text: Not bad, but not great either. My wife and I went here for an anniversary dinner, and neither of us was blown away. Their shrimp ceviche was pretty good, and some of the other dishes were good as well. However it's extremely pricey. Also not really the ambience of a romantic place to eat. You kind of get a cafe feel when you're there. Overall, not too shabby but if you're looking to get good tapas for a reasonable price, not so much here.

Fj-k0FIsp9nxFaOULX29Sg.text: Appreciate how taking a well known dishes and doing their own spin making it their own. Had the pleasure of eating their oxtail, octopus, and deviled eggs. I promise you they or not like the typical latin style dishes you have had before. Paired them with their awesome cocktails, you cant beat it. True tapas style offering

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand peeled cocktail
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail

x7Zpxk8ZWbY5YPBH0rqigA.text: Absolutely delicious. I had the privilege of visiting your fine establishment with my coworkers. The atmosphere was a live with music and people's excitement! We ordered a series of tapas dishes that did not disappoint. We started with their crochets, then had the big eye tuna cones. This was only complemented with the carne asada and something that reminded me of ox tail. Sooooo good. This entire dinner culminated to the paella that had generous amounts of fish and meat.   We enjoyed ourselves so much, with fanciful drinks and delicious dishes. Our service was top notch. There are a few items to note. This is a tapas place so it's good to have a few dishes in mind. This will hold you over if you order the paella, because it takes about 30 to 45 minutes to prepare. So well worth it!  They are also known for their sangria, so drink up and pace yourself for an unforgettable evening.

6amIME-S-4m97P07F2s8gA.text: Im a local... This is on the strip,... we eat here.. that's gotta be the best recommend i can come up with.

bVNlas4XLoMXsfeHtjcRJg.text: Came here after hearing all the great things and being a fan of Julian Serrano.  It's a very modern and upscale location. Located near the check-in of the aria Hotel. It is an open dining room so if there is a lot of traffic or the gambling pit is busy you'll definitely hear all of it.  Came here for brunch but the brunch selections are very limited. I highly suggest if you want to try this place you come for lunch or dinner. Wait staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  Decided to go for some of the more popular items on the menu. Started off with their blue sangria and a greyhound. Drinks are typical price for this trip. Anywhere from $11-$20. Sangria was OK. Comparable to a lot of the other taps locations.  Had the tuna cones. Spicy tuna sashimi in a cone. Not bad. Pretty tasty actually. Tuna was fresh. Gave these a 4/5. Yes, it's Tapas so be prepared for small portions at high prices.   Did the shrimp in garlic next. Appearance wise not appetizing but the flavor profile is pretty good. Just enough space and kick. I gave these another four out of five.  Had the stuffed peppers next. Sadly I wasn't impressed with these. These seem to be blanched and roasted bell peppers stuffed with a cheese mix. I only gave these two out of five. They were ok but lacking in flavor.  Last was the albondigas. Basically meatballs. But that's it. Meatballs... pricy meatballs.  Overall it's a decent spot. If you happen to be here and have $100 to dump then by all means. There are plenty of other off the strip locations where you can get a higher variety for the same quality and slightly less. Beautiful place though.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greyhound and sangria
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas 2/5
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Piquillo Peppers 2/5

W-5GE07jpb5_WqbE2e-xLQ.text: This is a new place in Aria and my coworker spoke highly off. However for the price tag, the food is a-okay. I'd rather spend that much money with a nice steak dinner than these tapas. We got deviled eggs, lamb rack, calamari, foie gois and paella. The appetizer are good but just okay-good, foie gois was a bit gamey and the paella was way to salty. Five of us spent over 400 bucks for these...just not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CcO3b70d_IUlmbpPoa2ODQ.text: Had an early bday dinner here and the service was great. My gf and I went with the Paella Mixta, and white sangria. One of the best paella's I've had--I really enjoyed each component of the dish. The shrimp and lobster were particularly tasty. They were kind enough to provide complementary churros with chocolate mouse for my bday, and it was overall a great dinning experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bday churros
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella Mixta

9ju2BsHdZb5HwfBGo33qDQ.text: Wow! This food is amazing. I came here with my cousin, her boyfriend & daughter and my husband. We made reservations the day of. The service was very prompt. Our water glasses were always full. We ordered family style. Every dish we ordered was so flavorful and cooked to perfection.   We got everything from ahi Tuna to ceviche, to carne asada and croquetas. I would definitely come back here again. Be prepared to pay more for the dinner but it's well worth the high price
