Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp ceviche
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Cones

4Jk70hVf62bqu6851BHpGQ.text: Though the paella was a little burnt, we really enjoyed the the shrimp and potato dishes. Great flavor but because it's Vegas, expect to pay a bit more m..

SWcV7AhqjD79WgOqUYyV7Q.text: Tapas!! 12 girls? 21 girls! No problems!  Been here a few times for their tapas. First time being with 21 girls! That was crazy! Crazy how much work it was to pass tapas around. What do you mean I can't just have it all?? :P They made a huge long table for us though. Which was stunning but harder to get to and from. Still it was fun!  I haven't been here for small group dining but large groups, this is my go to. The space is quite bright and open too so you don't feel stuffy! Tapas were good but I didn't care much for the vegetarian ones. I do like their seafood and octopus! Yellowtail! Yumm!

CfCTPvTye_gQuth0m3257g.text: Firstly, I would start by saying this is a great place for vegetarians. There are my vegetarian options and we loved them. I actually liked the vegetarian options more than meats.   My review is more critical as I gave higher expectations of food in vegas. We go to well known restaurant with a certain expectation.   1. Brava potatoes were great. Crispy and tangy and spicy with the perfect almost whipped sauce. Will surely order it again.  2. Pan Manchego was absolutely delicious. The flavors were simple yet a nice play on the texture and palette. Most likely my best thing on the menu.  3. Serrano han was average. It was nicely aged but i think they plate was just okay. Needs some work to make the plate more exciting and maybe the pairings and size needs to be rethought.   4. Velenciana paella was good but needed some more salt. I felt it was under seasoned. The chorizo was extremely tasty but the chicken and rabbit felt a little over cooked and lacked flavor. I think they should only make a chorizo paella. The other 2 meat seem like filler adding no value.  5. Ribs were okay seasoned but cooked to perfection. Felt a little heavy, I would have appreciated a freshness added to it through a base sauce or something.  6. The chocolate cake was something I was extremely disappointed with. I had much high expectations. It was moist, the center was gooey but there was nothing special. It was just an average chocolate lava cake that you can find at many restaurants. I was expecting an elevated version of it. Maybe a non traditional icecream or something crunchy to take it to the next level.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ei2094eLaQliRN10jnc-3g.text: Came here for lunch to celebrate my friends birthday and let me tell you!!! One of the best Restaurants we ate at in Las Vegas. I loved the whole idea of all foods being Tapas style because you are able to order a bunch of stuff and share it with everyone at the table and that's exactly what we did. It just makes the experience that much better.  The location is perfect and high end but the prices aren't even that bad. I love how it is located in the Aria Casino & Hotel. The decorations of the restaurant is to die for. The food was amazing! Everything we ordered we liked and ate. The service was great as well and the restaurant is pretty big so there are a lot of tables available so trust me when i tell you, you don't have to wait to get seated. They also, have great wine to go with your food.  My friends and i ordered the tortilla espanola, patatas bravas and chicken croquetas to share and then we each ordered the carne asada. For drinks we ordered Riesling, cabinet and Rose.  If you want to leave Vegas super happy, please eat at this restaurant because you won't regret it! I still can't get over how amazing the food was.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Traditional Spanish Chicken Croquetas

bcfIsIK05MJxqniYoLmEZQ.text: Wonderful! This Aria centered restaurant offers tapas and paella. They also have a bar top area in which to grab a quick bite. The  Spanish tortilla was incredible! Dessert was phenomenal. I had the chocolate molten cake. It was very much shareable in size. The wait staff was above and beyond friendly. My only recommendation for the ambiance at all would be to tone down lighting just a bit to create a more intimate atmosphere. It was a top notch dinner. We will be back!

JlwBSjigKv1ruhdqy2iAuQ.text: The second stop on our Lip Smacking Foodie Tour and we got to sample four dishes, each different with it's own story.  This place definitely seems more open and friendly than other high end restaurants that I've been to.   I'm not sure if it's the Spanish way but it was inviting and almost seemed like a show with the big kitchen, open for all to see.    Our menu consisted of: Stuffed, bacon wrapped medjool dates:  I've had bacon wrapped dates before and have never been impressed by them until this dish.  So these big, plump, juicy bites are what they are supposed to be.  I've been tricked for years.  So good. Tuna cones:  Ahi tuna, avocado, ponzu, cucumber, what else do you need?  These were really good and a nice contrast between the dates and our next dish. Spanish croquettes:  Consisting of chicken, fried to perfection atop bechamel sauce, this was sinful and very rich but I wanted more! Valencia paella:  I was most excited for the paella but was also most disappointed by it.  Although good, it was no where even close to the other three dishes we had.   Overall, although these dishes were picked for us, they represented flavors that I would not usually go for and I was very happy with the selection.  I know it's a tapas place but the plates need to be bigger than this for me to spend a night here and have any money left in my bank account.  Overall, very good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella: not bad.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquettes: very tasty.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna cones: awesome.

wv0Qk4DqqKkMeyesVB1rGw.text: Stopped in here on a Saturday night for dinner. We had placed a reservation through OpenTable 30 minutes before we arrived and were seated immediately.   Food is served Family Style and came out very quickly. EXCEPT for the Paella which they tell you will take at least 45 minutes. We ordered the Mixta Paella and it was delicious. They serve their Paella in different sizes and we were asked if we wanted enough for 2 or 4 people. We said 4 and I think that it was quite large, especially since we ordered a lot of other food as well.  We ordered quite a few dishes (Bang Bang Shrimp, Carne Asada, Lamb, Chorizo) and were very happy with everything.    Our server, Pedro, and all of the other guys helping him were great and very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NfPqDejnKB52JNoHlEH3uA.text: Decided to try something completely new for lunch today so here I am. After visiting the pool at the Aria the sun just sucks one dry of all the nutrients one needs now I shall replenish them. The fun upscale ambiance drew me to this restaurant and how they spice up a vegetarian menu. I do not at all feel like cooking today and wanted to be waited on by some of the friendliest servers and staff.   We were seated in the restaurant towards the back at a half bench seat where one had views of the whole restaurant. I love the effortless sheer brilliance of the decor and elegance of the surroundings. The music is of a Latin mix and while I do not know most of it the vibes keep one feeling upbeat and fun feeling. Although some of the songs make one want to get up and samba. Our server was very professional and carried himself with the utmost best.   The menu has a wide variety of vegan and vegetarian choices, I was so impressed with it! I decided to sample a few different flavors from that said menu. As an appetizer since I had been drinking beer prior I stuck with Corona and selected the roasted marcona almonds. The almonds really make the Corona great. I paired the apple salad with mushroom soup and they were so fresh and delicious. The best part of the salad was the apple and cheese mix so good. The brava potatoes melted into my taste buds they were so hot and vibrant.   The server recommended the asparagus a la plancha and it was a hit with the asparagus being steamed so well. The asparagus was fresh too with an amazing zesty sauce on top. I love olives so ordered the queso fresco balsamic glaze. This was olives wrapped in a cheese bread with balsamic dressing and fresh basil on top. It was tres bon! I had a variety of wonders to take home with me. So I can have left overs tomorrow!  The final part of the menu and any great completion to a great meal is dessert. Although, I was sorta full on my journey to seek out new and eclectic tastes today I decided to go for the dessert Torrija. Being rusty on my Spanish I know torrija means french toast. Plus anything with Carmel and macadamia nuts peeks my interest. The dessert when it was delivered to the table was almost too pretty and perfect to eat. It was heavenly when I took the first spoonful. The Carmel and vanilla ice cream compliment the torrija so much. It is a warm dessert but the ice cream just melts in a perfect burst. This new food journey that I embarked on today was so amazing, delicious, and I could not of picked a more splendid place.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corona Beer upclose. Look at that bubble action!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corona with Lime No. 2
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corona with lime No. 1

YNostv5iMFmgPjzY8K1Rdw.text: I love going to Julian Serrano Restaurants so We came to check this one out and We were very disappointed. Service was not good, We have to ask for water like 3 times before we got refills, absolutely no follow up. We ordered the Paella Mixta which is the most expensive item on the menu and it's absolutely the most disappointing food I've eaten in a Vegas restaurant so far. The rice in the Paella is literally burned and it taste like burned rice and it has such a thin layer of rice that you have to scrape it hard off the pan. Also the Mussels got so dry that it shrunk. One good thing though the food here that we liked was the Lobster Fideua is absolutely fantastic. Jullian Serrano your "Picasso" Restaurant is absolutely amazing what happened to this one?

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella Mixta. Urghh not a good way to cook Paella. Taste like the Chef forgot it in the oven for a long while. What a waste of money.

F6DozXwrxbvInE73_s9EMQ.text: Food was pretty good! The carna asada tapas was my favorite dish we ordered. The ceviche and the calamari were also pretty good. The oxtail was decent. For desert we got the churro which was too crispy for my liking. A couple of us ordered drinks too and the The food was overall good and we had good quick service. Our only issue is they messed up our order twice, but they were very kind about it. I would like to try to paella if I were able to go back (we were in a time crunch and it takes 45 minutes to make the paella).   In terms of amazing Las Vegas food, I think I'd eat at other restaurants before going to this place again.

jUS8RWnVvnRgn4Rx5ckFmg.text: The service was excellent! The food was just ok. Interesting menu and selection but the portion sizes were very small for the price. They make a blue sangria that tastes like kool-aid. The churros were over cooked. The Spanish restaurant at the cosmopolitan is much better quality and a better price point.

U3FSsvB0pKxJ5L7iaAYpMA.text: Went in for a wonderful dinner on our last night at Aria. Pedro was our waiter and he recommended the white truffles (only in season for a few weeks). They were amazing on the risotto!! Also tried the Cuban sandwhiches, short ribs and a fresh bruschetta that was heavenly. Will definitely be back.

iJruss-1LKg5X9yp76hcRg.text: Pedro Ortiz! Awesome server who was so attentive and made tremendous suggestions tonight! Stuffed figs with goat cheese and rapped in bacon...these were to die for! Arroz con secreto pork with mushroom rice  Pintxo Chistorra imported sausage with roasted cauliflower and garlic chili! Everything was superb! Thank you Pedro Ortiz!!!!

2yFVIeMUgpnPmyTA5krqSA.text: The babes and I enjoyed this place soooo much that we came here again a couple weeks ago... unfortunately the quality of their food went down and the prices went up. We ordered the same thing + more since we had a couple other people with us, but ARG. They even took wine off the happy hour menu :(  Food is still OK, but nothing to rave about now. Why, Julian Serrano, why?

pradGW4GcnhFc4xnt1DmAQ.text: I've been thrice. Quality food, lots of small plates to sample. Pricey, but worth it.

BeFUWNdAvzWepA7D0vaHNQ.text: Okay I was going to hold off on reviewing this place, but I'm lacking in places to review because I have a semi-restricted diet, as well as I'm such a homebody now. So here it goes.  For our wedding, our Plan (A) is to host our reception here.  (Which is why I wanted to hold off - I feel guilty or that I won't get the correct experience when places give me special treatment for Yelp. I also only say Plan A because large Vegas weddings are expensive and my bills have been crazier than I expected lately.)  When we did the tour with the Aria chapel hostess, she told us one of the reception options was at this restaurant. And me, the typical white girl, got ridiculously excited about the prospect of tapas (see Iliza Shlesinger). So we had to visit there during that trip. Duh!  We wanted to ask about recommendations, as well as other specifics to how their reception events go there, so we explained we had toured with the chapel coordinators earlier that day. They proceeded to treat us like royalty. I cannot emphasize that enough - I felt so spoiled. I met the chef, had some good rapport with the manager, and tried the best tasting tapas I have ever had in my life.   We came back again but tried to pretend we already had our reception planned somewhere else when the bartender conversed with us. This place is just too excellent. I'm so looking forward to planning our event there.

VUN9qT-vusj-umgQ-oIvXw.text: I love tapas, so I was super excited to try this place while we were in Vegas for my SIL's birthday! They were very accommodating, especially since we made the reservation for 7 people last minute on a Saturday. We also brought a cake in, which they presented very nicely and served to us.  The decor is beautiful, even the bathrooms. The food was delicious, and the service was great. We ordered a variety of dishes, some included: the lobster salad, bang-bang shrimp salad, brava potatoes, chicken croquettes, fried calamari, and the hunger steak. My favorite dishes were the lobster salad and the chicken croquette, although all of them were excellent. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

f6IAZwyW2n5vrvld0ApiJw.text: we stopped in and sat at the bar to get a quick bite before seeing The Killers. We thought this would be just an okay place but WOW! Everything we had was full of flavor and amazing. The cocktails are top notch and so fragrant and delicious. We also had the olives, meatballs and cheese plate. For dishes that are usually pretty basic and uneventful, all 3 were SO uniquely crafted and the flavors were out of this world. So glad we stumbled upon this place. my only regret is we didnt allot enough time to try more!

QMYLiUhCelm53-BtxPsmvQ.text: I was really hoping that Julian Serrano would be better, but unfortunately the food and the lack of service was really a disappointment.   Came here for Christmas dinner with the family and ordered a variety of things. I was expecting this place to have more of their servers be more professional and polished since this restaurant seemed highly rated. From the food being served lukewarm, the server not really having recommendations, the dishes not being timed out properly (it's a tapas place, they should know better)...and the list goes on.   seafood paella- crispy rice mixed with tiny pieces of seafood and fatty dark meat chicken pieces. Shrimp had no flavor to it, because it was probably just boiled. The lobster also seemed a little overcooked and the mussels were definitely over done. I wanted to try the paella for myself since I've been reading mixed reviews, but unfortunately I should have listened to the majority and not gone with the paella.  stuffed piquillo peppers- these were good. Nice plump piquillo peppers stuffed with a goat cheese mixture and served lukewarm in some tomato sauce.   Grilled Japanese eggplant- a well toasted egg plant with a nice savory taste to it.   Mediterranean chicken skewer- these fatty pieces of chicken were not my favorite. I loved the apricot mixed in this dish, but the quality of this fatty chicken was terrible.  Stuffed dates- nothing special about the stuffed dates. Plain and simple stuffed dates  shrimp empanadas- fried ball of shrimp pieces  gambas- I don't understand why they don't try grilling their shrimps to get more flavor. The shrimp is lacking flavor.   Grilled rib eye- it was a chewy piece of meat. The sauce was a little salty for my palate.   almond cake- nothing special again.   Overall, the dining experience here was a little lacking and food quality was also a huge disappointment. Just a normal restaurant with no spectacular dishes...even the sangria was normal.

xRKo32kNa-SuP-8Ck_kJug.text: 2017 Update- I returned with someone else who wanted to dine here and I had to update my review! This time it was fantastic! The patatas bravas and chixken croquetas were fabulous!   2016 Ordered 3 items and I was not impressed with any of them. Potatoes Bravas, Chicken Croquettes and the Black Rice with Calamari. Just ok and in fact I hated the aioli that came with the croquettes.

LAMD_HIdC9q8TYJwWoCq_g.text: Surprisingly good.  Maybe I'm a cynic but bright lights Vegas strip doesn't seem to go well with the concept of tapas.  Regardless of the ambiance (which was very much a Vegas Casino Hotel environment) the food was very much on point.  I love hangar steak so I went for that first thing and do not regret it.  The tuna stuffed eggs were creamy as well.  Cocktails were well mixed and not terribly sweet.  I could see myself coming back to this.

ToCRVSAkxVE0rBHLzOQjVw.text: Tapas restaurant in the lobby of Aria. Reccomend making a reservation regardless of time of day. Even if it is a last minute reservation. We are local to Vegas and have been here several times. Note: soon as you sit down and before you open the menu the waiter will kindly ask if he can bring you olives and almonds. This will cost you $11. These are not complimentary like bread in other restaurants. In Spain the olives and almonds are complimentary and thus you maybe surprised. The Manchego bread is nice and refreshing- 4 small slices of bread with crushed tomatoes and cheese. The tortilla is good and is what you would expect. The albondigas could be much better in texture as well as flavor. They seem frozen/reheated versus freshly made. Try them for yourself. No draft beer only $9 -12 bottles of beer. Cocktails are good and standard Vegas prices. This place can quickly and I mean quickly cost you a pretty penny if you are looking for a full meal. But if you really just want a bite of something you should try it.

E6WbPdRtF--jeUmYQHAp5g.text: The foodie experience is not just about filling your belly. It's an artform that includes the satisfaction of delicious food and delightful presentation. Mr. Serano hits the mark. We came with high expectations knowing is to James Beard award. We were not disappointed. If I were local, this would definitely be a regular spot. If I'm ever back in Vegas, this will be on my shortlist.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Calamari a La Plancha

USot0E_cAEvXByBhOexBGA.text: Great tapas across the board.  We tried a few of the specialty cocktails and found them to be a bit too sweet and lacking.   Stay with the sangria.

q7s2kHylxqow8PF5ipCh1w.text: Amazing food! Easily one of the best restaurants when it aimed to food quality and taste.  I had a great experience! Everything was good and not too expensive.

tCZk93wS62azRv2QvQRFKA.text: Fantastic tapas and Paella, the Paella mixta is fantastic and the gamble and albondigas tapas are delicious. Very detail oriented Sommelier and great service.  Highly recommend if you are in Las Vegas and staying at or near the Aria (city center properties).

ES-emTg-offYu3U35BQ99w.text: Great place for tapas! Went there with bunch of girlfriends. We got a perfect round table. Service was nice and the drinks were tasty. The lamb chops were to die for. All in all we had a great evening with some scrumptious food. Will be back when in Vegas.

ApXEbHt0G7b5jUFwdW5eYw.text: All the food was amazing, but unfortunately the service was not up to par with an establishment such as theirs.

tpaJSLIioDBWv1oKSSNPuA.text: We stopped in to Julian Serrano for Lunch while we were staying at Aria, although it wasn't our first time here we were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our lunch! We tried the mushroom soup, which was phenomenal, nutty and earthy and so good. I had the lobster salad which had a lovely presentation but the dressing on the sale portion was almost too sour for my palate.  We enjoyed the red sangria and the pina smash which was so refreshing I had to order a 2nd one, oh darn LOL! We tried a small assortment of tapas, the squid, iberico ribs and the sausage and cauliflower, all which was fantastic. Great ambiance and the service was spot on.

HO-DNOEnkEvWD4jVZ7O-4Q.text: Food was excellent however we asked for an appetizer and confirmed we'd like it first and it was literally the last thing that came out. Also after waiting about 20 minutes our one shared dessert came out after we had to ask where it was. Service was slightly disappointing but I would give a second chance.

-F3proXHRBomcIUqoYUYBQ.text: I love this spanish restaurant. I eat here at least once everytime I come to Vegas. The tapas area amazing, I love the padron peppers and  my favorite dish is the seafood paella Negra.  On our last visit  we were serviced by Nick@julianserranotapas and he did an amazing job so we could enjoy our afternoon. A must if you are in the area.

ETDEsU83rE5HuXlh312uVg.text: Incredibly expensive for such small portions of food.   The tapas were tasty and the service was attentive but I wasn't left with an overwhelming sense of desire to come back.   We were staying at Aria and wanted a bite but without reservations there was a wait so we grabbed seats at the the bar.   The stuffed dates lacked the little crunch you expect with cooked bacon. The meat seemed a little under done.  The ribeye was a disappointment. It wasn't served warm, it was served with four slices of overwhelmingly fatty pieces of meat. The potatoes it's served with were delicious.   The pan manchengo was simple enough, toast with garlic tomato spread and slices of cheese. The price seemed like a stretch for such a simple dish.   The churros and spicy Mexican chocolate sauce were enjoyable but the churros seemed overcooked. They had a snap like a chip and not like your usual churro with a softer center. The sauce was drinkable though. Absolutely perfect with deeps of rich chocolate and just a small about of heat.   Our bartender was helpful and personable. The sangria was great and we received all of our dishes in a timely manner.

iiR0glf35OJpN-F4G2bEAw.text: This is located in the Aria casino main lobby. We both enjoyed a glass of white wine and split 5 tapas. The tuna cones were a little messy to eat, but all really delicious food can be. It is sushi style tuna wrapped in a fried won ton. The beef and cheese sounds unappealing, but it was actually a modem open faced Philly cheese steak that was salty. Savory, and right on target. Yummy!! Our waiter gave us great recs on what to order from the vast menu.

3cZXBA9j5GALayVhuxmyWA.text: Everything I ordered from here was delicious.  Our waiter was awesome too bad I forgot his name.  Tapas are the way to go if you don't feel like having a big meal before you head out to a show or club.

M4Yf7C6pU3TF7OHn4Gl47Q.text: Divine!   Great atmosphere and fabulous food.  My husband and I shared the potatoes.... Amazing  ( not sure of the exact name) they came with a great aioli dipping sauce.  We also had the fried artichokes ... Delicious , and a grilled bread appetizer .. This however was minuscule but very good.  The service was terrific , the waitstaff bustle about serving you the food and quickly taking away empty plates!   I will come back to try other "tapas"

b4kWQeI_cW-FDUfjDlXuPQ.text: Erwin went over the tapas!! Excellent food hands down. And Erwin was a great server. The staff was so knowledgeable and recommended the best food. And the sommelier was on point. So well versed in wine. I highly recommend.

eF3M1neV4ihq-0ZjdOYYAw.text: Happy hour at the bar.  Excellent wine and a great array of options.  A gastronomic candy store.  Very helpful bartender who steered us toward the atypical yellowtail offering.  Black rice calimari is a must.  The tortilla brought us back to our times in Madrid.  Super.

yrd0QzPP-ik2tsSPyS0BMA.text: I think I had my hopes up too high... The food was just so so, nothing to write home about. We ate here on NYE at around. 630ish.  The place is pretty but a lot of our food came out like warm which was disappointing. The best thing we had was the oxtail tapas but everything else was lack luster. We had tapas plates (octopus, oxtail, yellowtail and pork croquettas) and two main courses (pork chop and the crispy chicken) We left $200 lighter and I felt like I would've enjoyed the  cheese cake factory better....

ZPo1DlOGyrZQMfhdqrKi3Q.text: Solid effort here in Aria.  The sommelier here is particularly amazing.    All the dishes here are pretty good, with my favorites being the short ribs and the fried potatoes.  Paella here is decent, but definitely not authentic.  It lacks the crispy bottom, except for the very edges.    However, what is really noteworthy is the sommelier here can recommend you some excellent Spanish whites and reds are very good prices.  You will so better with the wines price wise than drinking sangria, especially since you are getting cheap reds with the sangria.    Ask for wine recommendations here.  The food is pretty good, but definitely come here for the wine.  Lastly, excellent service!  Just a wonderful and bubbly staff.

HztWCP-NbpDEh2XVu8djCg.text: I came here for an early dinner tonight to enjoy the tapas.  For a resort hotel the food was very good. But overall, I found the food close to great but just not there.   The risotto was full of flavor, but a bit too al dente and firm. It should have been a little soupy but the sauce was thick.   The black rice was prepared the same. Full of flavor with lots of color and contrast and the squid was cooked perfect. But again, I found the rice a bit too firm for my liking.   Lastly I ordered the monkfish. Cooked crispy, but a touch over seasoned with salt. The veggies underneath and the flavored oils were delicious.   Service was a bit inattentive and I came early and it wasn't crowded. There's lots of intriguing dishes on the menu, but I'm not sure if I'd make this a dining destination.

2U3tiatNsydYNhP1niE2Cg.text: I'm pretty certain my review is going to be buried in the sea of reviews, but I wanted to add my two cents to this establishment. I came here to celebrate my birthday lunch. Which in retrospect was a bad idea.  Our initial plans was to eat at jasmine at the bellagio and my husband was trying to secure a reservation a month ago but to his dismay they said they could not hold a reservation for a small party. So when we showed up, they regretfully told us they were unable to accommodate us and that we should have made a reservation. What? Anyway to make a long story short we headed to Julian Serrano hoping to salvage what was left of our time in Vegas to enjoy a birthday lunch.   When we were first greeted, things were great, got seated right away, and I asked the hostess who seated us if we could get a high chair. She obliged but 15 minutes later no high chair came so I went up to her to inquire. This is where things got a bit interesting. I kid you not she looked at me and scoffed and rudely remarked "you should ask your server that" and went back to looking at her screen or whatever she was doing. I'm not the type to meet rudeness with more rudeness so I met her dismissive remark with a smile and said "okay, no prob, thank you." And walked away. Perhaps I was mistaken to ask her, but she could have answered nicely and honestly "oh I'm sorry, I forgot..." Etc. I just found her rude dismissive behavior to be pretty astonishing for this establishment.   When the food arrived, the salad we ordered had a raspberry that was black and moldy. At first I thought it might be pepper. But upon closer observation- it was indeed mold. I didn't want to tell the server nor alert the kitchen. I'm usually just complacent about that sort of thing and just removed the raspberry and set it aside. However, my husband has other ideas and alerted our waiter right away. Truthfully I never like to tell waiters or waitresses the "truth" about the food because even if it was their mistake I'm always fearful of "complaining because I'm certain that they could take that as an insult and unbeknownst to me, could potentially spit or do unspeakable things to my food. Hence- why I never complain and remark any regard to my food other than "it's great!"  Perhaps it's passive aggressive of me to wait til the end of my dining experience and just place up a review- but well, that's how I am at restaurants.

ncUi4pUykR77QbDUmo7iSg.text: Bad food 3rd time here.  I ordered pork and beef sliders. The meat was spoiled.i spoke with the manager. He really didn't seen concern but to blame it on the cook. Really this is famous Julian Serrano. Maybe he needs to come back evaluate his cooks and retrain them.

9wCp0rRg7evkN3vIFS9OAA.text: Repeat customer here !  Came here with friends several times .... Very nice atmosphere great host and server need to always order serveral grilled Lamb chops its AWESOME! Also had Gambas A La Plancha , Gampas , Mariscada , Atlantic Cod , Mixed Seafood Ceviche n Seared Scallaps ... Dessert Santiagos Cake all AWESOME ! Only one item I didn't care for is tuna cones ahi tartare ..... But still deserve a 5 star

OB3EFoLc0xEuH7pCozLrlQ.text: Was pretty good but not great. We had a few different items that were hit or miss.  Other places I'd rather eat at in Vegas.  - Tuna rasberry skewer - 4/5 - awesome presentation and flavor was pretty good - White ceviche - 3/5 stars - needed salt and flavor. I've had much better elsewhere - Gambas 4/5 stars - one of the better dishes - Black rice 4/5 stars - very flavorful - Sliders 3/5 stars - pass, didn't care for these at all - Bacon wrapped dates - 5/5 awesome - Spicy meatballs 3/5 - Good, not great

pXNWG4NkpWtr42BJwP0yIw.text: Simply outstanding range of seafood, poultry, veggies and steak! Great service and a fantastic wine selection too! Don't leave without trying the Pan Serrano,,,
