kQjZkem07AGvCBT0257YtQ.text: The good: (1) Portions here are large for tapas. (2) Service is really fast. (3) Servers are very friendly. (4) Anything with beef, tripe, or sausage are excellent. (5) White fish ceviche!  The bad: (1) Spanish tortilla was super oily.  It seemed to be slice of oily potato frittata. (2) Brava potatoes were very greasy.  Basically cubed fries, but a little soggy.  Overall, we had an ok experience here.  I liked how we were in and out super quickly so we were able to resume our winning streak at the roulette tables!

rlQlAT-rav-jxJ2hkVFsBA.text: Very good experience here! The ambiance is great, the food is Tapas style and yummy, and the service is good as well! The drinks in specific are PHENOMENAL!

5NmBXsr79gzA18DHZ09Z_Q.text: We recently ate here and tried about 5 - 6 different tapas between two people. There were some that we both loved, and others that only one or the other of us liked. We may or may not come back here depending if they change up the menu, for tapas I feel like if they don't rotate the menu it can get repetitive. If you've never been, definitely go and you won't be disappointed!

3PRMrtQmsgUeeoR3v8upDg.text: Was looking for a place to eat at the aria since we had a party to go there afterwords and Julian Serrano was the only one that seemed to get good reviews on yelp..so thanks go all you yelpers, so helpful!  I enjoyed it alot,  these two dishes were my favorite!  Beef and Cheese- Prime Tenderloin, Brie Cheese, Toasted Bread Salmon roulade | house-cured salmon | rocoto mayo | tartar sauce  The paellas was okay, not the best, the rice was kind of hard.  I like it better at Jaelo in the Cosmo.

AIfamTNQuupnUidMEICoBw.text: Excellent tapas.  Great service.  Came here with my bachelorette crew of 12 and the manager offered to create us a custom menu if we just named our price.  Someone threw out $75 per person (thinking this included only food and not tax and tip) and we proceeded to receive a feast.  There were more courses than I could count (and much more than we could finish) and everything was really delicious.  We also had a few hearty pitchers of sangria to go around.  The experience was great and I would definitely recommend this place to a larger group on their trip to Vegas.

Uwt0WCfJVeIq-1SV8lVzig.text: I love tapas, so my friends and I decided to try Julian Serrano for some tapas before we leave Aria at Vegas. We were generally happy with the tapa dishes we ordered. I specifically had the Pan Manchego, which was tasty!   Per our server's recommendation, we ordered the Mix Paella with lobster, clam, mussel and shrimp. It had tons of flavor, but the paella was a bit undercooked.   Great presentation, service was alright, and the tapas aren't the best that i've had. Still worth a try though!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Manchego
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella - lobster, clam, mussel, shrimp

v4VjSpzy2Mn2ZFMzSZtpFQ.text: Awesome tapas. Black rice is the BEST! And the tuna cones...and the ceviche...and the grilled calamari. YUM!

0jtUb7wlcBtjGOOvw9A5sA.text: The Paella is to die for but takes 45 minutes to make. The Tapa idea is great and there is a lot of variety. It is a busy place and the service was a bit slow.  Overall it was a good place to eat but with all the other choices in LV I probably won't be back.

5BT6rPTa2r7UkJ3_Ip7xKw.text: The wedding party we were with came here to start the night off with some Tapas and vino so to speak. This place was specifically chosen as a number of us did our MBA's together in Madrid, Spain, so wanted to see how a Madrid Native (Julian Serrano), put the swank in Las Vegas.   Verdict - the food here was better than we got in Madrid, hands down. The Sangria was a huge disappointment. Not even close to the average Sangria served in Madrid. With that said, the Spanish Absinthe was a very nice surprise. Service was excellent and if we were back in Vegas we would most likely visit Julian Serrano, except for the fact that it is in the Aria Hotel and we had a huge compliant with City Bar (which means we will probably avoid the Aria in the future!).

mSVh1V5gHINZ2NqjyjleRg.text: Verily, I speak unto you to discuss matters of most import. Julian Serrano has been dined! Upon the occasion of a company feast, we wearily sat ourselves within the confines of the establishment. Having ordered our feast, we sat and reveled in the soft, yet visible light, and the ambient sounds of music. The spirits list, long and True, held certain appeal to my sensitivities, those being of the smokey flavour of whiskey. The service conferred upon us was excellent, and the feast continued uninterrupted. Oh the meals, how they tasted! Most everything we had was exquisite. The only exception being that of the Pork Chop, which unfortunately was overcooked, and a bit difficult to chew. Other than that, a decent meal.

eDYO1d5gk374Z4hkzbrfyA.text: This was my first time eating here but my daughters have been here a few times. They raved about this place. Our waiter was Pedro who was not attentive to us possibly stereotyping us as "bad tippers". He was more attentive to the table next to us. We were given minimal service and requests were forgotten. The food was good. The kale salad was prepared poorly had no flavor the dressing tasteless. The desert was delicious. My experience would have been more positive if we were treated with equal service.

bTnw5JK5PaGf69qqQoMSgg.text: With so many amazing restaurants in Vegas, I wanted Julian Serrano to be better than it was.  It's visually stunning - the colors are beautiful and happy and vibrant... but why the televisions?  And why were they playing a program showing people being decapitated?  And why was our waiter so... laissez fair and slow?  Anyway.  The raw tuna dish was amazing, as was a dish with egg, french fries and pancetta (my dream breakfast).  The pork on skewers dish we had wasn't good at all - it was tough, chewy and flavored in a way that did not make my mouth happy.  The cured meat platter didn't "wow" me.  I did like the Spanish lessons being played in the bathroom.   Glad I tried this place, but I want my Spanish food taken up a few notches.

UnUGr2Gk-wItEbyKtoN4AQ.text: Having just gone to Spain recently, I was skeptical, especially since it was so much cheaper for tapas in Barcelona, but I have to say the paella here was better than what I had in Barcelona (yes, I know, Barcelona is not known for paella).   Order the paella first when you get there since it takes 45-60 min.  We started with a pitcher of red sangria, which was good - not to sweet, with lots of fruit.    Things are better done family style here.  - Lobster gazpacho: with a gazpacho ball and one small piece of lobster, mini croutons, and some micro greens. The soup is poured over it, and the flavor was good.  While the gazpacho ball was interesting, the coconut butter shell wasn't very good - Lobster salad: more like a lobster avocado crostini with 2 small pieces and some mixed greens on the side - disappointing  - Jamon croquetta with cheese fondue: the fondue added good flavor, but the croquette fell apart when you picked it up - I think the inside was too watery? - Octopus a la gallega: lots of paprika, with potatoes underneath. The octopus wasn't bad - Yellowtail tiradito: lighter, more refreshing - Chorizo with honey and whipped potatoes: the honey was really good on this to go with the spicy chorizo - Tortilla Espanola: pretty legit in terms of the texture and ratio of eggs and potatoes - Mixed paella: originally portioned "for 2 people," but we increased it to a portion for 3. The flavor on this was good, but I thought it needed some salt. It came with half of a small obster tail, shrimp, museels, chorizo, and chicken thighs. The artichokes were a nice touch  - Fideua paella: the more interesting noodle kind. The texture was actually really good on this one, and I liked that it had shrimp and fermented garlic, but it could have done without the aioli globs on top   Even though it wasn't busy during our late lunch, service was spotty, and I had to ask multiple times for things like salt.  The lack of service and the large tables just made everything feel very impersonal here. The space is really large, and seats are awkwardly big, so you feel far away from the rest of your table. If you have less people, I would suggest the bar seating.  You might be able to get more attention this way, too.

1MMQxzFbHo1dmVjZee0seQ.text: Very disappointed. The $ 46.00 Pitcher of Sangria did not meet my expectations. Made with a syrup it was so sweet that we could not finish it. The tapas are not tapas. I expected a little taste of Spain but this was not what you should get in a place like Aria. The chairs are so heavy that you have to seat were they put you or get up and push the seat with great force. The Buffet at Aria beats by far this hi end restaurant.  There is so much choice in Vegas, I will never go back to Julian Serrano, and cannot recommend it.

cAU1mrZWyFRKDN70Y4LLwQ.text: We had an excellent meal and great all around experience!  Pedro is a real professional, he provided authentic Spanish selections for each course from salad through desert including great Spanish wine and spirits!

bCREzZzM2b6IrpLjTEqdgw.text: This great Tapas restaurant is located at the beautiful Aria hotel, which is where I was staying this past weekend for a Bachelorette party. The restaurant was recommended by the Bachelorette who had eaten here during her last visit to Vegas.   My cousin called Friday morning and we had no trouble making reservations for a Friday evening for 8 ladies. Once we arrived, they asked us to wait a couple minutes to get our table ready but were seated shortly after.   Our waiter was friendly and explained the menu to us and how 2-3 plates per person should suffice. We each ordered 2 plates each and a pitcher of Sangria which was delicious and refreshing (it's also what knocked me out early for the evening!). Since some of the girls wanted the same thing, we ended up getting doubles of some. At the end of our meal we still had 2-3 plates of food so I'd definitely recommend only 2 plates per person.   All in all, among the 8 of us we had:  Huevos Estrellados* White Ceviche Mixed Seafood Ceviche* Gambas Black Rice Pinxto de Chorizos* Coca Vegetarian  Spanish Tortilla   There might have been a few other plates but I forget now. Everything I tried was delicious and I love the idea of small plates because everyone is able to try. You also don't get sick of eating a big dish of something.   I put stars next to my favorite dishes of the night. The Huevos Estrellados consisted of Fried Potatoes, Eggs, and Chorizo. The best part of this was breaking the yolk and it oozing over the whole dish. SO GOOD! The Mixed Seafood Ceviche contained Shrimp, Octopus, White Fish, Cilantro, and Lime Juice. This was a great dish to offset the fatty, savory dishes. The lime juice brightened up the flavors of the fresh seafood. Pinxto de Chorizos was Mini Pork Chorizo, Garlic Mashed Potatoes, and Garlic Sauce. Do I still need to elaborate on this dish? It's pork, garlic, pot, and more garlic! DELISH!   Great and quick service, friendly service, delicious food, and a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Rice
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Estrellados

nRWLoPQ7DjhLAwHSjmz8kg.text: Pros:   Beautiful atmosphere Service  Cons:  Food, especially Spanish pork and beef sliders. Nothing stood out.

Gl9leG7Rcd4MNCxchegKFA.text: I have to give this place two stars. I have never had any tapas here that I've really enjoyed. Their drinks are delicious and have perfect balance so I will give them that. The service was excellent as well. I have come here twice now and tried a number of tapas on their menu. I never reviewed it last year when we came but this year we ordered, the Mediterranean bass which was my favorite out of our choices, we also ordered the chicken croquettes which were bland, and the spicy meatball which we didn't know would be fried. We stopped here because we were unhappy with our choices. I've had tapas here in Baltimore that have been 10x better and for half the price. I would not return to this restaurant.

u8Oq0u-5G1jvRyHzfhrdUw.text: OMG SO DELICIOUS!!! its beautiful and the food was amazing.  our server Terrence was fabulous. he picked everything for us and we loved all of it.

w-TTZY-RTGFzluRl8eqCvg.text: The restaurant is beautiful, service is good, the food is presented beautifully. We got the baby back ribs, White Sea bass, pan manchego, and stuffed dates. While the food looked delicious, the vast majority lacked substantial flavor- something tapas demands. When you charge as much as this restaurant does for tapas, I expected small plates packing a huge punch of flavor. My baby back ribs tasted almost freezer burnt with this somewhat too sweet sauce. The ribs were plated over marble potatoes which were bland themselves. My pan manchego was tasty but I think it'd be hard to screw up bread, tomatoes, and cheese. My husband did enjoy his stuffed dates which I found too sweet. He felt his bass was overcooked. Overall, very disappointing, overpriced meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby back ribs.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates

UBu3x9iPHk0CgLEA-kjTvA.text: My BFF and I dined here within an hour of closing time. Our server, Pedro, kindly informed us that the selections would be limited due to the kitchen being close to closing. However, a very large percentage of the items were available to us. I had the mushroom soup and it was the most delicious I've ever tasted. The salmon truffle was cooked to perfection and tasty. My friend ordered the New York steak with potatoes and peppers. Absolutely delicious!  Pedro checked on us consistently to make sure we were taken care of. The grand finale was the dessert that Pedro recommended. We usually share dessert but Pedro assured us that we'll probably want our own dessert plate. He was right!  The Torrija was phenomenal. I'm not a fan of bread pudding but this .... changed my mind.  Bread pudding with salted caramel over vanilla ice cream and toasted macadamia nuts. This restaurant is clean, cozy, and staff are very welcoming and personable. I look forward to my next visit to Vegas. Shout out to Pedro--thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7SxRp9E7qXhshrYhcW81vQ.text: So delicious. I would give a 4.5 if I could.  Came here for a bachelorette dinner and shared about 8 tapas dishes and 2 desserts between the 5 of us.   The ceviche was probably my favorite dish. Everything tasted so fresh and the lime wasn't overpowering.  I really enjoyed the brava potatoes and the steamed mussels too. I'd pass on the croquettes next time.   The tapas menu is very extensive and there are tons of dishes I'd love to try. The service was efficient and never intrusive. I'd definitely stop by again if I ever stay at the Aria!

DCn1q5SK7VX3DAp30mkyqw.text: The only reason it isn't 5 stars is because the bartender messed up the drink orders- aside from that, the food is phenomenal !!!! I would definitely recommend the mushroom soup, salmon and rib eye. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OioB3J8-R0H38aCfMWLmAQ.text: First thing first, next time you visit vegas please go to Julian Serrano and order anything off of their menu. I would pay anything for this gorgeous array of salivating foods, but luckily it did not break the bank at all and that included drinks and two entrees.  Now, about the sushi...This was the. best. sushi. I have ever had. No, it was the best damn thing I have ever tasted. It seduced me. I didn't know you could be seduced by food but, baby, let me tell you.. This sushi was an ahi tuna tempura but not tempura in the sense that it was fried and had a whole mess of dressing and fancy toppings that take away from the fish. No, this sushi was warm, the tuna melted right in my mouth and it was a full amount, not all toppings with a little tuna. It was slightly fried on the outside, warm, fresh (no fishy taste at all), and it was topped with roasted slices of garlic that really made the flavors of the sushi set a warm fire from my toes to the tip of my tongue to my head. It was bedded on a delicious seaweed salad and creamy avocado sauce. The food was amazing and it was partnered with a sparkling glass of sangria that is kept untouched for three days so that the wine really takes in the flavors of the fruit. This meal was perfection and I will be dreaming of it.  P.s. Service was great too. They were very help in suggesting foods from the menu and our server talked up the sangria and I was not disappointed, with anything! Don't be afraid to try anything. I had four different plates to choose from and they were all on point but the sushi was obviously my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Tuna Tempura and Sparking white sangria. Perfection.

oovr9V8raNMARbzV1WfXBQ.text: I'm not a big fan of tapas. If a restaurant description highlights tapas, I will most likely run in the other direction, okay that's a little dramatic, I'll be off to the side, sippin on some sangria. Small portions, high price tag, hitting the mark ~maybe~ 3 out of 6 dishes, what is there to like? I have no idea why I decided to make reservations at a tapas place for a bachelorette party, but I'm really happy I did because Julian Serrano did good work with our group of 9 people.   Ordering tapas is really tricky for such a large group. You have to make sure portions are large enough so everyone can try a bit of everything and at the same time, satisfy what everyone wants to order. One look at the menu and my face was definitely showing some stress and anguish, regretting my restaurant selection: "oh my god how many meat and seafood dishes do we need? do we even look at the vegetables section? what about paella?" Thankfully, a brief consultation with our server helped us out significantly. For about $40 pp, she selected what she thought our group would enjoy the most. She even asked us if there was anything we definitely wanted to get (yes, we specified a couple) and she made sure it got to our table as part of our meal. After 8 dishes and a paella, we were happy and full, ready to start our night out!  + Mixed Seafood Ceviche: shrimp, white fish, octopus, cilantro. Taro chips were the bomb diggity and went with the seafood perfectly. + Fried Calamari: exactly what it sounds like. It comes with 2 sauces, 1 creamy, 1 tomato based.  + Pan Serrano: faluta bread, tomato, serrano ham, manchego cheese. This seemed like a filler dish, but honestly, with all the other dishes to come, I was happy to have some bread. + Yellowtail Tiradito: sweet potato haystacks, horseradish cream, ponzu. I would definitely get this again. Ponzu me all day~ + Gambas: sauteed shrimp, garlic, brava sauce, arbol chilis + Mediterranean Chicken Skewer: apricot, beet hummus, onion, spices. The apricot was a pleasant surprise here. The sweetness highlighted the spices on the chicken very nicely. + Grilled Rib Eye Steak: piquillo confit, mushroom demi + Pinxto Moruno: colorado lamb, fulful bhar, onion, mushroom + Mixed Paella: lobster, mussels, shrimp, chicken, spanish pork chorizo. Yum, best paella I've ever had. Perfectly cooked rice, flavorful, fulllllllly loaded with all the good stuff.   We got 2 dishes of each item listed above, one for each side of the table. Our server was incredibly nice and also split up the massive paella pan into 2 separate large plates for us as well. Each dish was good! There wasn't anything that seemed to be previously canned or stale as often times happens in previous tapas restaurants I've been to.

LmdZqNVGDQw0N_-79l0_Kg.text: We didn't have 40 minutes to wait for paellas, which is usually my must-try in any Tapas bar. Tuna salad was not bad, but the meatball was just average. I guess the price was more paying for the location than the food itself. And like other comments, it took forever for the waiters responding to you.

acOgREYlt7biapQ5uO3eog.text: Paella is fabulous, wine selection id delicious, service is prompt and courteous - has to be all 5 stars

XuZhdXADLZesMXzc4T8bcg.text: Our meal at Julian Serrano was fantastic. We were seated immediately with our 5:30 reservation, and the restaurant was pretty crowded by the time we left at 7pm. My wife and I had 7 different small plates, and all of them were good. As others have mentioned I wouldn't say I was exactly stuffed for our $150 tab, but everything we had was meticulously prepared and tasted great.  Ahi Tempura - Fantastic! Perfectly red Ahi tuna with a very light tempura breading, just enough to give it a bit of a crunch. The avocado puree under the tuna, combined with the seaweed salad was amazing. 5 / 5  Padron Peppers - Never had these before, and they were incredible. Crispy, light, and reminded me of eating green pepper flavored string potatoes. Not spicy at all as I originally expected but still excellent. I could eat plates and plates of these. 5 / 5  Iberian Sliders - More like a two bite burger. Flavorful and salty because of the ham. Up until this arrived all we had were basically appetizers so this dish gave our meal some "weight". 4 / 5  Creamy Mushroom Risotto - Very good, risotto had a bit of crunch to it. Manchego cheese added saltiness to it. About as good as risotto I've had elsewhere. Next time I'll try something different instead of getting this again. 3 / 5  Goat cheese and sweet marmalade cake - This was fantastic. Very creatively constructed. Looked like a little work of art. 5 / 5  Dessert was the churro with chocolate sauce - about the sum of it's parts. Chocolate sauce had a bit of a spicy pepper bite to it. 3 / 5    Service was great, drinks were decent, wine list was pretty good as well. Next time, I'll try out the paellas and some of the seafood tapas.

7L3ste4iupnB62FUN4ty-Q.text: Quick and short. Wide selection of various tastes. PRO: Food is fantastic. I enjoy eating family style. CONS: Can get very pricey very fast. If you're in a rush don't try to squeeze this in.   All in all. Underwhelming. Plenty of other choices around so I'll be skipping this one in the future.

82Uwzj8k-E9SxJoMUzF80w.text: Reading reviews of restaurants in big tourist cities like Vegas is tricky. Although there are thousands of reviews everyone comes at it with different standards.  I come at it from a foodie point of view. I've been disappointed with other restaurants with 4.5* over 3000 reviews. But Julian Serrano is a real foodie's delight in a city of thousands of restaurants.  To start, we got the Huevos Estrelladas, fried chorizo, fries and 2 fried eggs. Simple things but amazing when put together. A forkful of egg, chorizo and potato dipped in creamy yolk is divine. Next we got the Yellowtail "traditio", Yellowtail sashimi wrapped around shredded crunchy fillo fillings, topped with cilantro. The rich fish is balanced with a citrus dressing.  We also got chicken croquettas which is as it says, but the filling  is creamy with tender chicken chunks and although not in the menu, a slight hint of gaminess, I'm wondering if there's chicken liver in mixed in too. It was absolutely delicious and one of our favorites! It was second only to.....the Valenciana paella.  The paella orders take 45 minutes so we made sure to order once we sat down even before getting drinks. The arborio rice was so perfectly cooked and so so so flavorful!! There were chunks of chicken, chorizo and (supposedly) rabbit but I couldn't tell. I'm not complaining, the whole dish was amazing! Out favorite! The paella is meant for two as it says on the menu but with 3 smaller tapas, the paella really could feed 3 or even 4. We were so full we couldn't for in dessert.  Yes the paella costs a bit more, but it's at a reasonable price point for Vegas and the other items are all reasonably priced too.  This was our highlight meal of our stay!

vpm6psJ_BHqIG6g_EcFW8g.text: So glad we decided to try Julian Serrano. Party of 4 and we ordered 2 tapas each and a seafood paella. Two of us had some wonderful cocktails with our meal. We also ordered 2 desserts to end the meal. Highly recommend reservations. Beautiful setting and a wonderful meal enjoyed with friends. We had a 9:30 show. Reservations were for 6:30. Plenty of time to have a relaxing meal before the show.

fejHsgTsRc_1aFPN_OoBUQ.text: Well. YUM! Every tapa we ordered was amazing! If you like the tapa medley thing - then you will like this experience. Tad pricey but we left satisfied. Thumbs up - will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hi, my name is yellowtail!

rlqpcVQZveMKoreHvXvGSg.text: I was in Vegas Labor Day weekend and ate here twice. It was bomb both times. i loved it. I accidentally happen to go on the second day during happy hour and that was cool.  the food is very good, small plates which i like. quality over quantity.   You should try this place.

FvR0UWYEfAqhGWe4LMpj_g.text: Just really average- if you've ever had great Tapas you will be disappointed!  The wait staff was very sweet and attentive, but the food just isn't great at all.

GnCRSFDUGQvMW5d5LFY_mw.text: Two words: Happy Hour. Their happy hour menu is so delicious.  We basically ordered all of it and called it dinner. Albondigas, sliders, Brava potatoes, croquetas, chorizos... We also ordered the mushroom risotto and churros off the dinner menu.  Brava potatoes: What is this witchcraft? The sauce is so good that we had to ask for bread to keep dipping in it.  Croquetas: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Melts in your mouth.  Chorizos: So savory with a kick from the red peppers. Don't forget to scoop up all the mashed potatoes. It's worth it.  Risotto: Was it supposed to be dry and sticky? I ordered it cause of Hell's Kitchen, which always looked more like a porridge. Wasn't feeling how salty and congealed it was.  Churros: This. Was. My. Heaven. You must get this. I regret not going back every day of my vacation. It is so sweet, but the melted chocolate that comes with it tempers it perfectly.  Go churro big or go home.

XhXi5o872lygC43PZWkAzQ.text: As a frequent visitor to Vegas, I have had the opportunity to dine here three times in the last five months.  If you like Tapas, you will love this place.  I cannot say anything bad about the food, it is all wonderful: dates, octopus, short rib, paella, etc.  The paella is a little small for a large group. I heartily recommend the churros for dessert.  My only criticisms are that the wine list is always out of the reasonably priced selections and the general cost of a meal is ridiculous.  I know, every meal in Vegas has to be ridiculously overpriced, it is some kind of law, but go in prepared to have to use the home equity line.  Still, I cannot recommend this place enough.

JLyAWgYOtxnVQZGXApbryw.text: Great food, horrible service.  Service can make or break a good meal, and unfortunately the horrible service overshadowed the delicious food.   We dined on Saturday, 2/9, at 9:15.  I originally had made a reservation for 12, but 2 people did not make it. The hostess and server adjusted our table no problem.  Once my whole party arrived we were seated. After that, service declined until I spoke with the manager, Carlos.    Our server was Janice and it appeared from the beginning as if she had checked-out for the evening.  Once we were seated we were handed ONE drink menu by our unknown server at the time.  Everyone was getting a little impatient while they waited for the drink menu to reach them.  It would have been helpful if water was at our table before we were seated.  I asked Janice for another drink menu then she brought over a couple more in ipad form.  Thank you.   I also had to ask about the specials and the prix fix menu I read on the website.  Janice did not opening offer this information to us and did not communicate it to the whole table.  One of the girls in my party communicated our options to rest of the group.  Everyone except one person in our party opted for the Chef's Special Selection Menu, but Janice did not know that because she didn't bother going around to ask each person what they would like to order -  she assumed everyone was opting for the chef's menu. Someone  had to tell Janice that one person wanted to order off the regular menu.    Janice is not all to blame for the lousy service.  The bussers and food runners were not on top of things and appeared not to communicate with one another.  A food runner brought our paella and Janice had to take it back to the kitchen.  After I spoke with the manager he informed me Janice would try to be more attentive.  Janice was great at refilling our waters and sangria, but she was still not very friendly towards us.  I appreciate Carlos for sending out dessert at the end of our meal to make up for the poor service, but unfortunately the poor service really did break our special group dinner.    I recommend assigning a more outspoke and friendly server to large parties in the future.

xgbAhJAq6azKPn1m3A25LA.text: When i write a review, I make sure to mention that I am not comparing this place against the universe of restaurants, but against its own expectation. That means that comparing this to Chili's would not be fare to either, I compare to what is advertised and expected. I also rate according to three variables: food, environment and service. However, the perfect food on a non-perfect environment could still deserve perfect ratings going inline with my  'expectations' guideline above. I do not rate pricing, the price influences the expectation.   What you would expect: High end, gourmet tapas, smaller portions and priced accordingly, in a contemporary informal setup but at a Vegas prime resort.   Service: I sat at the bar by myself on a business trip. The bar tender was super friendly, fare and sincere in his suggestions. Service was right on time. No complaints. Above Vegas service standards in my opinion.  Enviro: Its an open space facing the registration deck at the Aria casino, which has a beautiful architecture. Decoration is modern, and table setup is not too formal. Its a little loud when crowded and tables are set close to each other, so it is romantic but may be not "first date" romantic. I was wearing jeans and a jacket and felt perfectly fine. I saw people in slacks and sports jackets and people in dress shorts. All inline with the nice-but-not-so-formal.  Food: Here's where it wins. Yes. Portions are not big, but that does not matter. Flavors are artistic and sophisticated, perfectly made for my taste. I would lie to myself with anything less than 5 stars. I tried the risotto, the lamb chop and the gambas and the three were among the best I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gambas

gvoWcBkymg2ZX_M8rUziWA.text: There may have been a good paella in Las Vegas last night, but it wasn't at Julian Serrano's. We have had two excellent meals at nearby Jaleo, and decided to give JS a try for a comparison. How often can you have the choice of two paella places within walking distance? So, why not. Plus, JS has several types of paella available at all times, while Jaleo makes only two, different ones each night, at the whim of the chef. In retrospect, that allows Jaleo to make perfection vs what seemed like "fast food version" at JS.  We ordered paella marinera right away, and three tapas to hold us the 45-60 minutes the menu stated it would take for the paella to be prepared, got a bottle of wine with the able and amiable assistance of Robert the sommelier, and prepared to have a relaxing evening. Instead, the tapas all three came out within minutes of each other, followed closely by the paella. It felt like food was piled on the table all at once, too much to even fit! The paella was the worst we have ever had. Obviously rushed, the grains undercooked inside and mushy outside. Paella should be soft inside and almost toasted outside. That's why it's so hard to make properly. Kitchen fail.  The manager explained that it was a very slow week (indeed was only 1/4 full)and the kitchen was still going full speed.  They did apologize profusely, and gave us chocolate churros as a dessert apology. Guess who is allergic to chocolate and wasn't asked about food allergies? This guy. No big deal, however, most good restaurants will ask before suggesting menu items, which didn't happen (again, something Jaleo did on each of our visits there).  I'm an easy to please guy, and I hope I just got a bad night.

m5rVcSZaNqnany9y2zvbFw.text: Before I wrote this review, I spent some time scrolling through and reading other reviews.  I simply do not agree with all the folks who rave about this restaurant.  While I share the minority opinion, the reviews from people who have lived in Spain are on par with my rating.  We made a reservation two weeks in advance on Open Table.  We were not walk-ins.  Let me start with the few positives.  The sommelier was extremely helpful in the wine selection process.  The black rice with squid ink was a winner.  And here ends the positives.  What didn't I like?  I was looking forward to sampling white anchovies.  They came on toasted bread with piquillo peppers.  I was underwhelmed.  As an anchovy lover, this dish was a huge disappointment.  The salty, creamy but sharp bite of the anchovies was lost in the bread and peppers.   Jaleo knows how to do white anchovies, hands down.  Let the anchovies speak for themselves.  Don't hide them in other ingredients.  The octopus was rubbery and tough and had obviously been overcooked.  The clove seasoning in the oxtails was completely overpowering, and the pork "wrapper", touted as Iberico pork, was ghoulishly transparent and unpleasantly chewy.  We observed dishes of paella being taken to other tables.  They looked mouth-watering.  Perhaps we would have been more impressed with the paella versus the tapas we ordered.  Now for my commentary on the service.  With the exception of the sommelier, I have little I can say that is complimentary.  Our server seemed clueless about the menu.  Unlike other tapas restaurants we have dined at, he explained nothing to us about any of the dishes.  When we asked about any particular dish, his response was always, "Oh, that's a wonderful choice."   Dishes would arrive to our table within two minutes of ordering.  What was this?  A production/assembly line?  I had to wonder.  The rapidity with which the dishes were conjured up makes me feel sure that they were not made to order.    I realize that most Americans revel in choking down a meal in under 45 minutes and feel they are receiving horrible service if food doesn't appear on their table within five minutes.  To the European visitors who understand what dining is, I apologize for this gauche and crass behavior.  Not all of us are like this.  But perhaps the American penchant for scarfing down food and failing to enjoy the dining experience explains the service at Julian Serrano.  This is not okay with us.  This is a high-end restaurant.  This isn't Chili's or Applebees.  We felt rushed by our server, and we did not want to be rushed.  We told him that.  It went in one ear and out the other.  We no sooner finished one tapas, and the server was back at our table within seconds, wanting us to order another dish as quickly as possible.    When I'm at a high-end restaurant such as this, my expectation is that the staff are highly trained.  They should know better than clearing away a plate before all the diners at the table have finished eating.   I was about to eat one of the stuffed dates -- the last one.  I had the date on my fork.  Before I could dip it in the tomato jam on the serving plate, a staff member came by and whisked away the serving plate.  What the hell?  Poof.  It was gone.  The tomato jam was gone.  So was the person who picked up the plate without even asking me if I was finished with it.  The unspoken message was "hurry up and eat and get out of here so we can turn the table."  Guess what, Julian Serrano?  Choking down tapas and getting out quickly isn't what the tapas experience is about.    I'm still not done.  We had made our way through four small tapas plates.  Our server came back and handed us a dessert menu.  He never asked if we were ready for it or wanted it.  He never asked if we would like more tapas.  We wanted more tapas and told him so.  He seemed miffed.  This reinforced our perception that the restaurant wants you to eat quickly and get the hell out so they can turn the tables.  We ordered more tapas.   When we were finished with our meal, I asked for a coffee.  Upon adding the cream, the coffee resembled dirty dish water.  I poured some "cream" onto the coffee spoon to taste it.  It was not cream.  It was not half and half.  It was not even full fat milk.  It was 2 percent milk at best.  Unacceptable.  We've had a number of tapas meals at Jaleo in The Cosmopolitan as well as other tapas restaurants in Southern California and Utah (a special shout out to Finca). They are all so much better than Julian Serrano.  The tapas are better; the service is better; the servers are knowledgeable about the menu; the vibe and atmospheres are better.  We won't be back to Julian Serrano.

JV3NBLpCRDjOkI2iSSc0Wg.text: It wasn't too busy for a Monday night, made reservations ahead of time so we were seated within seconds. Service was good although the waiter seemed as if he were just being nice because it was his job so that was a turn off. The good was excellent! From the seafood tapas to the vegetarian to the meat, everything was cooked to perfection. The churro dessert is also amazing. You honestly can't go wrong with anything that you order.

Pbq-XvvoIm_a5ao4BZvzkw.text: Came here on a recommendation of a client of mine who tends to be fairly particular (in a good way) about what she likes. So I thought it has to at least be decent! Right? Well let me tell you I am Spanish... I have lived in San Diego California since I was 9 and have NEVER found a tapas restaurant I cared for. Eating the food at Julian Serrano took me back to my child hood. The food was authentic with a modern twist! So creative.. GREAT SERVICE!! Will make this place a must go to for every Vegas visit!! Would highly recommend trying a little bit of everything

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria

PcjLJBQ4NPlo3JBxFsSxnA.text: Wow. Delicious creative menu. Every dish is top quality.  About as good as it gets in this space. Will absolutely, definitely return.   Recommend: tuna cones, yellowtail tiradito.

ZQCFsiDmjAbnWoG31Ej3Hw.text: We called ahead for a reservation thinking we wouldn't need one on a Monday night.  Boy, wasn't THAT a good call.  It was PACKED, but were seated quickly.  I loved the layout of the place, and wish we'd have read the review before we were seated.  The long bar had a lot of action and even had a couple of "jets" which could seat 4.  We got beverages and started looking through the menu.  We were impressed at the selections!      We talked with our waiter about what we were thinking and he voiced his agreement with a couple of our dishes.  We went across the menu best we could.  We got the Lobster salad and Gaspacho (both had good chunks of lobster in it and were very good), Steak tartare and NY strip for meats, and then did an order of the fried Gambas (more later), and Mushroom Risotto.  It was PLENTY for two very hungry individuals.      We looked at the desert menu and couldn't say "no" to the Pistachio tart and chocolate cake (think "melty cake" you got on your last cruise).      We were impressed with all.  I'd say the item I wish I hadn't gotten was the risotto.  It was good, but for two, I wish we'd have selected something else.  If you have a larger group where you can do the "tapas" and go through a LOT of dishes, then go get it.     Our favorite was the fried gambas.  WOW!  With shrimp, a touch of garlic, chilis, and the sauce, it had a TON of tastes that complimented each other perfectly, and you could get a taste of every one of them.  The grilled NY steak was also tasty, with a good mushroom sauce covering it.  Very well prepared (medium rare), and so tender you could cut it with your fork.     My wife had a post-dinner coffee, and we were stuffed when we were done.  Our bill for food (no liquor) was still under $100.  We could've left with a small box of leftovers if we'd have stayed another day.     Good call stopping in.  Service good, manager was doing work and not just glad-handing (bussing tables, getting the occasional order, checking on beverages, and he even filled my water glass once).   While Jose R. was listed on our receipt as our waiter, Antonio was also around a lot.  The crew did an excellent job of keeping us happy.     We'll be back.  Big thumbs up.

Uxgg_iBkH14GsvEtSoMhhg.text: Love it, Love it, Love it.  Much better than the competition and great atmosphere.    Quick tip, if you make reservations, be prepared to wait another 30 minutes on busy nights to get your table.  We ended up eating at the bar, which was way better as you can see each dish coming out of the kitchen.    The tuna tartare cones were unbelievable!  Must have!  They are literally tartare, avocado, and an array of goodies in a very small ice cream cone (like the size of your pinky).  You get four in an order and they deliver in every way!

J0ZHbm8lrvB_L9j3JkH_TA.text: Came here for Sunday lunch during Restaurant Week. Courteous staff, got seated right away. No issue with our toddler as they had high chairs available.   The $30 lunch menu was very satisfying. For starters we had the Wild mushroom soup and Lobster gazpacho. The latter is good for those who like sour flavors and can enjoy cold soup like me. We also got their Calamari which was perfect with the aioli sauce. For the main course we had Rib-eye steak and Garlic chicken. Both had ample servings (considering this is a tapas place) and good flavor. The Flan with raspberry cream and Santiago's almond cake with Turon ice cream were perfect desserts to cap the meal.   Overall very happy with experience and very good value for your money.

TnzIKeiC8uFOVqynQDIpHQ.text: Loved this place. Fun, inventive tapas, great drinks and our server, Chelsea was really helpful. A must if I go back to Vegas any time soon! We tried about 8 different tapas...way more than we should have, but they were so good we wanted them to just keep coming! The raspberry tuna one was amazing. Other standouts were the mixed seafood ceviche, black rice and stuffed piquillo peppers. I can't say enough good things!

qbQ_JnJu6qnhH9oanaemIQ.text: Had a great dinner at this gorgeous restaurant. The service was outstanding and food was worth every cent. Ladies be sure and powder your nose. The bathroom is so pretty.

FE_V6Lmf5OU6OVizZtvo1Q.text: Great food! Sat at the bar even though we had reservations and Premo made it great fun. Loved the tapa style food.

YhGDh_XBd9TRLjmXce3kug.text: This place is ok. Not sure why this place have so many 5 star reviews? Maybe we went on an off night? The service was kinda blah as well. Hub and I shared the following tapas:  ***Recommend***  Stuffed paquillo peppers (my fav there, the flavors went very well together)  Oxtail (sorry forgot the name. It was hub's fav, tender and moist)  Seared scallops (seared perfectly)  Yellowtail (this was ok, didn't think it was that bad to be added to the list below)  Lamb chops (hub and I both enjoyed it, but it wasn't the best we ever had)  ***Avoid at all cost***  Tuna cone (no flavor)  Fried artichoke (forgot the name as well, but it came with arugula and some kind of soft cheese on the side. This dish was completely bland and the flavors did not work well together)  Tuna and raspberry stick (looks pretty, but where was the flavor?!)  Fries and chorizo with egg on top (can't believe we paid for this dish. It looked like a dish that was thrown in with leftovers)  Pork shoulder (forgot the name as well. It was dry and bland and totally not worth it)  Bill came out to be about $180. It wasn't too bad, but I can think of a million other places where I would've left happy and completely satisfied.

UT2OJKxoqZaImLUHkQ699Q.text: Great happy hour. Get the croquetas! Get the foie gras! Kinda pricey but so, so yummy. Don't get the potato items! Unless you want filler food! They give so much! And they become filler food!  Get the drinks during happy hour! They're regularly $14, but half off during happy hour!!!  The dessert menu was seriously the best I've ever seen (according to things I like: flan, almond stuff, ice cream stuff). I wish I had more room in my stomach to eat those desserts. Instead, I will have to try it another time. But seriously, can someone please try the desserts so I can read the wonderful yelp review of them?

l9EzjHIMP_P4pXkVAnJAPQ.text: I love tapas especially these! I've been here 5 times with different people each time, never to be disappointed! I like to try a few different items each time & you can because portions are perfect to satisfy taste buds & move to the next! The seasoning of tapas each have incredibly deeeelish flavors! I went to the UNLV Foundation dinner last year @ the Wynn ~ the dinner was superb saw that Julian Serrano was Master Chef, wow again presentation impeccable so delightful! He knows how to impress his clientele! You don't mind paying when you leave beyond satisfied!

FkoQpddSP8LuDBCEDrRPfA.text: Awesome tapas! Everything served to us were fantastic. The chicken croquette, ox tail, scallops, duck salad, pork tacos mmm mmmm. Definitely get a pitcher of red sangria!

uZz0FnZCCc6ESaynJK4phw.text: Save ur $$$$  Skirt Steak- chewy&dry Mussels- bland piquillo peppers- bland & too heavy Ahi tuna tempura- worse tuna tempura I've ever had Black rice- too heavy & greasy Salad-salty

HM3lGLJfD30MGgYgkWk7VQ.text: So much fun, lots of choices & they keep the food coming out at a perfect pace. Had the pork belly tacos, amazing! As well as the white ceviche, so fresh! Definitely a great place to try the tapas experience! 2-3 choices per person & then sharing is the best way to try the most options & it's not too expensive, by Vegas standards.

J-gI_EMTB5AapUWOZQhgWg.text: Really disappointed I'm staying at the hotel tonight and based on all the reviews and on the fact that my mom really wanted to try this restaurant and hasn't come to Vegas in the last 20 years, we were super excited to go here tonight. Unfortunately, when I called to make the reservation, we mentioned we were bringing a six month old baby at 7 PM and their policy is no children under 6 years of age. I think that's a bad policy. I promise you, I have a quietest baby ever. anyone who has an infant knows this is probably the best time to go out and enjoy a nice dinner. They sleep through most of it. Anyway, Javier's across the way is going to take us, which we are grateful just disappointed that my mom really wanted to try paella and never goes anywhere because she can't really afford to travel won't have this small request fulfilled tonight.

VUfudSc86gx-jGoM-1IeDQ.text: We loved this restaurant!! Great tapas!! Vegan options! The guys ate surf and turf!  And several of us got seafood tapas that were awesome!! Best restaurant we ate at on vaca!!

9ljRcOPcTSO5R2tegBwlTw.text: Stopped by twice to and fro Garth Brooks concert. Definitely a place to check out. Sit at the bar and ask for Jason. Can't go wrong with any choice of tapas and wine but a must is to finish the evening with churros. Cheers!

dV9YOPOWV1ek6CHTbgWuOQ.text: I've been coming here regularly for years but last night I noticed an unfortunate disparity between the food quality and service.  Every dish we ordered was prepared to our liking but the hostess, manager, and our waiter were all inexcusably inattentive, thus the 3 stars.  Double check your bill for accuracy, especially if you're there for the "happy hour" service, which is $5 sangrias and lunch menu prices till 5 pm.  Don't let them hand you a dinner menu because they will try to charge you accordingly.

Vxgf6mzD2UxW0joLhODJeQ.text: Bartenders were awesome, especially Jeff. Made the best drink which I can't remember the name now but boy was it good. Food was just okay for the high price. Lobster gazpacho was refreshing with it's tiny bit of lobster. Shrimp gambas had a high dose of garlic and was swimming in butter.  Not sure if I'd spend my calories here since there's so many great restaurants in Vegas.

E7Vb9DNGmQ6bQC3uuY1yDg.text: The hostess was very disrespectful. The food was good and so was our waitress. I brought it up to the manager and he simply apologized. I am not into giving feedback and not feeling like the restaurant made an effort to guarantee the customer's return

GSftg8_Dl8xXRkA06-EpqA.text: I always hit this spot when in Vegas. Great tapas and a beautiful restaurant. The menu always has new dishes and I've rarely had anything that wasn't excellent.   It's a great place for a group to eat. Love!  (also the floor is stunning.)

MB2Jz2tL3IWtZrz-DjaYww.text: Delicious! The tuna cones were the very best! The salmon cakes were also very good. My friend tried the chicken skewer which she says were okay. Service was spot on.

McoLnLKIvvdLF9d4DaJj_w.text: Definitely a place to go while in Vegas, we found this place on yelp and based upon the reviews we decided to give it a try.  We were headed back to LA stopped in and had food just before we hit the road and so glad that we did of course we over ordered because we were so hungry! And i wish i had the pictures that we took because everything was just so picture perfect and tasted just as good as it looked. We basically had one of all the most popular dishes between two people. Would definitely go back. Situated in such beauty it is joy to dine there.

sKUWEJfhHcITEroSvaGezQ.text: Stick with the Tapas and bottled water. Looking forward to a special birthday dinner here we were very disappointed.  We started out grand , quaint table for two and we are already ordering our drinks. Gin & tonic came out and it tasted off by the 3rd try the drink was brought out with just the gin and a closed bottle of tonic water. The tonic was spoiled at the bar.  We loved the tapas we ordered very tasty, perfect for two. The fig tapas were just lovely! Now we are excited about the paella we ordered. When it arrived we noticed immediately it was small not really for two. Only two shrimps and maybe a scoop of rice each - oh! It smelled so fishy I was hesitant to eat it but took a bite and wish I hadn't! The rice was under cooked and the shrimp tasted bad. Really could not continue, we ask the server to take it away and I've lost my appetite.  My water is refilled and I notice large particles floating in my glass! Ugh. I ask for bottled water and tell our server why. She does apologize and we know this is not her fault. The manager comes over and starts to explain why the paella taste so off and this is just how they make it here, he does not apologize or offer anything to us. I am beyond ready to leave. But our server lets us know because it is my birthday she will bring me dessert and she is convinced I will be delighted. She brings out a lava cake, where am I, Applebee's?!! Please, just let me leave! But first she brings me the check. They took off the Paella and bottle of water. Finally it ended.

bnAQZVLcWyXxXg9h9XnEkg.text: Great food. Wonderful service. I highly recommend getting the oxtail. I was skeptical at first but it was absolutely amazing!

d4rRPuEzAxARSoG7DXg73w.text: The food was so yummy!!! Loved the Oxtail and white fish ceviche. Did not like the fried chicken... We also had a pitcher of Sangria... Tasted amazing too... It's on the pricer side but def worth it. The ambience is so great and the waiters are friendly.

NahPdQovvGONyMyiKzXmiQ.text: I really enjoy eating at this place when I come to Vegas. The atmosphere is relaxing. Our server Ernesto was very polite and the food was awesome. Paella, papa bravas, lamb chops, ribs. The sangria mmm.. I recommend anyone who has never tried Tapas food to eat here.

G1QD4dBXhdyuAF5bnTTaJg.text: This place was really good, and not to pricey for the quality you are getting. The white Ceviche was the best I have ever had.  The stuffed peppers were great also.

uM34JMmucT0qlCPu0HKREw.text: I came to Vegas early on a Friday afternoon with my other friends still delayed by air traffic.  Having all day to myself I decided to go exploring in the new Aria City center and after consulting my handheld pocket guide for eats, I decided to do the Julian Serrano tapas bar for lunch.   I liked the friendly, open air decor and bright colors thats easily visible from the lobby of the Aria and after a quick scan of the menu at the door, decide to pull up a seat at the counter and order lunch.  The menu is created by chef Jose Picazo and many of the dishes remind me of the creations of a similarly named chef, Jose Andres, of Bazaar fame in Los Angeles, of which I've tried many times.  However unlike the borderline molecular deconstructionist gastronomy of the Bazaar, the items of JS are a little more conventional and accessible, but no less delicious.  I started off with the avocado cannelloni which was salmon tartare wrapped with sliced avocado with japanese seaweed salad.  I enjoyed this from the first bite as flavours of the salmon, avocado were mixed with a pleasant amount of saltiness. I could have ordered another one of these to finish off my meal.  Next I tried the salmon & truffle dish which was a good but a little dissapointing as the wonderful truffle sauce seemed to clash with otherwise bland and familiar salmon taste, not really infusing into the meat of the fish.  Perhaps pairing the truffle flavour with a different fish would work better.  Rounding out the meal was the Valenciana paella rice with chicken, rabbit, chorizo and saffron rice, very nice indeed.  Luckily I ordered off the lunch menu which was smaller portions but also only half the price of the dinner menu item.  Prices are a bit up there to be honest, but not surprising given small plates usually tend to be pricy and given the premium real estate, but for those who are comfortable spending the extra dime on some quality cooking and intriguing flavours, JS is a nice place to check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WuOHWgsFbEuuXm2wqzpckA.text: Went at 5:30pm on a Wednesday so crowd was light, service was pleasant and responsive, and food came out fast (majority in ~5-10 min).  Atmosphere was like eating in a hotel lobby/lounge (which you are).  Food was so so.  In order of preference:  Stuffed piquillo peppers - bright acidity of tomato sauce well grounded by goat cheese White ceviche - tons of lime (almost soupy) but with great texture and flavor (suprising amount of spice) Albondigas - light fine crumbly texture but short on flavor Brava potatoes - soft on inside and light crisp on outside; go well with garlic aoili and creamy tomato sauce Grilled calamari - meh...  it's just a miniature grilled (not even sliced) squid wih some lime and garlic and garnishing Pintxo de chorizos - little smokies on a bed of mashed potatoes Ahi tuna tempura - too much going on in this dish.. it was just weird..  go to a sushi place instead

OZH4mabq-8cNCdgS9bkE5A.text: Great food at a great price, the ham was unbelievably good and the Spanish chicken rolled around that ham was delicious- would definitely come back, and don't even get me started on the desert. It's too good

ueuxmuTRRX5YvcRFcBYhkA.text: I was at Serrano on July 6th and never had Tapas before. The bartender that was there Roman was very nice and promised us we would be in and out in time for our flight. He suggested some great food and also has us try the sangria witch was perfect and we were in and out just like he said. When I'm back in September I will definitely come see him again. Best service I had during my trip for sure.

hJbwQsS9bLJ-Kj5JVeQN5Q.text: Food was pretty bad, flavorless and the drinks were overly sweet. Wait staff is great, but definitely overpriced.

RD7CllXeWEjhKkiNRE2rEA.text: This is a great spot to check out inside Aria! Highly recommend when visiting Vegas.   We sat at the bar and had Jason as our bartender. He was awesome -- we told him what we were in the mood for and he made us some amazing cocktails. He was also very helpful when deciding on food. Try the pan manchego if you like bruschetta -- so good!!

1dZyRQ7AibLqZoXG8s8joA.text: Food is okay but not the best i have every tasted. Si Tapas in Dallas has better Paella and better tapas. Service is overall okay. Too pricey.

-9QFQMmILVzSu9Bs1M5sYA.text: I really enjoyed my experience here!  I ordered the crispy artichokes, white ceviche, and the roasted red bell peppers.  I wanted the white sangria, but I was told that the sparkling sangria was better.. I'm not sure why they were pushing for the sparkling, but it was delicious.  My favorite dish was the roasted bell peppers.  I thought it was beautifully plated, and when I cut it open, there were slices of red and yellow peppers inside.  I also really liked the ceviche as it was spicy and vinegary.  I also liked the artichokes, for some reason I was expecting it to be crispy artichoke leaves.  The artichokes were quarter sliced and fried.  I would love to come back and try the desserts!

77a37FYHwwCN5uppo-WVWg.text: Excellent food!! Pedro, our waiter, is the best waiter I ever came across. I've travel a lot and have gone to many restaurants but never in my life had a waiter like this, he should be a manager. Everybody was really nice!  Will come back for sure!!

5t2akc8plgC2soyqNyCGPg.text: This is my go to place in Vegas for tapas, specifically beef and seafood tapas! If you enjoy eating beef I would recommend the porterhouse as an entree. If you like lamb there is also an excellent lamb chop entree. As for seafood, Chilean Seabass is great! It has a nice flaky texture and rich in flavor.   Their sparkling sangria is also on point.  If you have a big appetite, I would recommend ordering the seafood paella! It takes 40 mins to cook so prepare to order early. Here is a list of what I ordered (group of 9) and what I think of each dish:  1 large seafood paella - great for sharing, deep hearty flavor, the rice has a nice bite, they are able to accommodate for large groups and can make one big paella if needed  2 duck forgras -excellent whole duck liver sauteed to perfection and sandwiched between two baked apples, the sauce was a little too sweet for me, however the walnuts helped tone it down   2 beef and cheese - cooked medium rare  2 calamari - crispy, not too chewy, fresh  2 salmon cakes- hearty pieces if salmon 2 lamb chop entrees - the white sauce has hints of truffle, great fat to meat ratio, fresh meat  2 Atlantic cod- rich, fatty fish, chive oil was a nice combo  1 Porterhouse - new to the menu, very tender, cooked medium rare  1 beef tartar- excellent! Fresh raw beef with taro chips 2 chicken skewers - has a nice char to it, meaty chunks of chicken

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Seabass! Excellent choice for those who like fish!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skewers

n2yUVZm3dutxJ-sur0rwLw.text: Fantastic all around!! Great selection of tapas. My husband and I had the prime rib meatballs, cheese plate, mushroom risotto, calamari and hangar steak and we loved all of them. Left feeling full yet but the food wasn't overly heavy. Service was also excellent.

_J-ru6bRA9sNkEBScsKgKA.text: We always prefer tapa restaurants back in seattle, becasue we love getting variety of foods in one sitting. After seeing this restaurant near our hotel entrance, we decided to give it a try.   We went straight to eat after the morning workout. It wa pretty empty on sunday morning around 11am.   We had asparagus, beef tartare,steak, and sliders. The sauce that came wth roasted asparagus was one of my favorite thing. It had almond flavor to it, and I enjoyed it alot. Steak was tender and juicy, tartare was fresh. The tartare came with thing sliced root vegetables and  i thought it was a interesting addition. Sliders were great as well.  The price wasn't that bad and i loved the experience. The only thing is, it isn't a closed restaurant, and you are dirextly exposed to people walking by when sitted near the edge of the restaurant.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak

QhqtXAo0Atxik-3pq1s7Zg.text: It was OK... But something is missing. I just couldn't rate  top quality with this Restraunt.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7BEWIivKsHR2afaLdwDy2Q.text: Amazing tapas, amazing desserts (save room!), and amazing bottomless sangria. Definitely recommend the salmon benedict and croquettes. Also the waiter Yoshiro is GREAT! If you get him, you're a lucky guest! Definitely blow all your gambling money here instead

qm54QbOI7m8h4-mDJdI2bQ.text: Service was impeccable; and I am not a seafood lover at all but I felt like eating light food. So we decided to go mostly for raw seafood tapas.  We had:  - honeydew ham: I wish there was more prosciutto (jambon / ham) because the honeydew was in abundance and definitely sweet (the waiter revealed the sweetness is balanced with syrup injections)  - lobster tail salad  Definitely the best dish of all, with perfectly pouched lobster tail and subtle dressing on a crispy bruschetta.  - shrimp ceviche  The zestiness and heat were perfect and the shrimp was perfectly fresh.  - octopus a la Gallega Octopus texture was incredible: not at all chewy. I wish the paprika was used more sparingly because it covered up the fish flavor.   - yellowtail tiradito  Yum! Fresh and creative.   And for dessert:  - Crema Catalana  Oh the orange blossom aroma...   - Almond cake  The aroma was so delicate! Hard to obtain with almonds, they are pretty recognizable.

BHFp9h9s1RoLWEn-amC8BQ.text: This place never disappoints. Amazing food, good service, and a beautiful modern design.  Our waiter was very helpful. Since I had been here before and it was the first time for my friends, I was picking some of the tapas I knew and liked. He suggested other tapas too. The service was fast. Our tapas were brought to our table sooner than expected. My top favorites were the Creamy Risotto, Garlic Chicken, Papas Bravas, Pan Manchego, and Traditional Chicken Croquetas. The dessert, Churros with spicy chocolate was so delicious and brought back some childhood memories.   Julian Serrano has a beautiful modern design. It very colorful and lively. The restrooms are cover from top to bottom in tiny mosaic multicolor tile. Plus the restrooms play Spanish lessons.  I highly recommend Julian Serrano!! It's a must try! This is one of my top favorite restaurants.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Tartare

Hp4M0QJWY4nsPPFNUBBhxw.text: The only thing holding me from rating this restaurant 5 stars is pricing and portion. you shouldnt have to charge $25 a plate for 3 bites of food.. Cmon get the hell out of here with that. But with all that said the food here is pretty good but I think you can get a deal on their suckling pig dish if you have like 8 people..we saw another table ordering it and it looked awesome! Anyways the place is solid and if there was a happy hour on all their tapas dishes I would come back

JELYIUkvbU9dkeO2rnamFA.text: The food was great here. All the tapas is amazing in their own rights. The Paealla is great also. Only beef I had with this restaurant is the server keep bugging you to order more than you can eat. Are they on commission here or something? The server got us to order a paealla the size of 12 people when we only had 6 people. WTF? But the food tasted awesome though. Oh, also, get the sparkling Sangria, not the red like they recommend. The sparkling one is so much better!

nSeqlud3SIJBV0cpEslFGg.text: My boyfriend and I love Tapas Restaurants because we get to try a lot of flavors and new dishes at the same time. We came to Julian Serrano after a friend who used to manage the place highly recommended it for my boyfriend's special birthday dinner. We went in and were so impressed with the wonderful service and how kind and welcoming the staff was. We ordered all kinds of special menu items and everything was delicious! We even got two! Drinks on the house for our dinner and a free plate of three! Different desserts! Loved loved loved it! Definitely will be back on one of many our future visits!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The awesome complimentary dessert plate! The perfect way to end a perfect meal!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I totally forgot the name f this dish (my boyfriend had mixed feelings about it..
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The (amazing) grilles New York Steak! Yum!!!

ggv1SsSUylSHeNJGbXzuCA.text: We love Tapas. Being from KC, MO, we delighted to find this lovely establishment on the casino floor while staying at the Aria Hotel and Casino. In a resort property of that level, you expect dining to be exceptional, and during our 5-day stay, that's what we experienced. What sets Julian Serrano above all is how they handled a complaint: The first time we ate there, we ordered a variety that included a beef short rib Paella. When we were settling our check, I mentioned that someone should let the Chef know that beef short ribs should not be crunchy. Our server, Erwin, immediately stepped away and returned with the G M, Stephen Kuo, who graciously thanked us for our feedback. He invited us to lunch again as his guests. We came the next day and ordered a similar meal, but requested a different Paella. When our meal was served, Mr. Kou accompanied the server, bringing another short rib along with our order! It was phenominal...perfectly cooked and delicious. The whole experience was handled better than we've ever experienced. Every member of the staff has a goal to be tbe best. For my money, they hit the mark.

bn_GgtPowXh3Km8SkjBiBQ.text: Whimsical, vibrant & upbeat restaurant with friendly service to top off the overall experience.  Drink the Agua de Serrano-a crisp and spicy cocktail made with tequila, rum, cava and hananero infused syrup...banger!!  Eat the white ceviche served with thin taro root crisps.  I'd maybe pass on the crispy artichoke...I liked it but I think it could have used some salt or some kind of hot sauce.  The menu has so many delectible options but I stopped there.   I'll definitely make it a point to visit again and sample some more.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fresh white ceviche
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cocktail with a kick - agua de serrano

y4P0nYffslCN6nYIvusSzQ.text: The food was great but our service was lack luster. I would expect a more attentive waiter at this price point.

Q-Mk3VhHATtGLjNjJrCDwQ.text: Thanks to religiously watching Top Chef for the last eleven seasons, I'm just not a fan of Julian Serrano. In the most recent season, he built a Spanish menu against his the awesome Dominique Crenn, and every one of his dishes looked so boring that nobody was rooting for his team.  Fast forward to visiting Las Vegas with the idea of gorging myself on everything tasty that the city has to offer ... and I decided to visit Julian's eponymous restaurant for kicks (and to prove to myself that I was right in judging him from what I've seen on Top Chef). And you know what? I was wrong. I give this restaurant a solid 3.5 stars and appreciate what Serrano is doing to heighten Las Vegas' culinary caliber.  I think the decor is fun; trendy, whimsical and colorful. Kind of like tapas :)  If you're getting tapas, it's important to get around three things per person and share, so that you get the max out of your experience. Here are the highlights:  -- heirloom tomato salad -- coca vegetarian -- yellowtail tiradito -- stuffed piquillo peppers  Why wasn't it rated higher? One of our items was "lost" off the check, and we waited for 20-30 minutes even after letting them know. Second, while some of the food is great, other items like the chicken croquetas were downright dogs.  Nonetheless, I'm happy that JS had vindicated himself in my eyes ... I'm sure he'll sleep better at night now.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nGiEqOgCmfllnz835Zbkgw.text: I had been here a few months ago with a colleague and we had a great meal - great service and food. We had ordered 5 items to share and were satisfied with each one. I then took my husband back here last night and had a totally different experience. The food was still great. We had the ribeye, stuffed peppers, mushroom risotto, and charcuterie plate.  We were still hungry and wanted to order more but had gotten impatient with the slow service that we decided to just leave. I am a huge tapas fan so know what to expect and have to say - the portions were tiny. We had some laughs over this. If we had been a group of 4, each person would have gotten about one bite of each thing. At the high on-the-strip prices, that means you would be ordering (and spending) a lot.   I think we either got a bad server or she was having a bad night, because she was nice enough but hard to come by. We almost reached the point of asking the hostess if someone could get us our check to pay since the food and wine were long gone and we couldn't seem to even make eye contact with our server the few times she walked by. A different guy had taken our wine order and served the bottle for us, but we weren't sure if he was the sommelier or just another server helping her out. He didn't really say. Odd experience in that sense. Given my first experience had great service, I'm left with a really hit or miss feeling. Maybe try it a third time as the tie breaker?

Koj_FW9X936sgMMnJbGMHA.text: Good place, good service, very small plates. These portions are the size for photomodels, but not for the hungry man. The menu at the entrance to the restaurant does not match the real one.

MzUOf9UQVQIRJ_mTz1XN0g.text: Yummies in my tummies  Ive been here twice and both times, almost everything was perfect!!  My favorite dish of all time is the Squid ink rice.. It is the yummiest and I order it EVERY TIME.  The only fail was the Japanese Eggplant, It was undercooked and the flavors were not too complimentary.  My pictures will speak for themselves, must try !!

Dnj4wD7x_m4K71mXjV3YoA.text: A very good restaurant. Food tastes very good. From the soup to desert, all are perfect. Will recommend it to friends.

OyDYyEQtBCS6K5c5lpKguA.text: We had a company dinner here. Although the service was rather slow( took them a while to bring our drinks and refills), the food is quite nice.  My favorites: Potatas Bravas, Ahi Appetizer, pan manchego, mushroom risotto, Rabo de Toro and the amazing Red Sangria  Disappointing:the spinach salad and the absolutely horrible paella. I was looking forward to it, but the flavors were way off and the rice was over cooked. This is one dish that almost no one on our party ate.  I would come back for some drinks and apps, but would skip the paella for sure.

7hyqZajWEkLYz_5cR_h4Pw.text: Ate here twice, once for the paella and once for tapas only. The paella was huge, definitely too much for 2 normally-hungry people (this was 2 years ago so it might have changed). The tapas that I had this weekend were obviously much smaller, but just as delicious. I can't remember anything I had and I'm too lazy to look at the menu right now, but I just remember that I had a great dining experience. They did run out of stock of one item that I wanted, and their mushroom risotto doesn't have any pieces of mushroom in the final dish, but other than that it was a great dining experience for a good price.

hYPT-q3-TRHaMBtvPdO5Pw.text: Stopped here for a happy hour cocktail with my friend. We picked the $5 white sangria which was fresh and OK, but there was some fruit missing, wish I had ordered the red one that looked more 'authentic'. We also had the papas bravas with alioli to nibble and they were very good and the protion was enough for both of us. The place is very nice for a drink stop while shopping in the nice Crystals mall or while walking around Aria. The bar is nice and the atmosphere at happy hour is relaxed but with a touch of class, loved the Spanish songs in the background! Service was courteous and fast enough. Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas, and perhaps I'll try the tapas for dinner.

t-UCHfXPbLd-8IZd8h-MkQ.text: They accommodated the 6 of us rather quickly and our waiter was very helpful in offering the chefs special (which is also the priciest) but we had all already had a few drinks and said let's go for it. $980 later we were full and extremely satisfied with every plate that came to our table. I love how it was family style plates where we can all share, I didn't think it was going to be enough food at first but the plates kept coming and we were so stuffed by the end of it. We couldn't leave without dessert and the churros hit the spot. Everything was presented beautifully and each plate was exploding with flavor.

MbhBnknkjc5BDbbQPmD2oQ.text: Stellar Tapas restaurant. Amazing variety of Spanish food. Make sure to ask for Pedro as your waiter. Very good and will definitely come back every year that we are here.

iLEGHUgV1JSAcBHA8yTRvw.text: Very expencive place and very small portion tapas compare to other spanish tapas restaurants, will not offer you a piece of bread with your wine, with soo many choices in vegas please choose wisely and enjoy your experience somewhere else

GaUSawJ3WHHoaOvTB4Km0A.text: Love it! Must try their paellas very yummy . Great service. Love their sangria!!! Everything is so good! The octopus is amazing!!

jPYnv3sM6GPh7gKDfnfjfA.text: ********************* 1247 **********************     What not to love about chef Julian Serrano. He's a James Beard Foundation Award for Best Chef: Pacific and James Beard Award for Best Chef: Southwest, and many more awards. My parents are a fan of his 2 Michelin Star Picasso at the Bellagio. This trip to CES 2015, I got to dine here a few more times, our group tried about everything on the menu on the 4 days we stayed at the Aria.       The warm orange and red accents adorning the walls, crystal ball lighting dropping down from the ceiling, a beautiful bar, with brighter counter top, easily seat 20-30 people at the bar, make it a perfect place to eat, if you were traveling alone on a business trip.    - Chicharrones, pork belly, caramel, black pepper   - Lobster gazpacho, chilled Spanish tomato soup, lobster meat, cherry - interesting soup.   - Steamed mussels, shallots and garlic, brandy, natural jus - delicious   - Sauteed padron peppers, orange zest, orange sea salt   - Yellowtail "tiradito", sweet potato haystacks, horseradish cream, ponzu  - Octopus, potatoes, Spanish paprika   - Seared scallop, romesco sauce  - Ribeye, mashed potatoes, garlic sauteed kale, caramelized onions - a bit over cooked than what we requested.   - Chilean seabass, Mediterranean quinoa - generous portion, very tasty.  - Lobster fideua, angel hair pasta, half lobster tail, roasted red pepper - I would skip this dish, the pasta was prepared as Chinese egg noodle, sauteed in style, didn't do it for us.  - Gambas a la plancha, head-on prawns, lemon garlic oil dressing - 1 of my favorite dishes here.   - Paella Valenciana, chicken, rabbit, Spanish pork chorizo,  vegetables, saffron - a MUST ORDER when you come here.      Even it was CES 2015, the restaurant was over booked. Service was very good and the new GM was very attentive to us. The cocktails were a hit for our group, check out their happy hour menu $5-$7 sangria, wines, and small dishes from SUNDAY - THURSDAY 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM.     Julian Serrano also offers a vegetarian and vegan menu range from $6-$40. A $59 Signature Tasting Menu for 4 course, optional wine pairing available for $29 per person, is a good option if you are a couple.      All the dishes were fairly price for Vegas strip, if anything, this restaurant is a bargain on the strip.     All the dishes were good, a few didn't cut it for me, but my team enjoyed a few times we were here. Even though it's a tapas place, but the portion is fairly large. So come here hungry, with a group of 4-5 friends will be a good way to try all the dishes.

RPsY-5wFwKxESLoJEJAvRw.text: We had a great meal at Julian Serrano - the food and service were both excellent. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fantastic selection and meal in Vegas.   As for the overwhelming menu, I'd recommend the imported Spanish Serrano ham plate - a heavy portion of prosciutto to start a meal. I'd also recommend the grilled rib eye steak. It's so tasty and sizable for a tapas dish.   Enjoy!

jM8Oewc-XcLTXETsok9nbA.text: Black rice looked delicious, but not available. We had the gambas shrimp which was perfect and also the grilled calamari- too chewy and rubber like. Red Sangria was delicious though!!!! Also, not a fan of the hangar steak - 3 small pieces.

LhBinSh_-kRibilulTLukA.text: The happy hour menu is amazing! I'm a glutton and was able to get full off $90 worth of tapas for two people (the husband is a big eater as well)  Things we got: Dates 5/5 some of the best dates I've had Apple foie gras 5/5. Best foie I've ever had. The roasted sweet apple with foie gras is a great marriage Potatoes bravas 3/5 Slider 3/5 Hamachi 4/5 Yellowtail with sweet potatoe 4/5  Definitely my favorite tapas restaurant to date. I like it as much as Jose Andres and this is much more affordable ! I'll have a hard time not coming to this place every time I'm in Vegas !
