yVz0Naq8fedYKZwBREBk9w.text: First and foremost, our waiter--Erwin--was fabulous.  Very kind, down-to-earth...yet informative, refined and classy.  He helped us out with choices on the menu (without being overbearing or "fake"), providing his suggestions and experience with certain dishes.  He sold my husband on the gazpacho soup...and sure enough, he said it was the best soup he'd ever had.  I decided on some bread (queso fresco, I believe it was) and tuna carpaccio.  The presentation of both was beautiful, although I admittedly didn't realize the bread was going to be small, little cubes, compressed with layers of olives, cheese, etc.  I ate around the olives (I do like olives, but the compressed taste was a little off-putting for my personal preference).  Still very tasty!  The tuna carpaccio, however, was absolutely delicious.  The medley of texture and flavor was harmoniously woven together.  I especially enjoyed the pine nuts sprinkled on top.  Gave it a nice crunch and bang.  The decoration of the restaurant is very attractive; not too gaudy or obnoxious, and the lighting is spot-on.  It was also very convenient for us, having a hotel stay at the Aria, so we didn't have to go far.  All in all, I'd definitely go there again.  I wish we were hungrier, as our lunch carried over into our dinner, and prevented us from ordering a lot more.  We will definitely correct that mistake next time we go!

1wLzYS5YFAIPj-5wAeI5Qw.text: We got lucky to have the opportunity to do the restaurant week here at famous Julian Serrano restaurant. The lunch deal was fantastic! A total of $30 and you can mix and match 4 tapas from a long list of their famous tapas selections. My friend and I were able to select 8 tapas for lunch!   Brava potatoes - one of their most famous tapas, the potatoes was fried just right, crispy outside and soft inside. On top of it was their spicy tomato and allioli sauce. The combination was wonderful taste of potatoes. It will give you a wonderful surprise in your mouth.  Gambas - sauteed shrimp in garlic brava sauce with arbol chilis. This was one of my most favorite tapas here. The sauce was amazing. The garlic and chili flavors gave the dish a kick to the sauce and also elevated its flavors to the next level. One of those flavors that will wow you!  Stuffed piquillo peppers - unfortunately this was one of my least favorite tapas because the goat cheese was way too powerful for me. For people who like cheese, you may like the dish but I was overwhelmed with the creaminess and unable to enjoy the dish. Pintxo de chorizos - it was a really good dish. I love the flavor of chorizos and topped with lemon honey, which balanced out the saltiness of the pork chorizo. Their mashed potato also surprised me by how smooth it was. It was a wonderful combination of chorizo, mashed potato, and honey sauce.  Octopus a la gallega - The octopus was cooked in Spanish paprika and sat on top of thin sliced potatoes. I love the flavor of the octopus but I think the dish can be even better if the octopus could be sliced thicker.  Traditional spanish jamon croquetas - another my favorite! It was well made croquetas. I am not too familiar with croquetas but the flavor was excellent! It was a pretty heavy dish but I love the crispy crunch outside and creamy filling inside. The filling was just perfect amount cheese and serrano ham.  Salmon with truffle - the salmon was so-so. I was quite disappointed with the dish. It was over cooked in my opinion because it was dry and hard once it arrived to our table. The seasoning was nothing special or surprising. For this level of restaurant, I expected the salmon to be cooked perfectly and seasoned appropriately.  Rabo de toro - aka red wine braised oxtail. Amazing! Another favorite. I love the sauce and how the oxtail was prepared. Definitely showed the skills of chefs at Julian Serrano. The sauce was perfect for the oxtail.   Overall, I loved the experience at Julian Serrano! Dining here was more than just the food. The ambiance, the waiter service, and the excellent flavors of food together made this a great restaurant. I highly recommend to try it out if you are in Vegas.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with truffle
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional Spanish croquetas

0VztxEJXXaucqS8XllARBw.text: Absolutely ridiculous. I left starving. This place was outrageously priced. I've raged all day long clubbing and pooling it up; I wanted a meal. We had to leave this place and go eat again. I've NEVER had such small plates. Then they serve you flat water with no ice and I couldn't get refills to save my life.

rU2UDjUnt25OUR0gkZt4uQ.text: I joined Yelp specifically to review this place. Yelpers have helped me out quite a few times, so I found it necessary to write this review because I chose to go there specifically on the recommendation of the yelpers. I was there last Saturday for dinner with my Gma. We only did small plates, having six different selections.  5 star food -Mushroom risotto- I could've eaten a giant bowl of this. Absolutely PHENOMENAL! -Garlic chicken thighs-crispy skin on the outside, nice and moist chicken on the inside.  4.5 star food -Stuffed dates- great play on sweet and salty, just wished there were more than. 3 on the plate. I get the small plates concept, but compared to the huevos, three small dates seems skimpy.  4 star food -Huevos estrellados- really great flavor, just a little too greasy. -Iberico sliders- nice sliders, but for the best ham and beef on the market, I wasn't blown away.  3.5 star food -Lobster salad- GORGEOUS presentation, nice vinaigrette, lobster was slightly overcooked.   Honestly, I'd give it a 4.5 overall but since half stars aren't possible, I'm rounding up :) Definitely will head back here next time I'm in Vegas!

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos estrellados 4/5
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom risotto 5/5 BEST DISH OF THE NIGHT!

hILeGk1qcz2n6yXt0afMwg.text: Went here for dinner last night (March 10). While the food was great, what detracted from the experience was the pushy waiter. He expressed obvious disappointment and discontent we didn't order cocktails or the paella he recommended (didn't feel like drinking quite yet). And when we finished dinner somewhat quickly (restaurant was freezing), acted very put out that we asked for our check. We weren't a difficult party, very low maintenance actually, but he made it clear he didn't think we were spending enough money for his time. While the food was great (rib eye and mushroom risotto were awesome), the service was subpar enough that I wouldn't go back. There are so many restaurant options in Vegas, don't need to waste time with bad service.

c3mIdCvFNfz9pQ9kItYFhg.text: My wife and I love Julian Serrano. We try to make it a point to stop in every time we are in La Vegas. When we are there, you will find us enjoying a bottle of Albarino at the bar, where we almost always end up trying a few new dishes in addition to some of our favorites. The ambiance here is a perfect match for our tastes. Oh, and if you sit at the bar and opt for a cocktail instead of wine, ask Premo to make you a Suffering Bastard. I tried one on Saturday. Very nice!

LHExe-TEeNNI6CKn3GhwdQ.text: AMAZING thank you yelp for allowing me to find this place bu its amazing reviews. We went here Wednesday night this restaurants is located in the Aria hotel. I looked to see the items that you MUST order and i did and was extremely impressed. I started with the lobster salad omg lobster was cooked just perfectly and a decent portion too. Also the fish ceviche very good, and their advertisement has the tuna lollipops. that you just must try i cannot explain how good they are. Also the salmon with the truffle sauce and mushrooms. Great place a must try if you are a foodie !

O22K7PESJ-VK67GfdYLz_A.text: Amazing tapas dining! Some of the best food we've had on the strip. Great wine selection with very knowledgable servers. Will def go back!! Try the lamb!

5zKqGWopEs1x-K1iIe8Cxw.text: Didn't enjoy the food at all. The only reason they get 2 stars is because the staff was super friendly. The steak wasn't cooked the right way, actually sent it back twice and they still put in on my bill. Never going back there that's for sure. Total rip off !!

k1Uz_FOthOJzFzzyUYG6cg.text: My girlfriend and I were very excited to dine here but the food turned out to be appallingly bad, especially for the price. One of our dishes was described as eggs with chorizo on top of fried potatoes. The eggs were bland and mushy, the chorizo had the taste and texture of mediocre hot dog meat, and this restaurant actually had the gall to serve these things on top of pre-made french fries for $11. The other wildly overpriced "tapas" were consistently ill-conceived, poorly cooked, under-seasoned, or some combination thereof. I have never been actively insulted by food before, so the dining experience was unique in that respect. Julian Serrano should be ashamed. Avoid this place if you like food at all and have even a modicum of self-respect.

Vpx_xjLRmxRkTYPa0ALXhQ.text: Been here twice.  Loved it more the second time.  Sure it's a bit pricey for tapas but the dishes are great.  The seating area in the front has views of the hotel/casino which are fun but if you want more privacy and tranquility sit in the back - you forget you're in a casino.    Calamari a la plancha has to be one of the best tasting things I've ever had in my life - no exaggeration.  The chorizo is way too spicy so be wary.  White Sangria is refreshing.  Usually you can get a seat, no problem.

Fv1yWJiE2wy2Qi4Bldcf7g.text: Went here with another couple during our recent trip to Las Vegas. I have always enjoys Spanish tapas and was lured by the extensive menu at Julian Serrano. We had been spending some time walking along the strip and went to the restaurant around 8 PM on a Friday night without a reservation. Luckily they were able to seat us right away at a "high-top" bar table, which was in a cool spot near the kitchen so we could see all the plates coming out. Our server was prompt and polite, and the wine and drink list is nicely organized on an i-pad for easy browsing.  We shared a bunch of small plates for the table, all of which were nicely presented and very tasty:  mixed seafood ceviche | shrimp | white fish | octopus | cilantro | lime juice: 4.5/5 - very bright flavors with nice acidity and a bit of heat. Seafood was perfectly tender  gambas | sauteed shrimp | garlic | arbol chilis - 5/5 - amazingly succulent, tomato-garlic broth was addictive  fresh calamari a la plancha | lemon parsley e.v.o.o. | caramelized onions - 5/5 - star of the night - grilled calamari was so tender and flavorful - we ordered a second plate!  monkfish and pisto | seared monkfish | eggplant | zucchini | tomato - 4/5 - very moist with a good crsip sear - lots of fresh paprika flavor - wish it were bigger  sauteed baby spinach | pine nuts | raisins | apple | shallots - 3/5 - well prepared but not overly interesting - though we ordered it without the nuts and raisins because of allergy. the crunch of pine nuts would likely have made it more well rounded.  cheese lollipop | herb bread crumb | manchego cheese | red wine poached pear - 4.5/5 - little bite of crispy cheesy goodness - crunch on outside and fluffy creaminess inside. A touch of mint leaf added a nice pop.  spanish iberico sliders | prime beef | iberian pork | caramelized onions - 5/5 - super moist, salty goodness. One of the best burger bites I have ever had  creamy risotto | wild mushroom | aged manchego cheese - 4/5 - very good mushroom risotto  Everything was really good. Would not get the spinach again. There are a ton of other veggie options that looked good though, so there is plenty for non-meat eaters.  Would love to go again and try more tapas!

iE5x0ev27bxUlcTSToaVpw.text: Yellowtail, stuffed dates, tuna cones, stuffed peppers, Spanish meats are all great choices. Sit at bar. Fun to watch them make some of the dishes there.

_4So6CC2yCIlqGHj8nDtqw.text: Yum. Yum. Yum.  Great service (Jeffrey is amazingly helpful) and it's nice to have small plates as a mid afternoon snack/pick me up!

WyfAzs7WHO36Byx4Fw1Dow.text: Excellent food.  Great value.  We went here multiple times because I wanted to try all the yummy dishes.

NGSaP6zbgp6qkLP4UTGjQw.text: Such a fan of Julian Serrano -- he isn't Catalonian, but his menu samples heavily from the local cuisine (botifarra!  yummm).  The kitchen turns out some nice representations of tapas from other regions of Spain, as well.  And Serrano himself spends a lot of time in the kitchen and the dining room.  I like seeing "celebrity" chefs who are hands-on with their spin-off enterprises.

pYgVM7JHH29L0bDdK0YbeA.text: HORRIBLE!  Food arrived ice cold.  We sent it back and did not even receive an apology.  The dish was redelivered and was just luke warm.  We were not given new serving plates, and had to use the same plates that had the original portion of what we sent back and was never cleared.  2 other tapas dishes were delivered to our table which we did not order.  It was just complete confusion and rude terrible service from start to finish. The food was ok when we finally got what we ordered but really just mediocre and not worth the $$$.  On the way out, we told the manager how poor the service was and how unhappy we were with our meal, and he said, "Wow, that's terrible", but made no further effort to rectify the situation or offer us anything to make up for our terrible meal.  He obviously didn't really care very much either.   Very poor customer service.  Do yourself a favor and skip this restaurant!!

RRYvvBSSBDwGJh_NPJKbYQ.text: Was happy to see tapas in Vegas.  We arrived and were seated immediately and welcomed by Donovan our server for the evening.  We started with a martini (berry) don't remember the name and a bottle of wine. Both were delicious and there was a great wine and drink selection.  My husband and I order one tapas each because we knew we wanted for order the paella.  We started with a cheese plate and tuna carpaccio, both very flavorful.  We then ordered the mixed paella, which is by far enough for two.  The seafood was plentiful and included mussels, shrimp, fish, and chorizo.  The rice flavor was wonderful and not overbearing.    The seafood flavors still shined through.  Donovan was an excellent server, very attentive and pleasant, I recommend you ask for him when you dine there.  If you like paella, you can't go wrong at Julian Serrano!!  Enjoy!

QFopJSj1a2_Sd1-xIxNqSg.text: Loved this restaurant - definitely a fantastic option for lunch or dinner in Vegas. Moderately priced, the tapas is delicious - I would recommend 3-4 dishes per person, for sharing with others. The white anchovies and mixed seafood ceviche  were my personal favourites! Also try the cocktails - again, beautiful, plus they sure do pack a punch! Recommend making a reservation.

gx_dgv5vhh4sXO4uHyLqrA.text: Our party of 8 ordered 26 dishes and every single one was excellent.  Highlights included: White Ceviche, Lobster-Pineapple Skewers, Pan Manchego, Creamy Risotto and the Beef and Cheese. But the crowd favorite was the Brava Potatoes, crispy potato cubes served piping hot topped with spicy tomato and creamy alioli sauce. We also agreed the Huevos Estrellados is probably the best hangover dish ever invented.   Do not ignore dessert here. Treat yourself to the churros with spicy hot chocolate or the bunuelos - sugar coated donut holes served with butterscotch caramel dipping sauce. Yum, I could go for those right now.   Price point is high - you'll spend $14 for 4 Lobster-Pineapple skewers, however you are in Vegas and the food is sooo tasty. A pitcher of their refreshing red sangria and suddenly it's easy to justify spending so much on the indulgent meal.    We really enjoyed our 2 hr dinner in this bright and airy modern restaurant. Service was excellent, noise level was tolerable and the food will bring all of us back next time we're in Vegas.

c6Uoe4g-L2CgxGO5f1Q83g.text: Excellent service, mixed paella totally uninteresting for 50 bucks and luke warm.  Ate here before, pretty much the same mediocre and overpriced food.  Gotta love Vegas, they don't get better just pricier.

Fg_ajHccPoK2Vn9B0kyH9Q.text: Came here on a Saturday night in July for a bachelorette party. Groups of 9 girls can be challenging...but not for Julian Serrano. We arranged for a set menu with Sangria ahead of time and were pleasantly surprised to have personalized menus and an amazing table upon arrival. The entire staff treated us like VIPS and the food was absolutely wonderful. It was a great experience an I know we are all looking forward to going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KAPnF7mTf-t5T2X8LPfZcw.text: no, no, no!!! (sigh)  i love tapas.  so i was super stoked to be coming here for dinner.  the space is sort of odd because it's opened into the lobby so everyone can see you eat.  some people may dig that but i don't.  we let the waiter help us choose a few dishes, some were pretty interesting.  i don't remember what any of them were called, but i do remember how we left hungry.  the service was alright.  our server did drop a few utensils or forgot to refill the water, but whatever.  no one's perfect.  look, for the price, i expect to be semi-satisfied when i leave and i defintely don't think the price is worth eating in a setting where i felt like i was eating at some food court in a mall.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nDnucWmfUDPlFDP-Vh-1EQ.text: Good food, but I wasn't blown away.  We started with the dates and calamari.  The dates were pretty tasty, but the calamari tasted like it had been warmed up in a microwave.  It was soggy and blah.  Next came the white fish ceviche, which was probably my favorite.  My only complaint was that we didn't get enough chips to go with the fish.  Finally, our entree was mariscada plate.  It came with a lobster tail, shrimp, clams, mussels, and a meringue.  The seafood was good, but the meringue was so strange.  I'm not sure if that's a normal thing to serve with tapas, but it tasted like a sponge - or insulation.  And there was so much of it!  We honestly weren't even sure what it was and asked a server, and she said she wasn't sure either.  We had to look at a menu to figure it out.   Our waiter was great and the atmosphere was nice.  I also enjoyed the Spanish lesson in the bathroom :)

qSmGFOwfL3G-TY-3R4l1TA.text: Great food I had the beef and cheese tapas! So good! And the mushroom soup very good! But the best was Chelsea!  Great job juggling a party of 13! So professional and very friendly!

sT6ta_9D8y9-JfsxZudXMQ.text: Food is always delicious here. I had the romaine, albondigas and some mixed paella. However, the albondigas came an hour late, the paella came out 1.5 hours late, after repeatedly it asking our server. The manager made up for it. We weren't charged for the dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas and Jordan!

I3jmFy2BX2EVW-KUWEX_mA.text: As a vegetarian at a dinner in Vegas I was expecting this to be another night where I pick at side dishes, however Julian Serrano proved me wrong! This tapa styled restaurant offered plenty of vegetarian options that were not only delicious but also very satisfying. The resturant is structured in a fun way that it would be good for a large group or a smaller party. My favorite items on the menu would hands down be the goat cheese stuffed peppers paired with the white sangria! I would highly recommend Julian Serrano as a fun and delicious way to start your night in Vegas!

ajNrvLdH_dxZ8xclq4N4jA.text: Stopped in for some snacks with friends before a lunch we had planned, and we sat at the bar in order to be able to order from the tapas bar menu. I'm a vegetarian, so I ordered off of the vegetarian section, which has a good (and good-looking) selection.  The mushroom risotto is probably the primary reason for the 5-star rating I'm giving this place, because it was fantastic and one of the more memorably delicious things I had while in Vegas (and my group travelled here with the intent of eating lots of tasty food while seeing a couple of shows, because we're not really the gambling or clubbing crowd). I could probably down a giant bowl of that stuff and want more :) The intensity of the wild mushroom flavor is amazing, and is something I may have to try to learn to replicate at home (even if I've never made risotto before, ha). The stuffed piquillo pepper was also deliciously creamy, and had I not had another meal, I think I would have ordered seconds of both dishes. Maybe thirds, even! I also had their non-alcoholic sangria, which was decent and I really appreciated that it was on the menu for those that can't or choose not to drink alcohol. My friends ordered from the seafood and meats sections (plus a chocolate cake or brownie-looking dessert), and seemed pleased with their items as well.  The bartender, Jeff, was also really personable and friendly. It was fun that he told me what he was putting in the sangria as he was doing so, which is helpful if I want to try and recreate a similar drink at home (although it had a lot of ingredients that I certainly don't normally have on hand). He admitted easily to not knowing which of the vegetarian items had egg in them off the top of his head (I have an egg allergy), and then happily fished out the allergen menu/printout from behind the counter and handed it to me so I could look it over myself, which is something I wish more restaurants could (or chose to) do. They actually have a section of the tapas marked out as vegan, so it sounds like they'd accommodate a vegan here just fine, as well :)  Overall, it's a nice little restaurant with some really intensely flavored and delicious tapas, and I would absolutely be down for coming back if I ever travel to Vegas again :) (And I will probably order a big bowl of the wild mushroom risotto, yum!)

ED5OCUUBNy9Z5lZfLQLltg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Everything is delicious. Bacon wrapped dates and mixed paella are must try, as well as oxtail and foie gras.

9XSksjqpn4ufUOK-xbBsUQ.text: This is the best tapas place I have been to.  Great service! Friendly staff for being packed to capacity.  We were here with a party of 22.  They took the time to explain what was in each dish. I recomend the Scallops, best I have ever had.  They have a Limited beer selection, but I still give it a 5 star.

B1ekLc7-fSTWTEahwhbwUA.text: Wow this place was so freaking good!!!! Seriously loved it.  We started out with pitchers of sangria - both the white and the red were fantastic.  I may have liked the white a tiny bit more, but the red was really good too.  We ordered a ton of tapas, but my favorites were the meatballs, scallops, pan manchego, and the sliders.  But everything we ate was delicious, those were just highlights.  The service was great, the restaurant was well decorated, and it was nice to get to see the Aria hotel! Highly recommend.

gyf8KJNFsYy2GGT0ogLIPw.text: Easily the BEST tapas restaurant and bar i have ever been to!!  When i found out there was an upscale Spanish Tapas spot in Vegas I was very excited!!  It's located inside the amazing Aria Hotel and Casino.  I am a huge fan of the food, concept and culture. Julian Serrano 110% exceeded my expectations.  The atmosphere was very cool.   Staff was very friendly, attentive and accommodating.  I ordered the Piquillo Peppers stuffed with Goat Cheese and Mushroom, the Calamari with an incredible Aioli, the Salmon atop a Portabella Mushroom with a Truffle Bechamel, the Chicken Croquet's and the Red Sangria.  I was thoroughly pleased with every dish. The flavors and taste were out of this world!!  The esthetics of the restaurant were very modern. The music played in the background was a hip Spanish style.  I will most definitely return to this restaurant to try the rest of the menu ASAP!!!

HOwTRc4RhZw0KSpDLoZV1w.text: I really enjoyed my meal here!!  I'd say it's in my top 5 of Vegas restaurants.   Stuffed Dates - 5/5 - must get these so delicious!!  Short ribs 5/5 - tender and flavorful!  White ceviche 4/5 - large pieces and is lightly seasoned wish it had more kick  Seared scallops  5/5 - I love scallops!! Too bad they weren't a little bigger, but was cooked perfectly   Beef and cheese 3/5 - did not like the texture of the meat and did not like the combo with the cheese and walnuts and honey  Creamy risotto 4/5 - wish the rice was just a tad softer and less salty as it was verry salty  Churro 3/5 - I think I was hoping it would taste like the Disneyland churros but it's just lightly sugared fried dough you dip in chocolate sauce, much more authentic I'm sure  The sliders looked good but I didn't get to try it. The sangria was good.  Can't wait to go back!!

6xTE4T28gr_aXeUfJetwZw.text: this restaurant is beautiful, though I only sat at the bar and had dessert.  cocktails are delicious & tiramisu is outstanding.  I would go back for dinner.

SZurKji5v8nNONlgyaj33A.text: We came to Julian Serrano for a close friend's  30th bday. Because we were going to a show after dinner, we had to eat kind of early (7pm so the place was not as busy as usual). The atmosphere is airy, open to the edge of the lobby and entrance from the Crystals shopping centre. The decor is very spanish- bright and vibrant colors.  We started with the sangria- which they offer in red or white. The drink goes down so smooth, so be careful if you don't want to get drunk. Definitely get a pitcher to share amongst a table before dinner.  Family style is the only way to go here-  we ordered tons of share plates and a large paella. Try to save room for dessert because the creme brulee was unbelievable.  As with most places in Vegas, they have a great wine list. Bring your wine spectator skills and pick a bottle from their big collection.  Service was great- although we never had the same person come to our table ever. It was like they had an endless supply of staff and sent out a different one with every plate.  Price wise, it is decent for Vegas. Small plates are generally cheaper but can add up quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red sangria
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Valencia paella
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna

QPLSDCfepeX6swWNrbyQgA.text: I've tried about 20 dishes from here and most of them are pretty legit. I like the ribs and the spicy bombas (be warned, they've got serious kick). The Colorado lamb is the only dish that I can recall not liking - it was just kind of bland to me. Overall a fun tapas restaurant - be ready to spend ~$40-50/person before drinks.

EfqoGaDVoBk813SwMhTB1g.text: I LOVE this restaurant.  Small plates, masterfully done, superb service without being pretentious.  I've eaten here a few times, the first time for a quick lunch - my husband ordered a Spanish Tortilla and after one bite (and ordering another) we vowed to return.  Came for dinner and for some WEIRD reason my husband let me order the wine - the sommelier was great, I gave her my budget, the type of wine I was looking for and she gave me 3 suggestions, the wine I picked was awesome!  I actually am trying to find some locally!    Started with the pork belly and micro mozzarella - it was delicious. Shared the Paella with Lobster, Chicken, Chorizo, Vegetables & Saffron Rice - perfect to share.  Great combo of flavors and surprisingly none of them got lost.  Had to try the Spanish tortilla - so simple and delicious.    I will always try to stop in here when I'm in Vegas, you can grab a quick bite at the bar or sit down and enjoy dinner.  I look forward to trying more items on the menu.

6bUdDAmlV2DgT9G3mQEm8g.text: Came here expecting a nice ish tapas restaurant but turns out its a bit more casual. Its in the lobby of the Aria and despite being labeled as "$$$" there are a lot of people in flip flops and still wearing bathing suits or what have you from the pool.   We had reservations for 9 and arrived 20 min early and asked one of the hosts if we could be sat a little early. He said he would check and then disappeared for 10 minutes. People that just walked in were sat down before us as we just waited for him. He eventually came back and looked at us then walked away. Ok. After another while and more walk ins being sat in front of us a waitress finally said to follow her and sat us at our table. It was already past 9 at that point. He could've just said "Sorry we can't sit you earlier" and we would have happily sat at the bar and ordered a drink. What a pointless waste of our time as we stood by the hostess stand.   Food was ok. A couple hits and a couple misses. Overall wish we had gone to Jaleo instead. Food was not super creative, the tasting menu especially was really generic with caeser salad, chicken, and molten lava cake. Not very Spanish-y at all I imagine it was trying to appeal to the mass audience/flip flop crowd.  Started off with chicken croquettes with bechamel, yummy and really creamy/fried but not very reminiscent of Spanish croquettes. The pan con tomate and manchego was unremarkable. We were pretty excited for the black foot pig ribs with beans and the black foot pig shoulder on toast with caramelized onions. Black foot pigs are fed only acorns and their meat is supposed to taste amazing. The ribs were ALL fat. Honestly could not tell you what the meat tasted like because there were only tiny scraps of it attached to white blubber. The beans were ok. The pork shoulder had good flavor but was so tough. Its a shame to overcook such good quality meat like that. With the onions and toast it would've been lovely if properly cooked.  The dish I most liked was one of the specials, coca with goat cheese, figs and arugula. The coca bread was soooo good. Cannot wait to get that again somewhere. Its like a cakey thicker tortilla. With the fresh figs and goat cheese and arugula this was perfect.  The chicken with chorizo and potatoes was super flavorful and a lot of food. It came with salty whipped cream which I imagine you were supposed to mix into everything else but I was not quite fond of. It could have used a fresh/vegetable element since everything was very heavy.   They forgot my lobster saffron rice but at that point I was full so it was fine.   Looked at desserts but they looked pretty meh. The table next to us ordered the churros and they looked pretty unremarkable. The almond cake with turron ice cream sounded better but after the meal we were reluctant to order it. Would probably not return here.

9lFwRdxV_VyLCRpIlnr06w.text: I LOVE Tapas and this was VERY disappointing. I ordered the beet salad- raw sliced beets on dry arugula (not enough dressing which wasn't a bad thing via the dressing wasn't good either) I had three bites. I also got the Pork tacos. The meet was dry and the flavors did not go well. Some bites were super sour and made me gag. I was too afraid to order anything else so I left hungry... Also the waitstaff is VERY unfriendly. Not impressed at all.

z0sX0fO15YeTkFLwJvmkMQ.text: Full review in blog:  High/Low-lights below.  When the food did begin to arrive, however, we figured out why there was a delay - instead of batching our dozen dishes into waves, they were about to be served all at once.  With plate after plate after plate arriving and filling the table I asked Adrian why this was happening and suggested slowing things down to which he responded "this is a tapas restaurant, sir, it is how things are served."  Having already assured himself a lousy tip by this point I explained to him that although I've never been to Spain I have been to a multitude of Andres and Garces spots, plus other "tapas" style restaurants and have never seen anything like this.  Without apology I watched him amble off to the kitchen where he actually stopped two servers carrying plates (they would have been numbers 8 and 9 on the table at once) and after this service did improve, mildly.  Plate six was Mediterranean stew in deconstruction | prawns | bronzinni | sofrito, the first of the more "modern" tapas.  Familiar with European seabass I think the cut we received was a bit close to the tail and the fish's generally sweet taste was much brinier than expected.  With the prawn slightly overcooked and rubbery the seafood on the plate was fortunately brought up a notch by pureed sweet potato and "sofrito" of garlic, olive oil, tomato, and onion.  Taking bites of everything mixed did indeed harken to a seafood stew, but not an exceptional one in any way.  The final plate in the first (self limited) wave was the best "modern" tapas of the meal - tuna-raspberry skewer | ahi tuna | "molecular" raspberry | wasabi | sesame seed.  At $14 the portion/price ratio was poor, but the flavors and quality more than made up for it.  With the "molecular" aspect a similar texture to a gelee, the sweetness of the raspberry was nicely tempered by the heat of the wasabi while the pan seared tuna coated in sesame seeds lent heft and crunch to the dish.  At the same time visually appealing, texturally intriguing, and tasty this was the sort of dish I had expected when walking into Julian Serrano, though I'd have personally preferred sashimi style from the fish.  The second dish, Wild mushroom soup | shiitake | crimini | oyster | foie gras cream would prove to be another excellent classic dish spruced up with modern technique.  Similar to my favorite mushroom soup of all time (Canoe's creamless Mushroom soup) but topped off with foam featuring the unctuous sapor of foie gras.  Taken on its own the soup itself was hearty, earthy, and minimally sweet - the cream simply added a whole extra layer of flavor.  This, along with the subsequent dish would prove my favorite of the meal.  Overlooked by myself but ordered by my mother, Creamy risotto | wild mushroom | manchego cheese | natural jus was the steal of the menu at a mere $10.  With a base of flawless rice cooked in mushroom broth the dish found heft in the addition of creamy mushroom broth (quite similar in flavor to that on the salmon) while slices of fibrous mushroom added textural variety.  Topped with a slice of slowly melting year-old manchego that added its characteristic aged salinity the entirety of the dish was flawless - I was especially thankful to receive this in the second wave of dishes as I imagine it would not have been as successful in the cooled state.  Where the tuna skewers succeeded, Lobster-pineapple skewer | lobster tail | "molecular" pineapple | sesame oil failed.  Whether it was the small portions of overcooked lobster or the over sweetened and disconcertingly fibrous pineapple gelee I cannot be certain, but the dish was simply unbalanced and any nuance that may have been intended was lost in the sweetness.  As the final fish dish of the night I'll simply say that aside from the octopus the kitchen at Serrano really needs to pay attention to the textures coming out of the kitchen as nearly every fish was overcooked.  Tax and moderate tip included the total cost of the meal turned out to be ~$55/person - not a bad deal considering the fact that we ordered four dishes per person and did not pick based on price.  With that said, when a chef like Serrano attaches his name to something there is an expectation that follows and that expectation was not met.  Overcooked fishes, muddled flavor profiles, and service gaffs (especially the sort where the server tells the diner he/she is wrong) have no place in such restaurants and considering the superstar competition that just arrived in town with two restaurants at The Cosmopolitan these are the sorts of mistakes that could send diners looking for better.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qippa2gxcnrstFmbbnU6Xw.text: AMAZING lunch here!  We had Brava Potatoes (with a tomato sauce and aioli), Gambas (shrimp in garlic butter and chilis), chorizo with garlic mashed potatoes, serrano ham, and chicken chirondon (served with a tomato sauce and fresh rosemary sprig).  I had a white sangria, my husband had a delicious Pinot, and our daughter had a virgin sangria - all really good.    The most innovative tapa was the lobster & "molecular" pineapple skewers - yummy.  Dessert was to die for:  I had churros with a spicy hot chocolate dipping sauce, and our daughter had a molten chocolate orange cake.  The presentation was beautiful, and the service was attentive.   We've had tapas in Toronto, Boston, Mission Viejo, CA and Mojacar, Spain, and this is ranks up there with the best.   An added plus: make sure you use the restroom for Spanish lessons while you do whatever you're doing in there (the Men's, I'm told, has a racier bent).

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J5WOkGolDFQpB-IjQR21Kg.text: Food was decent. Service was good at first but certainly tailed off towards the middle and end of dinner, not good for a tapas place.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside at valet.

a_zHutnM76pc5jfS6bo8OA.text: We really enjoyed this place.  First off, they gave us samples of all three of their Sangrias.  I ended up with the red and DH had a cocktail.  We tried 5 dishes:  1) Fried Calamari (we judge most places by their fried calamari) was very good.  Crispy and well seasoned with two delicious sauces.  2) Tuna cones.  Spicy and good with creamy avocado at the bottom of the cone but DH felt that the wonton cones were a little too hard. 3) Spanish Tortilla--kind of pedestrian but the little cheese toast that came with it was amazing.  Therefore 4) Coca Vegetarian which had a similar cheese but the bread was different--it was really good though. 5) Pork belly tacos--what more does one need to say?  PORK BELLY!  5 dishes and drinks around $100 for two.  Not bad--we were full when we left.

lt0f0HnqK-SYnCzuj6xWtQ.text: Went with a group of 7 people. Three people didn't care for seafood so we divided the table. They ordered meat dishes. They loved the ribs!! Our side of the table ordered tuna cones!!! The best thing ever!!! We also ordered the rib eye. Also delicious!! We also got the chicken croquettes. Another good choice. Nice to come for a special occasion because the price is a little high. But if you are having a cocktail and a few tapas because your passing by then do it!!

oD4do2RYqUTFVGFuv7n9Bg.text: If you are into the Vegas scene, then you'll like this place. The ambience is very classy, and pretty much your typical, "club atmosphere" scene. The food is delicious, but the portions are very small. I would recommend purchasing at least three tapas per person. You'll even have room for dessert. The molten chocolate cake is very delicious. The price is pretty high, but you're paying for the experience along with small portions of the tapas.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lAc0TxO8YL_8_R7XV0nmHg.text: Bit pricey, but it's delicious.  And hey it's Vegas...  We ordered too many things to remember but for the most memorable things were:  Tuna Cones - Delicious tuna sushi (poke) style in crispy cones. Imported Spanish Serrano Ham - Delicious period. Creamy Risotto - Very well done! Stuffed Dates - Not bad. Grilled Lamb Chop - Loved it. Mixed Paella - Very good paella.  Had low expectations but wow'd.  I would come here again but give it sometime so they can add and subtract from menu.  Worth the try!

wWvm4YG5NcozukzArl_9nQ.text: Really enjoyed everything that we tried, especially the creamy risotto, peppers and the potato bravas. The paella was good for sharing-loved how the flavor of saffron complemented the dish. Ambiance is great and service was prompt.  Definitely recommend!

inBjc-lua3mwqjh7795a2A.text: After going to Estiatorio Milos for my first prix fixe lunch, I was determined to find another one at a great price. I found this thread that mentioned Estiatorio Milos and they also said Julian Serrano had an equally delicious menu for only $19. I thought it was too good to be True so I called to confirm since the thread was from last year. They said that they had this special menu from Sunday-Thursday at 11:30am-4pm so I had to get there on Sunday. It was weird because I checked the menu and it didnt mention the $19 so I thought it was a secret menu. When we got there, they gave us a regular lunch menu and I asked for the prix fixe but it was for $49 so I asked about the $19 one. He said it was only for Monday- Thursday but I told him that the person on the phone yesterday said it was for Sunday. He spoke with the manager and checked if they had the ingredients and they were able to provide this menu. I thought it was very nice of them to keep their word. So extra plus for them. The place is in Aria and it is quite festive. They have a bar and the game was playing so that was cool.   First 1) Lobster Gazpacho- chilled spinach tomato soup with lobster meat- I didnt see the chilled part so I was quite shocked by the taste of it. I never had purposeful cold soup so it took some getting used to. Not my cup of tea but I am glad I tasted a legit spanish appetizer.  2) Wild mushroom soup- I preferred this one since it was salty. It was good and I would choose this over the lobster.  Second 1) Salmon- It comes with mashed potatoes and I liked that the salmon skin was crispy. I dont know how salmon is a spanish dish so it wasnt anything crazy special but it was good nonetheless. 2) Rib eye steak- It came with eggplant and french fries and again I dont know how this is spanish but it was good.   Third 1) Santiago's cake- LOVEEE this!!! it is a traditional spanish almond cake with turron ice cream and candied almonds. It comes in a nice display and was deliciosss. The cake was tender and the ice cream went perfectly with it. I gobbled that thing right up. This was by far my favorite of the meal. 2) Flan de turon- almond mcreme custard flan. I am not much of a flan person so I thought it was ok.   I think Vegas will now be known for prix fixe rather than buffets for me. I am addicted haha. And for so cheap! You cant beat $19 for all this good food. I am surprised that the appetixer and dessert were more traditional than the entrees.  **TIPS** 1) The $19 prix fixe is Monday-Thursday, 11:30am-4pm. 2) The ideal menu is wild mushroom soup, salmon or steak (depends on what you prefer), and Santiago's cake. 3) Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan de turon
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best!! Santiago&#39;s cake
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye steak

uXjAXmU9AcW4OYo7XD4Kuw.text: Tapas in Vegas? Why, not? This little bodega is a cute spot with excellent service! Located inside the Aria it was a short walk from our stay at the Vdara. I love me some Spanish tapas so wanted to check out this place while in town.   Some of the dishes were spot on yummy. The calamari a la plancha with a hint of lemon and lightly charred was Delish! Another favorite was the bacon wrapped dates. Savory dates, crispy bacon and smooth goat cheese- I couldn't get enough of these bad boys. Literally, there were only 3.   Chicken croquettes were a bit too soft inside, lacking a bit of texture I like more shredded chicken, not from the blender.   I would order the mussels again but not the stuffed peppers.   You cannot leave without ordering the vino tinto sangria! With apples and a hint of cinnamon, this was to die for! And the almond flan was out of this world good!  Excellent service, good recommendations, cute spot in the Aria and great food. I would come back but bring a bigger check book- this place is not easy on the wallet considering the size of portions.

Psqhgkxwy1bcMK9rXpKOMA.text: Everything I ate here was exceptional.   The sangria was also amazing.   It was a very good place to take a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The setup
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Bombs
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Fin Tuna

zLUfnhThfrlkAYAvsznsSQ.text: Great food and excellent service. One of the better restaurants in Vegas and has a reasonable price point. Loved the chicken croquettes. Didn't care for the saffron rice pudding. Husband loved the calamari. Will definitely go again.

-tTLL7zQpisj7yeZBNoWqw.text: This restaurant has a pretty low key atmosphere considering the menu. We came here earlier this week for dinner and were lucky to get a table with a view of the TV so we could watch the end of our team's NBA playoff game. It was great that we were able to get amazing food and still catch the game!   Our server seemed irritated that we were so into the game (a bit pretentious even) but given the casual atmosphere I didn't think it was a problem.   Dinner was quite delicious- we started with Wagyu Beef Tartare and the Yellowtail Tapas with a half bottle of wine and enjoyed those while we waited for the Seafood Paella (the menu cautions a 40 minute wait, but I think it was less than that).  All of the food was delicious, but if I were to return I would skip the Paella and stick to tapas.   All in all, 4 stars - due to the weirdly pretentious service in a casual fine dining establishment.

ITIdv1HwTrpf_A3LhuYB9A.text: Bottom line.  Excellent Tapas restaurant that misses on ambiance.  Service 5/5.  Prompt, knowledgeable, and friendly, definitely trained and proficient.  Among the best I have encountered in Las Vegas.  Personality 4/5 .  The decor was a little sterile though some of the walls were covered with interesting glass works that are neat to look at but don't add to the experience.  The music was the same soundtrack playing throughout the hotel, so I can't really fault the locale for this because it is in the Aria wich is full of artlstic and decorative incongruities.  It is just a shame that an effort wasn't made to capture some of the color palate of Spain somewhere other than the floors.  (see my Cafe Sevilla review).  Quality 5/5.  We only had Tapas, and they were all seasoned and cooked flawlessly, universally delicious.  The list includes Papas Bravas, Calamari, Empanada Mallorquina, Tuna Cones, Gambas, Mixed Ceviche (best I have eaten in 25 years), Scallop, and Lagosta.  The flavors were delicate and subtle, the main ingredients always the star, and the portion sizes were perfect.    Recommendation 5/5.  Definitely an excellent spot for luxurious and delicious Tapas.  Highly recommended for food lovers. The only real detractors were not really in the restaurant's control.  The qualities they can control are executed perfectly.

AobN9KHbq46xpfegtDJMnA.text: Our party of four were impressed w/JS's foray back to his Spanish roots.    Seriously, tapas, galore, we literally read the menu and debated for over fifteen minutes, everything looked tempting, somehow, we were not bowling over for the descriptions of the 'new tapas', but after perusing the pics, it looks interesting.  Next time.    Everytime I have branzino in an Italian or Spanish restaurant, I'm not so excited, the fish was WONDERFUL here.  DO IT.   MUST DO: -Deconstructed Fish Stew, hands down the BEST tapa of the night. -Spanish Croquetas, perfect little puffs to pop in my mouth. -Branzino, crispy skin, sold. -Gazpacho, not a fan usually, this was hearty & good. -Truffled Salmon, yum, Omega-3s & fungus?!   -Any steak, succulant & seasoned well. -Cheese plate, nice variations. -Almond cake, dense w/beautiful almond essence.  Skip: -Manchego Toast, soggy mess on top. -Paella, not very flavorful, portion is small, priced at $40.   -Chocolate cake, just blah, nothing bad, just not special.  Extras: Sangria tastings & the bathrooms play Spanish/English translations.    A great meal, I would have liked to see more exotic offerings, like escargot & a more varieties of chorizo from different regions of Spain.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flank Steak
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Branzino
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coco Chorizo

zaTyqDPcCFaW-vp_l64AcA.text: Came with friends to celebrate wedding anniversary, we liked the food and the wine (great selection), but what made us give a 5 stars was the service from our waiter Pedro. He helped us get started with the tapas menu, great suggestions and the way he handled the wine made the meal complete. Would for sure visit again and we hope Pedro still there.

b6Dh6M_24LQHnecfMiSb7A.text: Service : excellent  Food: excellent Decor and ambiance: good  Came here for dinner with 3 other people we ordered, we had no problem getting seated because it was a little early. Anthony was serving us and he was really great, super helpful and attentive. kudos to him for being really outstanding. We order the potata bravas, grilled eggplant, flatbread with tomato and mozzarella, short ribs, lamb meatballs, duck confit and calamari. Calamari was really good what out it over the top was that they had pieces of fried lemon in it. I would not have thought it but I was sooooo good. Potata bravas, lamb meatballs, grilled eggplant, duck confit were really executed well. The flatbread was really nothing to right home about and was nothing you would not find at a deli in New York.  Overall will be back

j7jkq3g6m2BkWQYGkf8sTw.text: I could hardly like this place more. The foie gras is amazing. Their wine selection is outstanding, varied and reasonably priced. Great tapas and cool setting with lots of happy customers and attentive staff. Highly reco'd.

akHs7pQbieAzLUUv9lvtjQ.text: Many visits later... still impressed! We have always been impressed by the staff here and their longevity. They have always treated us like family (Adrian and Aurora) since our very first visit. They have always met and exceeded our expectations! We honestly didn't think we could be more impressed, yet we were! We had a very brief encounter with the Chef Serrano during the Vegas Uncork'd event last month, one of hundreds of encounters I'm sure the chef had. To our surprise, Chef Julian was walking through the restaurant upon our latest visit, he not only remembered us (which we didn't expect) but came and gave us an unsolicited warm greeting. We have always been impressed with the food and even more so with staff. That genuine passion for the industry starts right at the top with the chef himself.  I encourage anyone looking for a wonderful dining experience with great food to visit Julian Serrano at Aria. Thank you Chef Julian and Executive Chef Rafael for always providing a great and consistent dining experience we always look forward to visiting during our many trips to Vegas, you guys were the cherry on top at our last visit, the rest of the outstanding staff is what made us come back for the second and hundredth visit!  Let chef know, as much as I hate dressing up for anything when I'm in Vegas.... I will next time! just to see if Picasso meets the high standard you guys set at the Aria :)

JE0dkmlWVbWttECHPnbnEA.text: Food is wonderful but very small portions, even if you order 2-3 plates per persons. Expensive as well, so I wouldn't recommend this place prior a full night ahead of partying with friends but rather for an intimate dinner for two.

3M3qYA9UeWUdSjKcLIs7uQ.text: I enjoyed the restaurant, atmosphere and food.  Really great first impression when you walk in, colorful space and a great spot in the Aria.  I think the tapas idea is great but it is definitely a spendy meal for not a lot of food.  It is the type of restaurant that you need to go grab a cheeseburger afterwards to really fee full.  Our favorite dishes were the scallops, spicy meatballs and the tenderloin over grilled bread.  I was a little disappointed with the steak tartare as it almost had a meatloaf consistency.  I'm a pretty traditional tartare eater though so I was missing the typical flavors and presentation.    I'd try it again, it's a fun place for a big group.

i7_b_4npJCnxqFvhB_Bjew.text: Located in the lobby area of the beautiful Aria hotel sits Julian Serrano's tapas restaurant.. With it's white free standing Tim Burton style entrance and orange glowing walls it's hard to miss Jullian Serrano's restaurant and even more difficult to forget its flavorful dishes!   Like any other tapas place the food portions are small and I would estimate most dishes were meant for two diners to sample..however my party of four easily managed even thou most dishes were just enough for one or two bites per person.. Prices range from about $12 - $ 16.00 per plate and Also had the option of large  plates that were upwards of $30.00..   We visited this spot on a Wednesday night and there was a 30 min wait so you might want to make reservations if you are not the patient type. Tables in this restaurant are not setup for intimacy in fact they were just too close to other tables making us stop our dining experience to allow new diners to squeeze into there tables.. This can be definitely annoying..   Expect to find a nice selection of sea food options while here, like one of my new favorites, black rice.. Which is squid ink coated rice, topped with a few charred baby octopus. Other seafood options included fried calamari which is always good, just wish there was more on the plate .We were also fortunate to sample the chicken croquettes , which is a small fried ball stuffed with chicken.   At the end of the night we ended up doing about 5 plates rounding up over a hundred dollars and everyone walking out happy..   Service here is basic and could use some more fine tuning. Food coming out also took awhile so be ready to spend some time here.. Jullian Serrano has it down as far as location and food .. Comfort of tables and service needs work,, but do check this place out if looking for tapas.

8dORexh9TptXltFFk_k35g.text: Great tapas ... Tried everything from the chicken skewer and octopus to lamb chops, calamari and tuna.  Also tried crime brulee for desert and it was great.  For drinks try the cocktail with habanero in it... Spicy   Inside Aria do nice location as well

xrXFG60P8CtACIYbRS47eg.text: Incredible and outstanding. Every plate we ordered was delicious. Service was on point. Can't wait to come back the next time I'm in Vegas. Don't miss out.

oyd8VjMS727tu98seN3hwQ.text: Very disapointed. It was my first choice this trip. The service was excellent. The prices reasonable for vegas. The selection seamed good. We ordered 6 tapas and a paella ,they were all disapointing. We tried one from each category, nothing special, thought they tried.The worst was the paella. Burnt , very little saffron, the rice was under cooked. We both had terrible heartburn that night which we never get. Too many good restaurants to waste your time.

ShuI9lZuNvEx-ZRqnXAw3Q.text: Terrific food and service, and bit like eating on display in the mall.  Beautiful hotel. Restaurant is easy to find when you walk in (something the other hotels could learn from).  I love the butterfly swarm/ball you walk under.   We were seated right away.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  The menu has a good selection of tapas... Some traditional, some fresh and inventive.  Range of for for vegans and gluten free too. Waiter gave us good advice!  We shared:  Cheese plate - comes with the most wonderful bruschetta. Yum! (Perfect to share for two, maybe three) Yellowfin - had little kick and a lot of flavor. So fresh. Perfect reco by our waiter. (3 in an order) Stuffed dates - how can you go wrong - can't. Yum! (3 in an order) NY strip steak - perfectly cooked, comes slice   Had red sangria - A little sweet, but still good.  Overall a great reco by the concierge in our hotel.

rexAoJ_VTH0SsrgRDB88Wg.text: Food was just ok.  Nice salty flavors in some aspects the meat was cooked well but very little crunch or acid in many of the items that we chose we did enjoy the different variations of my most is that you can have especially the cactus pear one definitely good to try but I wouldn't go back as firefly has much better food on the strip in my opinion beautiful environment and good service though

_tH9_dXTQOiwdX5c8Etyag.text: We had the Cirque du Soleil Zarkana ticket plus meal package so we chose our 4 course pre-theater meal, only $39 each (drinks are extra) from a set menu. The place has a beautiful, colorful ambience. The service was as great as I expected. Our waiter was awesome and informative. We arrived late but he made sure the courses came out quickly enough so we could make the show in time. I asked someone to take a picture of my friend and myself standing up. He took a few. I didn't like them. He later came back to our table and offered to take more. I treated myself to a sangria. It was strong and refreshing.   Here's the breakdown of our amazing meal. Three course tapas plus bread was filling for 2.  Vegetarian courses  Stuffed piquillo peppers (goat cheese and mushrooms), divine. Tomato sauce great for dipping the warm bread Lobster (yes, somehow this counts as vegetarian) Gazpacho - very good. Had a gastronomic element, a sphere of butter with some filling in it. Crack it open and voila!  Seafood courses  Sauteed gambas (shrimp), garlic, arbol chilis - deliciosa! Fried crispy gambas with padron pepper and alioli sauce - spicy and yummy!   Meat courses Rabo de toro - BEST DISH of the night! Oxtail, iberian pork on top of creamy mashed potatoes. I savored every bite and was silent the whole time eating it.  Pintxo de chorizos - The only disappointment. I learned I'm not a chorizo fan. It's too dry. My friend liked it though.   Dessert  Churros with spicy hot chocolate sauce  Santiago's cake - almond cake, turron ice cream, candied almond both were delicious. Nothing like freshly made churros. I love almonds, period.  There are a lot of choices for fine dining in Vegas. I would love to come back for another incredible meal and service. I would love to try their paella and get the fried gambas, rabo de toro and stuffed peppers again.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pintxo de chorizos, nice plating
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rabo de toro - a must try if you like oxtail!!

VumjZS0ikW2YV6Y2BMuqZw.text: This is just an average restaurant to me. Good service, attractive decor, and being inside the Aria, has a nice ambiance. It's close to the hotel lobby and the entrance to Crystal, so good location for people watching . All the dishes we tried here tasted good, but nothing really stood out. The only one I'd recommend to try is the grilled eggplant. For the price and the portion you get, it doesn't offer a good enough value for me to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T1VbMTxNcMa_1HulqUfoqw.text: Just okay.   Was looking forward to a nice dinner with my husband while in Vegas. From the description of the restaurant I was expecting a more romantic relaxed restaurant. It's kind of just a fast food style tapas (expensive).   The food wasn't very good either. Was missing flavor in just about everything. The cocktails were pretty, and tasty, but had absolutely no alcohol in them! To bad we won't be back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No flavor what&#39;s so ever! Blah.

Lx3eELy8NR3tqeAdi_qp8w.text: Our second visit because we wanted a meal that wasn't too heavy but was enjoyable and professional.  This fit the bill as expected.  The food is *excellent* and you really can't go wrong I don't think.  We had tuna cones, steak and cheese (which is a small smothered steak on bread), a salad (can't remember which one), and a cheese platter.  It's tapas and that means very small plates - like 3 or 4 bites per plate.  You are going to spend about $50 per person and you'll be satisfied but not stuffed.  Which is what we were going for.   I will say that the pacing is off.  The tapas are treated equally, so if you like your soup or salad first then you really need to emphasize that or it will come out whenever.  That happened to us and I was miffed about it - salad came at the end.  They did make it up by giving us a dessert which we had the bread pudding and it was great.

sVl8Ec7iTj_7J2I3_2S5cw.text: No, no and no.   I just want to let everyone know that my experience wasn't terrible. The ambiance was stunning with beautifully designed decor all around. I wish I remembered my waiter's name because he was SUPER sweet and fun (he had red hair). This review goes for the food.  When I researched a place to take my bride and the crew I came across this place. It seemed promising based on the reviews, so I booked a reservation.  I was greeted by the host who seemed slightly snooty, but I didn't let his aura bother me.   The menu has plenty of items for tapas style and everything sounded delicious! Everyone requested their favorites for the first round and we waited patiently.  The food came out rather quickly. Let me tell you; for it to be tapas style, the portions for the price SUCKED. It's more like paying $20-$30 for a side dish and claiming that you can "share" it.  Problem two was the taste. I had marbled potatoes that I couldn't stick my fork through because they were so burnt. The ribs that I tried tasted like they were soaked in a cheap ass broth for 2 days and then cooked. The calamari was completely TASTELESS and I actually used a salt shaker for the first time in years.  The only reason I gave this place two stars is because our waiter was SO pleasant. If it weren't for him, I would leave just one star. I'm sure some of you were thinking "why didn't you send it back?" Because I don't trust restaurants when you send food back for ANY reason. I was embarrassed that my bride wasn't happy.  I don't mind paying premium for good food; Dallasites like myself eat for a living, but this was a disappointment. We went to Taco Bell after and that tasted much better than the shit at this place.   There are better places at Aria let alone the strip.

3NmK8R-MATeteRh4cCgQQg.text: The food was AMAZING!!! We had their lunch special. Favorites were the chicken croquetas, tomato and manchego bread, and the torejas dessert. Several sangria selections.  Grace was awesome!!

qGDJiZxLi9A7cb3-75srXA.text: 9/1 update:   Thank you for a wonderful evening of fine food with specially prepared tapas.  The great service and attention to details are much appreciated.  Looking forward to our next visit.

RuX3cXZsLcdsIY4AEmpnfg.text: This has been a favorite hangout of ours in the Aria for the past few years. We love sitting at the bar; their bartenders (especially Adrian!) will take excellent care of you! You can't go wrong with any of the tapas--Bang-Bang shrimp, albondigas, calamari are some of our go-tos, and their daily house-made sangrias are a highlight. On the weekends, you can get bottomless sangrias for 2 hours--quite the deal.  My only negative is that they used to have a sparkling sangria that was my absolute favorite; I really wish they would bring that back!

taKzUOjnl0Sf7Plh5p7e9A.text: Outside of the pushy waiter we had, the paella was not that great. The Valenciana had dry chicken and only a little rabbit. The rice was good but the meats were dry.   The worst part I would say is how the waiter would try to push his recommendations rather than just make a recommendation. We had to send back a plate that was supposed to be cancelled.

bzgXt6_cb07DWawHeo5YVA.text: This place was good, but pretty expensive for the portion size. I understand it's Tapas style but it was pretty pricey, I guess that's what you get in Vegas though. I would stay away from the bang bang shrimp. If you are familiar with Bonefish grill it is nothing like their bang bang shrimp. It was served cold and I thought the shrimp had an extremely fishy taste. Otherwise the other apps we ordered were delicious.

rSz_YjSk6X6Q7C6QRpnPgw.text: Amazing food and drinks here, probably the best my husband and I had during our stay in Vegas. We enjoyed every single dish we ordered and will definitely visit here again when we go back to Vegas.

Zex5-WJAckwoquhZBH33hQ.text: Julian Serrano's tapas was surprisingly better than I expected. Granted, these are still small plates but the variety and detail to their tapas is something I've never experienced with tapas. We stopped by for a snack, so here's what we shared and ate:  Pan Manchego: bread, tomato and cheese can be so simple. I think there's something about the fresh ingredients which make this so tasty.  Yellowtail Tiradito: this was kind of surprising because I've never had such fine shredded filo dough before. The consistency of it reminds me of fried rice vermicelli or even like shredded wheat cereal. I had my hesitation before taking a bite, but it works well. Tuna was really fresh.  I didn't have a bite of this but the guys shared a Cuban sandwich. They liked it so much that they wanted to get a second order but held off.   Service was exactly what we wanted. We were there just to pass some time and our server gave us just the right amount of attention without hovering over us. We also appreciate that they seated us near the TVs because of March Madness.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Tiradito
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Manchego

uHcEafZDBwgzLTjA7oOVUg.text: We enjoyed a great meal here last night.  It's so nice to have multiple small plates instead of one big main course.  We were able to try new things like their version of "Carne Asada" which is fillet mignon over the creamiest mashed potatoes with the best gravy ever! They have this bread with cheese and tomato which was one of the best bites of the night. It's like a bruschetta but the tomatoes were made into a paste and then topped with a slice of manchego cheese. Sooooo good! Garlic shrimp  Iberico ham - which I should mention is served over a candle to slightly melt the fat OMG  INCREDIBLE!!! Great service awesome table neighbors to chat with.  Perfect night!

0eoBXIcD44PFe_T2UsAb-w.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our meal here. Shared piquillo stuffed peppers, pintxo de chorizos, chicken croquetas and churros. Everything was very flavorful and was nice to split between two. We tried the signature drink, the Pina Smash. Delicious!  Highly recommend!!

SfZMkczA71RUOWJll5aOng.text: Service was terrible. We were railroaded into the tapas that was selected for our table. We were not given the choice of what was brought out. The amount of food that was brought for 10 people could've comfortably fed 5 people. It was awkward and long waits between dishes made it that much more awkward. The total price was 700$ and we walked away frustrated and hungry.

oEZkGsiNCk-GeAJDOEwkyQ.text: Love stopping at this tapas spot every time in I'm in Vegas (once a quarter). The service is always amazing as are the dishes, with their size greater than the average tapas bar. Location is central in the lobby with a view of the decorated lobby.   Great for large and small parties. JS offers lunch but dinner is busier, so make a reservation.   Favorites: veggie rice, patatas bravas and shrimp ceviche ~ yum!

2jGCBO3tvuv0cFmXnPmCpw.text: Fantastic brunch service (Yoshi, Stephanie. . .), paella (mixta), gambas/rock shrimp salad, calamari, and  mocktails. Excellent desserts  (churros, etc).  Would skip the braised octopus /pulpo.   And pro-tip: open the teapot lid when pouring to avoid spilling your drink all over the table.  Best family-friendly meal of our Vegas trip.

7QUaO-dQgJ2egYFzdORQGQ.text: Literally hugging the toilet as I type this ..   Julian Serrano tapas was the most repulsive food I've ever had in my life . Calamari was cooked in old grease and flavorless, lobster fideua was  terribly greasy. Scallop skewer was mush and undercooked. I didn't have a drink , but my date did, he said it was "eh". I can't believe they're selling sub par food to people and are still open !   Not to mention there was a hair on the app plate when we sat down. We switched it to a vacant table, and said nothing. The menu has changed , the food used to be to die for,and I'm very disappointed with the changes. I've been throwing up since I got home , and I don't drink alcohol. DISGUSTING FOOD !

fT8ZnEhTZkpxGrxMVCioVg.text: This is an upscale tapas joint. Spicy meatballs were great. Good wine. Pricier than normal tapas.

X76TkILzwUziHq4rDQVg6Q.text: Went there last Sunday night while in Vegas... Food was ok, server was very nice.    White Sangria - Ok  Fried Calamari - good  Octopus - did not like the potato cake underneath, but the octopus was good.  Mixed Paella - ok but extremely greasy.  Food was just OK, service was OK...  For the money we spent, we could have found better.     ** Note - I may have been bias since we went to Le Cirque the night before... there is a huge difference between food/service when dinner is $500.00 v $125.00.  BUT I have had better tapas and paella at Tapas Papas Fritas in Scottsdale.

ZS_mIlltKuF3MjiDnN2otw.text: Saturday night- it was extremely loud, very crowded, and service was slow. The atmosphere frankly sucked. The sangrias were also nothing to brag about. The "sparkling" sangria was def not sparkling, or bubbly, or fizzy in any way. Flat. With that being said, the food was fantastic. I'd recommend trying it for a week day lunch.

AATlyQ3K7yKqdaXW60GjEQ.text: Found this restaurant on Yelp. Made a reservation that went smoothly. Had never had Tapas before. Our waiter was extremely helpful in recommending great food choices. I cant wait to go back!

5tr-8BaQzlUX8m1cWG1XJA.text: I almost forgot how much I love Sangria and Tapas.  Not only is this restaurant very easy on the eye, it's dishes are sexy too.  2 of our favorite dishes that night were the lobster salad & the special Spanish ham with tomato sauce & crostini.  If you'd like to learn a quick "pick up line" in Spanish, make sure you visit the restrooms.  The English to Spanish translations are informative & surprising.  "Did I just learn how to say 'Where are you from' and 'Would you like to go to bed with me' in Spanish??"  UM, yes you did!!

OtEXHmAYmYsZYid2qYG4xA.text: Food: Most of what we ordered was well-cooked and well-seasoned. Highlights include the gazpacho (light and refreshing), brava potatoes (tasty alioli sauce), egg ravioli (crunchy outside, subtle savory creamy inside), creamy risotto (very salty, but I like it), and churros (the chocolate sauce is very good). Other dishes such as salmon with truffle, garlic mussels, albondigas, and paella were also quite good. The only mildly dissapointing dish was the tuna-raspberry skewer, which had a little bit too much raspberry flavor.  Service: Friendly and attentive.  Ambience: Open to the casino, but not too loud. Decor is modern/trendy. It's a very nice place.  I'd give this place a 4.5 if I could.

dWt-W8_ndVmgKFVohLW-eg.text: Omg! THE BEST tapas restaurant I've ever been to in my life! Period. Def miss it since I'm eastcoasting but will go everytime we stay at the Aria!

vVUmHrJNFcVhdgMfFmK9eA.text: Yes, Yes every time Yes!  The food has always been delicious, delightful little morsels of yumminess.  Service has always been wonderful and attentive.  Eager to offer guidance on what to order/how much to order.    My favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, the ceviche, and the mushroom risotto (FYI - I don't even like mushrooms).   I am giving four stars rather than five because I don't feel that they have perfected their paella yet.  It is a little too smoky/burnt in flavor for my palette.  Also, their sangria is just ok.  But - they have a full bar so imbibe in just about anything else and the dinner will still be amazing.     So all in all, great great place to enjoy a great meal.

TIN6ASM9GfN3fqVYxYEAbw.text: We hit happy hour 4-5:30. Got the dates, calamari, choriZo & tuna. The calamari was the best we have ever had so ordered another one! The happy hour sangria was delicious :) typically happy hour drink is 5-6 and tapas are 6.50.

D8LCRa-Uv4mvLivLyCbb6w.text: I ordered the huevos estrelladas expecting something like a Spanish tortilla. I got a fried egg on French fries with sub par chorizo (all fried in a corn or vegetable oil). I had to send the ceviche back, it was inedible. Everything just tasted salty.

vTiJFByRGST0SumqnTWTTA.text: I was looking forward to eating at Julian Serrano's, with the recent health problems at Firefly I have been looking for a new Tapas spot. I am disappointed to say that Julian Serrano's will not be that spot. The food was okay but nowhere near the quality implied by the pricing and not nearly as good as Firefly. Also, worryingly, two out of the three diners in our party got sick shortly after eating, one of them violently ill. The service was nothing special, courteous but when asked for a suggested dish I got blank stares.Disappointingly Julian Serrano's is exactly what it's desperately trying not to be, a run of the mill Las Vegas casino restaurant with a fancy facade. The food is not horrible but for the price you would expect much more.

QFWVOVBvkmKo2CpRjSS1IA.text: We went for convenience, as we were staying in Aria, but were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. All of the five or six dishes we tried were delicious! Chicken was the crispiest, tastiest I've had in a long time, ceviche was tart but not super acidic...was just sorry we hadn't left room for dessert :-)

yCd1m40l9NrNLr4CKEjySw.text: I really wish I could give this place a few more stars considering how much money we spent there.  We came here for the foie gras but were told that it's no longer on the menu.  Given that we were all starving we decided to start with a bunch of appetizers.   Besides the stuffed dates, the appetizers warn't very good.  We kept ordering more and more tapas hoping to get wowed, but everything  that came out was mediocre.  Our final dish was the paella, and we hardly touched it, it was more like a jambalaya than anything else.  Finally it came time for dessert and we ordered the chocolate lava cake and the fruits.  The chocolate lava cake was amazing but the fruits made us all giggle.  It was a bowl of pretty much all apples with some whip cream on top.  I don't know, I guess we all expected a little bit more considering it was in Aria and it was highly rated on Yelp

nYp6TEc_SY7c9pKNot4S0Q.text: This is place worth visiting and every thing we tried was phenomenal.  The service was great.  We promptly seated and the server was knowledgeable on the entire menu.  They have great drinks and happy hours.  Must have.  Even the vegetarian have so many options.  The presentation of food is so classy and clean.  Will certainly come back. Value for the price they charge

DBSxMLgyPTwTbS6K2EW28A.text: Good as usual.  Wicked sangria both red and white.  Tried the paella this time.  The Mix Paella.  Awesome.  Good flavor, more traditional than most recipes.  Gambas were amazing.  Tuna raspberry skewer, pineapple lobster skewer, and the huevos estrellados are amazing.  The menu reads easy, and I'm sure everything is good.  Trust what you order if you are a spanish food beginner.  It will turn out good.

xESChSs8AasgMjgThLKlKQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!   I make sure I stop here at least once with every visit. Favorites: Ahi Tuna Tempura--    I'm not a big fan of Tempura, but this is off the charts. Finely breaded, then like a sheet of paper... pure excellence. Tuna-Rasberry Skewer-  what amazing combination of flavors- pops in your mouth--  muah!! Ceviches--all of them are amazing--   same level as "La Mar". Fresh Calamari a la Plancha--  so fresh! Brava Potatoes--classic Spanish appetizer-  watch out-  you'll want to eat the entire bowl.  Grilled Angus Flat Iron Steak--  this is  so good! So, next time you're in Vegas--go to the Aria Hotel and check out Julian Serrano-- you won't be disapointed. Oh yeah,  try the drunken cherry drink--   amazing!!

IEczdF-yYPeujl-MiVMEiQ.text: In the land of tasty Vegas cuisine, Julian Serrano finished right smack in the middle of it all. While it wasn't remarkable, it was a fine meal overall.   The Good: The decor is shiny and bright, servers are attentive and helpful and there's a fair amount of tapas to appease just about any palate. In particular, the calamari, stuffed dates, risotto were standouts. Portions were mostly averaged sized, some much more generous than others.   The Meh: Like many tapas places, Julian Serrano can get really pricey if you're on the hungry side. I wasn't blown away by the sangria...it was fine but nothing I haven't experienced before. And a handful of the dishes we ordered were good, but not great (pork, ceviche). And while I did like the decor, the location of the restaurant definitely doesn't lend itself to any intimate date. It's smack dab in the middle of all the check in/check out action at Aria.   If you looking to share a few small plates, have a drink with friends, this is a great place to check out. Don't expect to have an uber romantic experience, though!

735g2KnbXZl-EHTryTJhnA.text: We had dinner at Julian Serrano's Tapas at the Aria last night and, based on reviews we had read as well as our preference for Spanish small plates, were really looking forward to our dinner. Well, sad to say that we were (with very few exceptions) disappointed.   We had: Pan tomate bread (good, tomato had a little too much garlic in it, nothing special when compared to other tapas restaurants where we have been vowed by a burst of flavor by similar dishes); Palmito Salad (very good - one of the exceptions); Creamy mushroom risotto (also very good albeit very small portion - the other exception); Sauteed Padron peppers (disappointing - not a lot of flavor and sloppy presentation); Octopus a la Gallega (very small portion, rubbery octopus pieces on small potato slices - nothing special); Albondigas (tasted precooked and microwaved - the fried cubes of potato were only lukewarm). The wines (Albarino, Granacha) were both very nice, but in summary our dinner still left a lot to be desired.  Aside from the food quality there were a couple of other observations that really disappointed us. One was that the food came out way too fast. Just a few minutes after ordering our first courses, three plates arrived in front of us. The pork meatballs were ordered later and again they arrived within a couple of minutes, for sure not prepared fresh! The other disappointment was the fact that we wanted to order the cheese platter, but because we both do not like blue cheese, we requested a change to a different cheese. Our server was not able to confirm this (?) and had to ask the manager. When he came back his answer was: "Sorry, but we cannot make any changes to your order and replace a cheese because all the cheese plates have already been prepared." WHAT?
