We were really surprised and wondered if we were in a cafeteria instead of a high end Spanish tapas restaurant (but at the same time, his statement confirmed what we had suspected all along about most of our other food - pre-cooked).   Suffice it to say that we will not spend another $200 for dinner at this restaurant again.

lpTM6WnuVoohH6O-rAAv_Q.text: I am from Spain and I am a foodie.   This place rocks.  Six stars out of five.  Better than sex (almost).  I would write details, but I gotta get back to the food.

JN0IFbA4jGJp_JUufvgyzQ.text: I took a party of six to Julian Serrano for an early dinner on a Saturday.  We ordered twelve different tapas and four desserts and barely a crumb was left when we were done.  Here's a descripton of some of the tapas we tried:  --Calamari--Light and delicious!  The breading was light and the calamari was fresh and not chewy.  --Cheese plate--Everyone enjoyed trying the different cheeses-- the manchego and goat cheese were table favorites.  --Egg ravioli--This was unreal!  I have no idea how they put a poached egg wrapped in bacon inside of a fried phyllo shell, but it was fantastic.   Very mild taste.  --Spanish pizza (with sobrasada)--The crust was buttery and delicious and the toppings were a big hit.  --Mushroom risotto--This risotto was the tastiest I have ever had in the U.S.    --Lobster and pineapple skewers--beautiful presentation and the lobster was very fresh  --Wilted baby spinach--I am not a big lover of spinach but this was delicious!  Our favorite dessert was the Spanish donuts with caramel dipping sauce.  We enjoyed the almond cake was well.  Our entire party enjoyed the dining experience.  We had great service, too.  I can't wait to go again!

VGkJqUo6hxIAC-ETXmg2Vw.text: Fun tapas and decorative food with restaurant decor!  Fig tapa was too sweet for me.    Lobster Gazpacho was great for the summer weather!  I love the octopus!  It was grand and nicely hammered to the perfect texture!   Carpaccio was a good addition to the whole tapas orders!   Service was adequate!  The host girls were lovely in their red dresses attire!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano melon
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Carpaccio

mOWKXaOPuWF4cuUyi_4sRQ.text: I love the modernity and I can see the art that was poured onto every dish. I still enjoy traditional tapas but since I'm no longer in Spain, this is the best Vegas has to offer.

F2x_Y85GjGlFjLPvVe7pvg.text: I love the tapas at Julian Serrano located in the Aria hotel. Beautiful atmosphere, great food and awesome service. I enjoyed the paella negra, brava potatoes, the lamb and hanger steak. The palla negra consists of fresh calamari, shrimp, vegetables and squid ink. This was my first time trying squid ink and it was amazing.The brava potatoes are a must they come topped with spicy tomato sauce and allioli sauce. The lamb was cooked perfectly, only problem you get just one piece of lamb per tapa.   The food is amazing here I will definitely come back for these tapas, but I think the price points here are very high. I was shocked to see how much you get for the amount charged. When they say small tapas they mean small tapas. Small plates, big flavor is what they stand by. If you don't mind splurging on small portions I highly suggest this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella negra
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger steak

AY5g97JnbT40k5vb2YPikw.text: I personally didn't care for my options as a vegetarian. I understand it's tapas but I guess I shouldn't have assumed that what I read in the descriptions would be more than what I was getting. It was more than ten bucks for a bowl of almonds. I was so surprised when they came over with the food. I thought that the plates would be more involved even though I knew it would be small. My friends meal looked good however with salmon and something else. And I did like the asparagus I ordered. Just a really fancy spot in a casino. I should have checked the noise level before coming but that's the nature of a large restaurant in a Las Vegas casino. I wouldn't go back but definitely suitable for those who love to gamble and eat high priced small plates.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus a La Plancha
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauted Padron Peppers

jNFoqAZsbEZJ7iFdrbFFqw.text: Happy to report that I've been to Julian Serrano for brunch and for dinner, and both visits did not disappoint from a food perspective!   Ambiance-wise, it's nothing special and I wouldn't recommend for an intimate/romantic occasion.   It didn't seem like reservations were necessary - both times I went, it was fairly empty.   Service was slow despite the lack of diners, so expect a leisurely paced meal. Don't go if you're in a hurry.   Obviously, being a tapas restaurant, portions are smaller and meant for sharing, so for two people, I'd suggest 5+ items (depending on how hungry you are.)   What we ordered (combining brunch and lunch for brevity):  - Lobster salad - light, super fresh, a bit bland.  - Mushroom risotto - rich, earthy. So good! - Yellowtail ceviche - refreshing and beautifully presented, but lacking in flavor.  - Fried calamari - some of the best I've ever had. Crispy and perfectly seasoned, and the aioli is on point.  - Chuleta de Cordero (lamb chop) - maybe my favorite thing that we ordered. So flavorful and juicy! - Carne asada - good flavor and large portion, but a bit tough.  - Stuffed dates - sweet and savory, rich, smokey, absolutely delicious.  - Tuna carpaccio - delicate, fresh, and loved the texture and flavor that the pine nuts added.   Regardless of the service and ambiance, the extensive and delicious menu, presentation, and overall creativity of the dishes made this a 5-star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chop
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates

7O0qr7X75ZnKPqgbie0TkQ.text: Fantastic Spanish tapas in Vegas! Julian Serrano only has 3 restaurants and they are all in Vegas. See my separate review of Picasso. Good to see an celebrity chef actually cooking in Vegas.   The paella priced at $50 for two people was a True highlight. It easily feeds 3-4 people. From the rice, to pork ribs and blood sausage, it was fantastic.   Same goes with the other tapas, garlic shrimp, potatoes brava, branzino, and a torta. Another highlight was the acorn fed ham ($39). It melt in your mouth and wow. Must order it here.   Service and decor was spot on. A we bit expensive for 3 people ($300), but we also got bottomless sangria ($25 each), during brunch service.   Must try when dining at Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best paella I&#39;ve ever tasted!!

xnr0DrrpXe67-pTt8pHa8Q.text: What a fantastic tapas restaurant in Vegas.  My gold standard was Jaleo in DC, but wow this place was superb!  $25 bottomless sangria during brunch!  I sure drank a lot of sangrias- which were probably the best ones I've had.  I thought I knew all about paella's but wow was I wrong.  We had the Serrano one which had blood sausage and iberico  ribs.  So damn good.  Ribs were fall of the bone tender while the blood sausage reminded me of soondae (Korean sausage).  The rice was nice and crispy.    Everything we ate was great- the branzino, brava potatoes, the Spanish tortilla and especially the iberico ham and the gambas!!  Don't miss the iberico ham and gambas!  The service was awesome.  Every time my sangria glass was empty a new one appeared in minutes!  How is that for service!!  A must dining experience in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Imported Spanish Pata Negra Ham
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella Serrano
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria

Nc4Ho7wiDfrsxgfz63ho0A.text: This is my third time eating here and it was just as wonderful as the first time.  I love the modern decor and the hip atmosphere. It's open so you can see and hear the lobby and casino, but the noise level is just fine. I like how it's a comfortable sound quality. The tapas menu is robust and I felt there were many choices. Since we ate before the dinner time, they had us sit at the bar, but we still had access to the full menu. It wasn't crowded at this 3:30pm hour so the bar was comfortable. We started with Sangria drinks so I had the Cava and my husband had the Blue. Food wise, we first had the Tostada Con Aguacate which is their Avocado Toast. I love Avocado Toast and this was an interesting take. Plenty of avocado and I liked it with the tomatoes. Next we had the Chuleta de Cordero. Though we planned to share this, it only comes with one piece of lamb. I would have felt this was more worth it if they gave 2 pieces. Just something to keep in mind if you are planning on sharing this dish.  Next we had the Pintxo de chorizos. This is what my husband wanted. They tell you it's spicy and it was. I'm not a big chorizo person so it wasn't for me, but my husband liked it. Lastly, we had the Bone-In Serrano Ham which was a True winner for me. All the combinations of the flavor and the presentation really surprised me and I enjoyed that dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-In Serrano Ham
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cava Sangria
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Sangria

-bdN1FqoqrRcLJOFnbHbcg.text: Cozy, Seductive, and, Vibrant is Julian Serrano Tapas.  Stunning it is to walk into their expansive dining room in bright colors and shinny black trees.    Excellent and Heartwarming is their service. I have learned to ask for pacing of courses;  if not, the freshly cooked plates are served all at once.   Delicious Paellas and Creative Tapas. A few of my favorite tapas are JS's heavenly "Stuffed Dates";  intriguing "Yellowtail Tiradito";  decadent "Serrano Tender"; amazing "Serrano Ribs";  tasty-saucy "Vegetables Zarzuela"; and, smoky "Octopus".  Truly a trip to Vegas for me is not complete without having at least a bite here at Julian Serrano's. Ole!  CHEERS!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iberico Ribs - amazing (10/2018)
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetables Zarzuela: perfectly prepared vegetables and wonderful sauce - yum (10/2018)
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano Tender: foie gras and tenderloin - decadent and fabulous! (10/2018)

0Zid4LQd1y-zQ3ifiR0txg.text: Julian Serrano Tapas came through for me in a bind. During a large conference in Las Vegas, I was looking for a place to entertain a few clients. It was a bit of a last minute thing so most venues were sold out. They worked with me in selecting a time a that was good for my group and accomodated us in a good table away from the hustle and bustle. The end result, a very enjoyable evening, we were able to solidify our relationships with our guests and explore new opportunites. We dined on tapas and the selections were diverse and delicious. Service was very good and the desert was totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ndcNFNo4zRr0GcbtOEy5cA.text: Good news/bad news: my dining companion loved the JS lunch special ($24, I believe). He had the chicken croquetas, Pan Manchego and Cuban sandwich. Each was tasty and perfectly proportioned. The plates were beautiful, by which I mean the tableware. Service of each course was well-timed.  Now for my experience. There was nothing on the lunch menu that I could eat. Not one thing. I don't have that many allergies, but they couldn't accommodate them. The poor bartender tried everything to find something that I could eat but it didn't happen. On the upside, the Mattaromera rose that I had was quite enjoyable.   The resto is adjacent to the Aria lobby but it's not as loud as may be expected.   Not sure if I would go back but I might if my dining companion really wanted to because he enjoyed every part of his meal except the fact that he was eating alone.

afnofpJPBANTiQvSPH7RTw.text: Great food. Great service. I loved that we were with a group have decision challenges, and the server asked if they could just take care of it and bring good stuff. Yes. Done. I'm a dessert person, and I didn't love the churros as much as others did (the interesting part was the creme at the bottom of the bowl, but there were neither spoons to scoop it out, nor were the churros sturdy enough to dip without breaking), but I really liked the orange creme brulee and salted caramel. Tappas were good too. :)

DSOuThnxTdZBzxSwnPqdKA.text: Delicious meal. Many, many creative and interesting choices. Lively atmosphere and attentive service. So glad we chose here and I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bar
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. birthday martinis
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eISrNlIddmamx4qXUCa5kg.text: "There are only three things women need in life:  food, water and compliments" - Chris Rock  We managed to escape the incoming bad weather of Hurricane Lane that threatened the Hawaiian Islands during the latter part of the week in August 2018 to celebrate my birthday (although it had passed) and a good friend's birthday in Las Vegas.  Julian Serrano Tapas was on our list to try as we have often passed by without trying during previous stays.  I had made dinner reservations through Open Table a month in advance, okay, so call me "AR" but, eating well is not always spontaneous for me.  We were promptly seated by the friendly hostesses who were smartly dressed in Flamenco Red dresses.  They seated us facing the bar featuring legs of famous Iberico jamon and full bar.  The brightly colored red hued decor around us also put us in a Spanish mood.  Our server, Richard L, was attentive, a good conversationalist and efficient.  I'm sorry that I didn't get the name of the sommelier but he, too, was amicable and "read my taste buds" as we ordered glasses of Tempranillo before moving onto more robust wines with dinner.  APPETIZERS: -Cheese & Charcuterie Plate: pata negra, chorizo, salchichon, cana de cabra (soft goat's milk cheese), 1-y/o manchego (sheep's milk), drunken goat milk cheese, rebollin afuega'l pitu red cheese (cow's milk) and picos bread. This plate was a perfect taste of Spain's Regions featuring mild to bold or fresh to cured flavors.  $26  FOOD:  -Bronzino donostiarra:  sea bass, tapenade, tomato and patata panadera.  The sea bass skin was beautifully pan-crisped and the large flaked flesh was buttery fat tasting.  The roasted garlic cloves was soft and spreadable onto the fish and added a mild nutty flavor.  I would have been perfectly happy eating this fish by myself, but, I DID share as I knew we had ordered other items. $19  -Bang Bang Shrimp:  rock shrimp fritters, guacamole on sweet gem lettuce bed.  These fritters were not oily or greasy and they were light and puffy.  There was a spicy chili kick found in the sauce which enhanced the shellfish.  Delicious nuggets of shrimp that we popped into our mouths like popcorn.  $17  -Paella "Serrano":  Spanish morcilla sausage, Iberico ribs and saffron.  To us, the Serrano paella called out to our carnivorous palates.  The Bomba rice was moist yet still had a luscious light socarrat.  Kudos to the chef or cook for this perfection.  Each of us were able to have 2 Iberico ribs and 2 morcillas along with the rice.  The rich meatiness and flavors were filling but not food coma inducing.  Excellent portion was served.  $50  We just couldn't order dessert or anything else after this wonderful meal knowing this was our second meal on this 6-night stay in Las Vegas.  We did vow to return and did so on our last night.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carajillo:  espresso &amp; Licor 43 (not stirred L). Although, this version tasted more like anisette
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It wasn&#39;t busy until after 7:00PM. Best to make reservations
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bZh3RFww_ypPCckohAyIBQ.text: This is a lovely restaurant, the interior is pretty. We were greeted at the front desk. I usually don't find the staff who work the front all that friendly, the 2 there were no exception.    Having dined at Masa's restaurant decades ago when Chef Masa was at the helm before his death, then Chef Serrano after, I was looking forward to dining here. Spanish paella is one of our favorite foods but no matter the multiple attempts at home even cooking with saffron and making a sofrito, I just do not make it like the restaurants. There must be a secret ingredient in their kitchens and not mine.   We tried 4 items: Apple salad was delightful. I enjoyed the dressing. Slivers if apples mixed with yellow cubes of beets were encased in a cylindrical, crispy bread toast.   The calamari fritto was OK, light and crispy.  We both didn't like the octopus. It was cut into pieces and was very tender. But the marinade if sauce didn't taste that great.  A plain, marinated, octopus which was grilled, was the best serve to us in Chicago.   The Serrano paella was our favorite and expensive,  about $50. The 4-6 Riblets were tender and tasty.  I didn't like the sausage where sliced pieces were placed over the paella. It was topped with greens.  We skipped desserts because we were too full.   Staff was OK. Hubby asked for bread and it arrived with no butter or olive oil.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

28Vpg7s3XFh0_yq0lwkP5w.text: The food was amazing no doubt and even the venue was beautiful! We had the olive bread, potatoes brava, and mushroom risotto. Out of all the dishes, the mushroom risotto was to die for! Really delicious with a lot of flavor. I'd go back just for the risotto!  Minus 2 stars for the poor customer service. Our waiter forgot to bring one tapa we ordered - the Spanish tortilla, and we told him. He said that he'll go check on it. We wait a good half hour and at this point we finish the other tapas and still our dish has not come out yet! At this point, we chase our waiter down and tell him if the order has not been made  then we just will take the check now. He tells us that he will check and comes back to us and says the order has not been made. He did not apologize for the inconvenience of waiting when he really just forgot to put the order in all together. He should of made it up by giving us dessert or whatever on the house. I'd been happy with the simple apology.   Not sure if I will be back here again.

oAitoMFB8oSitCMxQmeObw.text: Was in Vegas this past weekend for the RISE Festival and my friend and I stayed at Aria. Many of the other dining selections were a little out of our price range. This was the perfect fit. We were celebrating my friends birthday and I was paying so I had her pick the menu. It would've been a little different if I had ordered, but I enjoyed every dish we had.   My favorite was probably the walnuts and risotto organic mushroom: creamy risotto with organic mushroom mix so comforting and delicious not overly rich. My friend selected the beef & cheese:  prime tenderloin | mushroom | honey and the bacon wrapped stuffed dates. I added the Rosemary Apple Manchego Salad : honey crisp apple | rosemary manchego cheese | golden beets. Beautifully plated an a needed freshness to the other richer dishes we had. We wrapped it up with the churros with spicy chocolate. They were cooked perfectly nice crunch to the outside and soft in the middle.   Delicious cocktails and wonderful service.  The staff was terrific we came during a staff change and it was seamless. Beautifully decorated elegant without feeling stuffy.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. exterior shot
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. churros and spicy chocolate for dipping
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Cheese and Bacon Wrapped Dates

mT-tf38KBeCE8eIl7U-wJA.text: Mustttttt order the octopus! Fave thing I've gotten so far. It is cooked perfectly so that it is soft and almost melts in your mouth. It's a pretty good portion size too with delicious sauce and potatoes served with it. The yellowtail tiradito was very fresh. Another highly recommended item is the lamb which I wanted to be cooked medium rare. It was perfect with the sauce it came with! I also ordered the squid ink seafood paella which does take them about 40 min to cook so it is good to start with some tapas while you wait for the paella to come out! The edges of the paella is crispy delicious so be sure to scrape those parts off the pan!   This is one of my favorite places for Spanish food!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Tiradito
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid ink seafood paella

Jm5CfxTE70iTa-uAkAal6Q.text: Originally had reservations at Picasso, another Julian Serrano restaurant over at the Bellagio. However, as the outdoor area with waterfront seating next to the Bellagio fountain show was closed due to a private event, we ended up venturing over to Julian Serrano Tapas instead. Better decisions have been made in Vegas, and this was one of them!  STUFFED DATES (5/5) - The apple puree underneath takes these bad boys up a notch from your traditional bacon wrapped dates.  SERRANO TENDER (5/5) - OMG!!!!!!! Seared foie gras served over prime tenderloin that's sitting atop white chocolate bread. Extremely rich and fatty and has a unique combination of sweet, savory, umami... pairs well with the garnacha!  CHULETA DE CORDERO (4/5) - One perfectly grilled lamb chop with sprinkled crushed nuts and served with fingerling potatoes and an aioli. May have been meat-ed out by the prior dish by the time we got this.  TORRIJA (3/5) - Almost like a Spanish French toast that's drenched in salted caramel sauce and served with vanilla bean ice cream and candied macadamia nuts. May have enjoyed this more if we weren't absolutely STUFFED and feeling the creeping richness of the prior dishes.  GARNACHA (5/5) - Only $13 a glass and a great, light, dry accompaniment to the rich foods!  Service was top notch. Dishes came out within 5-10 minutes of ordering. True to form, my indecisive self originally ordered the healthier apple manchego salad... then got talked into switching to the lamb chop instead. As soon as I flagged a waitstaff to make the switch, out comes the salad... but the workers were more than accommodating to switch the plate to the lamp chop despite my insisting to keep the salad that was already out!  Will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red wines by the glass
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Torrija

G5hsKbs__LnOIC_UDUPPSg.text: Located inside the Aria next to Catch. Very chic and modern like the rest of the resort. What makes Julian Serrano unique is truly their staff. They went above and beyond for my party of 8. We were able to sample different dishes and were informed on all ingredients. I haves tuna allergy and someone else in the party has a seafood allergy. They were quick to accommodate that. Even asked about cross contamination. Extremely grateful for our server Eduardo who went above and beyond for us. I high recommend the yellow tail and for desert my favorite was the classic creme brulee.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my favorites. Queso fresco was very fresh!

CvhYiYp68sT3eyAGReN9cg.text: Allow me to be short and to the point.  This restaurant rocks. So much so, that I now compare every tapas place I've been to to my dining experience here. So good.  Go. You'll love it. (But make a ressie or you might be waiting for a table for a while!)

q7qWw_YvV77taYStjbv9WQ.text: The place looks fantastic, the decor and design is great.  (Most) of the food was excellent.  The price, like everything in Aria, is top-dollar, so expect to spend a pretty penny if you're making this your meal.  The service was great, the waiting staff was very friendly an attentive.    This is tapas, so the food is coming to you in small portions.  I love to eat, so while I'll like stuffing my face I exercised the compulsion to devour the plate in one bite.  Yes, you'll be nibbling a little bit of this and a little bit of that.    As for the food, we tried a bunch but here are a few that stood out to me:  1) Ahi Tuna - Good dish, very fresh and tasty. 2) Lamb Chop - On the small side for sure, even for tapas in my opinion, but very tasty. 3) Eggplant - OK, I have a few words about the vegetarian Eggplant dish.  This one tasted like the chef dumped one of my great grandmother's mason jars of cold veggies out onto a plate and garnished it a bit.  This was the last dish we were served, and sadly, by far the most disappointing food of my whole trip.  The menu would be far better off without offering this one.  I'd recommend this place to try on your Vegas trip if you're into Tapas and either have the cash... or you've got your company card handy.  :)

e448OPTIa8mErH3VXo5b2w.text: I'm definitely a fan!    Our waitress (Michele) was great as was the rest of the waitstaff.    Although I wanted to try the paella, the tapas seemed more fun so we went that route.    We tried:  Beef and Cheese - To.Die.For. Shrimp ceviche - Eh.  My husband liked it, I didn't care for it at all. Chicken croquetas - Yummy!  We joked with our waitress that we wanted to get an order to go. Pan Manchego - Good Torjilla - Yummy! Pinxto chorizo - Good Something with shrimp but I can't remember the name for the life of me!  I just remember that it was good!  Drinks: Red Sangria - Soooooo good!  Probably among the best I have ever had. Margarita  We both loved our meal and we would go back in a heartbeat.    While we were there, Julian was there!  We saw him walk Penn (of Penn and Teller) out and he was out front a little later and he said bye to me.  Then he showed me the kitchen and taught me how to replicate the tapas at home.  OK, so that last part didn't happen but a girl can dream, right?

aWJzNSNdvfO98amT42epww.text: No complaints here.  Enjoyed muscles, octopus, croquettes and all were great.  The muscles were quite generous in size and in flavour.  Followed that up with a mixed paella which was delicious and a meal in itself.  No room for desert which I'm always ok with.

UT97UJ70jO3wXtykhyoyOg.text: JS was so delicious!  We ordered the seafood paella and the four of us cleaned the plates.  It was as good as the one I had in Barcelona. I also got the white sangria...not too sweet!  It was perfect!  We also got the short ribs...it was good but I have had better hence the 4 stars instead of 5.  I would get the paella again but would definitely order a different appetizer.

-07F9URpE4MDivMGTafLlA.text: Fantastic, simply fantastic.   Mixed paella:   as if I returned to Spain.   It was _that_ good.   Tapas:  so good that my wife and I had to come back the very next day.   "Beef and cheese" redefined what a chef can do with a perfect cut of filet mignon.  Superb service.    Our new favorite in Las Vegas.

lTaJypZ-A1T8aryzWJz6fw.text: Muy expensivo but awesome artisan desserts.   And the coffee.. one of the best I've ever sent between my lips...

ebKU-HYK09QqPJD5NWTDcA.text: Ok...hold on to your hat for this one! This last monday  I was sitting at the bar having dinner. The hostess trapped a spider in a cup put a lid on it and passed to the the appitizer chef who was working right in front of me.  It was horrible , they thought they were being funny  but the chef added some food to the cup and was planning a joke on someone...OMG i was appalled. I reluctanly ate and left for fear of what may happen to me if i said something.  This was just rediculous.  The bartender who waited on me was very nice thats the only plus.

RtyVl1nyfIfd13Sodfgttg.text: We had a very good meal. Everything was at least "good" if not "very good". Service was excellent. Menu is varied. The price was reasonable. I think we shared 12 plates, 2 drinks, and 3 desserts for $230. We were stuffed by the end.

ilaQbkjKET_GqO3ZtYcIBA.text: Having only just realized Vegas had a Sushi Samba i HAD to check it out tho its no Park Ave SS. Then i stumbled across this tapas bar, and i hadnt come across any since 1997 outside of Spain that did any justice until now. Love everything about this place. Will def keep returning.

99bIOXeZaxLrl6EOzP5PTw.text: I had a really nice time. The food was a little better than I expected which is a plus! We sat at the bar and the bartender was working hard, serving a lot of people while maintaining drinks and positive personality too. I would like to go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5KUduLtia-ayfE7_LYKtoQ.text: We went here on our last day visiting Vegas because I was craving a Cheese Plate. they did not have one on the lunch menu but they were accommodating and made me the one off the dinner menu I also got the meat plate both were very good. I would come back again.

MF6hSNq9H_nhs4N0ju2ilQ.text: Not at all what I was expecting.    Expensive for the portion sizes.    Potatoes undercooked.    Shrimp ceviche giant, completely raw chunks.  Obviously marinated with lime to order.  I liked it, but the others in my crew nearly hurled.    Chicken croquetas disgusting, livery tasting, dry.    Best thing we had was the apple-manchego salad.  Paella overcooked, mushy, bland.    Desserts weak.  Chocolate lava cake?  Really?  They serve those @ Domino's Pizza now.    The local critics have been giving Serrano the courtesy reach-around for years.  I don't know why.  Picasso's menu hasn't changed since they opened.  The food there is served almost banquet-style.  Same veg and piped mashed potatoes I was served at my brother's wedding in 1993 at the Marriott.  Skip this place.   Go to Firefly*.

ofGcA8VDVIE9FAbDQjx_HA.text: My wife and I ate at Julian Serrano's on 6/18/12. This was a top notch dining experience. They have an extensive wine list. We asked the Sommelier for guidance with a Spanish wine that would resemble an Oregon Pinot. She did a perfect job. We had several Tapas that were delicious. We shared the Mixed Paella and what a treat. For dessert we had the molten lava chocolate also very good. My wife ordered the Absinthe and they brought over a contraption that serves the Absinthe with sugared water. Totally cool and my wife enjoyed it very much. Julian Serrano is one of the better food experiences I have had. Definitely not cheap, but well worth it. My wife and I felt completey perfect after our meal.

BpiMWlO_i3eyFARSc35X5g.text: Oh. My. Gods.   What a delicious meal. A group of 3 of us shared a white sangria, mixed ceviche, fried calamari, and mixed paella. Everything was amazing.   The sangria was so light and fruity. An excellent compliment to the meal.   The ceviche looks small, but it sure packs a punch of flavor. I believe it included octopus, shrimp, and white fish...I can't be sure. Either way, it was amazing. The textures were great, and the combination of citrus with a touch of red pepper felt like fireworks on my palette. So good.   When the waiter suggested calamari, I wasn't expecting anything too exciting, since you can get it just about anywhere. What a pleasant surprise this was. It was so very lightly breaded, so you could really taste the meat. Also, squirting lemon and then a hint of the aioli dipping sauce really created amazing flavors. It was a really delightful treat.   Finally, the piece de resistance, the mixed paella. It includes lobster (both claws and the tail), chicken, chorizo, vegetables, and saffron rice. Wow. It was hard not to stuff ourselves silly with this. Everything about it was amazing. It was pricey, but I would order it again in a heartbeat...I would actually say that about the other items as well. It will be hard to return and try new things, when I know how fantastic the other items are.   So, with such great food, why 4 stars? I took off a star for the service. Or server wasn't that great...he kept approaching at inappropriate times, and then when we were clearly ready to make our order, he was nowhere to be found. He did suggest the calamari though. Also, when we ordered the paella, he asked if the 3 of us would be eating it...and I believe he thought we wanted a larger order of it...not sure, it was a bit of a miscommunication that led to the paella costing $20 more than the listed price. It wasn't a huge problem, however, I wish it would have been made clear when we ordered it that we were getting a larger order that would be more pricey.   All-in-all it was a delicious experience and I will definitely return.

p8OLqot9z8jiZo1-iIL3Lg.text: The food was good, not great. It was way too loud for us, we had a hard time hearing the waitress and could barely hold a conversation.  The red Sangria was tasty.

Qa_f5bHJZdBwEkTEHZcgUg.text: This is one of the very best Spanish restaurants we have ever eaten in anywhere in the United States, and certainly rates with some of the better places we've been to in Spain!  We went for dinner (tapas), and everything was phenomenal!  The stuffed dates are so tasty (sweet, crunchy, and salty all at the same time ... and fried to boot!), the fried piquillo peppers were just sooooo good, we wolfed down the whole plate!  The bacalao croquettes (a special) were the most airy and tasty we've had in years, and the deconstructed mediterranean seafood stew was absolutely sublime!  And of course, the Pata Negra Jamon Iberico - well, if you know Pata Negra, enough said!   Pair all that with an outstanding bottle of Alion Ribera del Duero and you have the makings of one fantastic dinner!   Our only dings: the coco chorizo was a disappointment, and they didn't serve bread on the table.  But, hey, who bats 1000?  The service was very good, eventhough it was quite busy, and our sommelier was especially helpful and friendly.  If you like Spanish food (heck, if you like food), do yourself a favor and visit Julian Serrano ... but be sure to have your credit card ready!

A2Z0sfz9aZFp9sApseb6PQ.text: We went here for restaurant week lunch.  I guess I should have looked at the regular menu prior to eating here.  I thought they had regular sized entrees but what came out was tapas.  The menu they put up on the restaurant week web site should give some indication that tapas was what was being offered.  While the food tasted fine, I have never gone to a restaurant and left more hungry than when I arrived.  After lunch, two of my companions went to the coffee shop and the other bought a doughnut at the coffee stand.  None of the three are over 110 lbs and they left starving.  Frankly, while dining out, I cannot remember a time I felt more ripped off in my life and I eat out an average of 10 times a week.

QA4l0zE3gYM8qiNWmlnh7g.text: Oh Boo Hoo eating well in Las Vegas is expensive. Once you get over the sticker shock at every nice restaurant on the Strip it's time to start eating!  On our first night a friend of mine who lives in Vegas wanted to show us Aria since it just opened last week. Visually, Aria has, in my opinion, the most beautiful casino on the strip. And inside Aria is where Julian Serrano is.  First off I love the decor and the chairs, which look 70s modern are really comfortable. Usually I'm more of a plain chair to eat dude, but these were something special.  I looked at the beer list at the back of the wine list and also a beer list on the main menu and they were different. Very strange. They didn't have Weihenstephaner like one menu indicated, but Fat Tire was fine. You'll find FT everywhere in Vegas.  The food:  ~Dates with almond centers: Good. Weird spicy red sauce to go with them actually melded well with the dates.  ~Chicken croquetas: Loved these. Not sure what part was chicken but they were creamy crispy goddesses i'd eat way more of.  ~Seared scallops with a peanut sauce: $12 for one scallop. Ouch. But!, it was really awesome. Barely cooked. Some people might not like that but I did. Probably would pass next time because of the high price and small size.  ~Flat Calamari (not fried): The most interesting thing I ate in Vegas! I love calamari, but have never had this part of the squid. There were little baby one which you'll see most places, but then they had what look liked the ends of the tentacles. Not sure what part it was but they were fantastic! A must get for the adventurous eater!  This was my 2nd favorite meal in Vegas. I definitely recommend it. Go with a lot of people to try everything on the menu.

Umqtff05RWaWyIX42NroMQ.text: Tapas eating is just the way to go when you want to dry different plates... We had: *Brava Potatoes - We would have it again. *Flat iron steak - We would have this again. *15 year old Serrano ham - Nice touch with the toasted bread with the ham. *Shrimp ceviche - Ceviche is always good. *Mixed Paella - Good, but wished there was more crust/crunch to the top of it. *Flan - Delish with a strawberry topping. *Spanish creme brulee - Wish I had the flan instead. *White Sangria - Non-stop.  Vegas has so many good restaurants.  Perfect place for Christmas because nothing is ever closed.

9fPDUEytXrDSV1ekMYDbeg.text: I have to say that I was a bit disappointed with Julian Serrano. I thought I was going to be blown away based on all the reviews I had read and the pictures I had seen, but the meal just left a lot to be desired. We shared a ton of appetizers but the only standout was the yellowtail-the fish was very fresh and it had a nice flavor. The black rice was also good. Grilled octopus I did not like, and I love grilled octopus. The seasoning on it tasted almost like a curry and it just didn't go well, plus it was a bit overcooked. They never brought out our tuna cones which I was really excited to try, so that was a bit disappointed.  I wouldn't rush back here, but some of the food was good.

eo1eZQKjMUZi_FlRy1jacw.text: My wife and I were staying at the Aria and decided to eat here since we are a big fan of the food. Julian Serrano is the best Spanish restaurants in Las Vegas and we tried them all multiple times.  Pedro our waiter was very attentive and really provided us with great service. Which really made the meal more special beyond just a regular dinner.  He provide us with great recommendations that were totally spot on, followed up promptly and made sure all our needs were met.  I recommend making reservations and requesting for Pedro if you can.  A must try item is the Seafood Black Rice to die for.. (The best dish at JS in my opinion).   All the the Paella are fantastic. Pedro recommended the Carne Asada, very delicious.  Basically you really can't go wrong with any of the dishes.   My wife and I have eaten here many times when we are visiting Vegas and we have ordered most of them.

Li4Pt6cItESesVRF9slkwg.text: This is my second time here and this place still amazed me by their food and service. This time we came here for lunch. They recommended people to order 3 dishes per person (tapa style). We ended up ordering 5 and got full already. Service was great; our waiter was attentive, thoughtful and efficient. And food was delicious, we ordered a tuna cone, mushroom risotto rice, chorizo and fries with egg on top, a Japanese eggplant and a chicken coquettes. Each of them were full of favors and perfectly portioned.   We will definitely come back again!

Eyrh6i4xBUJaw8-2EwY_0w.text: We had Erwin as our waiter and he was AMAZING!! Extremely polite, very attentive, knowledgeable of the menu and showed sincere passion in what it took to make each dish. He even made my moms birthday extra special by providing a surprise at the end of the most delicious churros and chocolate dip! We can't thank him enough for making This restaurant an even greater experience. We will be back!

1xVqKUY6B0emJ_bVSL0l5w.text: Perfect Tapas place. The portions are surprisingly big for Tapas so don't over order.   4/5 stars only because the sauces were all a tad bit heavy making it hard to finish our meal.   - Potatoes Bravas - delicious and really fills you up - Salmon - perfectly prepared  - Olives plate nice little appetizer - Mushroom soup was very tasty however, we probably didn't need to order it there were only two of us - spicy meat ball - soooooo good, but pretty damn spicy so watch out - Mushroom Risoto - good  And the service was just great. Specifically our server Pedro. If you still remember your servers name days after, it means he was awesome! And he was.  2 People all that food for $70  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Place oozes with cool. Great ambiance.
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Meatball... spicy! But delicious.

1ITjbBZ4S_B1GaDZrbQjNg.text: Decent food but WAY, WAY, WAY overpriced (example: $12 for two slices of bread with jelly and cheese topping).    We had a group of 7 and our bill was $999.11.  Only $180 of that was wine/drinks. Crazy.  Also, it's very open and thus very loud.  We had a difficult time conversing as a group.   Service was good.

5VmJ14V0cKOcRviBKjSfcg.text: Pretty mediocre meal.  The paella was good but none of the other dishes were anything special at all.   The octopus was downright bad.    Service was really poor with a waiter that seemed as if he had never waited tables before.  And that's all complemented by a mostly empty and vibeless dining room stuck in a garish and cheesy hotel lobby

n6xivIftwUy6snGYSt5eFg.text: We really enjoyed Julian Serrano at the Aria.  We didn't try the paella, just feasted on tapas, all of which were super tasty.  I would especially recommend:  -- oxtail (raba de toro) -- Yellowtail -- croquetas -- charcuterie plate -- padron peppers  We had a delicious wine from Spain's Ribera del Duero region that went perfectly with the food.  The only complaint was how fast everything came out -- we finally had to ask the server to slow down the orders (which they did).  I always forget how fast Vegas service typically is.  A definite recommend!

n2dU71B3J9XUHYlUOV9oJQ.text: Really dig the open patio style seating that Julian Serrano has going on.  Since we had a group of 5, we ordered the regular sized Mixed Paella to start since it was going to take awhile, and just ordered a bunch of tapas to share.  Even though on the menu it shows the paella's portion is for two, with all the tapas we ordered, turned out to be a smart choice.    The paella came loaded with seafood.  Paella's tasty and it definitely hit the spot for us.  Can't really compare to "authentic" paella, but for what it is, pretty good!  One of my friend mentioned that the seafood wasn't as fresh as it could be, which is understandable since Vegas is in the middle of the desert haha.  My only knock on it would probably be the super small lobster tail.  As for the tapas, there were a few standouts.  The Black Rice is my favorite: squid Ink rice/risotto with calamari and lobster, with a heavy touch on garlic, which I liked.  Others that stood out were the White Ceviche, which was refreshing, and the Apple Foie, which is a mini apple roasted with a chunk of foie in the middle.  C'mon.  The Fresh Calamari a la Plancha was a surprise.  Essentially grilled calamari, but done perfectly.  The Beef Tartare here has an interesting presentation.  Tasty too to match the good looks.   Pan Tomate was a disappointment and didn't care much for the Stuffed Piquillo Peppers.    We ordered a pitcher of red sangria to share, which was good for about 8-9 glasses.  Solid solid sangria.  Seating was a bit awkward when I was checking in for my reservation.  There was a group of Chinese tourists in front of us and the host must've thought we were together so didn't pay any attention until I grabbed her attention.  Besides that, service was fantastic.  Our server was fantastic... but unfortunately forgot his name.

gFXjNObLCXTZI90Tj7RVkw.text: The decor is so detailed and beautiful.. the food was so unique and delicious .. just my chicken skewer was very slightly pink but didn't stop me.. Almost everything was with a sauce and flavorful... small portions perfect for two... We will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skewer
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail with creamy mashed potato

WxmvZgFnAQtljki-gKaEyw.text: I have eaten here once before and had such a great experience, I just had to come back.    I started out with the roasted apple stuffed with foie gras, which was my favorite of the night.  It had a nice blend of sweet and savory and the nuts added some nice texture.  Next, I had the seared scallops which were cooked perfectly.  Well executed, although not particularly innovative.  I had the short ribs which were a little bit undercooked this time around (the last time I ate here, it was perfectly cooked and tender).  The flavors still were great and the mashed sweet potatoes matched the short ribs well.  I tried the molten chocolate cake with blood orange sorbet.  I like the contrast in temperatures and the presentation was nice as well with the chocolate cake in one corner, while the sorbet occupied the diametric opposite corner, bridged by a stripe of chocolate.  The service was ok, but the nice variety of high quality small plates made this a wonderful experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main dining area
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. roasted apple stuffed with foie gras
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs with whipped sweet potatoes

jJWl2uWtT5yaSrev5Y563A.text: I've been here twice and it's just such a lovely place. Mostly hits and few misses, but something for everyone. Eat a little, eat a lot. Eat quickly, eat slowly. Watch the kitchen, watch the people in the casino. The staff could not be nicer. They have a gluten free menu, which I'm grateful for, but it's probably an 8th the size of their regular menu, and it's not up to date. It would be REALLY helpful if they were more specific or more adaptable. Because I asked a lot of questions (I'm a huge pain in the neck being gluten and dairy free) and although I said I don't need to worry about cross contamination or tiny amounts of gluten, my crab black rice came out with bread crumbs on top. Obviously, that would have been super easy to leave off. Maybe it would change the balance of the dish, but I would understand that and be happy and healthier!   Still, we ate many wonderful things (the black rice dish, the ribs, the oxtail) and I certainly recommend the place. I sat and watched the kitchen and my boyfriend sat and watched the people. Perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxyail
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail

c6buOTW813oftBuCy-5VVw.text: We came here to celebrate my Goddaughters 21st birthday... excellent tapas...we also had paella and white sangria... service wonderful, will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EY4KBvAicro40doafV71LQ.text: It's a trap ppl! Don't go there! Lol  Food is really good don't get me wrong, but the portions are supper small! If u wanna get full u would at least need to order 3 plates plus the dessert and I think u would b good... the view to the Bellagio fountain was really nice... so if you have some spare money to spend for a fancy dinner..then I would recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

myBmJt3_J1Jsn8wXw3ULKQ.text: We had an excellent dinner full of delicious tapas. Our waiter Pedro was gracious and knowledgable and helped us navigate the many menu options by making several suggestions that were spot on.  The tuna carpaccio was a standout, along with the shrimp gambas. The atmosphere is more casual and lively, with food that will make foodies happy. I highly recommend this place.

o4M2sOV6-Bzx-AyY_tXGlg.text: Overall: This is one of the best restaurants I have ever visited in my life. It blew my expectations on tapas and every dish was impeccably seasoned, as if I could feel the effort placed in the design of each dish.  Ambience/Service: Being inside the trendy Aria, the restaurant feels hip. The service was impeccable, probably because we were one of the first customers in an early lunch time.  Food: I have never been a fan of Spanish Tapas in America, because my general view is that they are very overpriced for only a small amount of food. This restaurant changed my opinion of this cuisine.  It was a very memorable experience. The best dish, in my opinion, was the seasoned Black Rice, which was a party in my mouth. I still can't fathom what kind of seasoning went into the dish, but it was just amazing and each bite oozed with umami. The Raspberry Tuna skewers were a pleasant surprise, especially when I found out they dabbed a bit of wasabi paste inside the raspberries. The wasabi really cuts the sourness of the raspberry - it is now my favorite way to eat these berries! I also tried the Spanish Tortilla: creamy potatoes, melt-in-your-mouth onions, all blended in so well with the soft omelette. It's exactly as homey as how my Spanish co-workers made it. I also tried the White Fish Ceviche, which was extremely flavorful with just the right amount of spicy kick. Overall, this place is simply amazing and I would visit it every time I come to Las Vegas.

IOQywjzrUQaSZOQ5gGON1Q.text: Ambiance is not cozy, food is great. Service is personable Desserts don't bother . Sangria is very good. Order a pitcher  Staff are great and welcoming  Expensive but worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pLFxMap9w3w9tIJqg3HdbA.text: I am a huge fan of Julian Serano. In fact, these days I will go to Vegas just because I love the restaurant so much. I discovered Julian Serranos restaurant about four years ago and have gone back many times ever since. Julian's also has a new restaurant over at Bellagio called Lago. That's Italian food and it's terrific. I went there for my first time a month ago. His restaurants are divine. Definitely a little bit splurge worthy but... Worth it. I recommend this place for all sorts of occasion- going out with coworkers, a date, or even just dining with your friends. The bartender makes terrific drinks and the menu items are always amazing.

JcK5jEoxc1alHE8q1h48cg.text: The girls and I are still talking about and craving the food from this place... I left my heart at Julian Serrano's last week sigh  We were promptly seated and service was truly memorable. Started off with a pitcher of sangria and proceeded to order a series of tapas. Everything tasted fresh and savory. Dishes that sounded spicy actually came out SPICY (which I always appreciate)..  Here's what we ordered and loved (4 girls):  - beef tartare - grilled octopus - fried calamari - stuffed peppers  - ceviche - grilled salmon  - stuffed peppers   - some potato/jalapeno skewer - chorizo   Sangria was nice and strong :) helped wash down all the various flavors. Hope I can come back!

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zCqVC0fonjGsm3WUr0NxmQ.text: To start, the restauraunt is very very comfortable and colorful.  The staff is very attentive, knowledgable and goes above and beyond to accommodate special requests.  The selection of Tapas is extensive, presentation of dishes is creative and  Pleasing to the eye.  The Mussels, Kale salad, Soup, Braised Short Ribs were delicious.  The Sangaria was addictive.  Looking forward to returning to try other Tapas.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fowjCPpd_6TXSTacNRiIxg.text: We ate here on Saturday night while hanging out in City Center. The place was packed, but we managed to get a couple seats at the bar. They serve the whole menu at the bar, so its nice if you just want to get in for a quick bite. We ordered tapas including the lobster gazpacho, stuffed dates, pan manchego, and grilled angus flat iron steak. All of them were excellent. The service was super fast and the bartender serving our food was friendly and knowledgable about the menu. He even described some of the items for us before we ordered. I enjoyed Julian Serranos very much. A great place for tapas.

SeY8Cee7ke9G5ufIlwKv3w.text: Very impressive. Scrumptious cuisine and reasonably priced.  The mussels were definitely the highlight of the evening, but there were very few downsides.  The service was top-notch.  The only downside was that we ordered 7 tapas dishes and they all came out essentially at the same time.  It would have been nicer to pace the meal, but aside from that it was great. Would return for sure.

kytFQpUwMPUZyUjS0WR6Lg.text: I was quite underwhelmed with this restaurant, the service and the food.  The waiter was errogant and not very attentive, the tapas came out randomly as if they had mixed up our order or had forgotten a plate, and the paella was extremely salty and not very flavorfull (though one would think it would be with all that salt).  The best part of the meal was the wine we chose, though incredibly expensive even for a Las Vegas hot spot!

dtcSp-PpiEbvgggGNJ_GiQ.text: One of the best Topas resturants there! Great atmosphere inside the city center. A must have is the Paella! But I do not think I have had anything there that I didnt like!

eVP7OxjsMB4Hl8w5axfnSw.text: I had a 10 pm Saturday night dinner reservation.  We were seated immediately and greeted by a friendly waitress who clearly knew the menu.  When we balked at ordering the paella because it was so much food, she suggested the black rice, instead.  It was delicious and brimming with seafood.  When we asked about ham and cheese sandwiches which are common in tapas bars in Spain, she suggested we combine the Pan Manchego and the charcuterie plate.  Another great call!  The black pig (pork shoulder) was incredible.  The french fries with egg on top and chorizo was delicious.  The roasted piquillo peppers were fantastic.  Did I mention the wines by the glass?  Not too spendy, given that it was Vegas.  The pours were fair and the three varieties we tried were all good.  We left thoroughly satisfied and will come back.

pa6iUqxV921Jl4EZVpNKxA.text: This place is super cute but our server was an ass super rude and the service is slow

XoZgF0x4gTnf6QFLGSHOfg.text: lovely spot to grab a late night dinner for two! delicious & light and left satisfied. would recommend for a larger group too, to try all that their tapas menu has to offer.  thx aria hotel, another terrific spot to dine at.  : )

0en8aXxip-DMwytEGZQtSg.text: Food was pretty authentic in parts all that except the molecular stuff.. Very PRICEY and lacks a restaurant setting overall.

trhJH9tM_HqxFIHjywK24A.text: The service the night we dined led something to be desired. In total we had at least three servers come by our table taking various orders or dropping items off which was confusing as to who was actually in charge of our table. After waiting 15-20min to place our order of three tapas and sangria, we received our food which was only a meat plate, cheese plate and tuna cones after 15min but no sangria until the end of our meal. We told our third waiter we wanted the sangria taken off our bill since it was ridiculous to be served our drinks after we were done, especially since we could see if was permeate in a giant glass jug with a spout on the bar. The manager was nice enough to come over and discuss our lack of service and took half off our bill including the sangria, which was appreciated. So I would give it a second chance because the food was excellent and the manager acknowledged the lacking service without us having to call him over.

WI2HML9ZK-XGD0khbAHaHg.text: Completely disappointed!  I went this past Sunday night with a party of 3.  We ordered about 7 or 8 dishes and not one was outstanding.  They were just ok, with the standout being the bacon-wrapped dates which were just awful.  We ordered wines by the glass, and they were small amounts of wine.  I'm not talking about just because it's in large glasses.  The wine pours were small.  Overall I just felt frustrated that I'd spent $300 in this place and felt like going to McDonald's afterward (which I didn't).  I see zero reason to ever go back here.  The positives are a nice atmosphere and cool furniture.  The food is just bad to mediocre - there's so many better restaurants in Vegas!

wX2ETi3RJMb6pRmN7Y3jSA.text: After reading some good reviews a group of us tried Julian Serrano's new tapas restaurant in Aria. The restaurant is called Julian Serrano, and the prices certainly reflect the chef's arrogance as much as the name. Everything was great, but if I had to come up with a sixth taste (besides sweet, sour, bitter, salty, and umami) it would be 'value,' because the value of a dish, or lack thereof, seems to make things taste different to me. When you order here you are hoping for dishes that are so unique and wonderful that the prices are justified, yet when the food comes out of the kitchen it becomes evident your expectations were too high and disappointment is inevitable. Take for example the imported Spanish 'pata negra' ham, described on the menu as 'the most delicious ham in the world' for $35. Obviously this is a ridiculously bold and definitive statement for anyone to make about a single meat, however, hopeful me fell for the marketing and ordered it anyways. While the ham was certainly lovely, and I can't say I specifically remember ever eating another that I found better, it was still a meager portion of ham for $35 and I've had comparable before (the curing of meats throughout Europe is an art form, and I've been lucky enough to experience this first hand).  The combination of small portions and hefty prices is bound to result in continued disappointment as you make your way through the menu. The scallop was done about as well as any other, but $12 for one of them is just too much to ask. The mushroom risotto ($10) was creamy but slightly underdone and the salmon with truffle ($12) was just so so. Definitely pass on the avocado canneloni ($10) which I found to be texturally amiss and void of any redeeming flavor. The almond stuffed dates ($8) were alright, but not only are the dates at Firefly a better value, they taste better as well. These dates had a panko bread coating that was unnecessary and bulky, which took focus away from the dates themselves, and the accompanying spicy sauce didn't pair well with them at all. The cheese plate ($14) included cana de cabra (soft goat milk cheese), aged manchego, and soft sheep milk extremedura, and was served with a fruit compote and soft toasty bread. Each cheese was complex, and it's hard not to love cheese, but I don't know if anyone other than the producers can really take credit for making a fine cheese plate. The piquillo peppers were delightful, with an oozy cheese center that was far more sophisitcated than that of Firefly, but was not worth the $10.  The good news is that I found the least expensive dishes to be some of the best anyway. The open-faced Pan Manchego ($8) was a revelation in grilled cheese, and the beet salad ($10) was not only an architectural gem but a well-balanced and colorful creation. The steamed mussels ($9) were plump and the broth was something special, though it was frustrating to capture in the shell spoons because of the pot used to serve them. In addition to tasting better than most of the other dishes, this was also the best value on the menu. If you order these items I think you'll be happier with your experience and your bill.  Tip: I noticed from the menu pictures taken by another blogger that prices were $3-5 less in December of last year. If you do want to go here I would suggest you hurry, before they become even more absurd.

UVcqZfEXVSjh676yy2x-Hw.text: Walked thru Aria hotel and stopped into Julian Serrano. Not impressed by the 15.00+ tapas items, that only sized 2 persons per item.  Our group actually chuckled a few times when the petite portions arrived a few times.  Now I've been to tapas but I guess because this is in Vegas you have to charge and arm and a leg with location.  One of my favorite red wines was only located on the - half bottle section only?? When they did bring me wine, they poured the remains from a bottle of another table, then came back 5 min later to finish the glass.  They also poured my glass before two of the females at our table had been served!  As I drank the last of my wine, I had noticed all the particles at the bottom of the glass.........  Check please! -  I won't go back.

j9_N2kHNmkazS4sQbQp1aw.text: Beautiful Restaurant and food.  I am a old employee of Julian and Im proud to say that.  This restaurant is awesome, and Julian Serrano is awesome.  Its casual so if your used to Picasso you may not like it...so set your expectations

9opSQHYZeXHlF7G4jnFjWg.text: Salty! I am not a person who puts a lot of salt on my food, but I do enjoy just the right amount, and a few of the tapas that I tried were a little too salty for me.  Despite the saltiness the tapas were good and the staff was friendly and attentive.  The restaurant itself was fun to hang out in, and the wine list did not disappoint.

7FmBEOkZk_Uas5mQyc6gYQ.text: Great restaurant in City Center.  I had many things on the menu and all where fantastic.  They also have a very good wine list.   Great decor and friendly staff.  One of the best meals I have had on the strip in years.

gZw9guGP8aZ6DmlWq4UXQw.text: We were walking around the Aria looking for a place to grab a quick and early dinner (as we had a 7:00 show to get to at the north end of the strip) and came across their "bar menu" advertised in front of the restaurant.  The prices seemed reasonable and "small bites" fit the bill since we weren't too hungry.  It was around 5:15 pm and the restaurant was almost completely empty.  We decided to give it a try but the hostess explained that in order to order off the bar menu, we had to sit at the bar.  Problem was that my mom is 86 years old and uses a walker and could not easily get into the raised chairs at the bar.  I explained to the hostess that this would not work and we left.  I was a bit surprised that she let us leave considering the restaurant was close to empty and they easily could have sat us at a table.  We walked around a few minutes more but decided to return to Julian Serrano and see if my Mom could sit at the bar.  When we returned, the hostess said that we could sit at a regular table instead of the bar which was great!  I was glad they decided to accommodate us as the food was excellent. The server was extremely attentive and friendly and the quality of the food was outstanding.  My mom even commented that it was one of the best meals she has ever had which says a lot because she can be very discerning.  I didn't expect any less from Julian Serrano and knew the food would be top notch.  I would not hesitate to dine here again when in Las Vegas in the future.

hvDu16TvrrKYXodWX4pLpw.text: Summary All of the tapas were excellent, but the paella was HORRIBLE.  Skip the paella and you will be satisfied.  It is a tapas restaurant so be aware that the dishes are small.  The restaurant is in the Aria and the restaurant is just as cool as the hotel.  A good place for a glass of wine and a few tapas.  Food dishes Bacalao a la gabardina (atlantic cod | rocoto mayo | tempura batter) The fish was light and fluffy and the batter was very delicate.  An excellent dish. 10/10  Sauteed baby spinach (pine nuts | raisins | apple | shallots) The pine nuts, raisins and apple added some interesting flavors and textures to the dish.  A good dish.  7/10  Escalivada (eggplant | red pepper | tomato | onion) I'm not a big fan of eggplant, but this one was pretty good.  The others at the table liked the dish.  8/10  Creamy risotto (wild mushroom | manchego cheese | natural jus) The risotto was cooked just right.  The flavor was excellent.  I thought I tasted truffle oil too.  9/10  Pintxo de moruno (marinated pork loin | pancetta | toasted cous cous) This dish had 4 pieces of pork on a skewer.  The pork was cooked just right and it had lots of flavor.  An excellent dish. 10/10  Pintxo de chorizos (mini spanish pork chorizo | garlic mashed potatoes | garlic sauce) There were 5 small pieces of sausage.  The sausage had a hint of spiciness.  8/10  Paella Marinea (calamari | shrimp | mussels | monkfish | vegetables | saffron rice) This was a HUGE disappointment.  The rice was not cooked right.  It was hard and it was not creamy.  The seafood was ok, but it didn't really add a good tasting flavor to the paella.  How bad was it?  I would rather eat Top Ramen than have this dish again.  1/10  Service The service was below average.  We were not rushed, which is good, but I think the staff forgot about basic service (empty glasses of iced tea, checking back timely).

mvPRnEmdjInVDGtOGTe55g.text: Really good food with nice service. We ate at a few of the restaurants at Aria hotel and the best was Julian Serrano. I would come back

BpD2DWa87XaX989JaVSL8Q.text: Amazing decor- absolutely stunning. We ate lunch, shared the shrimp ceviche ( $12 and excellent!), I had the salmon sandwich which came with a side salad and a small cup of gazpacho for $10. It was great! My husband enjoyed his seared Ahi salad which was around $12. We both had a glass of red sangria and the white sangria- red was great, white was good. Our bill came to $65, which was very reasonable for the awesome food and service! (And I got a kick out of the Spanish lessons in the bathroom.)

lk1efhurz4jW6PjAGboywg.text: Got horrible food poisoning here from the Paella. Had to be taken to the hospital by paramedics from my room. The doctors in the ER said it was food poisoning. Aria said I was wrong, stretched it out over a month, then said it was too late to give me a refund for the additional nights I had to stay because of their food. I stay in Vegas a lot, never had such horrible treatment by Aria or their poorly prepared restaurants food. I'd personally recommend staying away from here...it looks nice on the outside, but the food was mediocre and you may just end up in the hospital.

v7QDTshi9tUcIww4n7jWXQ.text: Despite a lot of large parties from the convention that was going on, we were seated right away with no wait. I was quite impressed. It's my favorite place to eat. The ambiance is interesting since it's somewhat open to the lobby at Aria.  Our server didn't seem too happy when he was taking our order and when we asked him questions about the menu or if we needed anything, his answers were all very curt.  However, the food is delicious. Since it's all small portions, it's easy to try different things from the menu and also portion things out depending on how hungry you are. I had the traditional spanish chicken croquetas which were so good. Perfectly breaded and crispy on the outside, warm and moist on the inside. The Spanish Iberico Sliders were also amazing. The combination of iberian pork with the ground beef was perfect and complimented each other really well. Too bad there were only two in an order because I wanted more. My friends ordered the lobster salad, grilled flat iron steak, and the fried calamari which they all enjoyed.  Despite the service not being so great and a little slow, I'm still gonna give Julian Serrano five stars. The server was probably just having an off day. He was nice enough to split our checks three ways which was much appreciated since it made paying a lot easier for us. The food is always delicious and I will definitely go back again.

Kl31qo0T-rkatOuPJUWyWg.text: First experience was over a year ago, and was awesome. We were determined to try new options while visiting Vegas this year but had to go back. We enjoyed the empanadas, lobster salad, spicy bomba, scallop, and (spicy shrimp). Every bite was amazing. We left completely satisfied even though this is a tapas joint. Excellent bar tender/server and good beer and wine selection. Super cool experience, without the exorbitant prices tag that can sometimes accompany the Vegas dining experience.

PLocpVFYPAtoXl2wlYYoOw.text: Wow! Sitting at the bar right now after a great dinner and waiting from dessert! Service has been top notch and food grest. I had the gamba (shrimp) and a sauteed baby spinach with pine nuts, apples. And drunken raisins. Best meal in Vegas so far. Dining alone at the bar and servers have made me so comfortable. This is a Do Not Miss!!!!
