Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gambas
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach with pie nuts, apples and drunken raisins over a pine nut puree!

ogLNfGL9cp4kD8VOldthBQ.text: I think I may be generous with the 2 stars.....we were served rancid olive oil (on asparagus), crispy paella (EVERY other time it has been cooked - not al dente), and Iberico ham that was kind of 'meh.'    Very loud - hard to hear conversation at out 2 top.    Server was lukewarm, clearly not thrilled to be there.    My advice?  If you need to drop some money quickly use a slot machine instead.  We actually did and won a bunch of money!  At Serrano's you wont win anything but hopefully will find a bite or two of actual 'AUTHENTIC' Spanish cuisine, which is better than we did.

o4JirluzCe_9xoBDj7z7cg.text: My experience here marks the official end of on-strip dining for me. People who enjoy being ripped off and know nothing of food quality will be pleased with Julian Serrano, but the rest us, who have standards and work hard for our money, will be incredibly disappointed.   It's hard not be attracted to this restaurant, with it's dazzling modern decor, and long line of people of waiting, you'd think it's a sure thing ... only it's not. My epic fail of a meal started with a $16 lamb chop tapa, which came with 1 lamb chop, ONE, which translates to about 3 bites of food. I get that tapas are small, but for $16, that's roughly $5 a bite! In Spain tapas are either free or extremely cheap, so this is just ridiculous. I also saw a stuffed pepper appetizer come across my table that featured 2 teeny tiny red peppers (about the size of half a crayon each). The tapas I sampled were good, but for those prices, they should have had gold nuggets or loose diamonds in them.   Next up was paella, at $22 per person, this was literally the most offensively bland dish I have ever had in my life. EVER. And we waited 40 minutes for it! The Chef might as well have come out and openly laughed in my face at that point, because that's how I felt, like a damned fool. Rice-a-roni from a box is exponentially better that this crap.   Now I know why Julian Serrano is the executive chef at Picasso because no professional chef be would be caught dead at this establishment.

MFOcZDZKkHraWWgIAuyTWg.text: We finally get to try this expensive tapas place thanks to restaurant week.  Very impressive with the Avocado Cannelloni-beautiful presentation and the flavor was refreshing. Chicken Croquetas was deeped fried, bit crunch on the outside and super soft at the inside.  I loved the stuffed Piquillo Peppers as well - very rich flavor. I have never imagined pairing Salmon and Truffle but both me and my friend were speechless by this dish. A tiny bit over baked but we love truffle.  The main course was a bit too salty but the Pork Chop was perfectly done. Tender and beautiful pink color. Roasted chicken was again bit over baked to my taste and a little dry.   Desert wasn't super impressive but the hot chocolate was interesting.   I would love to try other stuff @ Julian Serrano again. So far this is my favorite tapas in Las Vegas as in creativity, presentation and flavor.

RzMFE2Vu39Mdn6-sh-Uk4g.text: I am a slut for patatas bravas. It's the truth. That spicy aioli, the potatoes...crispy on the outside, velvet on the inside. It doesn't really get any better than that.   Oh wait, it does!   When patatas bravas are joined by a nice glass of wine, the delctable, savory paquetitos (manchego and artichoke mixture wrapped with JAMON), a  BOWL OF HOT, GLISTENING CHORIZO, and a handsome smiling man...I become THE BIGGEST SLUT IN THE WORLD. What's that touching your crotch? Oh, nothing. JUST MY HANDS.   JK JK JK   But really, I had a lovely time here. A lovely time that was made even lovelier with my smartly dressed hunk of a boyfriend.  The staff got a nice, fat tip, because they were positively PLEASANT, despite the madness of a busy lunchtime crowd.   A few negatives:   - I like chairs with backs, I found the stool situation to be a little uncomfortable - the space is TOOO small! Yes, it's intimate, but I shouldn't have to be grinding with strangers as I wait for seating!

MmGrvPdQVjHWrPDj61o_Yw.text: Had lunch here. Got the lobster gazpacho and oxtail over mashed potato. The lobster gazpacho was ok--as expected. Nothing great. The oxtail over mashed potatoes was lukewarm and not very good at all. Was disappointed with the meal. Not sure how this place gets 4 stars. Short order cooking with food tasting like it was prepared days ago and not even properly warmed up. Pretty bad.

JNE30g94wzPY-nB0LGcOxA.text: Food was decent. Service was super fast and friendly. The menu had great selections on it. Downside? Though everything we tried was good it was simply lacking the "wow" experience that I have had at other tapas places. When I walked away from here I remembered an enjoyable meal whereas when I walked away from other tapas places I remembered specific dishes that I would look forward to having again.

xKaLNUmy2I-MrYPnDPBIXQ.text: On my recent trip to Vegas, I brought my husband to Julian Serrano for their happy hour. The happy hour runs Sunday - Thursday from 4-5:30 pm. Yes it's a bit early, but completely worth it. We went on Sunday and got there slightly after 4 pm. The restaurant was pretty empty, so it was no problem getting two seats at the bar.  We enjoyed the white sangria for $4.50 per glass (red and sparkling sangria will run you $5) as well as a ton of food that cost between $3.50 - $7.00. We enjoyed the spanish tortilla, brava potatoes, pan tomate, fried calamari, and the stuffed dates from the happy hour menu. We also ordered the scallops from the regular menu. Just like my last visit to Julian Serrano, our scallops were cooked to absolute perfection and melted in my mouth. It was truly the highlight of our meal. Everything else was good, although none of it was better than what I have had at other tapas restaurants.  If you don't want to blow your wallet on eating and drinking, I highly recommend checking out this happy hour!

oRnpMRoWYvP4VU-hd207cw.text: I do not understand the high rating of this restaurant. I came here last year during Thanksgiving. I ordered two paella, one with noodle. It was horrible especially the one with ramen. I do not know how to describe it even a cheap crispy ramen taste better than that. The server was just ok and his recommendation was very bad since we did not like any of his recommended dishes. I can't recall all the dishes but the price is very high and the food quality is pretty low. I am very surprised by the 4-star rating giving the price of this place.  Edited: I saw a couple review talking about great prices. Give me a break! Check the menu price. We went to a Korean BBQ place with high rating the next day. We spent about 2 tapas amount to have a good meal for 5 of us. My sons love the BBQ place and laughed at me wasting my money here.

Uo9Ja571S8ewEC8kXDU1sg.text: Went there with 2 other people for lunch. Chose a variety of dishes and each one of them was wonderful. Lovely setting with a friendly and helpful staff. Our waiter recommended some dishes and none disappointed. Even got a couple of dessert items. A bit pricey, but this was expected. Would definitely come again.

AmSrB0zrvs_IcaHZ5tXJbg.text: Love the food and the service! Stephan our server really took care of us. If u love tapas then u have to check out this place. Definitely gastronomic !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate molten cake and raspberry sorbet
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pixto de lomo

AA3okpMyPGO_-DqcRGecwA.text: The food was delicious! Our Server Cristela was so wonderful. She recommended the dates and yellowtail and both were amazing. We will definitely be back.

vyeGfTQv9jcKyc_oNyHSqg.text: I am a huge tapas fan.  So of course, I had to take Mom here for her ongoing birthday weekend celebration.  Everything here was perfect -- the decor, the service, and of course, the food!  First of all, the decor is very classy -- fancy yet inviting.  Secondly, the service was excellent.  Our waiter was very attentive and patient, answering all of my questions and letting us take our time ordering without rushing us at all.  And at the end he even surprised my mom with a birthday dessert!  And finally, the food! Yes, the food... Every dish we ordered tasted so good. Every dish was so pretty, so delicate, and tasted so yummy.  Here's what we ordered:  --Tuna-raspberry skewer: almost too pretty to eat!  But each bite is burst with flavor! --Stuffed dates: sooo good.  Just the right mix of sweetness and savoriness. And the cheese was blended perfectly with the dates along with the crispy texture of pancetta... Wow, one of the best I've had! --White ceviche: Wow, the ceviche comes with taro chips!  TARO chips! That was a every pleasant surprise! I love taros!  The fish was fresh and light with just the right amount of tartness.. --Fried calamari: Very crispy but with the perfect amount of batter.  Tasted so light yet so flavorful. --Pan tomate: Simple dish yet nice blend of toasted bread with tomato sauce and garlic season.. yum! --Red sangria: One of the best I've had, although I am not much of a drinker :P  --And the complementary birthday dessert! Santiago's Cake:  The subtle nutty flavor of the almond cake and turron ice cream -- OMG sooo good!  And we thought we had no room for dessert! It was too good not to finish... :)  Like I said, it was a perfect meal! I would definitely come here again the next time I am in Vegas!

ZBmV8pAqNm519laGiAnHpg.text: The restaurant noise level is way too loud. We were a party of 5 and I couldn't hear my friends who sat across from me. The drinks were really good, but the food was average. Nothing special.

crk1QAqxWYIvjS6O-IZJcQ.text: Amazing Spanish cuisine with a huge variety of tapas.  My absolute favorite is a paella.  Totally worth it and a great value.

yNIfKfy6qqMjC1AVM7sLbw.text: I have to admit that I was pretty drunk while visiting. I can't say much about the place since I don't remember a lot but the one thing that I do remember is the incredibly small tapas. Yes, they're tapas and I understand that but when it comes to lamb chops -- it was a chop .. Some of the dishes were just poorly sized when held against their prices. I feel like it could have been more for the price.

xPZeh9Pd5HritBQWsPPMog.text: Restaurant is gorgeous, service was excellent, but the food left something to be desired. Each dish we ordered seemed to be lacking a certain component. I'll stick to Jaleo as my go to tapas place in Vegas.

czkYcI7oRCXfJQXx-nHPug.text: VERY overpriced but yummy!!!! I guess this is what I can expect in Vegas. I tried about 8 different tapas and I absolutely loved the ceviche with taro chips.  Just that will complete your night!

eByUI58QptQUw0Je94l_9A.text: Not too shabby. Went for lunch, but we were in a hurry so after a quick scan of the vegetarian offerings, which unfortunately had a lot of cheese and dairy, settled into our seats and had to improvise. I was without Lactaid.  Not sure if it was us that gave the impression that we were in an awful hurry to leave, but the waitstaff did make us feel rushed as we ordered and then proceeded to wait and wait for our order to arrive. It obviously didnt help that we asked to modify our dishes to exclude cheese and dairy, but the end result was more palateable and darn it, after a few experiences so far in vegas with subpar cuisine, see my other reviews to compare, we were not going to put up with much in the way of waiting and to be fair, thus the four stars, i know we were antsy.  I think most people will enjoy the regular offerings, and the location is great as was the atmosphere. Will dine again when less rushed.

OrwXwSurUqMrVof8VCqB2Q.text: Great service and wonderful food.  Each dish had a unique flavor and fantastic presentation.  The service was impeccable

614hqCBpzo4UE6crdWqSXw.text: Really cute place! We absolutely LOVED the fresh sangria. There are three different choices, each flavor better than the next. We were just stopping by for a snack since we had dinner reservations later in the evening, but were luckily able to try the black rice and stuffed peppers. Both were amazing. The black rice was better than any tapa we could even find in Spain, a must try for sure!! The staff was soo nice and helpful. We will definitely be back!

8U54WUNAISjsV2o-43VZdQ.text: Ohhh, Julian Serrano, how we love thee! My family and I had never been too partial to tapas, but Mr. Serrano has forever ingrained his delectable recipes into our "Vegas Hall of Fame." But, really. JS is one of our favorite lunch options in Vegas and for good reason! We have been here twice and both times have cemented themselves into my mind, directly wiring themselves in my brain to the drooling mechanism.... Okay, enough with the gushing, let's get down to business:   Ambiance/Appearance:  This is one heck of a dazzling restaurant inside of Aria. JS is delightfully colorful and has a welcoming yet upscale ambiance mood in the air. The hostess/seating staff is friendly and we've never had to wait to be seated, even on a weekend. The seating is comfy and, if in view of the bar area, you can catch up on your favorite sporting game/ESPN. I usually don't mention bathrooms in my reviews..but they have nifty Spanish lessons on the speakers while you do your business.  ...Soooo multicultural.   Service: Service has always been 4.5 stars. Only complaint is that water refills can be a bit delayed..and I drink a lot of water. No worries, though! This minor drawback is overshadowed by the knowledgeable waitstaff and accommodating manager (later on).   FOOOOOD:  Julian Serrano has such a wide array of Spanish tapas, it can almost be a bit daunting when you first open the menu. The prices are extremely reasonable for Las Vegas, no less for such a fabulous restaurant. We have had our fair share of tapas, and I seem to remember the following (** designating favorites):   **--Ahi Tuna Tempura: Fresh Ahi with just the slightest tempura crusting..not this thick coating that other places are enamored with that overpowers the tuna flavor. I want to say there are approximately 3 or 4 decently sized pieces. Great for a table of four!   --Bunuelos de Bacalao: Essentially fried cod, but this fried cod was pretty tasty. It came with a nice potato puree that complimented the Atlantic cod quite nicely. If I had to pick between this and the tuna, though, I pick the Ahi Tuna every time.   --Papas Bravas: Good potatoes, but I actually found this dish very boring. I wouldn't order it again.   --Huevos Estrellados: Uses the above potatoes, but has Spanish chorizo and fried, runny egg mixed throughout to create an interesting, homogeneous mixture of egg, salty chorizo, and the potatoes. My dad LOVES this dish, but I found it semi-average, mostly because I don't like runny eggs! If you're a fan of that, then this dish is right up your alley.   **--Stuffed Piquillo Peppers: OMG. I don't like pulling out the "OMG" card very often...but... OMG. These are so amazing. Maybe because I'm such a sucker for good goat cheese...and this has excellent goat cheese stuffed within the sliced peppers. I had never had a piquillo pepper before, and I'm kicking myself for wasting so many years not stuffing my face with these lovely red peppers. So delicious!   **--Creamy Risotto: Consisting of wild mushrooms and aged manchego, mmmm. My mom orders this each time and I make sure to get my fair share. The manchego makes this item as good as it is.   --Chicken Croquetas: Fried in the same way as a lightly breaded cheese stick (the only analogy I can think of). The base inside is a creamy Bechamel sauce. I can't remember too much about these otherwise. Still good! Give these a shot.   **--Beef & Cheese: GETTT THISSSS. This may sound like the most unappetizing, boring name for a dish EVER; however, this is perhaps my favorite item we get each time. This was some of the most tender steak I've had in my years (and I've eaten at my fair share of steakhouses-- take a look at my review for SW Steakhouse at Wynn for my feelings about that!).   --Pintxo de Chorizos: The pork was too tough for our liking...maybe we just caught them on a bad day. Skip this one unless you're a huge fan of marinated pork chorizo. We let our waiter know that we weren't big fans of this, and he took it away, and the manager came over and took it off the bill and apologized profusely. No worries, Neil Patrick Harris twin! (Seriously. This guy is a carbon copy of NPH).   DESSERTS: (~View my picture uploads for a peek at these desserts)  **--Churros: Served with a spicy chocolate sauce. Delicious churros. Being from the Southwest, I was a bit skeptical to try these...but my family loves Julian's take on churros! Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside. Give these teardrop-shaped, fried pastries a try.   --Flan: Creamy and over too liquid-y like some can be. Had a delicious fruit ensemble atop the flan with most berries.   --Bunuelos: Pretty much like beignet donuts. We also enjoy these. Served with a butterscotch type of sauce...mm. I still prefer the churros, though!   TIP: This place can get packed on weekend dinners. Call during the day for reservations.   Bottom line: I can't wait to go back to get my tapas fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanish Churros (spicy hot chocolate); Buñuelos (butterscotch caramel); Flan (frutas de bosque).

iQkA6gYlSUgumeYvZXgOXQ.text: Came here on a Wednesday night and it was pretty packed but we got a table immediately. We ordered a variety of dishes and we asked for recommendations first. Our food came out real quick but the table next to us, who got there before us, wasn't having such good luck.   Cod on asparagus- bland  Bone marrow-delicious, tender  Beef and cheese- beef was a little chewy, I didn't like the taste of the beef and cheese together, tasted alittle gamey  Duck confit- the duck and sweet potatoes complimented each other quite well  Salmon truffle -the salmon in the truffle sauce was delicious  I would definitely come back and try different dishes, they have alot of options on their menu.

ozQxksLMLczCbs45NDTq2g.text: Awesome experience! Feeling like back in Barcelona! Recommend the Spanish jamon, the paella! Delicious and artistic food.

The second reorder I got was just ok, I ordered fish which seemed fresh however did not measure up to a $30 price tag. My friend ordered ribs, which were awful. Service was average, one of the drinks ordered didn't come out, the dessert should have been comped.

RMe_vsopdHzPGZgqHai9yg.text: Had high expectations. Dinner food was mediocre. Had cured hamachi, salmon tartare, crab salad (good), home style potatoes (good) and shrimp in some excellent sauce. Good place if you are not too hungry, since they serve small dishes.

MdSARLZtChYcLZPBvEhF0Q.text: Very expensive but I do believe that you get what you pay for so this restaurant certainly did a good job on the quality of the dishes and service. We came late on a monday night and the restaurant is about 3/4 full, waited about 5 minutes for a table. we ordered the following:  Tuna Cones: ahi tuna filled inside won ton, very very good!   white ceviche: white fish, goes great with the chips  pan tomate: toasted bread with fresh garlic tomato sauce very good!  traditional spanish chicken croquetas |  grilled angus flat iron steak   grilled lamb chop  lobster saffron  marinera PAELLAS, the best I ever had outside spain! they say the portion is for 2 ppl but I think it is more than enough for 4 ppl!  Overall a great dinning experience here and will come back when I win big at the casinos!

4AubOJAMywfqd2o8rvgnqQ.text: We came for dinner for a birthday. They were very accommodating when some guests could not make the party. Sangria was delicious but expensive and serves about 5-6 glasses. Paellas take 45-60 minutes to prepare but are well worth the wait and price. Highlight dishes of the night include suckling pig, creamy risotto, rib eye cap on pretzel bread, and black rice. Somewhat expensive experience, but well worth it.

ykek0n7DwbnYcWQIuoYDhg.text: I would give 4-stars if judged on the food alone, but unfortunately this review must end on a sour note.   I usually do not give many negative reviews and I've come to expect great things from most Las Vegas restaurant experiences. Our experience at Julian Serrano fell a bit short.  When we arrived for a Saturday night for an 8 pm reservation for 2, we were promptly seated in the back among other 2-person tables. The restaurant was energized, and full of big groups, which made it pretty loud inside. I was seated across from my husband and we had to shout a lot to hear each other...not a big deal, but a little awkward.   We didn't receive our drink menus right away, which made it difficult when we were asked by one of the waiters what we would like to drink. I asked for the drink menu and was told it was coming (in a slightly rude manner). Luckily, we were able to order some delicious cocktails and they came quickly. Our waiter made an appearance and right away I was not impressed with the service...he barely even made it known that he was our server for the night and was bent down near my husband's ear trying to pick out some things that we should try on the menu. I felt an odd disconnect... My husband asked how ordering usually works (since it's a tapas place), and the waiter said that we could order everything at once, and he "would take care of it." We ordered a few fish items, a cheese plate, the Spanish tortilla, chicken croquettes, the beef short rib plate, and a few veggies.   Here's where things got annoying. The Spanish tortilla was brought out first. It was tasty but slightly cold (not sure if that's traditionally how it's served?). Before we could even dig into the tortilla dish the waiters brought out the beef short rib. That was a WTF moment to me. Within minutes of receiving the beef dish they brought us the warm monkfish dish and the cheese plate. Our tiny table was filled with foods all getting cold because we hadn't even made a dent in the tortilla. We weren't even half way through our cocktails and half of our meal was in front of us. We had to tell them to slow down (luckily they did). I felt like I was at an Applebees.    If I were in a hurry, this would be good. But at 8 pm on a Saturday night in Vegas, we were not in a hurry. We like to slow down and enjoy our meal. I was irritated by the order of the dishes that were brought out as well as with the pace. Who wants beef short ribs as the second dish?? Typically you would want salads, fish, vegetable dishes brought first. They didn't even see if we wanted a bottle of wine to pair with the bigger meat dishes. I found the order of everything all very strange and felt rushed.   On the plus side, the food was all very good. Everything was beautifully presented and cooked well. We LOVED the cheese plate. It ended up being glorious to eat cheeses between small plates (while our beef and fish dishes got cold, haha). I would go there again for the cheese alone!   So maybe it was just a bad night...I never thought I would complain about too fast of service, but I am. There are times where it's appropriate to rush through dinner (like before a show, etc), but there are other times where you want to relax and enjoy good food and conversation. Unfortunately, this was not the place for that experience. I guess I just expected more for the price. We got an Applebees experience for great food worthy of better service.

8BO5QiQGTqexCKJXfVuV0Q.text: This restaurant is what got my family into Spanish tapas (I had my introduction a bit earlier) and consider this their favorite restaurant so far. After my 2nd visit there, I can say this is a place I can take someone to without getting an urge to overstuff myself to get my money's worth. A bit pricier than other tapas places I've been, but hey, it's Vegas; nothing comes cheap.  The restaurant looks kinda like a transparent enclave of the Aria, which can make this spot a perfect place to people-watch as you eat, if you get a good spot. We had a wonderful waiter who made suggestions that were spot-on and made sure that we had a good dining experience. I got to try both the red and white sangria before I picked a glass of red as my drink. A good sangria has a taste of spiked punch that doesn't taste like it has been spiked. The dash of cinnamon was the perfect touch. Mom had one too, but started feeling lightheaded halfway and asked me to finish it. At one point she forgot what room we were staying in.  Here were the tapas we had that day. We tried to go for a balance between meat and vegetables. At the end of it, our party of 3 felt quite satiated without feeling stuffed.  Ahi Tuna Tartare - the tuna was a bit tough, but went well with the wasabi foam. Suprisingly, the avocado and mango ensaladilla was tasty by itself. Avocado Cannelloni - SOFT salmon mixed with mayo and paired with this bread. Yum. Brava Potatoes - spicy potato and alioli sauce. One of the most popular tapas according to the waiter. This is an example of a GOOD mix of alioli and brava sauce WITHOUT the excess grease that goes in frying the potatoes in said sauces. They were bite-sized that makes it easy to just gorge on the bowl.  Stuffed Piquillo Peppers - got as part of the waiter's suggestion. The goat cheese just melted in your mouth and the pepper had a good spicy "bite". Fried Calamari - a little bit too salty, but still crispy. Liked it with the alioli sauce Grilled Lamb Chop - at least this was a better rendition of a lamb chop than a certain buffet we went the other day...  The meal ended with Molten Chocolate Cake. The cake, though small, contained quite a bit of molten chocolate with just enough amount of cake. Paired with the blood orange ice cream, it was like a chocolate orange explosion in my mouth. One of the best renditions I've had in a while, especially since molten chocolate cake is one of my favorite type of desserts.   I thought I would pass up this restaurant as it was too "Vegas-y" and not enough Spanish, but the food was just too good this time. There's already Paris in Vegas, I guess there's enough room for one more culture to be represented.

-glsu9jcHx0wXtnGMSB9dQ.text: An excellent well run tapas style Spanish restaurant. Our reservation was honored on time. The selection of wines by the glass, as well as both hot and cold tapas dishes were plentiful, varied, generous, and delicious. You will pay Vegas prices, but this is a class establishment that I would happily go to again.  The only negative is the noise level. The restaurant is basically contiguous with the sprawling Aria Hotel lobby. With all that glass, metal, and stone, the noise bounces everywhere. So, it's not ideal if you want a quiet romantic dinner.

bcLxESDuwFLrkO04QLeKDQ.text: Long story short - LOTS of choices of both tapas and large plates to suit any palate, really great friendly service, and good food, but for my preference needs to punch up the flavor, and paella that was a little disappointing. I'd go again (went twice this trip) for certain dishes... long story follows:  I actually ate at Julian Serrano twice on my last visit to Vegas in May. It was an easy choice to go to again because of the very, very large menu that meant I could have a completely different meal the second time around, as well as have my favorite dishes again. Obviously dining there twice means I'd recommend it. Definitely make reservations, though - especially on the weekend. There were TONS of large parties both nights I went - a Saturday and a Monday.  This is a packed house, loud, high-energy restaurant that offers a selection of tapas, regular entrees, and family-sized platters to suit absolutely any taste. There is hot seafood, cold seafood, egg tapas, pork, beef, bread tapas, vegetarian tapas, multiple paellas, family sized pigs on a platter... This is truly a restaurant where the biggest issue is deciding, but having small plates makes this so much easier to do.  My personal favorite was the tuna cones - I had them both nights. The stuffed dates are also incredible. I'd wanted them both nights, but the first time, our paella came sooner than expected and I didn't get to order the dates. I'd eat them every day. My only beef is that our waiter the second night made a show of saying how since there were only 3 cones on the plate (and we were two people), he'd bring an extra, only for me to find out when the bill came that I was charged $5 for it. I'm not complaining about the cost, just the fact that it came across as a good deed but was an upsell.  Speaking of the paella...unfortunately this was my low point. I expected something amazing from a Spanish chef. There was zero socarret on the bottom of the pan (MAJOR disappointment), and the lobster tail in the center wasn't cleaned. I was also expecting the chorizo to be more of a softer, spicier sausage-style instead of firm slices, but maybe that's because I'm used to the Mexican kind. The second time around, I didn't bother with the paella. My only other letdown was what was supposed to be Julian Serrano's favorite - the Huevos Estrellados. They were really bland. When I mentioned to a floor manager that I'd have used some Tabasco on them, he said they had some available I could ask for next time.   The service was really great both nights. The floor managers really work hard here, even cleaning tables, and the servers are all super friendly. This service staff REALLY hustles.

wxkrUsvh8gy0cawsVdqZBw.text: D-Lish-us!! With my friend, Beth we had: Lamb chop Seared scallops Ceviche (my favorite!) Stuffed piqullo Gambas Cheese platter  Stuffed dates Spicy bomba  Next time we're for sure getting the paella!!  The service is top-notch. Highly recommend!!

TTSpCyzFxX0dnxPiHvY_Ew.text: I'm not a tapas fanatic (didn't care for them much in Spain either) but I found this to be the best tapas I've had to date. Trendy business clientele matches bar or table seating, excellent quick service, and no wait to be seated (Tues evening). The restaurant, though, was packed.  The place is expensive IMO for tapas (~8-14$ per plate) but for Vegas, not unreasonable.  We ordered for 2 people: Pork chop: excellent, would order again Grilled eggplant with onion and red pepper: savory and goes well with baguette; we ordered extra bread bc the one slice wasn't enough Grilled peppers: simply seasoned w/ salt and olive oil; light Mixed seafood ceviche: refreshing, goes well with the red onion slices, corn, and fruit Tuna tartar: Asian inspired; pass Wild mushroom soup with foie gras cream: as expected; pass   Beautiful presentation, and decently filling (but not heavy) food. Overall quality was good, simple, but not memorable.   The last star in my review is expressly for our waiter-- he was EXCELLENT. Never had to look for him, he was always 2 steps ahead of us, quick, efficient, & pleasant to talk to.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mixed seafood ceviche

9moTQ0EqhZkrTpp6RJIxhg.text: Best tapas I've had, hands down. The restaurant is in the middle of the Aria lobby and looks like it's built out of giant sugar sculptures. I liked it! It was very flashy (but appropriate for Vegas).  The waiter was great at suggesting what to order (Patatas bravas is of note. My boyfriend's father was doubtful; "It's just potatoes, what's the big deal?" It was a big deal). We chatted and took his advice, which turned out to be excellent. Drinks here are also GREAT (pricey, but great)--you can browse it on their very cool iPad app. My boyfriend's mother and I each had one, and we both loved our drinks.  As for the food...I'm not sure you can go wrong. As mentioned previously, the patatas bravas was great. We had a bunch of meat dishes (the chorizo on a stick was cute and tasty!), but oddly enough, the standout dish was the poached salmon. It had to be the best dish of the night, and probably the best salmon I've ever had. I had to question myself for a second because we were, after all, in the middle of a desert.  Probably the weakest part of the meal was the desserts. While they were still good (churros in a spicy chocolate sauce that we were practically drinking out of the cup, flan), a round of drinks might have been a nicer ending. At this point, however, I'm grasping at straws.  Julian Serrano was the best meal we had during our entire stay at Vegas, and we ate at quite a few notable restaurants. It was also (unfortunately for us) the first meal we had after our flight and set the standard for the rest of our stay. I highly recommend!

oLHbJabVXYZaTBlrViHbrA.text: Not great. Lobster gazpacho didn't impress, I understand this is tapas but lacking in substance, namely the lobster. Chill some Campbell soup and throw some tiny croutons in it and viola. I agree with the other reviewers, the baby back ribs were less than impressive. Three bones two sections of meat, unimpressed by the soy based glaze. Too much cilantro!!! (Ribs shouldn't have cilantro anywhere near them IMHO.) Ended the meal with a bread tapas which I can't remember the name as I was still a bit hungry.. Cold spongy olive bread on a stick. Wouldn't do it again and would second guess tapas as a style of dining completely. (Not to mention DO NOT bring your kids here, they will never forgive you!) Hope this review helps!!

XCCezStfcWyg42v2pJeqTg.text: Great place great food ....will come back next week to have more great tapas .....love the food here always great service and fresh food ...been here for the 10th time always better....

hJvzPKRaOdZBEB7x-jjLlA.text: My wife and I stopped in for an early dinner/snack at around 6:30 and were seated immediately. We shared three items: the coca vegetarian, the tender & crab, and the seared scallop skewer and had drinks. Everything was very delicious. The texture and flavor combinations were unreal. We were treated to one of their desserts (pictured, but I don't have the name). It was light and tasted amazing.  Our server "Ernest M" was fantastic, and he is the reason I chose to write this one restaurant review during our time in Las Vegas. He was treating us like VIPs, and had an unforgettably great personality. He truly wanted us to have a memorable experience and nailed it. We will certainly return to Julian Serrano's.

GxjbtDeoRNMYfKK6nAulIg.text: Worst service I've had in a long time and by far the worst on the strip. Ordered some Albarino and small plates to start.   Server seemed pissed, not sure why? we were gonna drop some money on paella and other small plates but not after he acted like an entitled prick and threw our menus in the bin and was clearly talking about our table while staring at us speaking intently to the busser.   Also they dropped the gezbacho and asparagus within 5 min of ordering it and then we waited 30 min for the stuffed peppers, I understand the stuffed pequillo peppers take a while but my god where was the server in that 25 min so we could've put the rest of our order in?!? Only reason I am giving two stars is the apologetic manager.

7SZK8ZyFzRBqWSrl_ghlig.text: 5-stars for the food.  3-stars for the service.  We love paella! We go to San Diego's Paella Festival every year and always get paella if it is on the menu. The Mixta Paella was absolutely delish! We were able to finish it between the two of us. It was the perfect flavor with the perfect balance of rice and seafood.  The tapas were a-ok and I think I would be back just for the paella and possibly try different tapas.  The sangria was not very good but I think that's just my personal opinion.  The service was odd and our server ignored us and was more focused on other tables. I felt slightly discriminated against actually.  However bad the service, the food was really good so we are going to come back next time for paella!

5JNKcmys7VJwvaYw3a-4XQ.text: Probably our favourite meal in vegas, it is unlike anything we eat in Vancouver. This opened our eyes to Spanish tapas and we loved every single bite. It was expensive and each tapas was order by the piece but each flavour and ingredient combination was carefully thought out making for an extremely delicious meal. I especially loved the paella, the tapas i don't really remember but overall, AMAZING.

6hyMG586KZGHf4CjNT34-Q.text: Came here on a New Year's Eve reservation, so I'm unsure if portion/pricing was the same as during standard times.  First off, lively, upscale atmosphere. We were greeted by live music and dancing that can even be seen from inside the Aria lobby through the open-view restaurant. Service was quick and super friendly!  Now getting onto the food, every single dish I ordered was exceptional. There was a similar style of flavors coming through with each dish that complimented each other as each plate was delivered:  - Octopus a la Gallega Melts in your mouth! Super flavorful and a little kick of spice. Probably my favorite out of the four dishes, with potatoes as a great compliment.  - Seared Scallop Skewer Scallops cooked perfectly and seasoned nicely. The apricots(?) on the skewer threw me off a little though.  - Grilled New York Not the most tender, but flavor was there. Not trying to throw the steak under the bus (it was still good!), but the potato puree was the best part of this dish in my opinion.  - Lobster (forgot the actual name of the dish) Came with noodles and had an unexpected flavor, but not bad! Unlike any kind of noodles I've had before.  I ordered 4 tapas to be shared between me & my sister, but a 5th would have been better to fill us up completely (couldn't tell if we actually had a little more room in our stomachs or if the food was just that good)!

T3uJD4enlIoDBIJc9zRr3A.text: What a delightful and delicious dinner.  My favorite was the hot lobster dish and premium cheese plate!  My husband was over the moon for the Cuban sandwich and the gambas (which was too garlicky for me).  The service was exceptional and the restaurant was beautiful!

ZBtJnAOrkqlTcO7LRcCOaw.text: This beautiful restaurant has been our go to for holiday get togethers, business dinners and birthday celebrations for close to 10 years now! We live small plates and having many options so this place is our favorite. The food is always delicious, service is always wonderful and atmosphere is enjoyable. Yes it is pricey but you get what you pay for and the quality of dishes served is beyond amazing.

V8kuBMshK20KyjQDl9Ieag.text: We came with decent expectations and we largely disappointed. We love tapas and been to many places but this one is not up to par in term of food.  The decor is very nice and comfortable seats. Service is better than most place but I want blown away.  Price is pricy but we expected it. We ordered the following:  Serrano tenderloin - this is the best dish of the night. The fois gras was good but the tenderloin is over cooked. Our waiter never asked me how I like it cook I guess it is predetermined. The beef is kind of dry so I guess they cooked it well done. The flavors of the dish are light and not overwhelming, which is the best part. 4/5  Lamb chop - very, very, strong scent of lamb and lack of flavor. Lamb is cooked medium to well done, again the waiter never ask us how we like it cook. get one piece. 2/5  Seafood ZARZUELA - no flavors! So bland. Don't order it! 0.5/5  Brava- it was the most recommended dish on yelp but I was so so disappointed. The only thing that save this dish is the sauce. The potatoes are still a little undercooked and salty. I dipped the seafood zarzuela with this sauce. 2/5  Gambas - my husband would order this at every tapas place but the one we got was highly disappointed. He took a bit and said it is a 1/5. No flavors! Shrimp are overcooked and chewy.   We usually ordered one round of food first to see if we like it or not. Since we didn't, we just stop there and went to Cosmo for pizza to finish our dinner. We went to firefly for tapas and thought it was alot better than here.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gambas 1/5 what a disappointment
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bravas, the sauce is very good but the potatoes leave now to desire 2.5/5

bi6WZVzSxhYHfeUeuFuX2g.text: Came for brunch, and it was amazing! The food was so good. Got 3 tapas plates each, the standouts were the yellowtail tiradito and the iberico ribs. The bottomless drinks were great, didn't have to stick to just one kind. My favorites were the blue sangria (with lemon and blueberries) and the passion fruit habanero mimosa. Will come here again next Vegas trip!

S38SyNDIK2wUsrbUOZFIqw.text: Wow! So beautiful, friendly service, and delicious tapas!!  The menu is separated by different tapas category, such as hot, cold, meats, and vegetarian.  We tried the grilled rib eye steak, bang-bang shrimp, sauteed gambas, and pork taco. These and a $5 lunch hour white Sangria special, it came to $50 with tip.  But totally worth it!  The grilled rib eye steak were so succulent, they sat atop of pureed potatoes and was glazed with a mushroom demi.   The bang-bang shrimp was really fun to eat, they were fried and battered, fiery shrimp on two tine heads of iceberg sections, drizzled with rosemary ranch sauce. These packed a bit of heat, which was a nice surprise.  You can get the gambas fried or sauteed. Our server recommended the sauteed and she was right. Three perfectly cooked jumbo shrimp were served in a ceramic flan dish, and swimming in brava garlic sauce, it reminded me a little bit of creole shrimp.   The pork taco is indeed singular. But being glass half-full, it just made you slow down to appreciate each bite of this gorgeous, dressed up simple street food. Served on a white flour tortilla, generous strips of glazed, marinated pork belly danced with pineapple pico de gallo and avocado chunks.  The white Sangria was was amazing, refreshing, and beautifully garnished with fresh fruits.  This might sound weird, but go check out their bathrooms, they are covered floor to wall in beautiful, mini iridescent tiles. Only in Vegas! So pretty!

bfKeLRj7wbqj4Yc9U8C64g.text: I have been to this restaurant several times since 2012. This restaurant was actually where I had my my first ever Spanish tapas experience and I absolutely fell in love.   Unfortunately I am giving 3 stars because the quality and dining experience has diminished over the years. My last 3 visits have been disappointing every single time. The service all around simply sucks and the food is no longer special. It's bland and just ok now when it used to be flavorful and left me wanting more.   I dragged my husband again today and I ordered the lunch special, which was 3 plates for $29 (and +$6 for dessert), and he ordered the chicken skewers. The lunch special is a great deal, but the food itself was less than spectacular. We did not finish a single dish. The croquetas were good but very oily, the gambas was bland, the chicken was a little over cooked. The black rice with seafood was definitely my favorite but again was nothing spectacular.  This place used to be phenomenal, but something has changed. Thought it was an off day at first but after several visits with similar dining experiences, it seems that is not the case. Not sure if I'll be back again, sadly.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special - Traditional Spanish Chicken Croquetas, Gambas, Black Rice

TkotVtq_ETsfFoH3wwf6WQ.text: Well, well, well. I'll admit - I was skeptical when my friends said they wanted to go to a Tapas place in LV. From my experience, I worried that it would be another very overpriced and underwhelming experience, like several of the other big name places that are but mediocre facsimiles of their namesake restaurants from elsewhere.  Happy to report that this was a solid night. We had a very nice sommelier, who made some great suggestions for our bottles of wine, and our server was super efficient and friendly. We certainly ate well - bread service (why do they charge for bread service?), gambas al ajillo, papas bravas, croquetas de pollo, jamon Iberico de bellota, short ribs, ox tail, grilled octopus, toasted bread with tomato and manchego, and churros were what we went for. The only one that disappointed were the gambas, since they really were just shrimp in a pier-piri style sauce, not the traditional dish that I know and love. They weren't bad, but they were a little bland and I guess I was disappointed because True gambas al ajillo remind me of my Spanish grandfather, so there is a lot of "emocion" embedded in that dish for me. I would have also LOVED to see boquerones on the menu, but they didn't have them...  The ambience was nice, with a busy, but not very loud or crowded vibe, and we felt that the value was good for splitting the above dishes amongst 3 guys along with 2 bottles of Rioja to boot. Definitely was a fun evening, and also a good value for Vegas. Would definitely return next time - although we would probably drop the gambas in favor for double orders of the ox tail and short rib, which were absolutely fabulous. I kind of wish we had tried the "paella negra," because it looked so good. iGracias por una noche buena con mis amigos!

u0O54hTSIb1asxncayq9yg.text: We said the last few times when we were in Vegas that we have to check out Julian Serrano. Well, at this most recent trip, I picked this spot for my birthday lunch and it did not disappoint. First of all, the ambiance is nice; it's a very open restaurant facing the lobby with gorgeous decor. The service was good the time we were there, our server came by after we were seated and checked in on us throughout our meal.  We wanted to try out several dishes here ... it is tapas style after all, so why not! The dishes we selected were three from the Julian Serrano Lunch - Chicken Croquetas, Pan Manchego, and Gambas, along with Padron Peppers & Gazpacho Andaluz. Each dish had its own unique flavor and everything was very tasty. My favorite dish was the Chicken Croquetas which were little creamy croquets, fried to a perfect golden brown.  The second course of the lunch was the only the one I was having a difficult time selecting, but I'm glad I went with the Pan Manchego. It was a light and refreshing with the fresh tomato sauce and went well with the manchego cheese. The Padron Peppers, my husband's selection were better than I expected and actually much larger than the other dishes. I would get them again if there were more people since the entire dish (as described) is only the peppers.  Overall, a fun delicious lunch! We will definitely be back in the future to try other options. As you can see in the pictures, they seem to be detailed with presentation as well, which I thought was a nice touch! Also, for convenient seating, you can make reservations online for the date/time you would like.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Tapas.

Jt6jBUhitzx6m1gX5s4P0w.text: Loved this beautiful and delicious restaurant! My bff has been bragging about this place for a while now and of course, i was excited about trying it.   She suggested we sit at the bar, and now i understand why. It's really a great spot and you get great service and have a full view of the place.   Of course we started with a bottle of Pinot and the rest is history. But definitely try the tortilla espanola and the shrimp! My mouth is watering as we speak.   Too many options to miss! So order it all!

84kLGCUPr2URATIWo6Ld8g.text: Hands down the best! My Husband and I Traveled to Vegas for our Anniversary this past month and I Made reservations here. My Reservation was for 6 PM and when we got there it was a little bit empty on that Monday. I was a little bit skeptical when I came in because you know that if a restaurant seems empty "It must not be good" right? Wellll to my surprise, as soon as we sat down it started getting full. Our Server's name was Pedro I believe and he was extremely knowledgeable of the Spanish Culture. I honestly felt like I was in Spain!  Food: We went with our servers advice since it was our first time here and started with the Pica Picas- which were  Pipparras ( I loved it except it was a little bit too salty, not spicy) Almonds (Best!) we also order a cheese plater and for a cheese lover like me it was like giving Ice scream to a Child!! Seriously great Cheese from different regions in Spain. Tapas - STUFFED DATEs are the best!! pintxo de chorizo very flavorfull Paella- We order the Mixta. It was the best option I would say. It lacked a little bit more lobster (2 pieces in ours) but It was still fantastic.  We also order the Sangria Pitcher  When we thought we had no room for desert our FANTASTIC Server surprised us with the Churros and a happy Anniversary note.  I really do hope I have the correct Names but Pedro and Mario were great!! our Bill came out to be around $250 which was worth it.

ESbV7ijYc_xy2ZB2SXjAuQ.text: My friends and I came across this restaurant while walking around Aria Hotel and decided to grab dinner here, but the kitchen was closed just a minute ago. We decided to come back the next day before leaving Vegas and dined here for lunch instead.  The eatery was pretty empty, so I'm guessing most people come here for dinner. The menu was different and more limited for lunch, so we all decided on the Julian Serrano lunch, which was $29. It says to choose an item from the three sections, but our server said that we can choose three dishes from any section.  I ended up getting the Cuban sandwich, albondigas, and gambas. Each item came out one at a time and portions were small. I was actually surprised that the food was filling though. I thought everything I tried was pretty tasty as well. Service was also very quick! I'll have to come back during dinner service to try their paella the next time I'm in Vegas.

2sN5dDufvR093MsFKnBpbw.text: Beyond surprised I am giving Julian Serrano 2 stars- but I have 100% experienced better. I had a few friends highly recommend this place and it just wasnt for me.   Came here for an early dinner to kick off my friends bday weekend.   Food:  Brava Potatoes-  I did not think this was spicy. It was slightly under done potatoes swimming in a tomato paste.  Deviled Eggs- Best part of the meal. I would literally probably come back just for these. order 3 orders it call it a day.  Yellowtail Tiradito- These were good.  octopus- Not a fan. We actually send back this item.  Carne Asada- ok this was fine. BUT beyond overcooked. we ordered medium/medium rare and it was beyond well done. My friend liked that but the first thing out of her mouth was " this tastes like Beef Medallions  from Maggianos" ( slightly disappointing that a top chef is putting out dishes similar to a chain restaurant)   The service was fine but slow, we seemed to have 2 waitresses and multiple people running our orders.   Honestly I was not a fan at all. I've had way better Tapas in Chicago.

TbAjD5Pwx2b3z6N5fJfr_g.text: It's ok. Overpriced with fairly average food.   We ordered the paella and a few tapas dishes. The paella wasn't cooked very well...the rice was over cooked. They did include a generous serving of seafood though.   None of the tapas dishes was really special. Everything was just kind of meh (especially the tuna cones). Just not very flavorful.   Sangria was $65 for a pitcher. Super weak with just a bunch of sugar.   Won't return

gcbNA2dPSqFVLZQB0NuM6A.text: Great place for Tapas. Must get the sangrias! We got the blueberry one which had light sweetness to it. We ordered two paella dishes and a few other items to share. Everything was pretty tasty. But the standout items were the oxtail. It had a sweet sauce on top that married the flavors together. Anther favorite was the octopus and fingerling potatoes. The octopus was nice and chewy. And has a hint of citrus to. The Pan di Cristal Manchego was my personal favorite. It was suggested to be paired with the Serrano ham. But I thought it was great by itself. The tomato sauce really lighten and refreshed the dish. And the cheese that went on top really made it pop in flavors. I couldn't stop adding more of that honey sauce.   The paella take about 50 mins to come out. And when they do it's worth the wait.   I would love to come back and try more!! Also it's a kid friendly restaurant. Provided a high chair for my baby. And is also in a less smokey environment. It's nice to have dinner without having to worry about that.

b_PyGUD_mL9ESzihnNxr2g.text: I feel like 4.5 stars but I can't select that :)  Do NOT skip this restaurant if you happen to stop by Aria. And I mean it! The restaurant itself is so cute, modern and colorful.  Now the food: 1. Yellowtail tiradito - good, but the shredded root the fish was rolled on overpowered the fish taste. Too much of it I guess. 2. Seabass - excellent on a bed of sote veggies 3. Asparagus a la plancha with Romanesco sauce- excellent  4. Peppers a la plancha- good but too oily  5. Pulpo a la gallega- good, not excellent 6. Paella negra that the ladies next to us offered to share as they ordered too much- excellent 7. For dessert we had Flan Coco - excellent  I would definitely come back here!

dgg49NB9YRoPilpUoZgzmA.text: We had an excellent dinner here on a recent December night. I must admit we have stayed at Vdara/Aria numerous times and just bypassed Julian Serrano Tapas opting for another dining option. That was a mistake. We had a delicious dinner with excellent service.   We started off with the tuna cones ($16). You get big eye tuna, cucumber, guac, ponzu & their own mayo rocoto. It was delicious. It's like spanish poke served in a crunchy wonton wrapper cone. Get it for sure. It only comes with 3 cones. 4 or 5 would have been perfect.  Next, we got octopus a la gallega ($21). You get grilled octopus served with fingerling potatoes and spanish paprika. This is a great hot seafood dish. I liked how tender the octopus was and how the potatoes paired with it was perfect. Very good tapas dish.  For vegetables we got asparagus a la plancha ($12). You get green asparagus grilled nicely, topped with crushed almonds and their romesco sauce. This was very good and a good change from the meat and seafood ordered.   Next we got the spanish chicken croquettes ($15). This was perfection. You get 4 chicken croquetas that are deliciously baked with a bechamel dipping sauce. Its so good. You must not forget to order this great dish. I will need 2 orders next time.  For pork we got the rabo de toro ($20) which was braised oxtail in red wine and iberian pork served on top of a potato puree. This was DEElicious. There was a slight crunch on the outside of it and just soft tenderness in the middle. It was exquisite. So good. You have to order this as well. Such a great dish.  Also ordered was a red sangria. For dessert, we were comped the torrija ($8) by our great server Janice B because we were celebrating a birthday. The dessert was delicious. It comes with salted caramel, vanilla bean ice cream and candied macadamias. It was very good. And it was nice of them to decorate the dish with a birthday message.   Overall, an excellent experience at Julian Serrano Tapas. We will for sure be having dinner there again. Everything including the service was great. Tapas were so good. It was a memorable birthday dinner for sure.

0M9ZOt7Oc4elvxZl_jfBGQ.text: Loved this spot in Vegas for Tapas! The Aria has many options - don't miss this one. Ask your server for specials and recommendations - they don't disappoint! We loved the White Ceviche, Seared Scallops and Paella!! Enjoy!!

eBaQAUnAJbGF-BfDy8GfLQ.text: After another looooong drive to Vegas, we landed at Julian Serrano Tapas once more!  This time I made a reservation through the very friendly Aria reservation service.  Wonderfully polite, and they even texted me the time as a reminder (sometimes necessary in Vegas!)  Last time it was packed on a Thursday night and they squeezed us in, but even though it was a Sunday night this time, it is a courtesy to call ahead.  We chose the same table we had before, as we found we liked the people watching aspect of sitting by the glass wall.  Tired from the trip, I managed to order the bacon wrapped dates and the lobster pasta, while Donald chose the carne asada with mashed potatoes.  A superb Margarita arrived instantly, and we began enjoying the lively ambience of Aria, tastefully decorated minimal style for Christmas.    The bacon wrapped dates were even more luscious than we remembered, and my lobster was larger and just as succulent.  Donald was happy with his beef, which was savory and tender, and the mashed potatoes were unctuous with flavor.  We ate every scrap of food, and were just enough filled up to leave room for desert.  We opted for desert this time, and chose the bread pudding, which came with a raft of whipped cream on top.  Maybe I am more used to looser, warm bread pudding, but this was not my favorite, and I might even order another small plate next time, instead of desert.  We ended on a high note, however, and are looking forward to our next stop here, maybe for their brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Pudding at Julian Serrano Tapas
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and pasta at Julian Serrano Tapas
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada at Julian Serrano Tapas

l7RUVLdldW5ZzpyxCQPLJw.text: We came with friends for a celebration. On arrival on Saturday night at 6 PM, the restaurant was very uncrowded. Rich, our server, was at our table immediately. As first timers, we had a bunch of questions. Rich was very friendly and very helpful. Jesus, our busboy, followed immediately with our water. Really outstanding service throughout the meal. We decided to share 3 tapas and a mixed paella for 4. We got the Lobster Fideua ($21). This consisted of the world's smallest lobster tail portion (yes, I know, it's tapas. So it's supposed to be a small portion) on top of paella pasta, roasted red pepper and pine nuts. We all got a very small taste of the lobster but what made this dish fabulous was the paella pasta. Wow was that good. Next came the crab portobello ($21). Again, the smallest taste of crab with some amazing portobello mushroom. Another terrific dish. Last, and least tapas for us was the carne asada (($21). Here the meat portion was generous, but very chewy, atop potato puree with a mushroom sauce. Not my favorite.  Finally, the paella made its appearance. Well worth waiting for. Presentation was beautiful (see the photo). The portion size was huge. Tons of shrimp and mussels with lots of chicken and sausage and calamari hidden in the saffron rice. Spectacular dish!!! Next time back, I will skip the tapas and go straight to the paella, it was that good. Only gripe - by the time we were finished, 3 large parties of about 20 each had come in. The noise level made conversation near impossible. Not sure the restaurant could do anything about that. Probably coming on a weekday would avoid the parties and the noise.
