rdWCgZZ8gexYhwmVWRJuIA.text: I would say is ok the food has small portion and the kind little bit salty I won't come back

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Its too creamy for me

NLyxgLAC1CZzJCZUEUoQuw.text: The food here is amazing! Had a team dinner during a conference week and we ordered a variety of dishes. Their menu is very extensive and the paella is excellent! Suggest ordering the paella as soon as you can since it takes a while to make. I will certainly go back next time I'm in Vegas.

b7iFB5RxF2cK4mtLkLDExA.text: This place was recommended to us by a friend who visits Las Vegas often. Boy, was she right! What a Beautiful restaurant inside Aria hotel. Tapas style with extensive menu and great choices for every taste. THE best mushroom soup we ever had (not creamy) with porcini mushrooms, a must try if you love mushrooms. Black rice dish with lobster, squid and calamari was pretty good as well. Tuna carpaccio was just ok, very nice presentation but we felt it wasn't the top quality tuna. But bunuelos desert was to die for! Similar to beignets but super light and filled with very light white chocolate whipped cream with a touch of liquor. Great service as well ! Try it if you happen to be in this hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom soup
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. To die for !!! Must try !!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

btVTnU-uMX9l09UeksKqog.text: Dinner was delicious and the service of Pedro was excellent.  One of the few service personnel at Aria with a good customer service attitude.  Thank you Pedro for making our evening special and memorable.

SA4Z94lnVHcMMIPHJ55QFg.text: Tapas is my favorite - I eat it everywhere I go. Having the benefit of dinner with a small but agreeable foodie group, we ate ALL. OF. IT. We had nearly every dish on the menu, as well as a giant pan of paella. Minus the food coma, we jokingly considered ordering the 9# suckling pig. Every single bite was unique, memorable, delicious fare - made with love and authenticity not found at many Vegas spots. I would eat the entire meal so many times over. Oh, and our waiter was kind and a pro expediter. Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the protein was divine and the rice...perfect.

4E6L5YC7LYdxqj2gE55FhA.text: In a sea of over priced and mediocre- Julian Serrano's was a bright star.  Very good tapas- best Chicken Croquettes ever.   Very good service- waiter, busser, and hostess staff.  Reasonable (by Strip standards) pricing.  Would definitely return and recommend.

36DpU8rHXNpeqLd9r_0Zjw.text: Food was delicious but not worth the severe food poisoning. Me and my boyfriend have been dying for almost 2 days now because we ate there. Never again!

AXwBSDyCXUlCWGvEUGL2YQ.text: No reservations, no problem. Waited 3 minutes and got a table.  This restaurant lived up to the reputation of Julian Serrano and we didn't even have to travel to Spain.  The squid-ink paella topped with basil leaves that we ordered to accompany our tapas was outstanding.   We had a host of tapas which were all good, some which I never had before: the croquettes, short ribs, sardines, and more. I love being surprised at the different preparations and tastes. Unfortunately, I was so eager to try some of the tapas that I forgot to take a picture.  We asked the waiter to pace our tapas so we wouldn't be overwhelmed. Besides, the small table wouldn't have been able to handle our orders. Although lacking the professionalism of what you'd expect from a restaurant as highly-touted as Serrano, she was friendly and accommodating.   We ordered an excellent bottle of wine from Spain to help down the tapas and two hours later, all in all, a really good dining experience.  The only negative is the noise. Oh my gosh, it was loud. All the hard surfaces and no dampening to speak of, made it difficult to hear the person across the table. 6 bells on a scale of 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquettes
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black paella

KJhQPpQctpG0viUaiWtxeA.text: Go here Go here Go here try the ox tail with a Cabernet. We never go to Vegas without stopping here. This place is terrific. The bites are great and the service is so friendly. Don't miss this place.

yJcb_dEPQP9yDbur-7aV-g.text: This was the best decision to come here for my birthday dinner in Las Vegas.. great atmosphere, portions were just right... the tomate bread, tuna cones, spicy shrimp, beef and cheese made up a perfect meal, we we're both very happy.. Pedro was fantstico, quite nice, and he brought me a special, delicious birthday dessert, yay! Again, perfect meal!!

uGRtLTd6cxnfZSfcEedJlQ.text: Wow! Was pleasantly surprised and blown away by this place. The medjool dates tapas were spectacular along with the albondigas soup, the sandwich with cheese, ham, mustard, melted into bread was tasty as well. Service was quick, ambience was very artistic and colorful, not too loud, comfortable chairs. I'd recommend eating at one of the tables in the center so that you can sit in the comfortable chairs.   Dessert. Well, they had orange blossom creme brulee which was recommended, but we went for the churros dipped in chocolate sauce! Go!

vJty4_vLXgVr087BFbgHqw.text: I love tapas.  I came here with my husband and two friends last weekend. Despite the fact that my husband and I always stay at Aria, this was somehow the first time we have had the pleasure of dining here. I am vegetarian (technically pescetarian, as I will eat fish sometimes, but generally no other seafoods) At first glance of this menu, I went crazy. I could eat nearly everything and it all sounded amazing.   I wanted to get all the breads, but my friend rightfully said that would be far too many carbs :) So we went with the olive bread focaccia and the tomato manchego. Both were delish, but I preferred the flavor of the tomato manchego. Simple, but the perfect bite.  The potato bravas was superb. Probably the best I've ever had. Definitely don't think like I almost did, that this dish is too simple/boring to get here.   On that note, DO NOT skimp out on the tortilla. It's the best I've ever had. So so tasty. The only negative is the amount of aoili on top of the bread that comes with the tortilla. I pay very close attention to the ingredients on the dishes I order, so I knew it was aoili and approached it as such. My dinner guests did not - they thought it was cheese, so they ate it all up and made some faces. Understandably so.  I had a few bites of some other dishes such as the Branzino and scallops skewer, both were good, but the others listed above were superb, totally worth the price tag.  The restaurant itself has a really nice set up and we had no trouble getting a reservation on a Saturday night. They sat us at these little 4 tops around the bar, very cute and nice set up. Servers we interacted with were nice. The wine list is great. I had the Temperanillo Reserve by the glass and it went well with everything else. I'll return here for sure.

gmo6wmbVjC2Zx9aQmoKZHQ.text: Such bad service!  And the food didn't make up for It! So many amazing places to eat in Vegas don't come here!

zQyoyIYAJZBQI6mj7_w2bg.text: Authentic Paella, almost as good as Barcelona.  The ingredients are top notch and they didn't skimp on the seafood.  Not overly salty as well, which is rare.  Prices were super reasonable for the quality and quantity of our food. Jason our server was amazing, super efficient and courteous. Definitely a place to try if you enjoy Spanish tapas and paella inside the Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6M_c0Ca0LK5Iq4wi8-Q1ug.text: Great flavor. Nice decor, good variety of cuisine. Expectational gourmet selection.  Very good service, great spot in the hotel.  I would recommend this place on a Friday night before a show or before hitting one of the clubs.  Come see the manager johnny V.  Hospitality pro.

UsNW3x2e4dkCGTgDtJScow.text: After checking into the Aria Hotel, my BF and I were hungry for a snack so we decided to check out Julian Serrano's. After overlooking the menu, we were excited to eat some Spanish tapas!  We sat at the bar and immediately ordered a pitcher of the red sangria!  The bartender was very helpful in recommending some dishes for us to try.   For those of you that have never been to a tapas restaurant, tapas are "small dishes" so you can order as many as you want so that you are not focused on eating one big main dish.   Here is what we ended up ordering:  Goat Cheese Salad ( I love goat cheese and I really liked the hint of mint that accompanied the salad)  Ahi Tuna Tempura ( The wasabi foam that they served was good, not over powering but just wished it was a little more than just a dab)  Stuffed Piquillo Peppers ( with goat cheese and mushrooms....YUM!)  Roasted Marcona Almonds (Don't Bother ordering this)  Cheese Platter ( Cana De Cabra, Manchego, Cabrales, La Serena)  Spanish Charcuterie Platter ( Chorizo, Salchichon, Sobrasada, Lomo Embuchado)   The Cheese and Meat platters were by far my favorite!  I will be visiting this place again on my next Vegas Trip!

DwZi-7IJRR44VV0grZjOHg.text: Went to Julian Serrano with a bachelorette party - about 16 of us and we had a great time! Unfortunately, they were unable to seat us all together, but they did get us two tables close together.  We got a couple pitchers of each the red and white sangria which was very good.  We then asked the waiter to bring us out an assortment of the most popular tapas. Everything was delicious with my favorites being the avocado cannelloni, the stuffed dates and the brava potatoes. Fun atmosphere and good service.

SiVUDmwK6RS7GhhrwWAXIg.text: I made reservations here on Thursday 7pm but decided to cancel for the happy hour instead from 4-5:30. I'm so glad we did because many of the dishes I wanted to try were half price.  Ranked most favorite to least: 1. Iberico Sliders- one of the best sliders I've ever had. Caramelized onions were a nice addition. 2. Seared scallop- perfectly seared, but you only get 1.5 scallop for the price and it's not on the happy hour menu. 3. Black rice-Very rich squid ink garlicky flavor. This is a good small option if you don't want to order the paella. 4. Albondigas- really nice flavors. One if my favorites. 5. Mixed Ceviche- this was good, but nothing special. It is a great balance for the richer plates. 6. Tuna-rasberry Skewer- nice presentation, but the tuna lacked flavor. They also hide wasabi inside the raspberry which gave an unexpected kick. Sorry to ruin the surprise, but my boyfriend choked on it. I'm glad I paid the happy hour price on this one. . Overall, they had great flavors. I prefer this over buffets and fried food. I was still stuffed after the experience. Service was impeccable. There are so many options at Aria as well as other hotels, but I would eat here again when I'm in the area.

qiDdqGTJ5FEKyvyeDSOXXg.text: I love places where I can sit & eat small plates all night long! That way I can sample & reorder as much as I want, and get the most variety. Aria itself is such a cool hotel, this restaurant fits in nicely. The ambiance can be lively, as its open to the the rest of hotel, but the variety of tapas seems endless! Everything from seafood to meats, to vegetarian options. My favorites were the lobster gazpacho, any of the ceviches, the stuffed dates & of course, I can never get enough lamb, so their little chops made my night! I like that you can spend a little, on a mid afternoon snack, or a lot if you want to sit for several hours with wine & make a meal of it like we did. Enjoy!

6KaU7DB82W6EEgDxa6gkZQ.text: A friend and I went to Julian Serrano for lunch after seeing an advertisement for a $20 special 3-course tasting menu from the Aria website. However, after we were seated, we were told that they could not honor the fixed pricing menu because they "were too busy."  The restaurant was not even half full. Surprised, I verified with the server and also the manager that I had come at the correct time under the advertisement, which didn't mention any sort of limitation to the deal. They both told me that I came at the correct time, but that they still could not honor their advertisement, with no reason other than they were too busy to honor it. They then told me I could order similar items at their FULL PRICE ($40-50 per person).  I am shocked at their bait and switch tactics, and will not be returning.

gwsCCqCd2KVxqKPvmg_y3Q.text: We tried Jose's experience - which is a sampling of 11 different tapas plus a dessert.  It was a fantastic experience.  Food and service were excellent.  We even had the cook deliver some meals.

uxGY5NHeYRUnoku2YaNoqA.text: Spectacular ceviche, fish dishes, atmosphere in the aria. Debated between this and jaleo, wasn't disappointed! Could have done without the Spanish tostada, too potatoey for my taste.

RnwlsdiDIUN0C06T672f9A.text: Excellent meal here for our group of four ladies. The extensive menu drew us to this restaurant. The service and food was excellent. Price was reasonable. Very fast service. We had to be out  within 90 minutes, and we were early. Would definitely go back again.

Opbcj9Hbzv90cn1SmzgCnw.text: Very enjoyable. Julian Serrano has a nice variety of dishes with many seafood options. I went there with some friends who had an array of dietary restrictions and all of them were accommodated.

0xPMPIyaH-7q2N48u19Dmg.text: I would come back here in a minute!  It was Friday night.  We were unreserved.  We ordered minimally.  They treated us like royalty.  Score!  We shared the Paella Valencia, and i had a wild mushroom soup topped with a foam of foie gras.  Both were excellent.  At the suggestion of the manager we were brought complimentary glasses of a Basque White Wine.  Our table was adjacent to an elegant couple from Toronto.  Our meal was made more wonderful by their great conversation.  The husband  had worked all over the world for the United Nations.   They'd just spent a week eating at all the best Vegas restaurants, and buying a year's supply of designer clothes.  They over-ordered and shared their flan with us.  Sit me next to folks like that any day of the week.  The few items we had compare very favorably with the Bazaar in LA.

2ziBF5jRgLDkMe_yiaccVw.text: I gave this place 3 star because of the service. The food was good but the service was awful!   Our server either did not put in our order or the kitchen just plain ignored it.  The food were coming out one at a time and we had to keep asking the server for our food. To top it all off, they overcharged us!   I get that they were busy last night because it was new year's eve but there's no place for bad service on the strip!

_86BYZNhFoahPvqd4LlRLQ.text: If you're looking for something that's a bang for your buck, this is NOT the place to go.  I ordered the salmon egg sandwich at Julian Seranno and it was OK at best. The eggs used were much too frothy and resembled something close to continental eggs. The salmon placed on top of the sandwich was paper-thin. Collectively, the meal was just mediocre.   Our waitress made it known before we ordered that the appetizers were great for sharing (seeing that we were a party of 5). The shrimp appetizer was served with, literally, three pieces of shrimp.  What I did like about Julian Serrano is the location. It's placed in the lobby of the Aria casino - needless to say, Aria is gorgeous by itself and makes everything just a little better.

6GZD0a6hzYGy4NHjH19UuA.text: We went here for lunch and sat at the bar.  Jeffrey was our bartender and he was amazing (knowledgeable about the food and football).  The food was great as well as the sangria.  We sampled a lot of different tapas and all were delicious and beautiful.  The bar tapas happy hour menu is a great deal ($5-$7).  We ordered many of the specials and a couple off the regular menu.  It was a great way to spend an afternoon.  Highly recommended.

wPfmKtHsyOdBW55aXhoP6g.text: my sister and i went here for dinner... we ordered mojitos which were perfect.  for dinner we ordered the:   paella minus the rabbit. instead we added chicken.. grilled calamari...   chorizo with mash potatoes...  black rice with shrimp.  foie gras cannelloni.  and a cheese platter... everything was good... but not.great. for the price ive had better and expected better.   for dessert, santiagos cake... it was ok.  the portion was so tiny!!  i wouldn't go again.

1AhbqBIzH1nO_3QhRGD1MQ.text: This place is overrated.  It was fine but not at all special, not a single one of the dishes we ordered stuck out to me as being especially good.  Sorry.  Considering how many great restaurants there are in Vegas, there is no reason to come here.

Y7Ptw25G8lrOL5tesZvKHA.text: Discovered this place quite by accident, and glad we did. Each dish had a delicious twist on the traditional tapas menu and these unique additions really made the meal. (I'm talking foams and other molecular gastronomy type twists.)  Plenty of options for vegetarians, and the small plate style makes it easy to try a lot or a little. And save room for dessert, they had the best fruit (with sparkling wine foam) I've ever tasted.

ei4myr_KpTmwUoE7hORYUA.text: We choose this restaurant for its selection of Tapas and small plates. Located in the Aria hotel which in Las Vegas itself is a very beautiful property the restaurant has a upscale appearance and lively vibe to it. Service was good but not great as we had to coax the waiter to explain each course. Reservations are a must and we where seated on time. Great place to dine and grab a light bite after catching a show which is what we did. I would return and recommend

CFfaDWp4ztT2DKplFkQs9Q.text: Came here for lunch while staying at Aria. Definitely a good place to check out if you want tapas, the menu is pretty extensive. We ordered the calamari, black rice (squid ink & lobster), mussels, and ceviche among other things. Everything tasted good and the seafood, fresh. We ordered a pitcher of red wine sangria, which was very good.  Our server was extremely friendly and helpful, upon seating us he asked us if we were familiar with tapas, etc. (we were, I eat out... alot)  The bathrooms are pretty funny, instead of cheesy "elevator-lounge type music," it's basically a Learn to speak Spanish tape.

EAaXX4mUGdVGnlI4thlSFA.text: Half of what we had was VERY GOOD and the other half was mediocre.    Mussels in a spiced broth, Squid ala plancha with carmelized red onions, Lamb Chop, and Filet with Cheese and honey were the bomb!!!  I will be back to enjoy another Burgans Albarino with the seafood and a Ribera del Duero with the meat!  Some of the other dishes were lackluster, and the atmosphere leaves little to be desired.    Overall, MUCH better than firefly.

99EZkWd-vsjmFI8zR9vHSg.text: Here is my breakdown and why-  Food: 3/5 Atmosphere: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Would I return?  Yes  Food: Although the selection of Tapas seems broad, the majority offer very similar ingredients (fishes, meats, cheeses) in similar patterns.  Having been to Spain I would have liked to seen a broader range.  I didn't see any Spanish style sausage and not much in the range of vegetables.  The food we did have was good.  We shared the tortilla, crab cakes, cheese platter, and something else.  I would have liked for the tortilla to be less runny.  The ingredients were fresh and higher quality.  One thing to note, most of the tapas cost about $10-15 and really are not big enough to share so expect to buy at least 2-3 tapas per person or you can share a paella which is about $50.  IMO this is more of a $$$ restaurant.  Atmosphere:  Much of the vibrancy of this restaurant has to do with the aesthetics of Aria.  The restaurant itself has great colors and modern styling.  The restaurant gets very loud especially if there is a lot of noise from the casino.  The crowd here tends to be younger and more trendy.  Service:  I found the hosts to be friendly as they tried to accommodate many people coming and going during a busy time.  The waitress was friendly and we didn't experience long waits for service.  I also found the the waitress was knowledgeable and was able to answer our questions about the different foods.

sQ4Ry33LB2ZIPurTQUfSmQ.text: Add to the list of entrees you can't pass up: the mussels. So, so tasty. Also don't miss the Spanish tortilla (eggs, potatoes, carmelized onion) and the albondigas.

rd6P3c2u3OwQM4rfYJW8Qw.text: We went to Serrano on New Year's Eve and they were obviously quite busy. The menu offers ample choices in all the categories and the food is generally quite good. Tapas are truly small but size is good enough for sharing (4 people top). Great place if you want to have some control on how much you eat and you like variety. Another plus is Its location in Aria where your lungs can take a break from chain smokers.  On the negative, the staff is not really attentive and seem to be more interested in talking to each other than paying attention to you. That's the reason for the 3 stars instead of the 4 I would have given to their food.

uVC5dzuk7oB6iXtBWzgTpw.text: This joint never fails to disappoint. Been coming here for years and Jeffrey and Adrian always takes great care of us. The food of course was phenomenal, the Ox Tail in particular was to die for. If you have a chance this place will certainly leave you feeling more than satisfied. And did I mention the Sangria? Delicious.

1ETGXPBrooAldLWKP7P7oA.text: This has been one of my favorite meals in Vegas to date! It's such a fun tapas restaurant with great service. My only major critique would be that I felt the plates came out a little quickly. Would have been nice to enjoy the courses a little bit more as they came out, we felt a little rushed.   My favorites - Scallops - Ahi Tempura - Asparagus - Steak - Lamb Chop - Chicken Croquetas  Word of Warning - The plate of peppers is not for those with a sensitive to heat, the same witht he La Bamba Meatballs. WHOA! - Desert was good but not my favorite. We tried the churros, donut holes and pound cake with the three dipping sauces a spicy chocolate, sweet caramel and a strawberry yogurt blend. Good but nothing to rave about. Stick with the savory items here.   Overall, a great tapas experience, amazing food and speedy service.

sIDpgCVFMaSZLBclqt8fqg.text: This was my 4th time eating here.  Was meeting up with friends for a nice lunch prior to a day of gambling.  The food was very good (as always) although a little pricey for what you get.  At the end of the meal we asked them to split the check for the 2 couples.  $131 each!!!  We paid it, but the more we thought about it the

GW50lF2eNo5Ff_Vqzfyu6g.text: i totally agree with anthony n.  the menu sounds promising but the food is definitely not good.  huevos estrellados* | fried potatoes | eggs | imported spanish pork chorizo 10 salty. everything with chorizo was super salty.  mixed seafood ceviche* | shrimp | white fish | octopus | cilantro | lime juice 14  one of the better dishes. i liked it because it was very tangy.  tuna cones* | ahi tartare | cucumber | crispy won ton | avocado | ponzu 14 too much mayo. others seemed to have liked it though.  seared scallop* | romesco sauce 12 wasn't salty surprisingly.  it wasn't over cooked either.  it was slightly raw in the center, just how i like it.  black rice | fresh calamari | lobster meat | sofrito | squid ink 12 salty..... lobster saffron | half lobster tail | saffron oil | iberian pork | creamy potatoes | asparagus 14 unmemorable.    roasted red peppers | fresh garlic | sherry vinaigrette | e.v.o.o. 10 didn't try. but some people seemed to have enjoyed it.  traditional spanish chicken croquetas | chicken | bechamel 12 flavorless.  stuffed dates | medjol dates | goat cheese | crispy pancetta | tomato marmalade 12 too mushy.  all the flavors seemed mushed together.   creamy risotto | wild mushroom | aged manchego cheese 10 salty. do you see a pattern?   mixed paella | lobster | mussels | chicken | spanish pork chorizo | vegetables | saffron rice 50 wayyyy tooo salty.  black pig pintxo* | iberian pork shoulder meat | caramelized onion 18 tough meat. everything else was unmemorable.  churros fried spanish pastries | spicy hot chocolate $8 super greasy and tasteless.  pistachio tart  almost like a pizookie.  it was ok.  surprisingly, it gets packed and people were waiting out the door. if i had to wait, i would've been super angry that i had to wait for mediocre food.  luckily, our reservation was at 6:30 and it was empty.

D9PDGne71YL59HkW7kxxAw.text: aria interior with access from lobby...spanish tapas 'n' paella...small plates or small bites...sangria pitchers tasty...requesting a tasting and restaurant deciding...tuna tartare seasoned light and well in individual crunchy cones..feeling a little gimmicky for $twenty-eight for six cones...goat cheese and sweet dates lovely snack throughout dinner...seared scallops tasteful, but wanted whole mouthful...avoid small or chopped....creamy cheesy risotto delicious and earthy...brava potatoes great bites with aioli saucing...chicken croquettes crunchy and fried...small bites and spoonfuls for six individuals...finding good, but nothing spectacular for pricing...tasting for $fifty-three per person tapas dinner...

E2O7Yn5sPGTXKpHuHSB60A.text: Stopped by for lunch and enjoyed the casual yet sophisticated atmosphere, and the friendly service.   The prices were expensive for tapas, but the quality of food was good. We ordered the mussels, calamari and other recommendations.  Mussels -- plentiful and enough for sharing   Calamari -- good, but didn't like how the batter quickly fell off the calamari  Nothing we ate here was out of this world good, but food quality was good and I wouldn't mind eating here again.

m7NaVECJXb5z4hXGT65UEw.text: I can' t say enough great things about this restaurant - everything is great about this spot.  Fantastic servers, great bartenders, terrific menu and high quality everything.  My first dinner / drink visit was so wonderful that I returned for a second meal there in under 24 hours.  I was craving their Stuffed Piquillo Peppers, risotto and brava potatoes too badly to stay away.  This is a classy place - it looks beautiful and will be sure to treat you and your pals incredibly well.  I'm looking forward to getting back there for another great meal and some bartender bonding (these guys know their stuff, super fun to sit at the bar with).

0PqaBUsRalvELEV8CFL5dw.text: Want good tapas, good Spanish good and atmosphere ? Whether it's business or pleasure Julian Serrano is the place ! Pricey but worth it.

aewVf2HRsRLxgJcmzGjf5g.text: Awesome Tapas dinner last night!!  Here's the rundown of all the deliciousness my friend and I tried:  Goat cheese tomato marmalade cake, beef & cheese, calamari a la Plancha, tuna cones, creamy mushroom risotto, stuffed piquillo peppers, pan tomate and the chicken croquetas!!    Order any and/or all of the above and you will be a happy camper!  There is nothing we were disappointed with nor would have ordered differently.  Our waiter was great too- we thank him very much for recommending the red sangria, however, the pitcher is huge and even though it is perhaps a Vegas "bargain" at $42, it is quite excessive for only two ladies.  Save it for a bigger group and order by the glass if there are less than 3 ppl, unless you are a lush.

DFsIxgGifgmvFwxzNYqiHg.text: The Ceviche was amazing! Was surprised that this place was able to pull off such a dish! We ordered a dishes but by far, Ceviche was the best.  Service is great! Our server, Eddie was phenomenal! The atmosphere was relaxed, not too crowded but just busy enough to give the place life.  The only thing that keeps me from going back is parking at Aria. What a mess that is!

xerj-KnAvOojcbfdu8byzA.text: Service is horrible , food is mediocre , avoid this place . There are tons of good places in Vegas . I don't know how anybody even rates this place more than a star

yterxUKta52M7UcoAiIMQw.text: Horrible, appetizer is fine. We wait way over 1 hour and the rice came. It's really not satisfying for the over-cooked shrimp and seafood. Disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MuZ241ESujlW9K5y5VlSig.text: The Skinny: undercooked rice in the paella, bland chicken croquettes with no chicken in them, flavourless sauteed spinach (2); service: is good and prompt (4); value: I'm sorry... we spent $90 including tax and tip, no booze, on food that isn't that great (1)  We were hovering between going back to Sage for round two or heading over to try Julian Serrano for dinner. My hubby decided, for the sake of Yelp reviews, that we ought to try something we haven't done before. This is even despite the average 3.5 star rating.  So, we checked out the menu and ordered the Valencia Paella, the chicken croquettes, the sauteed spinach, the mushroom soup and the stuffed dates.  The chicken croquettes were singularily unpleasant. Not much chicken inside, the bechamel sauce was bland. So basically, you bit into a croquette filled with bland bechamel... yuck!  The mushroom soup as an odd mushroom underseasoned consumme with foie gras foam (that didn't taste like foie gras). Considering the price you paid for this dish, it clearly doesn't deliver the luxury you are expecting.  The stuffed dates were atrocious - greasy and boring.  You couldn't taste the bacon, just the warmed dates with the crunch of a flavourless blanched almond.  Sauteed spinach with apples, raisins, shallots and pine nuts - sounds really yummy right? Well, it would have been if they'd added a grain of salt to the dish. The spinach was also unappealing on two levels - 1) uneven cooking method (see the pic - some are cooked, some slighty wilted) and 2) not enough oil leads to that filmy sensation feel inside your mouth.  The Valencia Paella was improperly prepared. First of all, the flavours were off for such a dish - perhaps too much saffron.   Secondly, the rice. Now, I know that the rice is supposed to be al dente. But this was not al dente, my friends. It's considered raw when the rice after chewing leaves a grainy texture in your mouth. Plus, if you look at my pics - no evidence of that wonderfully toasted socrrat layer (no golden brownness to the rice or the bits sticking to the bottom of the pan).  Third, the chorizo was subpar - texturally dry and one note... salty - it could not stand up to the other mediocre components of this dish.  So overall, a 2 starred review - mostly for the excellent service.

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottom of the pan - where&#39;s the soccrat?

CddCjg2btOg42phGtuEisw.text: The bar menu deal is a great deal! The sangria hits the spot. Perfect spot to eat after checking in.

jmb61g-06kpijGRd-HsTaw.text: They food is good but it was the small details that could have made the place great. For example my jamon Serrano could have been better had it actually been Serrano ham and not simply a thick cut of aged prosciutto. Also the roasted peppers and anchovies were good but could have been better had they not both been canned. Again, the food was good but I expected more for the prices and the hype around the restaurant.

ecM1i0z5Lv2P8VbJQvpVPg.text: The food is nearly as good as my best meal in Spain! The ambiance was lively and contemporary . Bravas potatoes were lovely - with a spicy sauce and am aoli drizzled over providing bites of heAven. The pork belly tacos had such perfect accompaniments that no bite was dry, and was actually, one of my fav dishes. The bacon wrapped goat cheese with pineapple and a pizza sauce was a sophisticated take and twist on Hawaiian pizza. Please go here!!!!

SRViYPszmmSEZstFwFycFA.text: Absolutely wonderful! Great portion sizes for Tapas, everything we ordered was the perfect amount for two people to split. We got four different plates and had a total of four cocktails, and our bill was just over $100, which we felt was very reasonable for the quality of food and service we received. Will definitely recommend to others and make it a priority to dine here again the next time we're in town!

rb6WHgyUXzXS7FTbvkkYew.text: I recommend you come for lunch on the weekdays and sit at the bar. This will bring the price of this place down to a normal tapas restaurant outside of the strip. The food quality is excellent. I had the red sangria, gambas, black rice, yellow tail, and atun de conos. The yellow tail was the best, it is to die for. Order 3-4 tapas plates/person. Enjoy!

MrkefXZjoT5XoSik5GGAEw.text: That I have dined here twice in one year, is testimony to the fact that if you don't dine here while you are in Vegas, you are losing out on fine food & a good experience.  But you need to make sure you have enough money, lest you be eating Ramen for a while...  With regards to the food, what's not to like?! Paella - good. Sangria - good. Mushroom risotto - good.  Wait, tapas here in general, good :)

2IzEcVFfHqDvAbtKXxCZgA.text: As I was driving to Vegas for my vacation, I was contemplating on dining options and suddenly thought of Julian Serrano.   Julian Serrano is a great alternative to the multi-course restaurants in Vegas, and here are the reasons that I may revisit the restaurant:  1) If you are looking for a good place to grab lunch and do not want to wait in line, this is the restaurant for you.  2) The waiter knows the menu well and points out food for our friends who have dietary restrictions.  3) The food is simple and arrives on your table quickly.   However, I have decided to give the restaurant only three stars because of the following reasons: 1) Although the restaurant is not full, it takes a long time before the host takes notice of us. 2) The food is good but not great. Having had the tapas in Purple Pig and Girl and the Goat in Chicago, my friends and I are not impressed with the food at Julian Serrano.  3) The restaurant lacks vegetarian options. If you are a vegetarian, I would recommend you visiting Jean Philippe next doors.  If you were me, would you visit Julian Serrano again?

Ko5f4HEev8cMbayQ9bULvw.text: We came here for a family dinner, large party and with kids.  We opted for an early dinner for obvious reasons.  The service was great and the food made me nostalgic for tapas in Barcelona.    One of the waiters tried to recommend the $150 paella but we knew enough about what we liked to navigate the menu without picking the most expensive item.  All in all a great experience and I would come back again.

WtScyf0XY_XecGjbmkdYVw.text: I sampled the romaine salad and the brava potato, as well as the saute spinach, chicken croquette and lastly, the molten chocolate with strawberry sorbet. Among all of these items, I liked the brava potato the best solely because I'm a french fries addict. The flavoring and preparation of the spinach and romaine salad were nothing extraordinary. I found the chicken croquette to be quite unique in that they used finely shredded chicken in this creamy sauce and the sauce was excellent.  As I am not a fan of overly sweet food, I found the molten chocolate to be not as sweet as I'd like it to be for a dessert!!! That was a bit unexpected and I really wish the chocolate in the middle was slightly sweeter.

RjhN5X_583fqIxTtJcgeiA.text: For my last meal in Vegas, I wanted to try a place on the Strip owned by a "name" chef. And why not try a different cuisine out at the same time? When I came across Julian Serrano at the Aria, I knew this was the place to try. It is my first time trying out Spanish cuisine, not counting an Elite Event at Pintxo last year.  While the dinner entree menu is high priced, I found lunch here to be reasonably priced. Tapas are offered for lunch alongside items like sandwiches, salads and paellas which range from $10-$14.  The decor is Spanish with a lot of bold and bombastic colors. Yellow being dominant. It is an upscale restaurant, but it feels very inviting. Even though I was dressed casually, I felt comfortable here. Though this was at lunch. Not sure what the vibe at dinner is like here.  I had the seafood rice ($14) which is a paella that has calamari, mussels, shrimp and monkfish! It is served in an individual size skillet which I praise for presentation. The actual dish itself was okay. It was a little too salty. Probably from the stock. The saffron rice could have cooked a little longer. Tasted a bit firm. I did like all of the seafood and the green beans were fresh and crisp however.  I did also get a red sangria ($9) here. It is good, albeit a little pricey. The drink was filled with orange and apple slices. It is a good addition to your meal.  Overall, I like Julian Serrano more than I dislike it. Seemed like the dish that I had was not executed as well as I would have liked. Still the lunch menu here is worth checking out for moderately priced eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Rice Paella
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria

pDagNl5ACQ5rfPrC_0IqFQ.text: During a recent stay at Aria, I did one thing that I NEVER thought I would do while staying at a hotel... I never left the property once during my 3 day stay. I don't know about you, but that is unheard of for me, especially in Vegas. I'm all about the hotel hopping and restaurant at this hotel and this other hotel.   With that said, Julian Serrano was one of the reasons I never left the property. I simply did not need to.   I came here for the lunch three-course menu, which I concluded was an AMAZING deal and steal. If you want to try this place out, but are wary about the heavy price tag, come for lunch. It was $19 for a three course meal.   My three courses was the Wild Mushroom Soup, Rib Eye Steak w/ fries and the Santiago's Cake. I really enjoyed the rich and earthy soup and the rib eye was cooked very nicely and served with thinly cut and crispy fries. The cake was surprisingly delightful and I preferred it over the flan that they offer.   Our waiter was very friendly and checked up on us several times. He also gave us some sangria mini samples and informed us of the happy hour they have daily 4-5:30 which includes sangria and app specials!  Overall, a good bang for your buck, especially for being at Aria and I'll be sure to come back for their happy hour!

APbG61mxnhh1Bcm9GojVgQ.text: The food was pretty good but the service was horrible! Note, I was part of a large group, however we were not demanding. And every time one of us asked for something or changed an order it was met with not only an eye roll but rudeness. When making a selection, some of us were told to order more or pick other items to increase the bill. Would not recommend coming here as a large group, since gratuity is included, don't expect good service. It was so bad our whole table almost got up to leave.

SsSSG7yH1v6YuzJWDVUmbg.text: Ok, so first off this place is GREAT! I love it, I know the plates are small but they're amazing and even though the bartender had the personality of a boulder he still gave us sangria Togo and that was cool! I liked him more for that, sorry for giving you a hard time, Jason. I'll definitely be coming back for the food!!

C25layuaYL27CTysQrYCDg.text: This restaurant was fantastic! Great, well paced service and delicious food and drinks. The highlights were the calamari a la plancha (over delicious sauteed onions) and the vegetarian mushroom risotto. The black seafood rice and palmito salad were also delicious - we weren't disappointed with anything we ordered. Highly recommend!

PgnBAHw0DPTBupoiTONUjQ.text: Came here this past weekend after being buffet-ed out in Vegas and wanted a bit more refined dining.  There was no wait for our party of five on Saturday at around 6, so I guess the trick is to come early because they were packed when we left around 8 or so.  We ordered several dishes, including the crispy artichoke, foie gras, fried chicken wings, and the valenciana and serrano paellas.  The paellas could easily feed three people per serving, but they do take up to 40 minutes to make.  They were delicious!  The rice is moist and flavorful, and they don't scrimp on the ingredients here either (as they shouldn't because one paella is easily 40+ dollars).  Between the two, it's hard for me to decide which one I liked more, although the serrano was definitely appealing given the baby back ribs and fresh kale in the rice.    The fried chicken wings were easily my second favorite dish.  They were crispy on the outside, featured lots of meat on the bones, and were sweet and tangy in flavor.  This dish came recommended to us by our server, and it was a great pick.  The crispy artichoke was good, although not super memorable.  I remember thinking that the "tapas" style seemed a bit odd given that the size of the plate and portions were quite large.  Not sure I'd order this again but would probably want to try another veg.  The foie gras was quite delicate.  It's always a treat to be able to order this since you can no longer get it in California.  It came sandwiched between cooked apple slices that were a bit mushy too and a sweet sauce.  I'd probably get it again just because it's a treat!    Service:  This was a stand out.  Our server - Pedro - was friendly, efficient, and so helpful.  He liked to chat and joke with us, and overall made the dining experience really enjoyable.    Service:  Looking for a nice meal in Vegas and tired of all the buffets?  Check this Spanish tapas restaurant out.

9uxevphNwtSKokJJ7cJglw.text: While on a girls' trip to Vegas, we came here to eat - the fact that we could order multiple plates and share them was enticing. We started off with a pitcher of Sangria that was really refreshing.   For plates, we got the following dishes, and I put them in the order of what I liked the best: 1. short ribs (my favorite but we had 2 orders - 1 fall of the bone amazing, 1 kind of tough) 2. white ceviche 3. stuffed dates 4.  brava potatoes 5. garlic chicken 6. spanish tortilla  Tips/Info: - Get roughly 2-3 small dishes per person. - Make a reservation ahead of time - It's inside ARIA just past the main hotel check-in desk

dQENt1f0phkKpsGkdhcVfQ.text: Food is absolutely delisssshhhh!!! Food presentation is beautfiful but the taste is to die for

yKQVdHXe9kiwRPawTXjcTA.text: Omg! This is my favorite Spanish restaurant! They have superb Spanish food/fusion! Love love love! I always recommend people to try this restaurant whenever visiting Vegas.

GJ339HS7H5LcHPD8bJ2zlw.text: My boyfriend and I had to make a last minute work trip to Vegas. We try to try something new every time we're in Vegas and Julian Serrano did not disappoint! Great food, great service and great atmosphere. Due to my work obligations, We didn't make it to the restaurant until 11 pm even though they close at 11:30 and our server still allowed us to have a full experience without being rushed. Food was delivered promptly and quality was amazing. We will definitely be back! We ordered the mushroom soup, shrimp ceviche, meat and cheese, artisanal sausage, tuna cones, seared scallops, stuffed peppers, risotto, and the oxtail. Thank you Julian Serrano!

At1x-d20DR63CaPoAJNcYw.text: MUST ORDER: Lobster paella!!! My girlfriend and I shared this and we murdered it!! Though they were a bit skimpy on the lobster, everything about the dish was amazing. I never really have paella because it always looks so overwhelming, but this is hands down the best I've had. We also shared the beet & goat cheese salad and that was amazing. I wish we came with more people because i'm sure everything on the menu is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster paella

Q6NEDAOlf9m0jt173UkQQQ.text: This place deserves zero stars! I went with a group of four girlfriends on a Saturday night. We made reservations knowing its busy and we were enjoying cocktails, small plates and conversation. During our meal we noticed that the wait staff was always trying to clear our plates prior to them even being finished and we had to tell them multiple times not to remove them. Then once we had finished our food but we still had cocktails the manager brought the check and my friend made a comment that they were rushing us. After we paid our bill the manager brought a round of sangria and apologized but said I'm sorry you feel rushed but we need you to leave because we need this table. As a paying customer never had I been treated so rudely. I think this was poor management and the food wasn't even worth it. Don't waste your time here!

i5yKULYNbAtHbj_Md4rRKA.text: Wife: 10,000 stars. That was fun.  I say GO TO HAPPY HOUR BAR MENU. You will get to sample virtually everything at a fraction of the cost.  All three Sangrias: red won with a dark berry note. Sparking was refreshing. White was on the spritzer side of light.  The food: Paella: MUST MUST MUST TRY. Next time we go we are ordering one of the full platters and swimming in it.  Papas Bravas: right spice and a phenomenal aioli. I wanted to order again. Cheese Coca: came last and was a scrumptious little bite. Salty goat cheese with warm spinach and crunch of a pine nut. Atun de conos: a little cone of tuna tartare with lemony zap of ponzu. Most popular dish in restaurant. I see why. Sauteed padron peppers: super orangey. I ate most of them. Not best dish, but a good palate cleanser. Creamy risotto: earthy and texturally creamy. Melon con jamon: what a contrast of salt sweet cold and warm. The melon ice cream was delicious with a sprig of mint. Extra (you have to ask, not on menu): scoop of melon ice cream over graham crumble. Ended the meal refreshed, pleasantly full.  Service: great. Jeff was bartender. Took time to learn our names. A little busy, but handled it beautifully.  Ambiance: clean, simple, appealing, and modern.  Cost: happy hour bar menu. 8 items and 4 drinks was $75.  Would we go back? Hell yes.

IwtB5rPIzDIFQRSe_2iNEQ.text: Best Spanish tapas! Must have: pan manchego, rabo de toro, creamy risotto, black rice

5U-FprZAxJm2u2gK6yFAug.text: The reason I gave two stars is the food here is ok. The the service here is the worst I have ever experience in my life. The server named Richard, the worst server !!!!!!!! He hasn't  taken my order and gone. Later one I asked for the supervisor, but they still send the server. His attitude is really unpleasant. He went to ask other tables were they doing ok , but he never come to our table. Won't recommend this restaurant.

2Ls5eBfSsWmpQ6TxVWRo7g.text: The service was good but not great. My wife got the Mushroom soup l, and DAMN, was it amazing!!! I got the pork ribs and it was all fatty, gross. However the red sauce they used for the potatoes was outstanding and the potatoes themselves were very good too... overall I give it a four because service was a little ehh and the food was hit or miss depending on what you order. I would definitely go back though, if only for the mushroom soup!!!

MpcJHQg26AYWP_KdbmeHAg.text: The only plus to our experience here was the fantastic drinks. Had a few quality gin and tonics to pick from. As far as Tapas, highly recommend staying away from any that involve steak. We tried the ribeye and then the tenderloin with crab. Both lacked any flavor. Ordered both medium rare and ribeye came out well done. After 4 tapas for our party of 4, we decided to call it quits and go elsewhere.

rx1LlaInNPg0nDl_oKnIxA.text: Very disappointed....the mussels smells stinky...couldn't even eat them...so worry I got sick

eyONc_Z32fQwc_bNE-dM7A.text: Pretty nice joint located inside of the Aria hotel and casino. The overall ambiance is pretty cool with a bit of modern chic"ness" to it which makes it pretty appealing for the folks passing bye. The food is essentially tapas but are portioned extremely small and have somewhat of a bitter taste. There were some dishes that were solid, but others were honestly just meh. The drinks are good but are extremely stiff and the service is slightly above average. Not a bad place to dine, just wouldn't be my first choice.   Pros- Ambiance  Decor  Stiff drinks Friendly service Location (within Aria)  Cons- Food is meh Small portions  Pricey  Lots of salt

oUxjQLOO-WidCZAUMCLPWw.text: It's a fancy place with small plates the food is good but expensive very small portions definitely a place if you just want some appetizers or something light dining.  And has a Spanish menu with a twist

xBSOAN4-zWWsp0pokayWaQ.text: Juliann Serrano tapas is the hidden gem of the Aria. I make it a point to start every vacation in Vegas here. The seasonal Sangria rivals anything in Spain or San  francisco. The pan seared padron peppers with orange zest and the chorizo with pepper puree are must haves. Any of the seafood crudos are also expertly made and incredibly fresh. You would forget you were in the middle of the dessert.  Always finish up with the churos, they are a simple and perfect rendition.

eFze57kXpHxwvUnRVh0qNQ.text: We ate here during the Christmas holidays and ordered a variety of tapas.  -Chicken croquettes: tasty, came with garlic mayo for dipping -Black rice: tasty slightly sweet dish, came with garlic mayo drops on it -Octopus: seasoning and texture weren't the best we had. Plus the quantity of octopus was small, vs the quantity of potatoes on the plate. Came with the same garlic mayo for dipping. -Patatas Bravas: Ok dish, probably the least exciting of our choices -Tenderloing & crab: served on a piece of bread, probably to make the portion appear larger than it was. Underwhelming seasoning. -Red sangria: delicious! Not too sweet. Nice and fruity. -Churros: came with a chocolate dipping sauce. Excellent. -Coffee: excellent  The dishes came out of the kitchen at a very quick, almost rushed rhythm. We were out in less than an hour.  Price was expensive. Sadly, we were informed that the happy hour option was no longer being offered as of very recently.  I don't think we'll return.

5AkMQsX3nGNBkWDo9kyQWA.text: Julian Serrano spoke to every culinary fantasy and seduced my palate with thrilling Spanish flavor. We dined here during Las Vegas Restaurant Week 2014 and this tapas restaurant was easily one of my favorites from the many we tried.   The ambiance sets the initial mood of a big-ticket appetite. You almost feel as if you are entering a secret Alice in Wonderland world and about to head down the rabit hole to experience an interesting turn of exhilarating dining events. Dramatic trees, colorful floor tile art, bold color scheme; Aria Las Vegas, you have effortlessly outdone yourself again.    LOBSTER GAZPACHO chilled Spanish tomato soup | lobster meat | cherries. This is out of control delicious. The lobster, very plump and sweet, plus the refreshing zesty chilled tomato gazpacho had a surge of exciting flavor; the slightly tart and sweet cherries just awakens all of your senses.  SALMON Scottish salmon | creamy whipped potato | horseradish cream. The dish was plated with intense artistry. The pop of color from the edible flowers was the ultimate eating with our eyes moment. But wait until you taste it; the flavor is unbelievable! Each component alone plays a sophisticated and important role in the dish.  Enjoy them all together as the perfect bite. Incredible! The crispy skin itself just kills me. Did I scrape the plate clean? You bet I did.  FLAN DE TURRON almond creme custard | whipped cream | turron. Entering food ecstasy in 3...2...1. Just one of those desserts where you just want to close your eyes, savor the creaminess and enjoy the moment, like in the commercials.  This restaurant stole the show that day and I kept talking about how delicious they were long after; a truly memorable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan de turron - almond cream custard, whipped cream, turron
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Proof that our meal here was out of this world delicious!
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crispy skin on the Scottish salmon just kills me with pleasure! I totally scraped this plate clean.

KZmrouB6OfZ9cqagjLmbCA.text: This is my second time here but this time for lunch. They have a different menu for lunch and all the food we ordered were delicious! I like that it's small plate portions and we can try a lot of different things from the menu. I was really surprised by the calamari. We're used to having it fried so we were skeptical when it came out like stir fried style. Boy we're we surprised by all the flavors. It looks plain and simple but the flavors were so good. It was definitely a dish that took us by surprised.

TAMUKx8iyzV7EhQi4Hjtbw.text: Well well we had a big expectation about this place based in reviews and location and we came out kinda disappointed, service was alright less the hostess ladies they were not really attentive but the busser and server deserved 5 stars, the ambiance well well what was meant to look as a casual restaurant was closer to mc Donald's ambiance nthg to do with a fancy place The food was okay we ordered paella the rice wasn't soft but super flavorful tho I ordered steak for myself it was good just super tiny and the croquetas delicious btw, cocktails super expensive and full of ice served in tiny glasses, my friend ordered a margarita and it was served in a tiny old fashion glass even in Applebee's they got it served in a fancy tall wine glass, but well, honestly it wasn't terrible

QkieqT9Lge_bS7TaNzntPw.text: This was the spot where Jim G. and I sat down to decide whether or not the Celine Micro Luggage was mine.  (Had I not purchased the bag, would I have reviewed them differently? Lol! No way!)  Had a great time sitting at the bar, chatting up the bartender, enjoying some delicious (and on happy hour!) wine, a few plates of tapas, and my favorite of all Spanish cheeses (technically Basque), Idiazabal!  I would strongly recommend hitting this place up during HH, as the chef takes some of the very popular dishes and puts them at HH sizes and prices.  I LOVE when paces do that, instead of putting the duds that no one wants, anyway.  The restaurant itself looks beautiful and the rest of the menu looks very enticing.  If I find myself down at this part of the Strip again, I'm stopping in for sure!

hWY5NWmlUj9Djg1gDAo1Bw.text: LOVEDDDD it here!   It was a group of four of us and we ordered all types of tapas and honestly, we enjoyed all of them. You will not go wrong with anything in their menu, everything was pretty darn good!  I am definitely willing to come back here when I go back to Vegas. The service was great also. I told our waiter that it was my husband's b-day and he came back with some churros and ice cream and a candle that he can blow, it was a nice gesture.

j16SKTFam8unPie3ce7cHQ.text: Excellent tapas, good paella and very expensive.  We started with the yellowtail with shredded filo dough which was excellent; the pan manchego that was recommended by our waiter. The tomato sauce had a nice fresh flavor instead of being acidic and the stuffed piquillo peppers.  I would have liked these more if they were cooked just a little bit more and served hot.  For our entree we shared the mixed paella.  It was good.  The chorizo was very good along with all of the other ingredients but the rice tasted like it had soy sauce in it but I prefer saffron in my paella.

H8geuaJeVkrVOJXovwGdGQ.text: Great tapas all around. Do yourself the favor of ordering the quarter suckling pig with one of the paellas (45 min cook time for those 2). Reasonable price considering it's a nice restaurant in a new casino in Vegas.

r8SIOdYG6fhBuQ_LcDGLfg.text: My absolute favourite restaurant in Vegas. Staff was on point.   Olive bread amazing. Cheese platter unbelievable. Highly recommend

kDqHkunFWtSMYQ8wI903IQ.text: Excellent service at the bar and the food was delicious! Was the perfect afternoon treat before going out for the night. Not too heavy. Definitely must stop in if you are at Aria!

KPN6jn0NItvlcAsexNvOvw.text: We had a great experience and would definitely return. Our server was so sweet and made my birthday really special. The ambiance was nice but on the louder side (possibly because we were sitting next to a party and loud music was playing).  Everything we ordered was a unique experience.  One thing that surprised me is that for tapas -- many of the main entree plates are large portions -possibly suited for larger parties.  Being just two of us, we werent able to order as many plates as we normally would at a tapas restaurant.  But what we did have was excellent.  There were some things that were very different from your typical american tapas restaurant, which could be really appreciated by a foodie or someone looking for an authentic cuisine.  My favorite part of the place was the bathroom - out of this world experience (ive got a thing for bathroom decor).  The restaurant really puts extra effort into all the details and customer service.  Thank you Julian Serrano for being a part of our Vegas vacay!

4-1pRod2RruTJvi0Rsd9Dw.text: Had dinner here the other day. It was quite alright except the pricing is a bit high of course it's because of strip prices. Had Muscat Sangria as a start, with peach and golden raisin hmm yummy actually it was really good. Simple, sweet not too much fruits love it very elegant. Another favorite thing is their paella, a lot of flavors a bit salty but it was still delicious. We also had their toro, dates and lobster noodles. Delicious. Good job Julian Serrano, this one much better than his restaurant in bellagio. Our service was great as well, food came our fast.

CScARUVD5usEbo8BTkuBRw.text: Julian Serrano has an assortment of Spanish tapas on their menu to choose from.   I went with a friend who did the ordering for us. I'm not too familiar with Spanish tapas but I love exploring new types of food. We got the Brava potatoes, tuna cones, parfait foie gras, and a bread that I don't recall the name of.   I had no idea at the time that I was actually  eating duck liver when I had the parfait foie gras. It was very sweet, melted in your mouth, and tasted dessert-like. My mind was boggled when my friend told me it was duck liver!   I wasn't incredibly impressed by the few tapas we had, but the presentations were lovely. I also remember having wonderful service. We had a young male server who was professional, friendly, and checked on our table frequently. He was a positive addition to our experience.   I would give this restaurant another try because of its service. I'm not sure I would go seeking out this restaurant myself but if I had a friend who wanted to go, I wouldn't be opposed to going with. I only had a few tapas my first time and would try other tapas if I return!

9BVbFSZ3fKVyd5JGsNiEGw.text: There is just something about Julian Serrano that keeps me coming back. Whenever we visit Aria, we find ourselves at the bar ordering our favorites. We love the bacon wrapped dates, red sangria and the paella. The paella can take awhile, so if you are going to order it, I suggest getting it in with your drinks. We have tried other items on the menu, but have always found the other items lacking. The paella may be on the expensive side, but you end up saving money in the long run because it is delicious and a very large portion. We have gotten the Chorizo, which just tasted like spicy hot dogs and were so small it was ridiculous. My suggestion is to try Julian Serrano for drinks and light appetizers to see what you like before coming for a meal.

Wi1aghyAj6xY-kD7dzCh_g.text: Here's the deal. This place is nice, but be prepared to find food after you have dinner. It's a schmancy snooty place where they charge you a lot of money for a taste of their food. To be clear, the food is tasty, but not worth it. Most things cost between $16 and $30, but you have to east like three or four things to even attempt being full. $29 for four thin slices of meat and a couple small chunks of cheese actually made me pretty mad. How they have survived for nine years is beyond me. With all that being said, if you don't mind spending at least $50 to $75 pp, you might have a shot a getting full. Otherwise, it's really expensive, but nothing more than tasty appetizers. Nothing more! Sorry, but I like value for my food and this didn't even come close. Again, the food quality and taste is not an issue as the food was delicious. The problem is the price to food value.  Many other places to go in Vegas with great food and a way better value.

bLgpbgCuoGSalT4UPVThlg.text: Easily my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Located in the aria it's hard to miss with the perimeter of the restaurant surrounded by what looks like trees without leaves on them. They're a Spanish style tapas restaurant so you can try multiple bites. Some more filling than the others but my favorite dish was the Pan Manchego which was simple enough but full of flavor!  This place isn't cheap but it is inline with typical Vegas pricing.

K4Q6yQHOZ4Khg6YyxYexvA.text: Julian Serrano Tapas is located in Aria near the entrance to the Crystal mall. This is a great place for tapas and wine. Perfect place for small groups and conversation! The menu is separated into categories: veggie tapas, cold/hot seafood, bread, meat tapas, cheese...of course the restaurant is known for their paella. There are 5 different kinds and I would suggest the Valenciana one: this one doesn't have the traditional snails, but has chicken, rabbit, Spanish pork chorizo, vegetables and saffron. If you have a large group, I would order two, but if you order a lot of small plates 1 should be enough.   The wine list is extensive with many CA and Spanish wines to choose from. Our server recommended a few Spanish reds and an Albarino which complimented our tapas.  Our first dishes (lobster salad and Spanish cheese plate) to the paella finale were delicious, well presented and spot on with flavor. We enjoyed this place as well as the ambiance. It was expensive and will be if you come hungry and order 5 plates per person plus drinks and paella! Still, exquisite and authentic tapas restaurants are hard to come by; and because of that I would def return.

M2G9usnI_kcBjOspYcnEgg.text: Had a bachelor party in vegas and the guys and I came here as the big blowout dinner.   We ordered two pitchers of sangria - red & white. I had no idea they could make a white wine sangria.   Ordered a bunch of delicious tapas and topped our dinner with their massive paella. The paella was so so so so good!   Dinner wasn't too bad, it came out to under $100 per person.

L2ZBdvn54na6eY_87k1xrw.text: Excellent food and service here!  After going to Jaleo twice, I finally decided to try the other tapas restaurant in Vegas.  I was not disappointed!  We had a party of five and ended up ordering a paella plus several tapas.  For the tapas, there were many standouts.  One was the padron peppers in the orange sauce.  It reminded me of Japanese shishito peppers but with a tangy sauce that complemented without overpowering.  The seared scallops were done just right, with seasoning that allowed the flavor of the scallops to shine without overpowering them.  The chicken croquettes were also very interesting, not too oily, and with subtlety of flavor.  The paella nera was excellent, with lots of different mixed seafood; the squid ink really gave the flavor a nice twist that you don't often find in paella.  Also, definitely check out their sangrias.  I'm definitely coming back here on my next Vegas trip!

6fLVWAerEJMRyJZBwSl2Pw.text: My husband was worried about me having solo dinner during his work trip. Bwahaha... what a silly man?!  I've dined here quite a few times so have really narrowed my diet to - no potatoes, no vegetables. Basically only consume items that'll cause my cholesterol to spike and increase chances of diabetes. After all, this is SIN city.   Here are my favorites from the menu:   1. Blue Sangria, 2. Double Seared Foie Gras on my filet, 3. Seafood Negra Paella, 4*.  Lebron's tears at Eastern Conference finals for dessert.   While most believe tapas is small plates to share, my favorite part about tapas is not having to share and eat two entire mini entrees all by myself.  *seasonal item. only on the menu when I went for dinner.

q8NqGwAX-xqPs4kDsal2HQ.text: Yeah... this was not good. We had checked out Catch on Open Table and it seemed like they had open availability, but that was naive and it was packed, so we went with our next closest option in Julian Serrano.   On paper it all sounded good, and I'm sure some things are better than others, but in a city with so many great restaurants and at such a high price-point, there really shouldn't be "misses" on the menu.   We started with the tuna carpaccio which was really the only winner amongst the things we ordered. The fish seemed fresh and the preparation was nice.   The three of us also split the carne asada, which in tapas world means one small piece each. My friends both enjoyed theirs, but mine was complete inedible gristle that I had to spit out (that makes for really charming tableside manner, if you were wondering).  We also split the seafood zarzuela which was a seafood stew of seabass, shrimp, crab, mussels, calamari and potatoes, and also awful. Perhaps it's a customary preparation, but the seabass was served with the skin on...try figuring out how to eat that, and also full of small bones. On top of that, the entire thing was massively overcooked. Rubbery shrimp and mussels, and needless to say the calamari was chewing gum.   I will say that we didn't give them a chance to make things right as we were exhausted, the service was pretty slow, and just going back to our rooms and eating trail mix sounded like the best option at this point, but seafood stew overcooked to this extent really shouldn't happen at any self-respecting restaurant.   With all of the great dining options in Vegas, I would advise skipping this place. Hell, a buffet can probably do a better job that what we experienced, honestly.

m4X0ixfALGKwJXswPrX1MQ.text: Atmosphere was nice although it was too loud to have conversation. The food was average tasting. The Tapas were priced high. Do not look at the menu prices on google its incorrect. Customer service was good. I would not recommend. If you want good Tapas that are priced reasonably go to Firefly.

iLc-vOli1Lilz5dbchejiQ.text: After a long day of travel, my spouse and I were looking for a place to sit down for a meal and some good conversation with my sister-in-law, who was already in Vegas for a conference when we arrived. It's not always easy to find a place with vegetarian dishes in Vegas, so when we saw that Julian Serrano had options for me when we were tired and hungry, we trudged on over and asked if they could seat a table of three. We were told about half an hour, so we grabbed a beer at a nearby bar and came back for dinner.   The restaurant is located in essentially a mall, so the seating is out in the open. The service is attentive--sometimes a little overwhelming as they often came by before we'd even had a chance to look at the menu, but we appreciated their exuberance. The cocktails didn't sound interesting enough for the price, so we ordered a pitcher of sangria. While it was enjoyable enough, the pitcher was so overladen with ice that it was kind of hard to tell how it tasted.   For food, we ordered a bunch of tapas to share. We started with the Bravas Potatoes, which were tasty but certainly not the best I've had. The stuffed piquillo peppers were also enjoyable, if relatively predictable. The mushroom risotto was tasty but nothing overwhelming or special. My companions had a few of the seafood tapas and enjoyed them as well, but similarly did not feel that they were inspirational in any way.   In short, the food was good and enjoyable, but didn't really merit the special Vegas prices considering that they were not better than a standard tapas restaurant. We absolutely enjoyed our meal but simply didn't find it to be anything special.

lS5_YBk8cao1LOwxQGYmPg.text: fancy schmancy tapas for ALL!  my fellas and I held my bachelor party dinner here ...about 100 bucks a head takes care of everybody for what it is.  also make for a good sit down meal individually or with the family.  open space, live scene, good eats = a great  choice!

I_kwe2rhFc8GMeoznKmKrg.text: First night in Vegas for the birthday weekend and we decided on Serrano's. We had experienced Julian Serrano's food before at last years Aria Luxury Experience event and really enjoyed it so we wanted to try the restaurant.   The food was good. The menu is a bit confusing and overwhelming but our waiter did a good job of explaining everything to us. We tried several different items and my favorite was the tuna cones. They were delicious. Second to that was the ox tail tapas.   At the end of the meal, our waiter brought over a complimentary dessert with "Happy Birthday" written on it which was a very nice touch. We had not told them it was my birthday so I know that was arranged by Christopher at Aria Luxury Experience and it was very appreciated.   The one downside to the meal was how loud they had the music playing in the restaurant. It made it very difficult to talk and it got very loud with everyone trying to talk over the music.   In all, a good experience.

Lu3jjt832lcdbsy9hgglow.text: I've been here three times. It's like a tradition to come here every time I'm in Vegas. This last visit was a big disappointment though. I'm not sure if I'll be back again.  I ordered the paella negra,less sodium.They undercooked the rice after waiting  60 min for it. (We know the difference between al dente and undercooked crunchy rice) But salt content was good.So they brought it back and recooked it in broth. After a long time later, rice was cooked but was salty -.-". Too hungry and too troublesome to send it back again so we just ate as much as we could. They did not discount us nor give us free desert. Might not come back again because of this experience.

vHMPVO-pA01eDseSPXfyOQ.text: This restaurant was my absolute favorite for several years. We travel to Vegas 3-4 times per year and always stoped.   I would be hard pressed return. This place has taken a significant turn for the worse.   First, the menu has been vastly limited from the past. Prices were increased dramatically. There's no more black rice (hey, we can call it paella and charge $50). Olives used to marinated, warm, and delicious. This time, they were cold, and just soaked in oil, without the signature seasoning. You can't order them separately anymore either. You have to also get either tasteless pickled peppers or 6 almonds. Charcuterie combo tray is $30 and consists of 6 slices of very mediocre sausages.    Second, wine and cocktail service is reduced. This used to be a great place for wine and cocktails. The options are now uninspired and expensive.    I have eaten at this restaurant at least 10 times. I can no longer recommend it.

lrhRWwkP68dCrAv7O08mBA.text: All the dishes were very delish! we ordered chicken croquettes, Bravia potato, pork dish, tomatila bread and shrimp Gambada! I actually thought the portion size of Bravia potato would be small, but it's definitely filling and spicy and yummmyy!! overall a Litl pricier keeping in mind that you need to order atleast 2 dishes to fill ur tummy, but you can try this restaurant once to enjoy the ambience and food!!

In6jF2AC8y0w6q36wfZwzA.text: I came to JS to celebrate me birthday with some friends and I was absolutely blown away by the level of service and food quality that was presented. From moment I walked in I felt at home and the server did an amazing job taking care of our party. We had a lot of different food items and each one was absolutely fantastic. Our server, Rodney, did a great job making recommendations about food and drinks, Chef Rafael did an amazing job explaining how the food was prepared and Jonathan did a wonderful job hosting us for my birthday.  My friends, who are all food enthusiasts, collectively agreed it was their best restaurant experience they've ever had. 10/10- a must try for any food enthusiast when in Las Vegas.

uCv_5BKRyngiVNhEqxTuOA.text: Beef and cheese is a must order! We got 3 meat dishes and 1 veggie being the asparagus and all was great! The other two meats were a lobster dish and another steak. Being a local....we will return!

DYgQ2RkqsYVDFvgGNrSLuQ.text: We have been staying at Aria every time we visit Las Vegas and I've been wanting to try Julian Serrano Tapas for the longest time and finally, this recent stay at Aria we had Brunch at Julian Serrano Tapas. I ordered the Hanger Steak, Sauteed Padron Peppers in Orange Glaze and Gambas. Okay, the Hanger Steak taste really good and cooked to my liking. My only complain is the gristle... It makes it hard to chew the steak and ruins the experience altogether. The Sauteed Padron peppers seemed needs more time to cook, the skin is still hard on most of the peppers which makes it very very spicy when you bite into it and the orange glaze didn't help at all as it only intensifies that spiciness. The Gambas, hmmmm I like that the shrimp is cooked perfectly. I just don't like the tomato base. It doesn't bring out the shrimp taste as the Garlic, Pepper & Oil one. I think, the Garlic, Pepper and Oil kind is the one that appeals to my taste buds when it comes to Shrimp Gambas.  I love the ambiance and the server is very friendly and nice.

IUFqbhHpNxXqmZKIClmvbQ.text: My uncle flew into Vegas to meet me for a early dinner at Julian surranos. He had been raving about this place known for there tapas. I was not expecting much going into Julian surranos. Blew my expectations. This place is a hidden gem of Spanish style food. The chef does a great job with the infusion of flavors that Can be very simple or very complex. The tapas are amazing. The Decore is stunning. Bright and vibrant Spanish style decore very modern. The food is amazing. I would recommend eating here to anyone.   Julian surranos is located inside the aria hotel. I always stay at the cosmopolitan. So there is a bridge that goes right over to aria. The trip is very quick and convenient. My uncle was telling me every year he comes to Serranos with his college buddies and they get the tapas. During a certain time of day for 1 hr they have half price tapas!  It's not a special known to the public. They don't put it on there website. Or promote it. The group found out because they buy bottles and spend a lot of money on here.   We called to make reservations. The girl on the line dident know about the half price tapas. So we walked over to serranos. The manager gave us the time they were having the half price tapas (apparently it changes). We made the reservations for the next day. The next day open arrival they had a table all set for us. We changed it to bar seating.   The tapas are amazing and full of flavor. We ordered over 10 plates. The food was amazing. I would have 100% paid full price for the tapas. The fact we got them half price was amazing. We ordered some drinks and had a good time.   Overall. Julian surranos in the aria. Could possibly be my fav Spanish restaurant in Vegas. The food is amazing. The decore is bright and vibrant. I will defiantly be back here. I recommend Julian surranos to anyone visiting Vegas.  PROS: -Ambiance  - clean  - great food   CONS: - little noisy
