Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-0VWuiVgurJ2BDQZFw8n2w.text: Saw good Yelp reviews so thought being that we were staying nearby give it a shot for dinner. However, sooo thoroughly disappointed. Service was mediocre from Finish to end as staff seemed more preoccupied with bigger tables ( we were only a table for 2)....found also food to be decent as tuna / raspberry skewers were rather bland in taste. We followed up with the potatoes which were no better than any home style fries you'll get at any local breakfast eatery...we thought to give it another try with stuffed peppers with goat cheese and received 2 small peppers. I understood the overall concept of it being a tapas place but overall quite average and nothing special of note for me to encourage others to go......

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna / raspberry skewers....an experience in Bland....

M4VEitZuzAC722mMIJAD9w.text: Me and my boyfriend try to come here when we visit Las Vegas. It's located in the lobby of Aria hotel. We started off with tuna cones, which was around $15 and comes with 3 cones. It's a perfect bite of tuna and avocado in a wonton cone. It's good but so pricey for something so small. We also got pepitio de ternera, which is literally a flavorless piece of rib cap in between a pretzel bread. Skip this dish and save your money. Also got gambas which is sauteed jumbo shrimps, it was good but nothing too special. We mainly come for the paella of course!! We prefer the pasta paella over the rice. We got the fideua de Camaron which is an angel hair pasta paella with shrimp. It's huge! So perfect for sharing for a party of 4, if it's just the two of you it's perfect to Togo for a midnight snack!

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna cones $15
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FIDEUA DE CAMARON: angel hair paella. So yummy

MF89LLJwMA1ahZ47qB1whw.text: This restaurant has a great vibe and vibrant, bright decor that just gives our dining experience a fun feel.  We enjoyed our dinner and tapas, only complaint would be that the food came out way, way too fast.  We sat down at 7ish, ordered soon after (about 5 or 6 different tapas), and by 7:30 or so all of our food had been served.  We hadn't even finished our first glasses of wine yet.  Lesson learned: only order 2 at a time so you can spread out the meal.  We ended up ordering another dish just so we could sit and relax for awhile, and my husband was still hungry.  The food itself was excellent, hence the 4 stars.  Highlights were the lobster gazpacho, Spanish tortilla, ahi tuna tempura, and Spanish iberico sliders. Avocado cannelloni was good but a little rich.  My husband also enjoyed the olives.  For dessert we had the bunuelos (Spanish donuts) with butterscotch and caramel; they were ok, would have been much better with just caramel or dulce de leche, no butterscotch.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spanish tortilla, classic done right
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster gazpacho, delicious
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna tempura

q8FksbsCMlTY9fFKPsbyrg.text: Really good just know its not much food!  But its really good!  The drinks and churros are wonderful too!!

UxuTmrhqZMh7DYWwIItlyg.text: Second time here in the past few years and totally enjoyed the food!  Olives with a lemon olive oil that were delicious, fresh sushi grade ahi that was melt in your mouth tender, mushroom soup that was light and oh so tasty, salad with refreshing dressing, followed by rib eye with mushrooms, patatas bravas close to what we had in Barcelona.  Definitely will return!

XA6-VorQlJb8xSDba5T3SA.text: I think I would give this place a 2.5 Went here on a weekend awhile ago and it was busy(as expected) and not to mention we had a party of 9 so we were bound to wait. Finally got seated and were given the menu. It was really fun looking at the menu because a lot of things actually sounded really good but I ordered the salmon and the seabass and had a sample of some other stuff like ceviche and mushroom risotto. I thought the mushroom risotto was pretty good but the ceviche was kinda bland. It was refreshing but it fell short. Out of the two fishes I got, I really like the seabass. The salmon wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special. Both the dishes looked really nice though but the seabass was cooked to perfection and it had a really nice crispy skin layer to it which made it mmmm. Get a fork and slice through the fish and get some skin = mmmm goodness.   I think the things were a bit overprice for how much you're getting and the taste is only decent. I wouldn't really come back as I have had better tapas places. I understand you're suppose to get small quantity but it kinda fell short for me. Service was nice. Maybe its just my opinion of course so if you haven't tried it, you are welcome to. The food was pretty good, I just didn't think it's worth my $.

ubf-9IZP956SZSZhiDOEEA.text: Extremely quick service. Amazing place for small plates that taste yummy. My fav was the spicy peppers tapas. A must try with the drinks

eWY-rDTkWbJfETJ5ehNtYg.text: Our waiter Ernest was amazing! We had him choose the dishes and all of his picks were delicious. Definitely recommend the scallop skewer and the oxtail/mashed potato dish. Will definitely be back.

2NVSZZbRTU8LDontIczKkA.text: The food was cold and the waiter do not her us good because he was in rash the food so little and the price was so high ..

I9BuXP6PAwbv7jzt2ampkA.text: I had high expectations for this place... only to be pretty disappointed.   First off, I love tapas and everything affiliated with tapas.  So this place had a running head start and advantage as most places go.  But when the two different types of croquettes we ordered were both mushy, and the potatoes brava was also overcooked, I started to wonder where we had come to dinner.... certainly a place for old folks who had no teeth?  Nothing with some texture, much less crunch.  Mush upon mush.  Thank goodness I ordered the osso buco because that was actually really good.  But what was that out of 4 different tapas?  The biggest disappointment of the night?  We ordered a double portion of the mixed seafood paella.  And honestly I was not trying to stay on the negative hype because as i said, I enjoyed the osso buco... but the paella rice was hard.  Now mind you... I can handle al dente.. and thats what my cousin tried to tell me... but seriously what I scooped out was hard rice, not cooked properly.  Others told me theirs was ok so I thought I was insane UNTIL others took a scoop of paella from a different area and they too came across the hard uncooked rice.  For as long as the paella took and for the lackadaisical service where I sat staring at empty plates that weren't removed I have to give this place 3 starts... BARELY.  They only got the extra nudge because of the osso buco.  Desserts were good, but no matter how much I enjoyed dessert, it couldn't erase the huge disappointment of undercooked paella rice and overcooked mushy croquettes.    I would have expected better.  But never mind, eat at your own risk, I can categorize this place as "been there, done that, no need to return."

QwQ3NFURyEakeR6O3DW-uQ.text: Service was very bad... The waiter obviously forgot to put order in for a plate, but blamed the kitchen. It took about an hour for a veggie tapas plate to come out, while a bigger party got all their food in half the time.   Later that night.. Without going into detail, I felt very unwell.   The other aria experience was not great either. The casino bar area was disorganized and smoky. The restaurant had the same feel. I stayed at the Cosmo and had opposite overall experience   I only gave it 2 stars because a couple of the plates (the tenderloin was best) were really good. If you are a risk taker with food and really  patient, it may be your place.

LPENVWnpMuKmDEUw8UYiOw.text: Tasty tapas in a fun atmosphere that encourages people watching in the posh Aria Hotel. I loved the oxtail tapas, the savory dates and I ordered two of the chorizo because it was out of this world delicious! We went at lunch time to get half price tapas bar menu and $5 sangrias. We ordered one item from the regular menu and it wasn't that much bigger. It was twice the price! All in all, we ordered 9 tapas, dessert and 3 sangrias for under 100 USD.

QC_guhtwKY9N7wt-2b6XpQ.text: This place totally missed the mark on EVERYTHING I tried. I had the olive bread, the manchego bread, the steak and cheese tapas, the risotto and asparagus tapas, and the black rice tapas. Everything tasted the same and was drowning in olive oil with very additional flavor. I also had a white sangria which was not flavorful at all. It was all terrible!!! The bill came to $122 and I was so disappointed. Do not waste your money.

5ifI2RaSE5pA0honrjV_eA.text: Nom nom nom. Came here for a yelp event and the food did not disappoint. Loved the hamachi wrapped in crispy sweet potatoes, great balance of taste and texture. The croquettes were also pretty good along with the paella. I tried both the white and red sangria and personally preferred the red. Would love to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat cheese stuffed peppers
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella!

CZPEQhByUYLa12IggML8Ow.text: We went to Julian Serrano on our first night at the Aria and we really enjoyed it. The service was very good and the food was excellent. The menu is huge.  We ordered the Paella Serrano (with morcilla, short ribs and kale), the apple with foie grass, the lobster gazpacho and the bread with tomatoes. For dessert I ordered the bunuelos. Everything was outstanding but the bread with tomatoes -which we are very used to eat in Spain- were to oily and the bread was too soft for our taste.   If you ask me between Jose Andres and Julian Serrano, I couldn't pick one over the other, regardless of my 3 and 4 stars respectively. They are just not the same, the food is different. I did find Jose Andres to be more intricate.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rjHHViOC9rugviRSTjvypg.text: Traveling with my mother and my aunt, we chose here for one of our nicer nights out in Vegas, since we all prefer to share small plates rather than get individual big meals and we were incredibly pleased with the entire experience.    The aesthetic of the restaurant itself is beautifully artistic and funky (which fits right in with the Aria hotel where it is located).  We went early enough (just around 5) and there was no problem not having a reservation.  Service was fast and our server (Ernest) was super helpful, attentive and friendly.  We tried around 5 different dishes total and a few craft cocktails and everything was fresh, tasty and very unique.    For us, 5 dishes was more than enough food but it may not be the case for others (as they are tapas- so they come in tiny portions).      For anyone who likes to try different foods and doesn't mind having sharing/having smaller portions, I highly recommend checking this restaurant out!  This is my 5th time to Vegas and ranks as one of the best meals I have had there!

I1jpn95INPKUjn9DhhhTMA.text: I love tapas: traditional, modern, Spanish, Latin, whatever.  I like them all.  The menu here is extensive and gives everyone choices.  There are still so many tapas that I have not tried, but here are a few that stand out and I would order over and over again for dinner:  * Tuna-Raspberry Skewer: ahi tuna, "molecular" raspberry, wasabi, and sesame seeds...looked too pretty to eat * White Fish Ceviche: different types of white fish, red onions, a little pepper, cilantro, and lime juice...very refreshing * Salmon with Truffle Bechamel Sauce: served on a portabella mushroom...so good that it is my favorite tapas here * Manchego Cheese Lollipop: fried in herb bread crumbs and paired with a red wine poached pear...kind of like a deconstructed fancy salad * Bomba: veal and pork spicy meat ball...just the right amount of spice * Iberico Black Pig Ribs: served on a bed of garlic white beans...a little different than the traditional American pork ribs  There are less tapas choices for lunch, but the $19 prix-fixe menu is a good deal for 3 courses. It includes iberico pig items, too.   Mmm, iberico pig!

913YbsuvCKks0Xe5PSdKjQ.text: Definitely the best meal of my life and Ernest was the best server and gave us the most amazing recommendations and and was so sweet and made our experience so much better

AWnSjxOZR7HLvjtWl2Hxcg.text: Probably the best food I've ever had.  Ordered:  To drink: red sangria.  For dinner: shrimp ceviche, calamari a la planchas, cheese plate, brava potatoes, mixed paella.  For dessert: torrija, and churros.  Everything was AMAZING.  The service was fabulous.  Pedro and Victor were AWESOME.  This place is HIGHLY recommended.  I can't say enough about how great everything was.  We will DEFINITELY be back!!

5w7v9nZdlPQyNouQ2MgBcA.text: I was in Las Vegas for work and looking for places to eat that were good but not too expensive and I came across Julian Serrano in the Aria Hotel.  I took a seat at the bar and had a wonderful meal.  I started off with a Spanish beer which they had to make sure they had and luckily they did as it was great.  For my meal, I got the white ceviche which was so good and really had a kick.  So stay away if you're afraid of that but otherwise embrace it because it's amazing.  I also had the sliders.  It came with two of them and I wanted three because they were so good.  Highly recommended spot in Vegas.

yT3sf9SJdpMvUKpCWAtZPg.text: GET THE RED WINE SANGRIA.  My friend's flight into Vegas got delayed so I found myself waltzing into this place for some food and drink to help pass the time.  I'm so glad I did, because it was great.  Firstly, the server was amazing!  Before my butt hit the bar stool, I had a both a food and drink menu in front of me.  After mulling over the drink menu and being stuck on the plethora of options available, I asked for a recommendation.  He offered samples of both the red and white sangrias (little shooter glasses), without me even having to ask.  I tried both and the red was head and shoulders above the white.  I think what made it so good was the cinnamon in it, which really added something a little extra.  I ended up ordering a glass of the red, which was easily the best $10 I've ever spent in Vegas.  Beware though, that thing packs a punch and I was feeling it by the time I left.  For my meal, I had the ahi salad which was delicious.  The price was really fair too (especially for Vegas), $13.  The fish was fresh and seared perfectly, not to mention, there were also chunks of avocado and tomato amongst the greens which were dressed just the right amount.  Upon perusing the remainder of the menu, it looks like the tapas are similar in price but would probably be smaller dishes and therefore require more quantity-wise, so I can see where it might get expensive.  Regardless, if the quality of food is consistent with what I experienced during lunch, I definitely need to come back for dinner service.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria! A glass of the red, a taster of the red, and one of the white.

Gpz6yWgI4nk0L7JKgYlZjQ.text: This is not a tapas bar! I feel like I was robbed of a True tapas experience where as you buy drinks food in small plates are brought to you so you can share and enjoy with your fellow dinners.  The tapas plates where so expensive and lacking. How can you charge $16 for ONE scallop? Truly outrageous and pretentious, I will never return!

vDUu-NvB2aY4wRuJhBEHHQ.text: We wanted something small to eat, so we went to Julian Serrano for tapas. We had the marinated olives, albondigas (meatballs) and a flatbread. Everything was delicious and the service was wonderful. We especially loved the sauce on the albondigas! The red and white sangrias were also delicious. They were fruity, but not overly sweet. I would definitely come here again!

Ez7o1b02ic28QkFpaX4acw.text: OH-EM-GEE. This restaurant has made such an impression on my taste buds! I had mostly everything the table ordered, but I have to say the Lobster Gazpacho was divine, as was the Ceviche mixto and the Paella mixta. Red and White sangrias were delicious. What a treat to have been able to dine at this place while staying at the Aria Hotel Resort & Casino.   I have every intention of going back there!

ygQelmQYYzOVxxEQSLxl-g.text: I came here for an impromptu dinner date on a Saturday night.  We had walked through the Cosmo, Crystals and finally decided on Julian Serrano in Aria.  The restaurant was starting to get busy with the dinner crowd, but we were still able to get a table right away.  My brain was pretty fried from partying two nights already, so I asked for our servers' recommendations and picked something from there.  We ended up getting the Fried Calamari, Spanish Iberico Sliders and Paella Marinera.  The food came out pretty quickly, which was good because we were starving.  The calamari was nice and crispy...pretty much your typical fried calamari.  The sliders were quite good.  They were filled with prime beef, Iberico pork and caramelized onions.  The beef was nice and tender and the caramelized onions gave it a nice sweet flavor.  The paella was huge...it definitely could've been shared by three or four people.  there was calamari, shrimp, mussels, monk fish and vegetables  with saffron rice.  The flavor was amazing and we were quite impressed.  We ended up with leftovers of the paella, and I took it back to my hotel for my post party munchies.    The service here was very good and our waitress was very attentive.  Granted, most restaurants on the Strip are more pricey, but our bill came out to be very decent for the items we ordered.  I would mark this as a restaurant to come back to and try other items on the menu.

FuAjZxvRckX1LSyAONHVRQ.text: 3.8 stars.  Julian Serrano is a tapas restaurant located in the lobby of the Aria Hotel next to the front desk.  The restaurant is decorated in vivid colors and is enclosed by a short clear divider that leaves part of the restaurant exposed to the eyes of lobby guests.  Since the divider is only a few feet tall and clear, I think that the people who dine at these tables get a more casual atmosphere since it almost feels like you are dining in the lobby itself.  However, the rest of the tables are tucked further back into the restaurant giving it a more private and cozy atmosphere.    I have been here a few times and the people who dine here have always ranged from extremely casual ("Hi, I just came from the pool") to dressed to impress ("I'm going to the cluuuuub!").  I've seen families with small children here and I've also seen bachelorette parties here.  The good thing is that the ambiance can really accommodate anyone, and the restaurant is spacious enough that you can sit far away from small children if you prefer.    The service has always been excellent - no complaints there.  As for the food, it is definitely pricey for the size of the dishes.  I believe each small plate is $8-$14 and they are tiny.  However, the dishes are great if you want a high-quality light meal.  One dish that I was impressed with based on its size is the paella.  It is HUGE.  I ordered it when I was with a party of 10 girls - 4 of us really wanted paella, and the menu said that the portions are designed for 2 people.  Based on the size of the tapas, we were thinking that the paella would also be small and fulfilling, so we asked to get a 3-person serving for $75 (expensive IMO).  The paella dish was so big that it easily fed 8 of us (in addition to the small plates), and we left happy and full.

-xrqucbjFXdX8dArfnrISA.text: We were in Vegas a couple of weeks ago and this was one of the places that really impressed me.  Mostly because of one thing -- the PAELLA DE LA HUERTA which I am gonna remember for a LONG LONG LONG time.  It was a poem in food form :)  It was one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten!   We were staying at the Aria and my hubby was at a conference so I had to eat dinner by myself one night -- I came into this restaurant 'cause the night before we'd come in for some tapas and I felt comfortable returning to the same place even though I was by myself.  The tapas btw were pretty ordinary -- and kinda on the smallish side, but I'd wanted to try the paella  --  because it's vegetarian and it's really hard to find a vegetarian paella.  Oh boy, was that thing ever perfect!  It was meant for two people and I was going to eat a little bit and take a doggy bag like a decorous lady :)  I'm ashamed to say it was so good I gobbled up the entire thing :)  A definite must try.

ZJ1UV3N1vaaewamo8Z-_5A.text: DELICIOUS food!!!  One of the best tapas restaurants I've been to.  Between me and two other friends, we ordered about 15 dishes in all.  We just had so many because when would we be in Vegas again?!?!  Some of the highlights: Spanish Charcuterie Spanish Cheese Spanish Tortilla - was perfectly cooked - almost melts in your mouth Albondigas - juicy and fluffy meatballs Anchovy Filetes - was probably my favorite of all the dishes.  Just the right amount of tang and oiliness, it was served over roasted peppers and bread.  Besides the outstanding food, service was great.  The food was paced nicely and the wait staff was super attentive!  LOVED it!!!

8x9LKzGca_Cf4kaX98le8A.text: Very good Tapas place just off the Vegas strip. It is in the Aria lobby, so was practically in our hotel since we were staying at the adjacent Vdara. Everything we tried was very good, and they had some interesting cocktail options too. We were there on Mother's Day so they even brought out some free sangria for anyone at the table who looked like they might be or potential someday be a mom. Sadly I did not receive one, but that's ok. Cool environment, very good food, very good service. Definitely recommend it.

OYK-4mZ8otfvl34HJoqxSw.text: delicious food, polite server, loved the presentation of the dishes and it was also very cool in the bathroom they had a girl speaking spanish translating to English teaching you how to ask for things like white wine = vino blanco etc...that went on with the background music...and they played songs by Bose, Alejandro Sanz, very Spanish from La madre patria!!!!

Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp ceviche

NzGxXcwXiN_MlWM9RSovEQ.text: Beautiful restaurant with great service. The wait staff is very attentive, and is quick without being overbearing.   The food was ok. I had the cheese lollipop that was so-so (unfortunately it was not warm when it came out, unclear if that was by design), the Spanish tortilla (I have had others that were much better. This dish didn't have a lot of flavor) and the Pan Manchego (which was quite good and very simple - toasted bread with a very thin slice of manchego cheese, topped with what I'd guess was a basil olive oil). For dessert I had the bunuelos, which were good. For a Vegas restaurant with a great reputation, I have to say I was disappointed. I'm a big Tapas fan, and I would not return here.

o1_Mu7PB2c_ggmm7jaQwAg.text: First time we have been here.  We took the recommendations of our waiter Ernest, and he nailed it each and every time.  Service was spot on!  We celebrated a birthday and mother's day and were comped for 2 desserts.  Nothing but the best!

XvfuH6XhCAhlqabXYzLWCA.text: I'm not really one for eating tapas, but our group ate here after a little convincing and it was quite good. The pace of tapas coming to the table is a little too slow for me, but Serranos seemed to pull things off quite nicely.  If you like tapas, I'd highly recommend. Everyone in our group thoroughly enjoyed themselves.

ZEypsfLpnQJiEaDhUcEogg.text: This is the third Tapas Bar I've been to in Vegas and I was quite disappointed; Julian Serrano is mediocre in my books and Firefly is still #1 to me. The Mister and I came for a Valentine's Day brunch since we had $75 credit from the Aria Hotel, if it weren't for that reason I doubt we would have eaten here.   Service that day was kind of off; we didn't know who our server was since we had over five different people helping us. And when we needed to order more drinks and tapas no one was around to take our order; so we had to ask the Host to help us out and of course he apologized for the rest of the staff that wasn't around.   As for food, we ordered:  -----------------------------------------------------------  Traditional Spanish Chicken Croquetas - $9  Bravo Potatoes - $8  Seared Scallop - $12  Lobster Pineapple Skewers - $14 Stuffed Dates - $8 Marinated Garlic Chicken and Mushroom Skewers - $9  Coca Chorizo - $10  -----------------------------------------------------------  None of these items stood out to me, they were all very average tasting just like any other typical tapas bar. The only item that was amazing was the Lobster Pineapple Skewers, it had a lot flavor, and the texture of the cooked pineapple gave the skewer itself a nice twist to the lobster piece - the sauce, the seasoning, everything was perfect, it was so good that we even ordered an extra one.

photos.caption: Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Dates
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bravo Potatoes
Photo of Julian Serrano Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanish Chicken Croquetas

FPfwuP1Cv1zvrXibi5U3qA.text: ive been to barcelona, palma de mallorca spain...  ive had tapas in SPAIN.  but i'd rather eat TAPAS @ Julian Serrano!!!!!!!!!!  Literally everything i have ordered here is good, if not very good.  The pitchers of sangria are huge. Good for parties of 4... any less, it might be better to order by the glass.  Highly Recommend:  Colorado Lamb Chops - order in an entree... they give you two chops. I usually order 2 entrees, they are that good!  Salmon with Truffle - Mmmmmmmmm  Ceviche - flavor is perfect, served with Taro chips.  Oh yeah... & they have the best Paella i've ever had in my life. Be sure to bring a friend, or 5 if you order the Paella. its huge!!  one of my fav places in vegas!

s_jOa4gxUloxY8YFBvimuw.text: Would give this place 5 stars but for the service. We have eaten here many times and the food is always outstanding. We had beef and cheese, lobster salad and tuna carpaccio, all of which are outstanding. We always order the risotto which you don't want to miss. Had mushroom soup for the first time and was not disappointed. The only issue was the lack of service. Our server was more interested in talking to other staff than in paying attention to our table. Once the server was given a large table, we had a difficult time getting any attention.  This has not been our previous experience in this restaurant.

2mrI4_wdNXG9EWRkBMz_MA.text: We love small plate restaurants and Julian Serrano hit the spot. I would highly recommend that you don't miss the risotto, scallops, and the churros for dessert. The chocolate/pepper dipping sauce with the churros is fantastic.  I thought the ceviche was really bland and the lobster saffron while good, it's not really worth the price. Many well grilled tiger prawns could top this dish.

q5adelMsEjtRCCb1AZLJ1w.text: It's very sad for me to give this restaurant only 2 stars, but I truly expected so much more from this place. I ordered a spanish chicken dish with vegetables and unfortunately it was so oily that I couldn't really enjoy it.   My table of four tried an assortment of tapas ranging from lamb, potatoes, greens, fried calamari and many others that are not mentioned, which paired well with white and red wine, then we had some desserts that weren't very impressive.   The bill for the whole table came to $842 which included a bottle of red wine. At this point I do not know if the billing was accurate, because it seemed a bit high and our bottle of wine was only 150.00, but anyway the truth is that it was not worth the price tag at all.  The service was also less than desirable, because our waiter was unprepared and lacked the food knowledge needed to work in this kind of establishment. I definitely won't be coming here again, but if you want to try your luck here then be my guest. Unfortunately I can not recommend this place.

XBNIcjO6rkvCbjYkJNUIRA.text: Stepped in for some tapas and sangria before our dinner.  We sat at the bar and had a great time. All the tapas we had were delicious, sangria (there's 3types!) were refreshing and yummy, and the waiters were wonderful.  We had a great time and almost forgot about our dinner reservation elsewhere.

9MLc44ZY04AyDZNCYAMjzg.text: Our cousin took us here as this place is one of her favorites. My husband and I have never had tapas before and it was our first! We got about 7 different tapas, white sangria and churros (laugh now but they were sooooooo good!!) Our server was very attentive and friendly. Some of the tapas we got were the dates, short ribs, duck confit, beef tartar, yellowfin tuna, just to name a few. Our favorite was were the dates tapas and the beef tartar tapas. The white sangria was really really good and would recommend it! My husband even enjoyed it and he isn't one for those "fruity" drinks. It is a little pricey but well worth the tastes and flavors!

dYAJv5Ne6nHe7Jc5z-nJwQ.text: This is a tapas place and its probably one of the best tapas restaurant out there.  They have overwhelming number of choices, meats seasoned/marinated/cooked perfectly, and plated like a work of art.  However I seem to always feel artificially full when I eat so many small dishes.  I almost always feel hungry again in an hour.  It's a fun place to go on a date and perfect place to try many many different 4-5 star dishes.  Lobster saffron and "meat and cheese" really stood out.  But honestly after ordering 12+ dishes everything is a bit of a blur :)

q9MJAmL44pVrpcbQZUm87w.text: This was one of the best nights/places I have ever had and eaten at.  I have never had Tapas before, and my boyfriend is a Manager at a high-end hotel and his Director set us up at Julian Serrano's Restraunt when we were in Vegas. We were immediatly sat by the general manager and had the menu changed exclusively for us, all COMPD', and at the end of our amazing meal Julian Serrano himself came to greet us at our table and share some insight on the menu and give us both hugs and a kiss on both cheeks!!   Truly an amazing expirience. Julian Serrano is a mastermind at Culinary Arts.
